text: "Good grief! How on earth is this establishment still operational? It can only be a facade for some type of illicit financial scheme or another...I shan't squander excessive time here...I have visited the premises on two separate occasions...on both instances, I encountered an oppressive ambiance, brusque staff, abysmal customer service, and, lastly, but certainly not least, a bout of food poisoning! Suffice it to say, my experience was utterly wretched."

"I commemorated my birthday at this establishment, and I must say, it was a rather unfortunate experience, save for the complimentary evening meal. The purported $800 in'savings coupons' proved to be a fallacy, with the exception of the gratuity-inclusive dinner. The accommodations left much to be desired, devoid of even the most fundamental amenities such as a refrigerator and microwave oven in the guest chamber, and the elevators presented a persistent predicament. Moreover, unwelcome visitors, ostensibly seeking cannabis, disturbed our repose at regular intervals, necessitating the utterance of an ad hoc phrase, 'Not my room, stoner; try the rappers next door.' Furthermore, the nearby convenience store imposed exorbitant prices on essential items, such as $5.50 for a two-liter bottle of soda or $15 for a half-pint of spirits. Accessible alternatives were located approximately a mile and a half away, accessible only by traversing an inconvenient route through hallways and walkways. Therefore, it is advisable to don comfortable footwear, rather than fashionable heels, for the duration of one's stay."

"Excellent applications! Elham serves as an exceptional hostess, and it is highly recommended that you request her assistance during your visit, as she possesses a proficient and hospitable demeanor. However, it is advisable to avoid indulging in the remaining options offered by the establishment, as they fail to meet expectations. Instead, consider patronizing the adjacent DW Bistro, which offers a superior dining experience."
You just lost our business.. no longer open on Sundays is a very bad decision. Religion and business does not belong together.. seperate

Terrible terrible food, well our adventure started when our waitress brought out the coconut shrimp, terrible taste felt rubbery. Then my father asked for a well done prime rib came out medium rare. The waitress seeing disgust on our face offers to have it recooked. Wow what a waste of time and service stay away!

My last interaction at this branch was beyond frustrating. In an attempt to finalize a few matters dealing with my late husband's finances, I requested assistance at this branch.

I understand why they did not help. It wasn't that they could not. It was at the (acting) manager's discretion, as explained to me by Wells Fargo customer service when I called their toll free number.

What I can't appreciate is the manner in which the (acting) manager chose not to help, which included lying about "federal regulations", refusing to honor checks written on a Wells Fargo account by a government agency, and refusing to honor documentation from the Mecklenburg county courthouse.

The customer service I received at this branch was the proverbial straw.

I finalized my business with Wells Fargo yesterday.

Good riddance...

I have had the pleasure of dining at Bouchon on multiple occasions, and I must say that my expectations were not entirely met during my most recent visit. Specifically, I had the misfortune of ordering the short ribs, which were unfortunately comprised primarily of adipose tissue. Needless to say, I was rather dismayed by this discovery and opted to replace said dish with something more suitable. Following a brief consultation with my dining companions, we decided upon the lamb and strip steak as alternatives. While these selections were undoubtedly an upgrade from their predecessors, they failed to meet the exceptionally high standards that I have come to associate with establishments bearing the illustrious Thomas Keller name. It is my sincere hope that Bouchon will take the necessary steps to rectify this unfortunate situation, as I am reluctant to dismiss it altogether as a viable dining option.

"Motivated by profound dissatisfaction with a recent dining experience, I elected to establish a Yelp account with the primary intention of expressing my grievances regarding this particular establishment...Purchased an order of kare kare for my grandmother and was thoroughly disillusioned by the meager portion size, which seemed utterly disproportionate to the price charged...Upon placing a to-go order, I specified a medium-sized cup, anticipating a commensurate quantity of food; however, upon receiving our order, it became apparent that the container held only a minuscule amount of meat accompanied by a modicum of sauce, raising questions regarding the veracity of the advertised portion size and prompting us to query the restaurant's customer service representative regarding the seemingly arbitrary pricing system...The representative's response, unfortunately, served only to exacerbate my indignation, as they inquired about our frequency of patronage and ethnicity, implying a correlation between these factors and the quality of service provided, which I found both objectionable and unacceptable...In light of this experience, I have resolved to avoid this establishment in the future."

"Ambiguity permeates the cognitive process of an individual who has opted to procure a detailing service for their mid-size sport utility vehicle via a popular online marketplace, as the notion of authenticity versus fictionality becomes increasingly indistinguishable within the confines of their mental faculties; thus, precipitating a state of utter exasperation and frustration. The inherent difficulty in establishing communication with the purported service provider serves as the foundation for this trenchant critique, which meticulously documents the futility of numerous attempted interactions via both telephonic and textual means. Furthermore, the unreliability of the service is underscored by the fact that appointed meetings at the customer's residence were consistently disregarded, culminating in a total absence of any tangible results. In light of these circumstances, a prudent course of action would be to avoid engaging in commercial transactions with such an enterprise, lest one desires to squander valuable time and resources. Instead, the individual may opt to execute the cleaning task independently, thereby circumventing the necessity for a refund from the online marketplace."

During my previous patronage of this establishment's alternative venues, the quality of service I experienced was satisfactory, however, the assistance my kin received during the present visit was deplorable. It necessitated a twenty-five minute interval prior to the presentation of our initial courses, and an additional sixty minutes lapsed before the primary dishes were served. Furthermore, we observed a duplication in the number of parties accommodated at adjacent tables preceding the arrival of our fare.

"Greetings and culinary service were tardy and underwhelming, commencing at 3 PM and manifesting a conspicuous dearth of patronage. Following a fifteen-minute wait, we were eventually accommodated; however, our server, Luke, exhibited proficiency and attentiveness in his recommendations of beverages and tacos. Our order included the'street corn' appetizer, which proved to be a disappointment due to its diminutive size, excessive oiliness, and meager adornment of cheese. In contrast, the shrimp and Al Pastor tacos, accompanied by saffron rice and a surcharge of $2 for sweet plantains, possessed satisfactory flavors, although the plantains displayed evidence of burning and stickiness. Unfortunately, the saffron rice contained hard, unchewable clusters, detracting from its overall quality. Following a review of the South Park location's superior ratings on Yelp, I am willing to accord Cantina 1511 another opportunity, albeit at the alternative site."

I revisited the establishment four years subsequent to my initial visit, with the intention of savoring their signature Bloody Mary once again prior to boarding my return flight. Unfortunately, this experience proved to be a colossal miscalculation, as the dish failed to meet my expectations and left me feeling utterly nauseous, both during my time at the airport and upon my immediate return home. Notably, our server for this particular visit was none other than Sigi, who exhibited her customary warmth and hospitality. However, the fact that the culinary offerings were presented on silver platters, reminiscent of the iconic "Be Our Guest" scene from Disney's Beauty and the Beast, did little to enhance the actual quality of the food. In point of fact, the dishes appeared, felt, and tasted like a haphazard creation that might have been rejected by a preschooler's art project. My chicken noodle soup, for instance, boasted an unsettling sweetness, coupled with unappetizing, undercooked pasta and a generous helping of grimy carrots that had all congregated at the bottom of the bowl. The spicy buffalo wings, on the other hand, were disturbingly arid, with a sprinkling of pepper flakes that seemed to be the sole attempt at imbuing them with flavor. Moreover, one of the wings disintegrated into two mushy lumps, accompanied by a mysterious brown substance that oozed out of it. It is safe to say that even the most discerning prison inmate would have been appalled by the subpar quality of the cuisine. In fact, I can attest to the veracity of this statement, having endured a grueling twelve-hour period of discomfort subsequent to consuming these dishes. Suffice it to say, I strongly advise skipping this establishment and opting for a more satisfying dining experience, such as a humble bagel or similar fare.
The constant electronic/techno music made me want to shoot myself. There was absolutely no R&B or hip-hop played. The music didn't change all night!

"A protracted waiting period ensued, culminating in an underwhelming encounter that failed to meet my elevated expectations, particularly with regard to the gastronomic experience that a purportedly high-end burger was expected to provide. Notwithstanding my preparation for a flavorful indulgence, the fries accompanying the primary dish were excessively greasy, rendering them unpalatable, and the absence of standard condiments such as ketchup or mustard further exacerbated my disappointment. Moreover, the unrelenting solar radiation pouring down on us during our meal proved not only uncomfortable but also detrimental to our dining experience, a fact that the restaurant staff seemed to disregard, as they made no effort to mitigate the effects of the sun's intensity or offer any semblance of an apology. Although the service we received was adequate, it fell short of impressing me, and I was only able to consume half of my burger, which, regrettably, proved to be an unsatisfying experience due to the aforementioned shortcomings."

"If you possess an affinity towards the culinary offerings of Cici's pizza buffet or Homestyle buffet, you will undoubtedly experience a state of gastronomical euphoria upon partaking in the delectable delights presented by the Orleans. The visually appealing and mouthwatering assortment of comestibles will precipitate an uncontrollable flow of saliva. However, I must caution that my gratis dining experience at this establishment has led me to formulate a steadfast resolution to refrain from ever revisiting this eatery again, instead opting to indulge in the diverse array of superior quality fare available at comparably priced buffets throughout Las Vegas. It is indeed a rarity when each and every item sampled from a buffet line fails to meet even the most minimal standards of edibility, yet such was the case during my regrettable visit to the Orleans. What a lamentable misuse of time and resources."

"In the event that you have become disoriented and are unable to navigate your surroundings, it is imperative that you expedite your departure from this establishment with utmost haste. Not only will the alcoholic beverage known as vodka have deleterious effects on your gastrointestinal tract, but also the culinary offerings purported to be edible by the management of this eatery are, in reality, an affront to gastronomy. Furthermore, the tariff for their so-called 'holiday menu' is exorbitant, amounting to $35, and when factoring in taxes and gratuities, the total cost reaches a staggering $45."

"I have had the dubious distinction of visiting numerous eateries and bearing witness to an array of subpar service, but this particular establishment takes the proverbial cake in terms of sheer ineptitude. It is truly astounding how they can foster an atmosphere of utter indifference within a mere half-minute of my arrival, making me feel like an inconvenience rather than a valued patron. The prolonged wait to be acknowledged at my table, a paltry 20 minutes, was only exacerbated by the fact that I was not the sole victim of such neglect; several other couples in close proximity to me suffered the same fate. The cumulative effect of these travails prompted me, as well as two other pairs in my vicinity, to exercise our right to seek better accommodations elsewhere. It is a crying shame that this establishment, with its manifest lack of concern for its clientele, sullies the reputation of diligent restaurateurs who genuinely prioritize the comfort and satisfaction of their guests.

The cuisine itself was a sorry spectacle, a veritable nadir of gastronomic mediocrity. The manner in which the meat was conveyed to my plate, via the uncouth method of employing a knife as a makeshift tongs, only served to reinforce my conviction that this eatery is an unmitigated disaster. Suffice it to say, I shall not soon forget the unfortunate experience I endured at this woeful excuse for a dining establishment, and I would advise others to steer clear of it at all costs."

This culinary extravaganza falls short of expectations, refrain from squandering your resources on this establishment. We failed to receive a vessel containing potable liquid until our repast was concluded. Not until we had reached the sweet course in our delectation did the aquatic beverage arrive. Our server was ineffectual in providing hospitable services, her interactions were brusque and lacking in salutations! The sole utterance emanating from her being was, "Do you desire vinous beverages or not?!" The smorgasbord available was limited and the comestibles presented were devoid of flavor. By the time you compile your platter and arrive at your table, the temperature of the fare will have diminished significantly. How can a hostelry, possessing considerable financial resources, falter so drastically in their buffet? While I hold Aria in high esteem, it is imperative that they divert some of their abundant wealth towards educating their staff in fundamental customer relations. Patrons do not wish to expend a substantial sum on mediocre victuals and subpar service. Moreover, my significant other suffered from gastrointestinal distress subsequent to partaking in the buffet. It comes as no surprise that they offer a complimentary buffet with each purchase, given the quality of their provisions. For your own benefit, dine at the Wynn instead.

"Abysmal clientele assistance and an arduous endeavor to locate any item! No employee extended aid to myself, my significant other's progeny, and I was even seated on the floor, meticulously scrutinizing a stack of shorts that lacked coherent sizing and were intermingled with diverse styles in a futile attempt to procure her appropriate dimensions. The store's already limited pedestrian thoroughfares were further encumbered by numerous bins of attire, and not a single staff member acknowledged our presence for approximately twenty minutes. Ultimately, a recently arrived associate, seemingly fresh from their shift's commencement, approached us and proffered some suggestions, yet by that juncture, the negative impact had already been felt, leaving me utterly disenchanted and resolute in my decision to avoid revisiting said establishment in the near future, thereby necessitating the quest for an alternative retail destination for my beau's offspring."

We made an inaugural visit to this establishment several months prior, yet I must emphatically state that my return is highly unlikely due to the sluggish nature of both the culinary offerings and the hospitality we received during our brief tenure. The fare provided was not merely unimpressive, but its diminutive proportions and lackluster appearance rendered it utterly unremarkable. This venue proved to be a profound letdown, particularly with regard to its advertised specialty of nachos and beer.

"Upon procuring a beverage referred to as a 'lean machine' from a specific establishment, I proceeded to consume it and was met with an unpleasant surprise, as the flavor resembled a concoction of various medicinal substances, which not only caused the hairs on my arms and neck to stand erect but also induced an unsettling sensation throughout my body. Despite attempting to mix the contents of the cup in hopes of improving the taste, the endeavor proved futile, leaving me no choice but to discard the drink, thereby deeming it a waste of financial resources. I must emphasize the extreme dissatisfaction I experienced with this particular smoothie, to the extent that it evoked a visceral response, prompting me to advise others against ordering the 'lean machine' from this location, as it was not only unpalatable but also utterly nauseating."

This proved to be a profoundly disheartening episode. We opted to visit on a Sunday evening at approximately 7 pm, only to find the establishment devoid of patrons. Following an extended period of time spent awaiting seating, we were eventually accommodated; however, our order for tea and bread was met with an unacceptable delay. Indeed, it required no less than 35 minutes to receive our simple repast, prompting my beloved spouse to express her extreme dissatisfaction and precipitating our departure. Despite my innate sense of integrity, I felt compelled to compensate for the tea consumed during our brief tenure, but even this straightforward transaction was protracted. Unfortunately, the exorbitant tariffs charged by this eatery, coupled with the conspicuous lack of clientele, led me to infer that the quality of service would be commensurate with the prices. Our subsequent dining experience at Cheddars, located in close proximity, served as a stark contrast, providing a satisfying meal and underscoring the reasons behind the former establishment's vacancy.

"Well, well, well! Who would have thought that I, myself, would end up at a club that I thoroughly detest, and which makes me feel utterly uncomfortable? It's truly mind-boggling! The security personnel there are utterly incompetent and appallingly discourteous. I've had the privilege of visiting an array of high-end clubs and dives, and I've even hired and fired security staff. However, this particular establishment takes the cake when it comes to subpar security. They're so incredibly impolite that it's almost laughable! I was forcibly ejected from the premises, and a corpulent individual who worked there even had the audacity to pinch my arm. I was informed that I was being escorted out because I had removed one of my boots and was unable to put it back on due to the crowd being requested to hover in mid-air - good grief! The sheer absurdity of it all! I've had the pleasure of frequenting exclusive, invitation-only clubs in London and New York, and I must say, this place is far more unpleasant than having each individual hair on my derriÃ¨re meticulously plucked. I'd rather endure the latter than set foot in that club again. It's truly unfortunate, as the club has immense potential. The ambiance is superb, the dancers are phenomenal, the DJ is fantastic, and the promoters and bartenders are quite friendly. Alas, the boorish behavior of those security guards ruins everything. I won't be returning to that club, and I wouldn't dream of sending any of my acquaintances there. People, please refrain from visiting this establishment until they decide to adopt a more civil attitude."

I assiduously endeavor to circumvent this aerodrome at every opportunity during my peregrinations to alternative locales. The terminals lack any semblance of a tram or train, and are instead situated at an exorbitant distance from one another, rendering navigation an arduous and time-consuming process. On multiple occasions, the people-movers have been nonoperational due to maintenance, thereby further exacerbating the inconvenience of traversing these vast expanses. Furthermore, the lavatories boast a narrow corridor that can accommodate only a single individual at a time, making passage with luggage a precarious and amusing endeavor, particularly when a multitude of travelers converge upon the facilities following a flight arrival, thereby creating a bottleneck of epic proportions. To further compound the chaos, a last-minute gate alteration was implemented, and the subsequent deployment of the jetway required an unconscionable twenty minutes to materialize, culminating in an experience replete with frustration and disorder.

"On multiple occasions, specifically during my most recent visits, Mia Za's has demonstrated a propensity for error in the fulfillment of our orders, with the most recent instance being particularly egregious. Specifically, upon requesting a nut-free salad for my wife, who suffers from a severe allergy, the restaurant's staff proceeded to include nuts in the dish, despite my explicit instructions to the contrary. Upon observing this transgression, I brought it to the attention of the staff, who initially attempted to rectify the situation by merely removing the nuts from the salad. However, given the severity of my wife's allergy, this superficial solution was deemed insufficient, and I was compelled to request a completely new salad, which the staff eventually provided after displaying an uncooperative and discourteous attitude."

"I indulged my family with a dining experience at this establishment on Mother's Day, and regrettably, it failed to meet expectations. The management demonstrated avarice by overbooking and underpreparing for the influx of patrons. Moreover, the ambient temperature was oppressively warm, and the fans proved ineffectual in providing respite from the heat. The absence of misting systems further compounded the discomfort. Our server, though industrious, struggled to keep up with the demands of the numerous tables, resulting in an extended delay in the replenishment of our water glasses. It is worth noting that the location was Las Vegas, and the month was May, which warrants adequate preparation, particularly for a table costing $600. Our reserved table was tardy by thirty minutes, and the ensuing wait for our initial course prolonged for approximately one hour. The fare, while palatable, lacked distinction and appeared formulaic. The piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance was the hostess's unaware utterance of an obscenity upon discovering both restrooms engaged, unbeknownst to her, by my five-year-old niece and another patron. This incident encapsulated the frenzied and flustered demeanor of the staff. I must confess that my affection for this venue has waned due to the subpar service and culinary offerings. In contrast, Marche Bacchus, another establishment I held in high esteem, also fell short of my expectations."

This hotel experience has been, by far, the most unpleasant and problematic that I have had the misfortune of encountering during my numerous visits to Las Vegas. Our brief two-night stay was marred by a plethora of issues, including the inconvenience of being locked out of our room on two separate occasions due to faulty keycards, which resulted in a significant loss of time on my part. Furthermore, upon entering our room, we were greeted by an uninviting atmosphere, complete with an unappealing odor emanating from a half-eaten burrito that had been carelessly left in the refrigerator, the pungent aroma of which seemed to be a bizarre fusion of garlic and vomit. To add insult to injury, the hotel management offered a paltry $50 credit for dining, which was utterly inadequate compensation for the multitude of inconveniences we had endured. The accommodations themselves were subpar, lacking in both size and aesthetic appeal, while the casino and pool areas were similarly underwhelming. It is utterly perplexing as to why anyone would choose to venture all the way down the strip to stay at such a mediocre establishment, especially when taking into account the fact that the illustrious Wynn/Encore brand owns this property in its entirety. In conclusion, I shall never again grace this hotel with my presence, and I strongly advise others to avoid squandering their time and resources on such an inferior lodging experience.

The only time this Walmart is acceptable is if it's late at night. Other than that, it's full of nothing but welfare moms with screaming brats complaining about what they can and can't use their food stamps on. Don't bother. Go to Target instead; it's cleaner and not so ghetto. On the upshot, most of the cashiers are really nice; it's the class of people that make it crappy.

"It is utterly reprehensible that, despite having a reservation for our luxurious suite well in advance, spanning over five months, upon arriving at the establishment, we were met with an unfortunate and completely unacceptable revelation; that being, our accommodations had been unilaterally downgraded, prompting an utterance of disbelief and indignation. It is truly mystifying how a purportedly distinguished hotel chain could engage in such egregious and dubious business practices, which not only undermine the trust and confidence of their clientele but also call into question the very quality and reliability of their services. Therefore, it is imperative to exercise extreme caution and skepticism when considering this particular lodging, lest one desires to be confronted with an unexpected and vastly inferior alternative to the originally reserved accommodations."

"The lodging establishment in question, characterized by an unprecedented level of squalor, reprehensibility, and administrative ineptitude, constitutes a veritable nadir in the annals of hospitality, rendering it utterly inconceivable that any individual, regardless of the pecuniary inducement, would opt to prolong their sojourn within its tainted confines for even a fleeting moment beyond what is absolutely necessary."

"My perplexity regarding the favorable evaluations bestowed upon this establishment prompts me to ponder whether my visit occurred during an inopportune period. The subpar service and underwhelming culinary offerings I experienced at Sakana led me to question the validity of such acclaim. Specifically, our hostess exhibited signs of impatience and forgetfulness, which detracted from the dining experience. Furthermore, the menu selections at Sakana appear to be limited variations of the ubiquitous California roll, and the liberal usage of imitation crabmeat struck me as excessive, rather than generous. Thus, if one's sushi preferences are not particularly discerning and a craving for rice and imitation crab exists, then perhaps this venue might prove satisfactory."

I purchased a Groupon for this salon, based on the positive Yelp reviews.  The stylist I had seemed very apprehensive and inexperienced. It almost felt as if it was the first time he was cutting hair professionally (shakey and slow). 

Here's the kicker, I go to pay and asked what the original cost was (because I always tip on the original amount of the service) and the receptionist tells me its $35. The groupon I purchased was $30 (supposed to be a $70 value). I was shocked. I saved a total of $5 by purchasing the groupon. 

Bottom line, they clearly reserve their higher level stylists for non-groupon clients. The whole point of the groupon is to try out a new salon and hopefully become a regular client. I suggest the folks at Folicle remember that moving forward.

"Indubitably, this barber shop can be classified as one of the most unproductive and sluggish establishments globally, with patrons enduring excruciatingly prolonged haircutting durations, often surpassing 45 minutes, which raises questions about the management's proficiency and commitment to optimizing their clientele's time. It appears that the staff's lackadaisical attitude towards efficiency takes precedence over any aspirations for financial success. Consequently, if you possess an abundance of leisure time, perhaps in excess of three hours, then this barbershop may prove to be an ideal location to while away your hours."

It goes without saying that I regret expending my financial resources at that establishment on the aforementioned evening, but I can assure you that such an unfortunate occurrence will not transpire again in the future, as I have no intention of setting foot in that place once more. The culinary offerings were subpar, to say the least (Pinky's, located just a stone's throw away, serves significantly superior fare), the hospitality was lacking in attention and civility, and the administration was utterly inept. If anyone inquires about this particular business, I shall enthusiastically guide them towards Pinky's and ensure that all of my gastronomic acquaintances are aware of the abundance of exceptional establishments serving burgers on Montford, once the signage for their Woodlawn location has been erected. A waste of money, indeed. Incidentally, those who claim that the aforementioned restaurant serves excellent burgers have clearly not had the pleasure of dining at Brooks (a veritable mecca for burger connoisseurs in Charlotte), the Liberty (where one can indulge in some of the most exquisite high-end burgers imaginable - simply Google them to peruse the numerous accolades they have received), or Zack's.

"The dimensions of the servings are minuscule, and the tariffs are exorbitant. I requested a beverage comprising orange juice, and was presented with a diminutive container containing a mere sip of said potable. Upon perusing the invoice, I discovered that the aforementioned orange juice had a price tag of seven dollars, while my accompanying bagel carried a cost of five dollars. This establishment's pricing strategy is nothing short of exploitative and egregious, preying upon unsuspecting tourists who are oblivious to the inflated costs. It is the epitome of a tourist trap."

"The Chinese Chicken Salad we had the displeasure of consuming was, by far, the most unimpressive and unsatisfactory culinary experience we have had the misfortune of encountering in recent memory, with a paltry three minuscule pieces of poultry that were ostensibly intended to serve as the dish's primary protein component, but ultimately proved to be little more than an afterthought amidst a sea of bland, uninspired greens that would have been more at home in a garden than on a plate, thereby rendering the entire dish an utter disappointment and ensuring that we shall never return to this establishment again."

Worst experience my sienna van had a wrap around warranty I bought thru them and they said they would repair my van and got me a rental car then the next day they said they would not honor their word. After back and forth they fixed it and when I drove a block the problem was worsen. I called no call back.

If the culinary offerings at this establishment were deemed suitable for a monarch, the chef would face capital punishment for presenting such unpalatable dishes. The smorgasbord was situated within the Imperial Palace, which necessitated an arduous trek from the central area of the Las Vegas Strip. Allow me to emphasize that traversing the distance was a futile endeavor and, had I perused Yelp previously, I would have refrained from entering the premises altogether. My motivation for visiting was solely driven by my craving for crab claws, and my hunger temporarily clouded my judgment.

Believe me, along with the collective sentiment of other patrons who concur with the abysmal quality of the victuals served here. The crab claws were merely passable and lacked freshness, while the vegetables appeared limp and wilted (with mushrooms displaying visible signs of spoilage). Furthermore, the lobster bisque was excessively salty, and the prime rib was either overcooked or dried out. The food was left at room temperature for an extended period, and the staff failed to rotate the offerings promptly.

To compound the issues, I waited for approximately twenty minutes before anyone bothered to clear my table. I was compelled to procure my own soft drinks, and the waitstaff neglected to attend to my needs, not even bothering to glance in my direction. The absence of clientele was palpable, and the servers nonchalantly navigated around my table without acknowledging my presence.

I would award this establishment a meager half-star rating, provided such an option existed. Under no circumstances would I consider returning to this venue in the future.

This was my maiden experience receiving a professional nail treatment, and I must admit that I was feeling rather apprehensive upon entering the salon. Unfamiliar with the customary protocol, I requested a comprehensive set complemented by nail polish. However, I was taken aback when I discovered that this merely entailed a partial application of paint on the tips of my nails. When I inquired about the possibility of having the entire nail surface painted, I was met with a dismissive response from the attendant. Despite my disappointment, I chose not to voice my discontent. Prior to arriving at the establishment, I had placed a call to confirm their acceptance of Discover, a particular payment method I wished to utilize. Nevertheless, upon presenting my Discover debit card as payment, I was taken aback when informed that it was not an acceptable form of compensation. The incongruity of the situation left me feeling perplexed. Eventually, I opted to settle the bill using an alternative card and tendered a $5 gratuity in cash. Unfortunately, the finished product failed to meet my expectations, with visible irregularities in the shape and appearance of my nails. Needless to say, I shall not be returning to this particular business. The ambiance of the salon appeared dated and unkempt, with an overabundance of flashy embellishments. Moreover, the level of customer service was subpar, and concerns regarding hygiene were evident. In light of these factors, I have resolved to seek out alternative establishments for future nail care needs.

Really wanted to like this place.  But had a horrendous experience all around... Staff was woefully inept and over their heads.  Food came out 40 minutes later and was burnt & inedible.  We will not be back.  Very sad to see yet another restaurant fail so early...  good luck to them.

Really want to like this place. Have been here a few times and the food was just never very good and portions were small...especially for the price. Save your money and your tastebuds...go somewhere else.

"Gastronomical offerings of a subpar quality. Indeed, the cost is economical, yet comparable establishments such as Boulder or Fiesta provide superior culinary experiences at a similar price point. The fare served at Cannery Row exhibits an unfortunate propensity towards flavorlessness, overcooking, and aridity, frequently manifesting as a combination of these undesirable traits. Our complimentary buffet vouchers remain unredeemed, a testament to our reluctance to partake in the dining experience gratis. In light of this information, it is advisable to bypass this establishment in favor of more satisfactory alternatives within the same price range."

"Due to preexisting commitments, a reservation was secured; however, upon arrival, a twenty-minute wait ensued, during which time the staff proffered an apology, citing the unavailability of the table due to the tardiness of the previous patrons in vacating their seats, despite the fact that numerous tables remained unoccupied. Furthermore, when we brought to their attention our limited time frame, no effort was made by the establishment to accommodate us, leaving us with a negative impression of their ability to honor reservations, despite the culinary quality."

"Acknowledging the fact that the location in question was indeed Las Vegas and Summerlin, it was perhaps unrealistic to anticipate an authentic Korean culinary experience, per se; however, the inaccurate presentation of the gochujang sauce accompanying my bibim bap, a quintessential Korean dish, was nothing short of disappointing. Upon requesting the condiment, the waitstaff appeared oblivious to its existence, which speaks volumes about the establishment's commitment to providing an authentic Korean experience. Suffice it to say that the exorbitant prices charged by such eateries only serve to exacerbate the disappointment stemming from the subpar quality of the food they purport to serve."

Called to make an appointment and told the receptionist exactly what was happening.  She said they can help me and I made the appointment.  I got there at 1:10ish for a 1:20 appointment.  They didn't call me back until 2. Then when they finally did, the PA told me that they don't do what I'm there for. I explained that I told the receptionist why I'm there and her response was \"The girl you spoke to is new and she was kinda left a lot for a week to fend for herself\"......really?  I needed this test done and now I have to go somewhere for it. If you go here, make sure you are clear about what you need and maybe call back to make sure they do it. I gave up some much needed sleep for this appointment.
Don't know why everyone likes this place. Ate here three times in hope I was wrong. I was right, this place is over rated. Their ahi poke was salty. You can't have hawaiian food and mess up poke.

I requested the ramen bowl and the soup was entirely unpalatable. It had a flavor akin to water and oil. They did not possess any supplementary seasonings such as soy sauce or salt and pepper on the table. It required an additional 15 minutes to signal someone to acquire some soy sauce. For $12, it was a complete swindle. Not only was it inauthentic, but it was also not even edible without an abundance of condiments. If one is seeking adequate and more affordable noodles, they should visit Umami or Ha Long Bay instead.

been there before, but this tym was terrible... I just called to place an order for take out\nI didn't know the price but I got shocked when they charged 12 dollers for a medium pizza I was totally disappointed...\nthe messed up my pizza I asked for well done but it was too cheesi....

"The culinary experience offered by Pasta of the Day was utterly devoid of any discernible flavor profile, which was particularly disconcerting given the establishment's emphasis on gastronomic innovation. In contrast, the pizza offered by Regina Marg was merely adequate, failing to impress this patron with its uninspired toppings and lackluster presentation. Furthermore, the absence of any semblance of hospitable service significantly undermined the dining experience, rendering it an unmitigated disappointment. While the possibility of a superior dining experience at a nearby pie place held some promise, it remained to be seen whether such an establishment could truly deliver on its culinary potential."

"This constitutes a cohort of malefactors and a deceitful assemblage of individuals occupying a shared workspace. They have numerous pending grievances with ADRE and diverse minor enterprises due to their deficiency in execution and their propensity for duping individuals with regard to deposits, invoices, and rent payments that are purportedly misplaced or unaccounted for. They exhibit a consistent pattern of neglecting to respond to telephone calls and remain impervious to communication, leaving individuals who engage with them utterly vulnerable to their capricious whims. It is advisable to exercise caution and perform an exhaustive examination of their history and associations prior to considering any interactions with them. Regional administration firms are cognizant of their questionable practices and it would not be surprising if they cease operations within the forthcoming year."

Horribly slow service. Meals came out minus condiments ie ketchup for burgers and fries and steak sauce for T-bones and sat getting cold while waitress went back into kitchen looking for the condiments that should have automatically been served with meal. Drinks were only refilled once, food was tasteless, buns were stale and fries over cooked. Will not return under any circumstances. Manager was not accommodating when I complained.

```
Individuals exhibit discourteous behavior! Upon being informed that an additional $100 would be required to remove all scratches, resulting in a paint job appearance that was practically pristine, it is utterly unsurprising that this establishment has acquired an unfavorable reputation. I deemed it necessary to assign a rating.
```

The original text uses simple language and short sentences to convey the writer's frustration with the service they received at a car detailing business. In the modified text, I have tried to make the language more formal and complex, while still conveying the same message. Here are some of the changes I made:

* Changed "People are very rude!" to "Individuals exhibit discourteous behavior!" to make the sentence more formal and less conversational.
* Changed "I was told for an extra $100" to "Upon being informed that an additional $100 would be required" to make the sentence more formal and to avoid using contractions.
* Changed "when can buff out all the scratches" to "resulting in a paint job appearance that was practically pristine" to make the sentence more descriptive and to better convey the intended meaning.
* Changed "no wonder this place has a bad rep!!!" to "it is utterly unsurprising that this establishment has acquired an unfavorable reputation" to make the sentence more formal and to avoid using colloquial expressions.
* Changed "I had to give it a rating" to "I deemed it necessary to assign a rating" to make the sentence more formal and to avoid using colloquial language.

Overall, the modified text uses longer sentences and more formal language to convey the same message as the original text, while also avoiding colloquial expressions and contractions.

This location is awful. They changed names and nothing actually changed besides that. Food isn't very good. Dinners come with nothing but mounds of onions. So many better places to choose from. Won't be going back.

This dining establishment appears to be in disarray, as evidenced by the substantial amount of litter scattered throughout the premises. Furthermore, the eatery was teeming with patrons due to the late afternoon hour, leading me to anticipate an extensive delay before being seated. However, I observed that numerous tables were unoccupied in the central area, which seemed incongruous given the abundance of available waitstaff. Specifically, I counted seven servers and approximately twenty tables that were currently inhabited. It is unclear why these servers would choose to work with such a limited number of tables, especially considering the importance of maximizing their earnings for the evening. After a forty-five minute wait, we were finally seated. Unfortunately, our culinary delights took an hour to materialize, and we did not receive our beverages, ostensibly due to the absence of our server, who may have been experiencing personal difficulties, such as menstrual discomfort. Despite the quality of the food, the portions were minuscule and grossly overpriced, rendering the entire experience unsatisfactory and not worth the prolonged wait of two and a half hours.

When we convened at the establishment on a Sunday evening for a belated supper, my spouse and I encountered an unfortunate sequence of events that left much to be desired in terms of hospitality. Despite having visited this venue previously and experiencing satisfactory culinary offerings and passable customer service, our most recent visit proved to be a veritable debacle. Following a twenty-minute wait during which no staff member attended to our needs, I rose from my seat and solicited assistance from one of the young women stationed at the front of the restaurant. Unfortunately, my efforts proved futile, as she failed to provide any meaningful aid. Ultimately, a server appeared briefly, only to vanish as suddenly as he had materialized, leaving us in a state of utter neglect. In light of this disappointing experience, I must confess that I shall not be inclined to return to this establishment in the future, nor would I recommend it to others.

Both times I have been in here I have been disappointed.  Last time when I was look for a firearm they showed me a little pink gun I'm assuming because I'm a female. This time we came because online it states they are a full 5.11 retailer. They are not as we were only able to locate 1 polo that was 5.11. It is now the beginning of June and they still have a 2day sale sign up for 20% off 5.11 that is from May. Also because we were not looking at the firearms not a single employee spoke to us. I will continue to stay away from this store as they are not customer friendly.

Last night, we visited this establishment for the first and final time, and our dining experience was utterly disappointing, as the culinary offerings failed to meet our expectations in terms of taste, texture, and value. My spouse ordered the chicken marsala, which was unfortunately served with poultry that was excessively chewy and difficult to cut, rendering it nearly inedible. Our son opted for the fettuccine Alfredo, which regrettably lacked any discernible flavor profile, leaving an unpleasant taste of blandness. Furthermore, the pizza we shared among ourselves and our two other sons was excessively oily and featured a crust that was unyieldingly firm, perhaps due to overcooking, although we cannot say for certain. In conclusion, our meal was a resounding disappointment, and we left feeling unsatisfied and overcharged, having spent a total of $65 for a dining experience that fell short of our expectations in every aspect.

"We experienced an unprecedented level of ineptitude during our recent dining excursion, characterized by an unacceptable delay in seating and a subsequent lack of attentive service. Despite having reserved a table for 7:45, we were requested to postpone our arrival until 8:15, which we reluctantly acquiesced to. However, upon being seated, we were subjected to an interminable waiting period, ultimately culminating in our departure well after 11 pm. The inadequacy of the service was further exacerbated by the sluggish demeanor of the wait staff. Needless to say, we shall not be inclined to revisit this establishment in the future."

"Although my culinary expectations were elevated, I must admit that my experience at this establishment was subpar. Specifically, my excitement to indulge in an ostrich burger and an elk burger, both of which I had never tried before, was met with disappointment due to the dryness of the meat. It appeared that the individual responsible for preparing the dish lacked the necessary skills to execute it properly, or perhaps the quality of the meat itself was substandard. My companion's recommendation of the traditional beef burgers over the exotic meats further reinforced my dissatisfaction. Additionally, the salmon burger, though palatable, failed to impress. Considering the steep price point of $13 for a minuscule ostrich burger, accompanied by fries and a beverage totaling nearly $20, I am unlikely to return to this restaurant."

"It is highly advisable to refrain from consuming sustenance at this particular Burger King establishment, as numerous individuals, including myself, have fallen ill after partaking of their culinary offerings. Furthermore, the ambiance of the restaurant leaves much to be desired, with an abundance of unsanitary conditions and a plethora of unwanted pests, such as cockroaches, present on the premises. Additionally, it has come to my attention that several acquaintances of mine have also experienced adverse gastrointestinal reactions subsequent to dining at this location. In light of these facts, it would be wise to seek nourishment elsewhere."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition." It is enormous, but I discovered a strand of hair in my cuisine, which has caused me to experience persistent eructation throughout the day, despite having consumed only a portion of the meal. The total cost for two adults and two children was $45.00, including a gratuity. I do not intend to revisit this establishment.

We experimented with a modest assortment of these gluttonous, ostentatious donuts, yet we failed to consummate our relationship with any of them. It was almost as if they possessed an unpleasant medley of stagnant tactile sensations and bizarre gustatory experiences, rendering them utterly unsatisfactory. Frankly, I am taken aback by my own incredulity at having to express such disfavor towards a pastry that has historically been a source of delight for me. Our distaste for them was genuinely profound.

This 24-hour Wal-Mart Supercenter embodies an unfortunate ambiance reminiscent of a lower socioeconomic status, and my assertion in no way intends to disparage the diverse clientele who frequent this establishment. My criticism pertains specifically to the physical state of the store, the demeanor of its staff, and the subpar service one can expect to receive upon entering its premises.  
Pros: The auto department offers reasonable pricing and efficient tire installation services.  
Cons: The overall cleanliness of the store leaves much to be desired. Employees often display a lack of cordiality, and essential items such as milk, bread, and soft drinks are frequently out of stock. Insufficient personnel man checkout stations, leading to prolonged wait times; furthermore, malfunctioning self-checkout machines add to customer frustration. Additionally, employees aggressively scrutinize customers' receipts upon exiting the store, raising questions regarding the legitimacy of this practice. Self-checkout machines also flagrantly accuse customers of theft, proclaiming, "Unauthorized item in the bagging area! Attendant has been called!"  
For a more satisfactory shopping experience, consider visiting the Wal-Mart Supercenter located at 540 Marks Street, which boasts better maintenance, lighting, marketing, and inventory. Opting for Winco Foods is recommended for grocery needs.

Ignore the 5/5 reviews from the employees, this place is bogus.   Poorly made drinks and botched food orders during the day, RACIST bouncers at night that actually told my group everyone but my black friend could get in.  Unbelievable in 2014 that employeesare enabled by the El Hefe owners and managers to openly discriminate.\n\nThis place is doing a great job of bringing sub-par, snotty service to the otherwise Mill and deserves to be gone in a few months...frankly Canteen was much better.

"Thus far, my culinary exploits within the confines of Phoenix have been utterly disappointing, with regards to the quality of service provided. Specifically, this particular establishment's shortcomings were glaringly apparent, as our server's visits to our table were fleeting and singularly purposed, leaving us in a state of suspended animation, our queries and requests unanswered and our mouths agape in mid-sentence. Eventually, the victuals arrived, and they were indeed delectable, consisting of turkey eggs benedict accompanied by potatoes and a medley of fresh fruit. Regrettably, the presentation of the repast was marred by the absence of essential utensils, condiments, and refreshments, such as coffee, which were not replenished in a timely manner. It is my sincere hope that the restaurant's management will undertake a comprehensive overhaul of their staff's training regimen, or perhaps consider recruiting an entirely new team, as the quality of the cuisine alone cannot sustain a successful business venture."

Real rating is negative 5 stars, not much of a selection as per commercials lead you to believe. Staff was very rude when we asked for a manager which was not available. Made rude comments speaking Chinese, fortunately my wife is Japanese and heard every word they said, will be reporting them to the BBB for rude and unprofessional behaviour.

"The sushi rolls presented a considerable challenge in terms of manipulation due to their tendency to disintegrate easily, thereby compromising their structural integrity and rendering them difficult to handle. Moreover, the absence of an genuine Japanese flavor profile in the sushi rolls further contributed to our disappointment. Additionally, we were put off by the excessive application of creamy sauce on the rolls, which not only overpowered the delicate flavors of the sushi but also made for an unpleasant dining experience. Furthermore, the presentation of the sushi left much to be desired, with the rolls arranged haphazardly on the plate, giving rise to an appearance that was decidedly lacking in aesthetic appeal. Lastly, the ambiance of the establishment itself was less than inviting, with a pervasive odor of stale fish that lingered in the air and seemed to cling to our clothes long after we had departed the premises. In light of these various shortcomings, it is unlikely that we will return to this particular sushi restaurant in the future."

"Not a Philadelphia Phillies or Philadelphia Eagles bar, as they fallaciously purport to be. I queried the bartender/proprietor regarding the status of the Phillies and the feasibility of televising their games. Her retort was a dismissive 'I don't care about that.' Translation: She has no interest in my patronage. Continue catering to your demographic and maintain your culinary viewing habits."

"Upon awakening this morning, I received a message via Yelp, a platform for evaluating and reviewing businesses, from an individual named Samantha A, who conveyed her sentiments regarding Caffe Bene, a recently established cafe in Urbana. Specifically, she expressed her displeasure with my review of the establishment, stating that it had an adverse effect on her digestive system and that she hoped I would never return to the cafe again. This prompted me to ponder whether I had received an instance of internet hatred and whether individuals held such strong opinions regarding this particular venue. Furthermore, I recalled my own experience at Caffe Bene, during which I ordered beverages that were subpar and poorly prepared, consisting of a mixture of powder and liquid with visible particles of undissolved powder floating on top of the ice and milk. Considering the simplicity of mixing these ingredients, it is reasonable to assume that minimal training is required to execute this task effectively. Moreover, I must admit that I have not revisited the cafe since my previous visit, but I have yet to hear any positive feedback regarding the establishment. In light of this information, I choose to award Caffe Bene an additional one-star rating, in lieu of a friend who also had an unatisfactory experience, and advise potential patrons to seek alternative coffee shops, such as Paradiso, located nearby."

I am a transplanted Texas girl hailing from Austin, and I was yearning for a taste of my native terrain, which led me to discover this establishment through positive reviews. Upon entering, I was immediately struck by the captivating ambiance, and the waitstaff's playful demeanor only added to the charm. Unfortunately, the culinary offerings failed to live up to my expectations, with the chicken fried steak being particularly underwhelming. The absence of seasoning on the meat was glaringly apparent, prompting me to query whether it was truly necessary to include a disclaimer on the menu. Furthermore, the abundance of condiments present at the table seemed to corroborate my suspicions regarding the lack of flavor infusion in the dish. As a self-proclaimed aficionado of all things fried, I was utterly dismayed by the uninspired preparation of the chicken fried steak, which bore more resemblance to a bland cube steak coated in a flour-water mixture and deep-fried, rather than a genuine, expertly crafted CFS. My disappointment extended beyond the main course, as the chicken tenders, potatoes, biscuits, and other fare proved equally unimpressive and lacking in flavor, rendering them inedible even for someone with an insatiable appetite for fried delights. Such an unfortunate turn of events left us feeling sympathetic towards the restaurant, as we opted against requesting a take-home container and instead chose to depart without further indulging in their offerings. In conclusion, I strongly suggest that a minimum of salt and pepper be incorporated into their recipes to elevate the overall gastronomical experience for future patrons.

"Refrain from frittering away your time, as the young woman stationed behind the counter exhibited a flagrant display of incivility without any apparent provocation, seemingly due to her occupational position at a fast food establishment and a perceived lack of accomplishments in life, which led her to project her frustrations onto me, an innocent patron. Initially, I inquired about the possibility of a military discount, a courtesy extended by numerous other Wendy's establishments, yet her response was curt and dismissive. Subsequently, I placed an order for two meals, which she persistently botched, necessitating three attempts to fulfill my request. Furthermore, upon preparing my beverages, she carelessly slammed them onto the counter, nearly causing a catastrophic spillage. It would have been reasonable to assume that, given the fact that I was dining alone and had placed two orders, she might have offered a drink carrier. However, such a gesture was conspicuously absent, prompting me to solicit one, which she callously flung onto the counter. Upon receiving my culinary items, I requested additional ketchup packets, to which she begrudgingly provided a solitary packet, only to disappear momentarily and return with a single supplementary packet. This sequence of unfortunate events culminated in an utterly unsatisfactory dining experience."

"This particular Subway establishment appears to be afflicted with an unfortunate dearth of cleanliness, as evidenced by the unsanitary conditions permeating both the dining area and restrooms, as well as the employees' questionable adherence to proper hygiene practices, such as the infrequent changing of gloves, which seems to be a recurring issue. Furthermore, the culinary offerings served at this location appear to lack the freshness that one would expect from a reputable eatery, with the cookies in particular displaying an unfortunate propensity for overcooking. It is truly mystifying how such a simple task as baking cookies can be consistently botched, and it is equally disconcerting that the staff does not seem to be motivated to provide adequate customer service by offering freshly baked alternatives when faced with depleted inventory. In light of these numerous shortcomings, it becomes apparent that a more authoritative managerial presence is urgently needed to address and rectify these issues, thereby ensuring that patrons can enjoy a satisfying and sanitary dining experience."

We were endowed with VIP passes as an integral component of our premier package of \"O\", which enabled us to gain admittance to the club at approximately 12:30, whereupon, we were immediately and flagrantly disregarded.
The establishment in question exemplifies the quintessence of \"small\" man syndrome, as the sentinels tasked with surveillance and control of ingress and egress exhibited conduct befitting utter douchebaggery.

I refrain from consuming sustenance at establishments such as McDonald's subsequent to becoming cognizant of the reality that their culinary offerings contain Genetically Modified Organisms (GMOs). It is imperative to conduct research on the pernicious nature of this phenomenon. These fibers bear a striking resemblance to the plastic fibers that have been extracted from the epidermis of individuals afflicted with Morgellons disease. "This establishment ranks among the most unpleasant shopping experiences I have had the misfortune of encountering. Perpetually devoid of inventory, they steadfastly decline to recognize any advertised reductions in price, and their customer service personnel seem to take great pleasure in displaying an acrimonious demeanor towards patrons. It is my sincere hope that this enterprise becomes insolvent in the near future."

The unsatisfactory experience at Home Depot, wherein a lethargic wait of thirty minutes ensued before receiving assistance in the electrical department, prompted a dismissive response from the customer service representative, who asserted that they had already summoned the appropriate individual and inquired what further actions could be taken, ultimately suggesting a visit to the Val Vista store as a potential solution to the inconvenience encountered.

If Toby Keith genuinely has an affection for this establishment, he would consider dismissing the present culinary staff and recruiting new personnel who possess the ability to prepare delectable dishes that would appease his refined taste buds.  The hospitable nature of the service staff was appreciated, yet the gastronomical offerings left much to be desired, particularly the BBQ Baby Back Ribs, which lacked succulence and flavor, and the Jumbo Fried Shrimps, whose heavy batter overpowered the delicate essence of the seafood, thereby rendering them unpalatable.  Based on my personal experience and culinary standards, I have reached the inference that Harrah's resorts to issuing complimentary food vouchers as a marketing strategy, given that few individuals would voluntarily opt to dine at this establishment if they were required to cover the cost themselves.  Needless to say, I do not intend to partake in any future gastronomical endeavors at this venue.

Check in staff was great the view from out side was ok. Then the room electrical switches that are barely sticking out some you can see wires on. Paint was peeling all over and the shower was falling apart the caulking was all coming off. These rooms are not what I expect for this price. Even the tv which was a older flat screen did not have HD and half the channels failed to work. Breakfast was not great and  they failed to clean up tables so no where to sit and eat. Pool area had several areas trapped off as well as the parking lot had a lot of it closed. Over all very disappointed in this property I would not recommend it. When I checked out I was told your good to go as she ate her breakfast and then walked away not once was I asked how my stay was.

"This establishment has undergone a significant decline in quality, as evidenced by my previous experiences here, which were characterized by exceptional service. However, our current stay has been marred by a plethora of disturbances emanating from the adjacent room, where a large group of intoxicated individuals engaged in boisterous behavior, including shouting and jumping, both within the room and in the corridor outside. Despite numerous attempts to alert security personnel, their response was inadequate, leaving us with no choice but to seek alternative accommodations. It is unfortunate that a previously esteemed establishment has deteriorated to such an extent that it now resembles a budget-oriented motel, thereby forfeiting our loyal patronage."

The entire gamut of flavors falls short of expectations, with a particularly egregious deficiency in quality evident in the eastern region; rather than possessing the desired velvety texture and rich, nuanced taste, these samples exhibit an unfortunate tendency towards iciness, which proved so off-putting that even a child of tender years declined to consume their portion.

Following my meticulous examination of diverse weight loss clinics, I ultimately opted to experiment with Medshape's services. Upon securing an appointment at 9 am, I arrived promptly and registered my presence â?despite the absence of a receptionist â?and awaited my turn in the compact waiting area. As time elapsed, specifically five, ten, and fifteen minutes, a staff member briefly appeared, inquiring about my presence, seemingly oblivious to the fact that I had already signed in. Subsequently, she assured me that she would promptly return with the requisite paperwork. However, five minutes lapsed before she reappeared, instructing me to accompany her to a chilly office to complete the forms. I expedited the process, finishing the paperwork within two minutes, and subsequently awaited further instructions. Unfortunately, a prolonged period of time passed without any indication of progress or communication from the staff, compelling me to seek clarification regarding the delay. To my dismay, the reception area was unattended, and following my departure at 10 am, I remain sans an explanation or apology for the inconvenience endured during the sixty-minute ordeal.

"If I had the option to bestow a rating inferior to one star, I undoubtedly would! This establishment's subpar service was truly appalling. The waitstaff's initial salutation consisted merely of a perfunctory 'what can I get you', devoid of any semblance of warmth, welcome, or even a cursory acknowledgement of our arrival. A veritable fiasco! Furthermore, the ambient illumination within the premises was excessively dim, fostering an atmosphere of discomfort and unease, particularly in light of the fact that I prefer to possess visual acuity when partaking of consumables. Additionally, the presence of litter on the floor only served to further mar the already unimpressive ambiance. Suffice it to say, we opted not to remain and shall never revisit this establishment."

Dirty, dank, stinky cars.  One pretty good customer service rep working tonight, one really bad one.

The girl at the counter is rude, huffy, rolls her eyes at me, attempts to argue with me.  Almost comedic in nature.

Aside from the foolishness of the one cranky agent who should be replaced, the cars are dirty- very dirty, and they smell.  

The experience I had today does not fit into the Hertz brand image nor does it reflect well on the businesses that refer to this location. 

This place needs to get secret shopped badly.

I forgot to mention the tag on my rental car is expired as of June 2014.  So, yea, no one is taking care of the cars, expired tags plus dirty cars makes me sure no one is paying attention.

Placed an order for delivery on phone at 6:45 pm. They said it would arrive in approx 45 min. 1 hour later i called them. They stated that it was on the way. Called them again at 8pm, they said so sorry, give you 50% off. Waited untill 8:30, still no food. Called them back again and told them to stuff it. VERY POOR! Would not recommend this joint to anyone. Very, very poor!

It's 12/23/2014 - almost 5 months to the date since I posted my Yelp review of Phoenix Music Lessons -(and months passed since I had attempted to solicit feedback from the owner of Phoenix Music Lessons).  TODAY - I am contacted with an explanation that "I honestly thought you were probably a good person but I felt a dislike towards me right away. That energy was truly difficult for me to deal with."  

His "concerned" response concluded with this: "PS. I once had a doctor do surgery on my knee.  I really disliked him (really this guy was a jerk) but I knew he was an expert..... My knee works great again. :)"

Since 12/23/2014 (again five months after my initial review) - the Owner has contacted me several times via personal email 3-4 and 1x telephone (actually left a message) - surreptitiously attempting to convince me to edit/delete or otherwise alter my review.  I find the Owner's contact inappropriate and borderline harassing.  I rejected his offers of a refund as that is not the intent of my review - rather to advise others of my experience.  The Owner provided a service- and was compensated for his service.    My opinion is this Owner does not take kindly to those with opposing/differing views.  

Unprofessional and inappropriate boundaries.

At Las Vegas for the initial instance and despite the fact that I prognosticate and thoroughly anticipate impoliteness, miscreants, and unabashed alcoholics to approach me; I have never encountered such discourtesy as I have figuratively JUST experienced from a clientele service attendant (to whom I posed a straightforward inquiry; "where can I locate the lavatory?"), to which she reacted, "I'm indicating towards it, are you unable to perceive, it displays "restroom"", to which I replied, "oh, I apologize, I've never been here, therefore you could've simply stated "around the corner and to the right"." Las Vegas is deliberately constructed to divert attention from EVERYTHING, in addition, complimentary beverages are provided for gambling. I apologize if I've been savoring my holiday. How about merely expressing, "hey, it's down this passageway and to the right." I'll discover it eventually. No requirement to offend me or my intellect due to the fact that I am significantly more sober than the majority of these individuals. The conclusion. Thank you. "Norma" was her designation. Avoid her.

1.  The 15 minute wait to be seated was unnecessary.  There were 10 empty tables when we were seated, but yet there was a line waiting to be seated.
2.  The 5 minute wait for our server to show up was way too long.
3.  The service was forgettable.
4.  The food was too expensive for the level of service we received.
5.  Note to manager.  Hire some more servers.  Hire servers who know their income depends on their level of service they provide.
6.  The food was ok, but over priced for what you get.  There are other BBQ restaurants charging half the price, and better service.

I have had the misfortune of leasing a dwelling in this locality on two separate occasions, and both times, the queue for the rental process has been excessively prolonged, lasting for more than sixty minutes. Considering the brevity of life, it is unwise to squander one's time in such a manner; hence, I strongly advise potential lessees to seek alternative accommodations.

I've used Danny's for years, in fact I did work for the company for a number of years also, so I supported their business until a recent event that I will never do business with them again! 

  To my fellow Arizonians, the guys at first take in are on commissions, so they will sell you the moon, guarantees, refunds, whatever to get you to sign, once the sell is complete, you are stuck & Ted @ corporate can't remember one conversation from the next, so obviously there is a lot of complaints, I got nailed for 200 bucks written right on my ticket, but the sales receipt says "All sales are final", drive past this place, bad news, read the reviews. 

  In final, the workers in my vehicle vacuumed up all my loose change in my ashtray & daily they split up everything at the end of the day as tip money. Ted, management, whoever deny or make shotty excuses & it is at the consumers risk to use them. Do yourself a favor & go elsewhere. The 200 charge I got stuck with (a full detail) I gave it away, I'll never use them again!

"This establishment can be considered a subpar iteration of Wazuzu, with a service quality that falls short of satisfactory standards. Our Dim Sum order was neglected by the server, who upon his eventual return to our table, demonstrated an apathetic demeanor and refuted my claim of the oversight, accusing me of being dishonest without offering a scintilla of remorse or concern. It is truly confounding how such an esteemed eatery can exhibit such indifference towards its patrons, especially given the premium prices charged for their culinary offerings. For an optimal gastronomic experience, it is advisable to visit Wazuzu at the Encore, where the quality of the fare and the attentiveness of the staff will render the expense worthwhile."

I have been checking on this place for the last couple weeks, first there was a sign on the door, \"Temporarily closed, come back later\"  Not a good sign.  Stopped again today, letter from the city showing is is shut down.  What a shame, were did my favorite waitresses go???

"It is utterly perplexing to observe how individuals residing in affluent neighborhoods will unquestioningly purchase, consume, and effusively praise any edible item that happens to be located within their perceived territorial boundaries, without regard for its actual quality or value. Let us establish a sense of reality here. The pizza served at this establishment was not merely mediocre, but it was also exorbitantly priced. The crust, supposedly crafted with water from New York, was unjustifiably burnt and charred, rendering it inedible. The sauce, if present, was seemingly devoid of any discernible flavor profile. The cheese, what little there was, had been cooked to an unfortunate state of desiccation, resulting in a texture akin to paper. The pepperoni slices, measuring a paltry dime in size, were applied with an heavy hand, defying any semblance of authentic Italian cuisine. Furthermore, the solitary basil leaf, dried to a crisp, situated in the center of the pizza, served no apparent purpose other than to accentuate the overall lackluster quality of the dish. In fact, a hastily prepared Pillsbury biscuit, topped with ketchup and Kraft cheese, would likely prove more satisfying when subjected to a makeshift cooking method involving a fire pit. Additionally, this restaurant's absence of ranch dressing as a condiment option only serves to further underscore its shortcomings. People, let us not be deceived by such transparent gimmicks. Instead, we should seek out genuine culinary experiences, such as those offered by Montesanos, Villa on Sahara and Valley View, or even Metro. The cacophonous ambiance and excessive illumination within this establishment should be sufficient deterrents against patronizing it, not to mention the challenges posed by the parking situation, which borders on the absurd."

$14 per individual left me utterly disillusioned. Out of my numerous excursions to Las Vegas, I had consistently yearned to experience the roller coaster at NYNY due to its perceived coolness, which unfortunately did not live up to my expectations. In fact, it was as enjoyable as inserting 50 cents into an arcade game at Chuck E. Cheese's and occupying one of those diminutive vehicles designed for young children that oscillate back and forth in a mundane manner. Needless to say, I am now thoroughly disheartened. A daylong admission pass cost a whopping $25, and if one desires to partake in the ride again, an additional fee of $7 is required after the initial experience. Following such an egregious act of exploitation, it is bewildering why anyone would opt to indulge in this subpar attraction once more. Instead, it is advisable to preserve your financial resources and contribute them to a more worthy cause, such as the destitute individual situated on the sky bridge.

"The experience I had at this establishment was utterly disappointing and frustrating. The staff member who assisted me was curt and displayed an uncooperative demeanor when I sought clarification regarding the products I was interested in purchasing. Notwithstanding the fact that I was the sole patron in the store at the time, my queries were met with brevity and an air of impatience. Moreover, I was taken aback by the fact that the liquid chlorine I purchased failed to produce any noticeable impact on my tested levels, despite my having followed the recommended dosage instructions. Perplexed and disconcerted by this anomaly, I opted to contact the store via telephone, only to be met with a dismissive and discourteous response from the representative who answered my call. It is worth noting that my usual place of business for such necessities is a different store, and my decision to visit Leslie's on this particular occasion was purely out of convenience; however, in light of the subpar service I received, I shall resume my patronage of the aforementioned familiar establishment henceforth."

"I am thoroughly exasperated with Sprint's subpar service, characterized by unreliable coverage, frequent app malfunctions, dropped calls, and payment issues. Furthermore, I am currently experiencing extreme frustration due to my iPhone's sudden demise and the ineptitude of a certain Sprint employee. Specifically, after my phone died, I attempted to charge it with three different chargers, but to no avail. Consequently, I brought it to the store, whereupon a male employee with light-colored hair and dark-rimmed glasses displayed visible annoyance at having to assist me. Following my explanation of the issue, he curtly informed me that the phone was functioning properly and that I could either purchase a new charger or wait; his tone conveyed a lack of concern for my inconvenience. Upon returning home, I discovered that the phone remained lifeless despite being charged for an extended period. In light of this experience, it appears that Sprint may benefit from training their staff on Apple products, particularly since they will likely encounter a high volume of iPhone users. Therefore, I shall seek assistance at the Apple Store tomorrow, as Sprint's employees have proven themselves to be incompetent."

This establishment appears to implement discriminatory practices against patrons who may encounter difficulties transporting merchandise beyond the premises, as evidenced by the restriction on utilizing carts outside. It is intriguing to ponder the rationale behind such a policy, particularly when considering that neighboring retailers, such as Target, permit customers to convey their purchases to their vehicles without any apparent qualms. One cannot help but wonder if this disparity in treatment stems from an inherent prejudice against the clientele frequenting this particular store, which has been described by some as "ghetto." A cursory examination of the customer base at Target, Fry's, and Ross fails to reveal any appreciable distinctions, rendering the rationale behind this discrepancy in policy all the more enigmatic. Personal experience has confirmed the veracity of this phenomenon, as a friend had acquired a satisfactory bargain on a decorative item for furniture, only to be thwarted by physical limitations in transporting it to our vehicle. In response, a courteous security personnel suggested driving up to the entrance, while a sympathetic cashier listened to our plight and a kind-hearted individual overheard our conversation and gallantly offered his assistance in conveying the item to our automobile.
