Compelled to express my dissatisfaction, I returned to the location the following day, only to be met with a rude and dismissive response from the individual behind the counter, whom I can only assume held a managerial position within the organization. Based on my underwhelming experience, I would strongly advise against patronizing this particular KFC branch due to its subpar service and culinary offerings."

We were starving and decided on the TI Buffet. YUCK! This buffet was $26.95./ person. Ok so we are talking cheaper in terms of nice buffets nowadays. But, the food was INEDIBLE! I had a small salad, which they plate for you. I appreciate that as it was all behind glass, and had at least not been sneezed on by everyone in the hotel. The veggies were not fresh. The selection. 3 or 4 stations. Turkey? ewwww was that even turkey?

I have had the pleasure of dining at Carmine's with a considerable gathering and was eagerly anticipating the entire family-style experience they offered. Unfortunately, my expectations were not met, as the cuisine was subpar and the eatery was excessively priced for its quality. I was presented with plates that were inundated with salt, broccoli that was charred beyond recognition, and pasta that was cooked to an unpalatable texture. The cost was exacerbated by the fact that I had the opportunity to indulge in superior culinary delights for a fraction of the price during my excursion (Vegas, being the city of abundant gastronomic options, certainly did not disappoint). The sole attribute that warranted a positive rating was the respectable service we received. Therefore, I would advise those seeking delectable fare in Las Vegas to avoid this establishment.

"We had an unconventional experience at a restaurant. I attended the establishment with my paternal figure and my spouse, and we requested a booth. The waitstaff member replied, 'Certainly, allow me to sanitize the booth.' Subsequently, a group of four individuals entered the premises and also requested a booth. The waitstaff member responded, 'Sure, follow me,' which we found perplexing, as we had been waiting for several minutes while she tidied up a table (a considerable duration when one is anticipating being seated at a booth and ordering beverages...). Eventually, she seated us at a diminutive three-person table, which we found incongruous, considering my father's substantial stature (he weighs nearly 300 pounds). I queried the waitstaff member, 'Have you observed my father's physique?' Her response was evasive, as she failed to comprehend the predicament of accommodating us at a minuscule table. We decided to depart the establishment due to the waitstaff member's inability to understand our annoyance at being forced to wait for an inadequately sized table and her suggestion that we wait even longer... Frustrating, indeed, in a region renowned for its numerous delectable Mexican eateries."

"The salesperson who purported to assist me today exhibited a profound lack of competence. Upon approaching me, I articulated my requirement for a lockring tool, which necessitated an explanation of its purpose, specifically citing its utility in removing gears. The salesperson, seemingly perplexed by my query, responded by referencing a 'CASSETTE tool,' an appellation that struck me as somewhat incongruous given the context. Undeterred, he embarked upon an aimless excursion to the tool wall, situated behind the service desk, whereupon he fixated blankly upon the array of implements for a duration of approximately one minute. He then intimated that he would venture to the rear of the establishment in quest of the coveted tool, leaving me to await his return with a measure of trepidation. Following a brief interval, during which I remained stationary and unacknowledged near the register, another employee, cognizant of my presence, inquired as to my needs. Upon disclosing my intent to consummate a purchase, he necessitated the involvement of the original salesperson, who had initially rendered assistance, in order to effectuate the transaction. My initial intention had been to solicit counsel or advice from the sales staff regarding a problem I am currently experiencing with the brakes of my bicycle. However, in light of the manifest ineptitude displayed by the salespeople at this establishment, I elected not to seek their guidance and shall not be patronizing this store, or any other Tempe Bicycle, in the future."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

The text is: Good if you like painfully slow service, frozen breaded seafood, and potato soup passed off as clam chowder.  This restaurant, while decorated in tacky, outdated marine decor, used to be really great.  Disappointed that the place I used to go for a taste of New England \"home\", is now serving overpriced meals with a side of ridiculously slow service.

The modified text is:

"Suboptimal culinary experience with excessive latency in service, questionable seafood offerings, and an unfortunate attempt to pass off a potato-based soup as a traditional New England clam chowder, all within the confines of a kitschy, outdated nautical-themed establishment that once held promise but now disappoints with its overpriced fare and sluggish servicing, leaving a once-loyal patron disillusioned and seeking alternative dining options that can provide a genuine taste of nostalgic New England cuisine."

The only good thing about this eatery is its proximity to the Benedum. The three of us were seated at a table that was jammed in between two other tables, next to the kitchen - even though the place was half empty. I could hear the conversation at the next door table better than that of people sitting opposite me. The food was a sorry, sloppy, soggy mess that would have had Chef Ramsey throw up. The service was slow, inattentive, and made you feel vaguely unwelcome. Ridiculously overpriced. For  better value, a nicer atmosphere, and quality food, I strongly recommend a couple of places nearby that beat Tambellini's hands down - McDonalds or SubWay.

"As a novice to the area, I was determined to procure an exceptional brow waxing experience, and after conducting thorough research and perusing numerous endorsements, I opted to schedule an appointment with d'Lisa at the Scottsdale branch. Upon arriving at the salon, I was immediately struck by its pristine condition and inviting ambiance, which was complemented by d'Lisa's warm and welcoming demeanor. The procedure itself was remarkably expedient, lasting mere minutes, and upon completing a cursory inspection in the mirror, I hastily departed the premises. However, upon conducting a more thorough examination of my brows upon returning home, I was dismayed to discover that one eyebrow was offset by approximately 1/8 of an inch from my center line, while the other was a full half inch away. This disparity resulted in an unsightly and lopsided appearance, further exacerbated by a noticeable gap in the thicker brow, which necessitated the use of a pencil to fill in the deficiency. Needless to say, I was thoroughly disenchanted with the overall experience and do not plan on revisiting the establishment in the future."

"The most deplorable service and customer service I have ever had the displeasure of experiencing with any corporation thus far. Setting up a 3-bottle monthly agreement through Costco for $18 per month proved to be an unmitigated catastrophe. Every single scheduled delivery was missed, multiple times, and each and every delivery was incorrect, necessitating numerous telephone calls that were never properly addressed. Moreover, I was charged for deliveries that I did not request, and additionally, I was billed for all of the mistakes that they were unable to rectify. None of my phone calls appeared to register, or be noted or recorded anywhere...ever. During my inaugural month of service, I contacted the company an astonishing 15 times, only to realize that they were completely inept and could not be relied upon. Following my decision to cancel, I was charged and auto-debited for what was supposed to be my final month of service. Subsequently, I contacted them again and requested that my debit card be removed from their system, emphasizing that I did not trust them to accurately manage the billing process. Intelligent move - I received a $39 bill in the mail for erroneous deliveries that I never solicited, and I demanded that they retrieve them. Each and every charge was a result of their own blunders. To say nothing of the fact that the individuals employed by this organization are incompetent, they are also dishonest liars. No joke - it is significantly more convenient to physically visit a retail establishment and purchase 30 one-gallon jugs of water every month than to endure such nonsense. Not to mention, it's cheaper - gas included."

"The price of a product or service is often commensurate with its quality and the level of expertise provided by the vendor, as was evident in our recent experience with a wedding gown purchase. In May 2010, we acquired a wedding gown, bridesmaids' dresses, and attire for the mothers of both the bride and groom, including their grandmothers. Unfortunately, the encounter was marred by the bridesmaids' rudeness and the poor quality of the dresses, which manifested in the form of detaching straps mere moments before the nuptials were set to take place."

"Upon entering the establishment, I was immediately struck by the profound transformation that had taken place since my last visit. The previously barren landscape of electronic components had given way to an array of colorful and visually captivating merchandise, eerily reminiscent of a toy store. Perplexed and somewhat disoriented, I hesitated momentarily before approaching the sole employee, who appeared to be engrossed in a task of considerable importance. My presence, however, seemed to interrupt his concentration, and he reluctantly acknowledged my query with a demeanor suggestive of mild irritation. I articulated my requirements, specifically pertaining to a cable suitable for facilitating the functionality of my DVD burner, but was met with a dismissive response, implying that such an item was unavailable. The employee's curt demeanor and conspicuous lack of interest in assisting me further left me feeling disheartened and frustrated, prompting a hasty departure. Ultimately, my quest for a solution proved successful elsewhere, much to my relief, and I was grateful that my experience at Radio Shack did not culminate in financial support for their enterprise."

The modified text is: "Traumatic encounter characterized by an utter lack of empathy and bedside manner, culminating in a dehumanizing examination process akin to livestock handling, evoking feelings of indignation and disillusionment towards healthcare professionals, rendering the notion of accepting a beverage from them inconceivable, and instead, inspiring a desire to express dissatisfaction through a forceful and unambiguous departure."

The Eiffel Tower-inspired beverage may appear fascinating, but its practicality leaves much to be desired; in point of fact, the design of said drink is rather impractical for consumption, particularly for those who, like this author, possess diminutive upper extremities and a propensity for sipping their potations at a leisurely pace. While strolling along the famed Las Vegas Strip, the weight of the towering drink becomes increasingly burdensome, making it challenging to maintain one's equilibrium. Furthermore, the taste of the margarita strawberry daiquiri, which was this writer's selection, proved to be less than desirable; specifically, the flavor of the alcoholic component was not adequately masked, resulting in an unpleasant aftertaste. However, for those who do not share this author's aversion to the flavor of margaritas, the potency of the drink is undeniable. In order to mitigate the strength of the beverage, the addition of ice cubes is recommended. In conclusion, based on the experience recounted herein, it is advisable to avoid the Eiffel Tower drink and instead opt for an alternative container that is easier to handle, such as the guitar- or Fat Tuesday bong-shaped options; essentially, any vessel that includes a strap or handle would be a more judicious choice for those who wish to indulge in adult beverages without the added concern of managing the container itself while in a state of intoxication.

"The query regarding my absence from Kmart remains unanswered due to the unsanitary conditions of their restrooms, which had previously been subjected to financial solicitation. Furthermore, the dearth of customer service was appalling, prompting me to refer to their support team as the 'Lack of Customer Service' department. The employees appeared overburdened and visibly irritated by the mere prospect of addressing an inquiry or extending assistance. Their demeanor was utterly inacceptable."

"Although my culinary expertise does not extend to assessing the gastronomical quality of pizza, I must confess that my expectations regarding the edibility of other menu items at this establishment were not merely unfulfilled, but utterly decimated. Upon discovering a diminutive menu nestled within our entrance, we opted to exercise caution and sample their buffalo chicken fingers, accompanied by a side of Greek fries. The menu listed the item as either 10 or 6 wings for the modest sum of $6.99; however, during our telephonic order, we were informed that the quantity had been erroneously advertised, and that we would, in fact, receive twelve pieces for the same price. We verified this detail no fewer than three times prior to terminating the call. Our comestible curiosities satiated, we awaited the arrival of our repast with great anticipation. Alas! The hour that elapsed before its arrival proved insufficient for the preparation of the fries, which, upon their appearance, were manifestly undercooked. Their texture approximated that of a gelatinous mire, rendering them irredeemably unpalatable. The chicken fingers, too, suffered from an unfortunate deficiency in flavor, their taste bearing a striking resemblance to that of a recently thawed, microwave-heated meal. This gastronomical fiasco reached its zenith when we were presented with a bill totaling twenty dollars. The inclusion of a pair of ranch dipping sauces added an additional dollar to the tally, while the chicken, despite our previous confirmations, was priced at nine dollars and ninety-nine cents. Two dollars and ninety-nine cents were furthermore demanded for the uncooked fries. When combined with the delivery fee and gratuity, our total expenditure amounted to twenty dollars. The duration of time that transpired between our initial craving and ultimate satisfaction? A mere ninety minutes. Suffice it to say, I would not venture to sample their pizza offerings, nor any other item on their menu, based on this singularly unpleasant encounter."

The apologetic sentiment is conveyed, albeit with a tinge of regret, as the writer expresses their disappointment with the underwhelming experience that was had at the show, specifically citing the lackluster nature of the performance, the unengaging and unamusing attempts at humor by the host, and the overall overratedness of the production, which, for the sake of clarity, is not to imply that the writer is not a fan of Cirque du Soleil, as they have thoroughly enjoyed previous shows such as KA and Zumanity, but rather, that Mystere, in particular, falls short of expectations, thereby warranting skipping it altogether.

Horrible service and food. Worst beef Enchilada I have ever had, even I know Mexican Rice doesn't have peas and corn in it, and margarita tasted like it was poured from a can. This is not considered real Mexican restaurant in my eyes. Was definitely a waste of money!!

This particular Walmart establishment bore a striking resemblance to its counterparts, with one notable exception - the staff members exhibited an unfortunate tendency towards discourteous behavior and an absence of assistance, rendering them decidedly unhelpful. Consequently, I have opted to discontinue my patronage of this specific Walmart location in favor of traveling a greater distance to alternative Walmart stores where I can anticipate receiving cordial and friendly service.

"It is imperative that individuals avoid visiting this nightclub at all costs, as it is an establishment that exudes an ambiance of utter displeasure and dissatisfaction. The patrons, specifically the female dancers, possess physical attributes that are far from aesthetically pleasing, with their corpulent figures and unattractive features being particularly noteworthy. Moreover, one dancer, Suzy Q, has an odor that is reminiscent of putrid underarm sweat, which lingers on the fabric of my garment even after she has departed. The remainder of the females at this club exhibit a lack of warmth and friendliness, choosing instead to display an attitude of indolence and inhospitability. Although the club offers reasonable drink specials, this solitary aspect does not compensate for the overall unpleasantness that permeates the atmosphere. In conclusion, I would not recommend this club to even my most bitter adversary."
My gf sent me as a treat and it was the worst massage ever. I left before finishing the 90 minutes. I probably feel better massaging myself. So very disappointed.

I reserved a one-night stay at this hotel through Hotwire, rationalizing that the cost was approximately one-third of the expense of lodging on the Las Vegas Strip on a Saturday evening, and given that we would only be utilizing the accommodations for a mere nine hours, it seemed logical to opt for this particular establishment. However, upon arrival, it became apparent that the hotel was in dire need of extensive renovations. Water was observed dripping from the ceiling in the corridor en route to the elevator, and while the area was cordoned off with a waste bin positioned in the center to collect the water, it continued to drip onto pedestrians as they passed by. The room itself was adequate, with a comfortable bed, but the shower facilities left much to be desired. Specifically, upon opening the shower curtain, a puddle of black sludge was discovered on the floor of the shower, prompting me to forgo showering altogether. When brought to the attention of the front desk at the time of checkout, the representative displayed a discernible attitude, implying that I was complaining unnecessarily, and expressing annoyance that I failed to notify staff members prior to bringing the issue to their attention. In response, I received a complimentary upgrade for a future stay, although I seriously doubt that I will ever return to this hotel again. It becomes abundantly clear why this establishment is no longer affiliated with Hilton.

I was eagerly anticipating visiting a local donut establishment, but my expectations were unfortunately not met. Upon entering the shop, I was immediately struck by the lack of descriptive labels accompanying the assortment of donuts showcased on the counter. While it is common practice for donut shops to omit detailed ingredient lists for their products, this particular business has deliberately differentiated itself by offering unique and unconventional flavors, thereby warranting further clarification. Subsequent to requesting elaboration from a visibly irritated staff member, my better half and I opted to sample four distinct varieties. Notably, my selections included the maple bacon and strawberry shortcake donuts, which, owing to their conspicuous lack of texture and flavor differentiation, could have easily been designated as the "greasy" and "sticky" options, respectively. As for my spouse's choices, their forgettable nature precludes me from recalling their specificity, although I can confirm that one remains uneaten in our refrigerator two weeks later. Considering my underwhelming experience, I cannot envision a scenario wherein I would voluntarily return to this establishment; however, I do foresee the possibility of utilizing discounted offers in the future.

"It appears that my sentiments regarding the establishment in question are shared by numerous individuals, as evidenced by the plethora of comments expressing similar dissatisfaction with the dining experience provided. Upon entering the premises for the first and, I assure you, last time, I was struck by the utter lack of flavor and warmth in the food presented before me. Furthermore, the service we received was nothing short of abysmal, with a palpable sense of apathy and disinterest emanating from the staff members who, after an interminable wait, eventually deigned to attend to our needs. It is worth noting that, despite the dearth of patrons in the establishment at the time of our visit, the staff seemed to be in a state of utmost urgency, as if they had more pressing engagements to attend to than ensuring the satisfaction of their few remaining customers. Lamentably, the culinary offerings of the establishment in question pale in comparison to those of its competitors, such as the venerable Burger King, located mere steps away. In light of these considerations, it is my conviction that the longevity of this particular eatery is unlikely to extend beyond a fleeting moment in the vast expanse of time."

That was the most unpleasant coffeehouse encounter I have ever had the displeasure of experiencing, and there isn't a close second in terms of its unpalatable nature. If your definition of an upscale coffee establishment entails snooty and patronizing servers, interminable waits when there is no one else present, mediocre (at best) and exorbitantly priced coffee, and limited options for customizing your coffee to suit your preferences, then this particular establishment would undoubtedly be your preferred choice. Wow, I have had the privilege of consuming coffee in various locations around the globe and at some of the most renowned coffee roasters in the country, including Intelligentsia in Chicago, which happens to be the source of 21st's beans. You would never be treated with such disdain and haughtiness there. Never. The barista seemed to possess an air of superiority, as if they had discovered the meaning of life and felt compelled to share their profound knowledge with us Pittsburghers, who should be eternally grateful for their benevolence. Newsflash - pour overs and direct trade coffee are not novel concepts in the realm of coffee. Get over yourself, 21st. I might have been willing to overlook the entire ordeal if my straightforward black coffee had been a respectable cup, but alas, it fell short of my expectations. My recommendation? Spare your time, money, and taste buds by visiting Espresso a Mano in Lawrenceville, Cannon Coffee in Brookline, La Prima in the Strip, or any of the other establishments in town that offer exceptional coffee without the accompaniment of a condescending attitude. I yearned for a good cup of coffee, not a lecture, and certainly not a subpar one. What a disappointment.

Traveling from San Francisco saw the store ate breakfast next door and then went to go to the uniform store and they were closed even though the sign said they open at 8am\nWe waited until 815 still no sign of anyone \nVery disappointing

"It is evident that I once derived pleasure from visiting this establishment, however, it appears that a recent shift in policy has rendered my attire unacceptable. The proprietor, upon recognizing me, retrieved my wristband from the entrance attendant and compensated the individual responsible for collecting covers without uttering a single remark regarding my headwear. Shortly afterward, a staff member approached me and demanded a refund, insisting that I remove my hat before departing. Needless to say, I shall not be returning to this venue in the future. Furthermore, I am now reevaluating my loyalty towards Images, given its shared ownership with this particular business."

This culinary experience was utterly disappointing and subpar, and we would unequivocally recommend patronizing an establishment such as Hometown Buffet instead, as it offers a vastly superior gastronomical encounter. The ambiance and decor of this particular buffet were unremarkable and bizarre, lacking the sophistication and refinement that one would expect from a venue named after a deity of ancient Rome. Indeed, the fare and overall experience provided by this buffet fell short of even the most modest expectations of mere mortals such as ourselves.

"Offered the eatery a subsequent opportunity - similarly disillusioned.  Sluggish bar service, approximately three quarters of an hour elapsed prior to receiving an hors d'oeuvre from an apathetic server.  Following our seating, we observed our salads traverse the dining area twice before the attendant located our table.  Wait staff delivered the main courses and promptly departed, neglecting to enquire about the quality of our repast.  Although flavorful, the helpings were diminutive. \n\nUnfortunately, the most satisfactory aspect of this culinary establishment is the valet parking.  Refrain from tormenting yourself; dine elsewhere in the company of companions."

Upon entering the office, an air of perplexity enveloped me, as I had presumed that I was accessing a complimentary medical facility; however, this notion remained unconfirmed. My scheduled time for the consultation was 1 pm, yet I endured an extensive delay, ultimately being attended to at 1:50 pm. It is worth noting that had I been responsible for such a prolonged latency, my appointment would have been summarily terminated. Notwithstanding, I did engage with an individual purporting to be Bryan Monson, although the brevity of our interaction precluded any meaningful dialogue. Following a cursory examination, he directed me to seek the expertise of Dr. Garcia, situated within the same premises, for the purpose of surgical intervention. Subsequently, he provided a fleeting explanation to my daughter, which I, regrettably, failed to comprehend due to my advanced years, resulting in an abrupt departure. Suffice it to say, I shall not be returning to this establishment, nor shall I express gratitude for the cosmetic enhancement treatment offered.

"The epitome of unpalatable Chinese cuisine, this establishment has unequivocally earned the distinction of being the most unsatisfactory dining experience I have had the misfortune of encountering. The series of unfortunate events began with a telephone call to place an order, during which the language barrier proved insurmountable for the female staff member, who demonstrated an utter incapacity to comprehend even the most basic aspects of the English language. Compounding this already unpromising start was her subsequent propensity for vocalizing my credit card information, including the sensitive security code embossed on the reverse side, at maximum volume. Such egregious negligence regarding the handling of personal financial data not only engendered profound consternation but also irrevocably compromised my trust in the restaurant's ability to uphold even the most fundamental standards of competence and professionalism. Regrettably, the gastronomic offerings themselves proved equally disappointing, with the quality of the food falling short of even the most modest expectations. In light of the abundance of superior Chinese restaurants in the vicinity, I emphatically advise against patronizing this establishment and instead encourage seeking out alternative dining options that are truly deserving of your custom."

"Flee the premises immediately! The proprietor's behavior is utterly reprehensible, exemplifying a complete lack of respect for their patrons and an inability to emulate even the most basic aspects of ownership. Furthermore, the eatery itself is a breeding ground for unsanitation, as evidenced by the discovery of an unsolicited and unsettling foreign body within my salad. When brought to the attention of the owner, they initially attempted to dismiss the situation by implying that the errant hair must have been carried by a gust of wind into my dish, only to later offer a feeble compromise in the form of a supplementary side salad. Upon expressing my dissatisfaction with this inadequate solution, the proprietor became defensive and belligerent, insisting that their staff would simply reheat the tainted chicken and serve it alongside a fresh salad. Needless to say, I declined this dubious offer and demanded a refund, which was eventually granted, likely due to the owner's fear of losing clientele. It is truly unfortunate that such a potentially pleasant dining experience was marred by the owner's callous disregard for their patrons' satisfaction and well-being."

"For the second consecutive occasion, they have perpetuated an egregious oversight, precipitating an untenable delay for me to procure a vehicle, thereby calling into question the efficacy of their reservation system. My designated time for car collection was 11:15 a.m., yet it is now 12:30 p.m., and I have been assured that the automobile will be available within the next half hour. It is abundantly evident that the operations manager would benefit from exploring alternative vocational pursuits, as their proficiency in this particular domain is patently limited."

On December 19, 2014, I observed that my outdoor freezer had a noticeable puddle of water encircling it, which prompted me to hastily venture out to Lowe's in pursuit of a substitute freezer. Given our lack of enthusiasm towards the Rock Hill Lowe's, we opted to visit the one situated in Fort Mill instead. Upon arriving at the Fort Mill Lowe's, we were informed that they would examine their inventory to determine if they possessed any freezers in stock. However, it became apparent that they did not possess any in stock; nonetheless, they offered to contact the Rock Hill Lowe's on our behalf to ascertain whether they had any available. As we awaited a response from the Rock Hill staff, we decided to proceed to the Lowe's in Rock Hill while simultaneously awaiting a callback from the Fort Mill store on our mobile device. Following a 15-minute drive, we arrived at the Rock Hill Lowe's, only to discover that the Fort Mill store had neither contacted us nor provided any updates concerning the availability of freezers. Ultimately, we were dissatisfied with the sluggish and thoughtless service displayed by Lowe's, leading us to explore alternative retailers such as Sears and Home Depot for our appliance requirements. Eventually, we managed to locate a store with a freezer in stock, yet we never received a response from the Fort Mill Lowe's, leaving us feeling underwhelmed and unvalued as customers. Moving forward, when seeking appliances, I shall prioritize visiting Sears and Home Depot.

"Grossly exaggerated positive reviews, which aroused my suspicion regarding their authenticity, as they seemed to have been crafted by Cosmo's PR firm employing clever linguistic tactics to create a false impression of excellence.  

The rooms were equipped with state-of-the-art technology, integrated into the television set, allowing for seamless control of lighting and temperature; however, the remote batteries were depleted, necessitating replacement with my own set of batteries, solely to adjust the thermostat settings. Moreover, the maintenance staff proved sluggish in addressing the issue of multiple burned-out bulbs, compelling us to improvise by redistributing functioning bulbs to ensure adequate illumination in the lavatory area, thereby averting complete darkness. 

My assessment of this hotel warrants a solitary star, not for the aforementioned shortcomings, but rather for their unabashed audacity in charging our room a whopping $68.00 for the mini-bar, which we did not utilize. Furthermore, their flippant attitude towards an accounting error, which they claimed was 'common,' only served to exacerbate our dissatisfaction. We were informed that merely opening the refrigerator, which we employed for storing our personal items, would trigger an automatic charge. Such practices strike me as not only underhanded but also as a reprehensible and twisted means of generating profits. Our experiences during check-in and check-out only added to the overall difficulty of our stay."
Can't really comment because I came on normal business hours and at normal time at 4pm and they were closed no sign no nothing . Kinda disappointing.

don't go here.
after reading reviews, i went to it.
i and my friend ordered 2 pastas. they were horrible taste.
alfredo didn't have anything. only it and sauce.
if you are very hungry, i want to recoomend here.
they serve huge amount of pastas

I'm all about supporting small local businesses but I was lied to by John Mull employees about something I consider important.

I called once and asked if they carried grass fed, pasture raised beef. The woman who answered the phone said yes so I went down and purchased two steaks. I verified one more time before purchasing that the beef was grass fed and again I was told yes. The steaks tasted great, but grass fed beef has a particular taste.

Feeling skeptical, I called again today to see if they had any more in stock and to get the name of their supplier. The woman who answered the phone consulted with someone else and told me they don't carry grass fed beef, nor have they ever.

I tried to go here to get a bite to eat and have a Smithwick's.  There's a fridge with premade sandwiches and no Smithwick's.  I don't think you can call yourself an Irish Pub just because one of the 6 beers you have on tap is a Guinness.  I ended up going somewhere else...

I placed an order for delivery from this establishment, which amounted to approximately $35 worth of sushi and other culinary items. Upon the arrival of the delivery driver at our residence, I requested change for a $40 bill and was prepared to offer a gratuity for his services. However, the delivery driver, a shorter Asian man, began to vociferously express his discontent with the paltry sum I was about to bestow upon him, incredulous that I would even consider such an inadequate tip for his efforts in traversing the city. My response to his outburst was one of utter disbelief, as I felt no obligation whatsoever to provide him with a gratuity, especially given the unacceptable manner in which he conducted himself during our interaction. Suffice it to say, I shall never again patronize this particular location, and instead recommend visiting the Edo restaurant situated on Monona Drive, where the staff has consistently displayed exceptional customer service and a welcoming demeanor.

I only put one start because I was going to invite me my mom but as soon as I walked in someone rudely said we are closed ! So in my head I'm like ohh well shouldn't you have locked the doors for I wouldn't have wasted my time going inside . Plus it was 2:05 I don't think u should say no to a costumer right away

"It befuddles my comprehension how Taco Bell manages to maintain its operational status in Arizona, given the plethora of exceptional Mexican dining establishments that permeate the region. The quality of cuisine served at Taco Bell pales in comparison to the authentic, delectable fare offered by local eateries, rendering it a mystifying enigma that this fast-food chain continues to attract patronage."

If I were able to bestow upon this culinary establishment a rating of zero stars, I undoubtedly would, as my dining experience was utterly unremarkable and subpar in every aspect. First and foremost, the horchata, a beverage traditionally crafted from the richness of rice, was regrettably fabricated from a pre-mixed formula, resulting in an unpleasantly chalky texture and flavor. Furthermore, the so-called "nachos" presented themselves as a travesty, boasting neither the genuine, handmade tortilla chips nor the velvety, melted cheese characteristic of authentic Mexican cuisine, but instead proffering a pale imitation in the form of circular, processed yellow chips smothered in a bland, synthetic cheese sauce. The lone redeeming quality of the meal lay in the palatability of the meat, yet even this virtue proved fleeting, as its preparation lacked the nuanced seasonings and masterful cooking techniques that distinguish truly exceptional Mexican fare. This dining experience resembled nothing so much as a mediocre, overpriced movie theater snack, catering solely to the unsophisticated tastes of inebriated patrons who, in their diminished state of discernment, might mistakenly equate such an uninspired meal with gastronomic excellence. Those who have had the privilege of partaking in genuine, authentically prepared Mexican cuisine would do well to exercise extreme caution when considering a visit to this eatery.

"The subterranean transportation infrastructure in question does not possess the customary exceptional quality of service that one would anticipate from such a system. I have personally experienced multiple instances wherein the personnel operating the establishment have not conformed to a standardized attire, which has contributed to an overall impression of disorganization and unprofessionalism. Furthermore, my interactions with the staff have frequently been met with brusque and dismissive responses, thereby further undermining my confidence in their capacity to effectively address customer concerns. Consequently, I would advocate for the patronage of alternative dining establishments, such as Jersey Mike's, in lieu of this particular subway franchise."

It is a Monday evening, and I am currently experiencing an extended wait on hold in order to secure a collective booking, as eight individuals are considered a substantial gathering by the establishment's standards. Following my direct interaction with a representative from the restaurant, it became apparent that they were not interested in engaging with me further, resulting in their decision to transfer my call to the department specializing in large reservations. However, this assertion proved to be false, as I was instead redirected to Caesar's dining line, which I was already aware was uncapable of accommodating such a sizable party. Consequently, I endured a series of transfers between various lines for approximately fifteen minutes, during which time I composed this very review. Ultimately, a male individual named Brandon informed me that they would need to obtain my contact information and return my call at a later time. The likelihood and timing of such a callback remain to be seen.

"A transformation has occurred at this site...As a habitual patron, I have noticed a considerable decline in the expediency of the drive-thru service over the past three weeks...If the current state of affairs does not experience a marked improvement, it appears that visiting Dutch Bros will be a more judicious utilization of time."

"Gross. Gross, gross, gross. My culinary experience at this establishment was utterly disappointing and subpar, with a menu that lacked authenticity and presented an unpleasant assortment of dishes. Even the seemingly innocuous fruit cup failed to impress, with its meager selection of unripe and unvaried fruit that did little to excite the taste buds. Las Vegas boasts a plethora of exceptional dining options, many of which offer reasonable prices and refined culinary experiences. I implore those who rely on Yelp reviews to seek out alternative venues for a satisfying breakfast."

This establishment appears to possess an appealing exterior, yet its interior fails to meet expectations. Despite my initial enthusiasm for the menu and accompanying visuals, the raw fish dishes did not live up to their promise. The presentation of the dishes was indeed aesthetically pleasing, but upon consuming them, it became evident that the flavors did not deliver the expected culinary experience. A closer inspection revealed that the majority of the sushi rolls conformed to the conventional California roll format, with additional ingredients added on top. My order of four pieces of eel proved to be disappointing, as the texture was unpleasantly chewy. Furthermore, the rice accompanying each piece of sushi was excessive and seemed to be either undercooked or improperly prepared. None of the dishes we sampled possessed the desired quality of melting in one's mouth, which is a hallmark of exceptional sushi or sushi rolls. Our order consisted of five rolls, along with a variety of sushi and soups. Notably, the mushroom soup, priced at $3 above the standard miso soup, contained only minuscule fragments of mushrooms, rendering it an unremarkable experience. The chopsticks provided by the establishment were of a subpar quality, resembling those commonly found in grocery stores and exhibiting a tendency to splinter. In conclusion, the sushi offered at this location failed to measure up to even the most basic standards, leading me to formulate a strong aversion to ever returning to this restaurant again.

"Having availed ourselves of their facilities for the extraction of septic waste on a previous occasion, we were generally content with the level of service proffered by this particular enterprise. However, upon our most recent interaction, it came to our attention that the cost had increased by a factor of two, while the duration of the procedure itself appeared to be somewhat abbreviated. Furthermore, the demeanor of the individual responsible for conducting the drainage process struck us as brusque and tinged with an air of impatience. We were left with the distinct impression that the task had not been executed with the same degree of diligence and attention to detail as had been the case during our initial encounter. Disappointingly, the septic tank was once again saturated to capacity a mere six months subsequent to this subpar service. Our attempts to solicit assistance in addressing this issue have thus far proven unavailing, leading us to conclude that we would not, in good conscience, advocate for this firm's services to others. It is our fervent hope that potential patrons will exercise greater discernment in their selection of a waste management provider."

"My dissatisfaction with this establishment stems from an unfortunate incident during my second visit, wherein they erroneously charged my credit card $84.01 for an order of chicken wings. Despite the lady's assurance that she had voided the transaction and corrected the issue by re-swiping my card, the amount remained deducted from my account five days later. This prompted me to seek assistance from my financial institution to rectify the situation. However, I find it unacceptable that I was subjected to such inconvenience and potential financial strain due to their mistake. Consequently, I shall seek alternative destinations for my future wing cravings, pondering the possibility that a similar blunder could have jeopardized my ability to meet essential financial obligations."

"The initial experience at this establishment was satisfactory, however, the subsequent visit proved to be disappointing. Upon ordering the Tom Kha soup, I requested a spiciness level of 2/10, but unfortunately, the dish was excessively piquant and caused me to experience respiratory discomfort, leading me to return it to the server, who seemed to have limited proficiency in the English language. Subsequently, a new soup was presented to me in the identical cooking vessel, containing the same ingredients, with the addition of coconut milk, which failed to address my concern regarding the spiciness level. In quest of a resolution, I sought assistance from a managerial figure, but due to their absence, I was compelled to communicate with a senior staff member, who also displayed limited fluency in English. Through her efforts to explain the situation, I gathered that the soup had been returned and combined with a pre-mixed soup, owing to the fact that a portion of it had already been consumed before being sent back. Following this sequence of events, a fresh bowl of soup was eventually provided, which included all the necessary components and possessed a flavor profile distinct from that of its fiery predecessors, although the entire process proved to be arduous and taxing."

"The culinary experience afforded by the establishment in question was suboptimal, with the bovine protein being overcooked, desiccated, and lacking in flavor. However, it must be acknowledged that the meat was still somewhat tender, presumably due to the manner in which it was cut, whether intentionally or unintentionally. As a patron who availed myself of a promotional offer to dine at this establishment, my level of satisfaction was not particularly high, but I cannot claim to have been entirely displeased. Be that as it may, it is my contention that, given the tariff charged by this establishment for a meal consisting of a sandwich, fries, and a beverage, the quality of the fare served should be commensurate with the price point, which, regrettably, was not the case on this particular occasion."

If the restaurant business includes some degree of customer service, then this place has NO business being open. Perhaps the worst service I've ever had and to top it off, I sent an item back, only because it was terrible, and they did not take it off the bill.\n\nSorry Charlie but there are a million good restaurants to go to and this one has been crossed off our list forever.

"The culinary experience was truly delightful! The Robata Kobe accompanied by a dollop of wasabi dissolved effortlessly in my oral cavity! My preference was undoubtedly the Enoki mushrooms enveloped in bacon... Nonetheless, the hospitality was deplorable! The server who attended to us initially displayed a lackluster demeanor. I presumed at first it was merely a result of our presence, but upon observing his interactions with adjacent tables, it became apparent that his tone remained consistent. Although, he did exhibit a slight increase in fervor when engaging with the patrons seated adjacent to us. He periodically checked on everyone else, but neglected to do so for us, except when taking our order and when we summoned him over. I made a conscious effort to allow them a reasonable amount of time to arrive, considering their hectic schedule. Nevertheless, it required twenty minutes to receive our check, solely because I managed to capture someone's attention. Moreover, the server cleared our table prior to procuring our check, which added an additional ten minutes to the already prolonged twenty minute wait. As a parent, I felt that my children were subjected to preconceived notions based on our appearance. Generously, we habitually leave gratuities ranging from eighteen to twenty percent, and occasionally even more! Unfortunately, the service we received fell short of expectations. As an individual employed within the service industry, I would never treat clients in such a manner! Do correct me if my assumptions are incorrect."

We recently returned for an additional visit, approximately two weeks subsequent to our initial excursion, with the expectation that improvements had been implemented in the interim. Unfortunately, this was not the case, as our experience was once again marred by subpar service and an uninviting ambiance. Specifically, we desired to be seated in an outdoor location proximal to the fire, a request that seemed to be met with utter disdain by the hostess, who appeared to be inconvenienced by our mere presence. The pace of service was lethargic, and the atmosphere was further compromised by the boisterous demeanor of the staff, who vociferously shouted orders and other instructions. In light of these factors, it is unlikely that we will return to support this local establishment in the future, despite our initial inclination to do so.

Update: Upon my return visit at a subsequent juncture, the venue appeared relatively devoid of patronage.
The quality of service was subpar and lacking in proficiency, ostensibly due to the inexperience of the attendant, who seemed uncertain regarding their responsibilities.
Furthermore, the fruit garnishing the plate was observed to have traces of mold, while the salad exhibited signs of spoilage, manifesting as wilting and an unpleasant brownish hue.
Given these factors, it is unlikely that I shall revisit this establishment in the future.

US Today needs to have its head examined. Had a brunch buffet for $25 which featured really, compared to Bellagio and the superb Cosmopolitan, very few choices. Dry brisket and sausages. Seafood bar without seafood. Had a small cup which had a handful of gamey shrimp and crab pieces in it. Needed a big mug of green tea to wipe my mouth clean after that. Desserts were equally a mixed bag. Gelato was fine, but forget the dry little chocolate mousse pieces or even worse the over sweetened pecan tart. More green tea was needed. Best part of the buffet, other than the green tea, was a raw fuji apple. Imagine that... and they didn't even have to cook it at the hotel. Forget the hype and avoid this culinary waste space.

This is a tough review to write. On the one hand their cook is incredible! He's nice, remembers your order, and makes one of the best Breakfast Burritos in town! I would highly recommend getting the Bacon one and adding jalepenos. 

Also, if you go there for lunch and get one of their specials, it is very generica cafeteria food. Of the items served on their specials, typically one is pretty good, one is really bad (to the point you can't eat it), and one is mediocre. 

While the food passes the test for cheap quick food, what kills this place in the ratings is the cashier's ability to be unfriendly, almost all of the time. If you go there just once or twice, you wouldn't even notice it. But, if you go there most days of the week for breakfast, it starts to ruin the great breakfast burrito.

I'll still eat here, but if anyone recommends anywhere else, count me in!

"The ostensibly laudatory evaluations do not accurately mirror this establishment's culinary proficiency. This restaurant does not embody the genuine essence of traditional Greek cuisine. Patrons should exercise caution when considering dining here. My primary grievance regarding this eatery pertains to its preparation methods; specifically, the food is not prepared using fresh ingredients. I placed an order for a chicken Greek salad, which possessed a satisfactory flavor profile, yet the poultry itself was conspicuously processed. I inquired about the chicken's provenance with the male proprietor, who responded by claiming that the poultry is initially fresh, then seasoned, grilled, and subsequently warmed in the oven upon order placement. However, the ambiguity surrounding the term 'heated up' prompted me to wonder whether the meat undergoes reheating via microwave. 
Regarding the pita bread accompanying the salad, its temperature was unpleasantly frigid and its texture was unyieldingly rigid, rendering it inedible. When questioned about the bread's consistent hardness, the proprietor reacted defensively and divulged that the bread is not baked on-site. Rather, it is infused with herbs and oil before being warmed up. His demeanor remained dismissive as he offered a refund, inquiring whether I desired one." 
"When opting to partake in a dining experience (particularly at a Greek restaurant), I anticipate that my meal will be carefully prepared using non-processed ingredients and served straight from the kitchen, rather than relying on pre-cooked or reheated elements."

"Attempted to visit this establishment on two separate occasions, only to be met with disappointment as it was closed during both instances. I have come to the conclusion that it would be futile to continue to allocate my time and resources towards this venture, as the management has demonstrated a lack of commitment to maintaining a consistent and reliable schedule, thereby rendering it unnecessary for me to expend my financial resources in support of their enterprise."

"Here today, I encountered an unfortunate experience with a middle-aged male bartender who displayed discourteous behavior towards me. His conduct was utterly unjustified, and it became evident that he habitually mistreated patrons, as other staff members appeared subdued and intimidated by his demeanor. It is speculated that this individual may hold a supervisory role, and his unpleasant attitude possibly stems from dissatisfaction with his personal life, manifesting in poor treatment of customers. Therefore, I strongly advise against visiting this establishment."

I am completely disappointed in this establishment today. 30 minutes in the drive thru line. Then the kid was an ass when we asked what was taking so long, he said we are understaffed and busy! As we finally get to the window we wait 15 more minutes for 2 iced birthday cakes and a small watermelon! And look through the window as the staff are all just standing around looking at one another. I usually love this place but man it's summer in Az you think you would be staffed for these hot days!!!

During the past seven years, we have annually visited this establishment for a Chinese culinary experience while attending a trade exhibition in the city. Despite its boisterous and cramped ambiance, the fare has been satisfactory, and the prices have been reasonable. However, our most recent encounter has led us to reassess the value of patronizing this restaurant. Specifically, the quality of service has been subpar, with staff exhibiting a combination of discourtesy and ineptitude. Notably, our reservations were misplaced on two consecutive days, and the management failed to accommodate our party, seemingly oblivious to the fact that we were repeat customers. Furthermore, Las Vegas offers numerous alternative dining options that we will consider in the future.

Been here a few times, only because we live near by. In the evening this place usually has a long line. They are usually under staff here, so the wait is long. When the employees are busy and in a rush they will usually make mistakes. Management really needs to help out and make sure customer service is a number one priority! I try to avoid this location and go somewhere else.

"It is patently evident that the quality of service rendered by an airline is directly proportional to the tariff levied for its utilization, as evidenced by my recent voyage aboard Spirit Airlines. Embarking upon my maiden and final journey with this carrier, I traveled from Las Vegas to Fort Lauderdale and returned, during which time I encountered a plethora of unpleasantries. The aircraft itself appeared to be somewhat antiquated, with a window seat that resembled a veritable petri dish of bacterial growth, replete with remnants of prior passengers' detritus. Furthermore, the headrests were stained and grimy, while the seatback pouch contained an assortment of rubbish, rendering it unusable for its intended purpose. Most egregious, however, was the absence of even the most basic amenities, such as potable water, which was conspicuous by its absence during the duration of the 4.5-hour flight. It is worth noting, however, that the carrier did adhere to its scheduling, transporting me to my destination in a timely manner, albeit with an unfortunate layover. Upon disembarking, I felt compelled to seek immediate sanitary refreshment, owing to the unsavory nature of the experience."

I live in Henderson and travel almost weekly.  TSA is pretty much hit or miss... but mostly miss... so good luck with that.

My problem is the TSA Pre-Check.

Since I live in the area the tram at Gate C is easier to use since I usually do not check bags.  However, they do NOT offer TSA Precheck altho they do in the D gates just alongside the C gate line.

They did start for a while, but quickly stopped.   The last time I went through the D gates to be 'let inside' the C gates by a TSA agent.  No one showed up.   Two TSA agents were coming in so tried to exit as they entered.  Was LOUDLY encountered with a WHERE ARE YOU GOING!?  and even when said C-gate Precheck was condescended to and made to show the boarding pass.   Next time they didn't even allow C gate passengers to enter.

So now go to the main C-Gate (Southwest) security area.  I show my boarding pass and am pointed to a special line that wraps along the wall to ONE TSA agent at a TSA PREcheck booth.  Usually 10 or 12 people deep.   

Which would be no problem EXCEPT there are TWO OTHER agents at a stand BOTH with TSA PreCheck signs that the 'general public' can get in line for and then go through Pre-Check themselves.  And NO, the 'main' TSA PreCheck line does NOT have access to the other two stations.

"It is strongly advised that prospective patrons refrain from partaking of culinary offerings at Mikkie Finnz's sister establishment adjacent to its present location, as the quality of the fare served is utterly deplorable. Specifically, the fish and chips dish, which is often a staple of British cuisine, is woefully inadequate and fails to meet even the most basic standards of gastronomical excellence. Indeed, the entire menu is characterized by an unfortunate lack of sophistication and finesse, rendering it unworthy of consideration by discerning diners seeking a satisfying repast."

"Upon initiating contact with this enterprise to obtain an approximation for the rectification of my tile roof's damaged state, I was met with an unfortunate lack of response, which I perceive as a deficiency in the realm of professionalism and ethical conduct. Furthermore, it is my conviction that had I conveyed a desire for a novel roofing system, rather than merely a restorative endeavor, I would have elicited a more favorable reaction. Notably, I divulged the identity of the individual who had recommended their services to me, yet this seemingly did not suffice in prompting a return communication. An answering service was employed by this establishment, thereby obviating any potential justifications for their inattention to my inquiry."

"Exclamatory utterance expressing profound disappointment and incredulity. Gastronomical experience characterized by excessive pricing and meager rations, specifically three diminutive frites accompanying the principal dish. Futile exercise in elaboration upon the culinary aspects, as the quality of service was equally subpar, with a dearth of attentive and proficient attention from the bar staff, despite a steady clientele, suggesting a perplexing enigma regarding accountability and responsibility."

My fiancÃ© and I were in pursuit of delectable barbecue cuisine on the fourth of July, which led us to halt our journey at Tom's establishment. I yearned for an evocative reminder of the scrumptious nature of barbecue, but unfortunately, the culinary offerings did not satiate my craving, particularly considering the festive occasion. The pork ribs contained an abundance of fatty sections, which proved to be somewhat of a disappointment. Furthermore, the macaroni and cheese dish lacked a distinct flavor profile, leading me to speculate that it may have been prepared the previous day. Lastly, the baked beans failed to exhibit any remarkable qualities, with their taste being eerily reminiscent of a store-bought variety. In conclusion, while Tom's may cater to novice barbecue enthusiasts, it does not quite live up to the standards of connoisseurs seeking a truly memorable dining experience.

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."
I recently visited this establishment with the expectation of obtaining a delectable Banh Mi sandwich, but unfortunately, my visit was marred by a series of unfortunate events. Firstly, I was compelled to wait for an extensive period of time, nearly 20 minutes to be precise, which I found to be rather disconcerting. Furthermore, the female staff member who attended to me displayed a remarkable lack of enthusiasm and interest in my presence, her demeanor being described as taciturn and indifferent at best. The culmination of these unsatisfactory experiences was the diminutive size of the sandwich, which paled in comparison to others of its kind that I have had the pleasure of consuming. Moreover, the flavors were not particularly vibrant or fresh, leading me to question the quality of the ingredients used in its preparation. In light of these factors, I would strongly advise potential patrons to exercise caution and consider alternative dining options.

"This individual's behavior was utterly reprehensible, as he failed to comprehend my desire for a thorough interior detailing service, despite my explicit articulation of the requisites. His intransigence was particularly perplexing, given the imminent excursion I was embarking upon, during which I would be absent from my domicile for an extended period. Moreover, his reluctance to accept the agreed-upon remuneration of $150 was utterly incomprehensible, especially considering my willingness to compensate him at that rate. Furthermore, his assertion that he required additional financial compensation to subsist was patently absurd, given the existential imperatives of providing for one's family. Consequently, I shall never consider utilizing his services again, whether for personal or corporate purposes."

"Utterly atrocious!  We were deceived by every single member of the team. The cashier demonstrated appalling customer service, addressing us in a derogatory manner and branding us liars; meanwhile, the wait, which we were initially informed would be approximately one hour, rapidly ballooned to three hours, and upon inquiring about our order for the fourth time, we were notified that yet another hour would be required. The personnel exhibit discourteous behavior, consistently treating patrons with disdain and an attitude of superiority. \n\nUnder no circumstances would we recommend this establishment to anyone!!"

"I am compelled to conduct an exhaustive and arduous search for items in this establishment that do not possess an ephemeral quality, expiring mere moments after their purchase. The dearth of inventory that corresponds with the advertised offerings is a perennial source of frustration, leading me to formulate an alternative strategy for procuring the requisite provisions. The queues are invariably lengthy, and the environment is frequently unkempt. Despite my best efforts to communicate my concerns to the assistant managers, I have been met with indifference or an excessive timidity that borders on paralyzing fear, manifesting in stammered responses. Notwithstanding these negative experiences, I must acknowledge the exceptional courtesy and assistance displayed by the staff members responsible for packing groceries and collecting carts."

"The personnel permitted a female patron, whom I politely requested to restrain her offspring, to vociferously castigate me and return multiple times to express their disapproval of my character, deeming me 'cruel and malevolent' for merely requesting that her progeny refrain from emitting ear-piercing shrieks during the midday repast. Despite my entreaties for assistance, the staff remained impassive and unresponsive, opting instead to spectate and listen, rendering me, a former restaurateur, utterly appalled and revolted. Following this distressing encounter, my acquaintance and I have resolved to avoid future visits to this establishment and to convey our unsavory experience to all within our sphere of influence."

"The gastronomical establishment in question is utterly deplorable. While the culinary offerings are passable, if unremarkable, the hospitality proffered by the waiting staff is abysmal. In the company of colleagues, I had the misfortune of experiencing egregious lapses in service, including the forgetting of our orders, the erroneous delivery of beverages, and the flagrant discrepancy between the items requested and those billed. Furthermore, upon bringing these issues to the attention of management, we were offered additional game cards, a paltry compensation for the inconvenience endured. Based on my experience, I would strongly advise against patronizing this eatery."

I think they just put lipstick on a pig. Was in the casino floor for an hour and was not offered a drink. The casino area is very small. It seems they didnt have money to spend on the parking elevators.  Also believe is not handicap friendly when it comes to spacing everything is cramped and is difficult to manuver.\n\nThe guys at vallet were very courteous.

"Prepare yourself to proffer three forms of identification and a credit card, as the personnel at this establishment appear to be oblivious to the concept of customer recognition. My companions and I endured an agonizing wait of nearly sixty minutes due to the persistent insistence of four bouncers that my friend's identification did not belong to her, despite her providing thorough explanations and displaying her credit card, which ironically featured an alternate image of herself. Following this unnecessary and unpleasant experience (which can be attributed solely to the uncooperative demeanor of the individual in question), we opted to visit an alternative nightclub, whereupon we were successfully admitted. Having frequented numerous clubs throughout Las Vegas, I must say that this particular incident was unprecedented. It is my sincere hope that the staff at this venue will rectify their deficiencies in customer service and comprehend the fact that patrons' appearances may not remain identical to their driver's license photos, particularly given the lapse of several years."

"Expressing utter disdain towards this establishment, I exclaimed, 'Eff this place!' It was, regrettably, our final option for a one-night stay during President's Day weekend, with every other hotel along the strip displaying 'no vacancies' despite questionable authenticity. Upon arrival, we were greeted by an overwhelming stench akin to that of a deceased individual, which permeated the entire property. Furthermore, we were informed that the only available rooms were two queens within the pyramid, despite our explicit request for a king. The condition of the accommodations was deplorable, appearing unkempt and unsanitary, with a glaring absence of proper housekeeping. To exacerbate matters, I was charged double the amount on my credit card, remaining oblivious to this fact until my return home. The experience was utterly egregious and warranted a phone call to the Luxor's accounting department. Following a heated conversation with an incompetent representative, I was assured that one of the erroneous charges would be refunded by the end of the day. Notwithstanding this fiasco, Tacos & Tequila proved to be a satisfactory dining venue. However, the staff presented an air of melancholy, perhaps attributed to the early hour (3:30 pm). In conclusion, I strongly advise against selecting the Luxor as a place of lodging, as it failed to meet expectations and left an indelible mark of disappointment."

New to area and saw a coupon in one of our mails. Decided to take my daughter to check it out we got there at 9:29 pm and it looked like they were closing,  the open sign was shut off and the screens were down. Even though yelp says they close at 10. Bad first impression will stick with Froyona.
Ate ate Popeye at many states, this is not it!\nThe spicy chicken is NOT spicy yet it contains more grease then chicken, purely inedible. no idea how they get away with it in a corporate environment.

"It is utterly deplorable that this establishment fails to deliver on its culinary promises, especially considering the acclaim it received on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives. My expectations were elevated, anticipating an unparalleled barbecue experience, but alas, they were tragically unmet. En route to visit my grandfather in Tucson, I decided to make a brief detour to sample their offerings, expecting a gastronomic delight. Unfortunately, my visit fell on a rather unfortunate day, a Tuesday at 11 AM, which may have contributed to the subpar quality of the food. The server's response to my inquiry regarding the menu's highlights was rather unhelpful, amounting to a vague and uninformative "everything is good." Thus, I opted for the unconventional approach of ordering one of each item, which resulted in a colossal plate overflowing with an assortment of unidentifiable dishes. Disillusioned and disappointed, I consumed a solitary bite of each before deciding to seek sustenance elsewhere, specifically at Weinerschnitzel, where I hoped to find palatable fare."

"I am utterly dumbfounded by the plethora of effusively positive appraisals regarding Greenberg's, leading me to infer that the majority of patrons have perhaps not had the privilege of indulging in truly exceptional Jewish deli cuisine, thereby rendering their assessments somewhat misguided and disproportionate. It is imperative for individuals to comprehend the true nature of Greenberg's; it serves as a hastily prepared, simplified rendition of an authentic Jewish deli, possessing the superficial appearance and ambiance of the genuine article while falling short in terms of gastronomic excellence and spiritual essence. This phenomenon is by no means unusual within the confines of the Las Vegas Strip. Patrons who have had the pleasure of dining at esteemed establishments such as New York City's Katz's, Montreal's Lester's, Los Angeles' Canter's, or any other celebrated Jewish deli, are cognizant of the unparalleled flavors of authentic matzo ball soup and top-notch pastrami. In my opinion, Greenberg's fails to meet the standards of a genuinely superior Jewish deli, earning a paltry two stars at best; it perpetuates the guise of a speedily prepared, watered-down adaptation of traditional Jewish cuisine, leaving me utterly dismayed that individuals depart its premises under the false impression that they have partaken in a truly satisfying Jewish culinary experience. Oy vey!"

"Upon visiting Coco's on a Monday afternoon, it became apparent that the parking lot was rather uncharacteristically vacant, with only three vehicles occupying the space. Notwithstanding this anomaly, the seating process was expedited, and our order was taken in a timely manner. However, the delivery of our salads preceded the arrival of the primary entrÃ©e by a considerable margin, with the latter taking approximately thirty minutes to materialize. It is worth noting that the restaurant's patrons consisted of merely two or three tables, casting doubt upon the notion that an extensive delay was necessary to prepare a meager pair of cheeseburgers. Furthermore, my digestive system experienced discomfort for an ensuing hour, leading me to surmise that the culinary offerings perhaps did not align with my individual preferences. Although the service was generally satisfactory, several lapses in attention to detail transpired, including the failure to replenish the tea and remove completed dishes in a timely fashion. Specifically, the manager, despite his assurance of promptly returning to collect the remaining dishes, neglected to do so. Additionally, the waitress required prompting to partition the checks, which ultimately failed to occur. These oversights, coupled with the aforementioned delays and gastronomical dissatisfaction, suggest that Coco's may be following in the footsteps of Marie Callender's, another establishment that has recently encountered difficulties."

Update June 2013: My update unfortunately devalues the ice cream parlor further. I wanted to buy a scoop of ice cream for my little son today at the ox festival in Hagsfeld and asked for a paper cup (!!!) because the little one has a milk allergy and cannot eat a waffle. The lady told me that there is only one waffle per scoop and that I would have to pay 20 cents extra. Since the scoop already costs EUR 0.90, I was not willing to do this. Personally, I don't think it's a good business practice, especially since the prices per scoop are already quite high. Today, I rode past this nice ice cream parlor again. A nice ice cream seller sold me an ice cream with two scoops. Up until then, smooth 5 stars, nice, authentic, clean. However, the ice cream did not impress me. The lemon was still okay, but the raspberry ice cream had an unpleasant texture, similar to a slushy consistency. Nothing creamy, but rather a frozen and then thawed effect (which I don't want to accuse them of). Maybe they could have let the ice cream ripen a bit longer. The waffle was also not a hit, and therefore, I disposed of it. It reminded me of toilet paper. Bottom line: Nice store, but you can get better ice cream elsewhere.

Service is horrible !  Simple as that 
I felt like regulars and member of the same race was being favored I waited 15 mins for the table which doesn't bother me at all ! If your busy that's fine 
I sat down and waited for 10 mins no water or anything was brought to me ... 20 mins passed I flagged down a busser and informed him I was ready to order can he notify my sever 30 mins passed 
And nothing I told my wife to just wait a lil longer and nothin 
After 35 mins they can we ordered and I waited for my 23 mins for my food it arrived I ate and had to wait another 24 mins for my check ...

"ABHORRENTLY ATROCIOUS!!! The hospitable waitstaff exhibited remarkable promptness in attending to our order; however, an unacceptable duration of thirty minutes transpired before the culinary offerings arrived at our table. My gastronomical inclinations leaned towards the pineapple upside-down pancakes, which, regrettably, proved to be a gustatory disappointment. An unfortunate dearth of flavor and an unpleasantly tart pineapple component marred an otherwise respectable dish. Conversely, the country fried steak and gravy manifested a satisfying quality. Notwithstanding, the concatenation of an interminable wait and an unsatisfactory pancake experience precipitated my disenchantment with the establishment, thereby impelling me to seek alternative dining options."

Again ,let me start by saying I am in the restaurant business. 
Uncle Bears is a cute idea gone wrong. The concept is lost....what is Uncle Bears ? A sports bar, A pet friendly family restaurant?  An offshoot of an often repeated some kind of something with no identity? I am not sure what it is. 
I am sure that the food is HORRIBLE. Just garbage....The taste reflects the quality....HORRENDOUS. Enough said on the food.
Ambience.......HUH ? I along with all 4 of my dining companions were totally confused as to what they were trying to do. In addition, we all thought it was a "hollow" feeling in the restaurant. It just doesn't work. It is a cross between several ideas that do not go together at all.
Price point is 3 steps above the quality of food being served. Alot of other reviews state precisely this. The price is an insult to those of us that know better. If you don't know better ...enjoy. But enjoy soon the doors will be closing.

Horrible! We waited in the lobby full of people for over 20 mins for a table. Normally I don't mind waiting but when I look and see servers shooting the breeze and half the restaurant empty well then it becomes an issue. Finally got a table, the food was horrible and then the bill came. What a rip-off!!! Stay clear of this place!
Driver's are crooks! They write in their own tips! Managers aren't very helpful either! All crooks! order somewhere else, not here!

Individuals with a predilection for vintage or unique items may find Le Chariot appealing, as they can rummage through an assortment of seemingly disparate objects in search of hidden gems or exceptional deals. However, my personal experience at this establishment was markedly different. Upon entering, I was immediately struck by the eclectic array of items on display, including various militaria, antiques, and knick-knacks; nevertheless, upon closer inspection, I quickly realized that the vast majority of these items were, in fact, worthless trash that the proprietor, a surly and unfriendly individual, was attempting to pawn off at exorbitant prices. Despite my initial enthusiasm, I was ultimately disappointed and disenchanted with the shop's contents, which largely consisted of broken, damaged, or otherwise useless items. Furthermore, when I expressed interest in purchasing a particular street sign, I was met with resistance and was informed that it would cost me Â£30, a price I deemed excessive. Subsequently, I noticed that the same sign was prominently displayed in the shop's window, accompanied by several other seemingly valuable items, all of which were assigned an eye-watering price tag of Â£45. In light of my underwhelming experience, I would advise potential patrons to avoid visiting Le Chariot, as the vast majority of its inventory consists of worthless junk.

It has figuratively taken me an extensive duration of approximately two to three years to articulate my thoughts and emotions regarding this establishment, but I have come to the realization that it is imperative for me to express my sentiments as I prepare to celebrate my daughter's eighth birthday. I will unequivocally never recommend this venue to any acquaintance or friend. When I initially visited the premises to inquire about the available options for my daughter's birthday celebration, I was met with a dismissive and unhelpful demeanor from the staff member behind the counter. Despite feeling slightly deterred, I chose to disregard the ominous sign and proceed with booking the party. Unfortunately, the event proved to be a catastrophic disappointment, ranking as the most expensive and unpleasant birthday party experience I have ever had the misfortune of encountering. One of the hosts even caused a guest to become so distraught that they were compelled to leave prematurely. Furthermore, no refreshments were offered to the mothers in attendance, further contributing to the overall lackluster ambiance. Following the conclusion of the party and the departure of the guests, I approached the counter to request the proprietor's email address. However, the elderly woman present ignored my query and instead provided me with an email address that I was skeptical of, leading me to question its validity. At this point, I was overcome with emotion and a friend intervened on my behalf to communicate my dissatisfaction. In summary, my experience at this establishment was utterly unforgettable, and I would strongly advise against visiting it.

"It is rather conspicuous that no individual adorns gloves within these premises; I personally visited this establishment during the evening of November 21st, seeking a swift pizza acquisition. Upon querying the young woman stationed at the register regarding the fiscal responsibility associated with procuring a large cheese pizza, she responded by stating its cost to be $12.92. My subsequent inquiry pertaining to the price of two medium-sized cheese pizzas yielded a response of $12.95. Following my order placement and payment, I was informed by the aforementioned register attendant that the preparation time for my culinary items would be approximately 15-20 minutes. Subsequently, I returned to witness a queue comprising merely two individuals, a duration of time less than 15 minutes having elapsed. Unfortunately, I was compelled to endure an extended waiting period exceeding 10 minutes while fixating my gaze upon the pizzas awaiting retrieval on the shelf designated for me.
