For some inexplicable reason, I was compelled to reiterate matters repeatedly...she either failed to thoroughly peruse my emails or possessed questionable reading comprehension, as she persistently posed identical queries...concerns I had previously addressed. During our telephonic conversation, Monica displayed signs of being disorganized and scattered. 

On the day of the wedding, all male participants donned disparate vest styles! Although they conformed to the correct hue (a rather uncomplicated aspect to execute properly), they varied in style. Evidently, following a protracted sequence of emails, Monica was still incapable of accomplishing the task effectively. 

A friend of mine recently celebrated her union, and during her interactions with Monica, the gentlemen received incorrect footwear â?she had erroneously ordered the wrong shoes! Reportedly, Michelle's agreed to grant her a refund for the shoes, yet she has not received it thus far."

"Were I able to bestow a rating of zero stars, I would unhesitatingly do so. We placed an order for Garlic Shrimp and Three Cups Chicken, dishes that purportedly featured a discernible garlic flavor profile. However, upon the expedited arrival of our meals, it became patently evident that the culinary offerings did not possess even a trace of the advertised flavor component, leading us to surmise that the fare was not merely unpalatable but also conspicuously lacking in freshness."

"It is not worth your time or effort to visit this establishment if you value quality customer service, as evidenced by the fact that only one stylist was available to attend to the needs of all patrons, leading to an unacceptable wait time that prompted two customers to leave within a mere 20-minute period, which can only be described as an amateurish display of incompetence."

Besides the reality that this lodging establishment was approximately thirty minutes away from the primary area of entertainment and leisure activities, the personnel affiliated with this enterprise displayed behavior that could be described as discourteous and unkind. Moreover, they exhibited an inclination to expel us from the premises at an unreasonable hour, specifically 5 a.m., under the pretext of an individual, who was not associated with our gathering, experiencing a sudden loss of consciousness within the gaming area. Furthermore, they had the audacity to enter our room and disturb the slumber of my companions, who were peacefully resting and had not participated in any disruptive or disorderly conduct, and compelled them to vacate the premises. In conclusion, the term "impolite" would serve as an appropriate descriptor for their demeanor.

"Comprehensive debacle.  The hospitality personnel at the hotel exhibited discourteous behavior, the sleeping surface was not conducive to restful slumber, and during my sojourn (which coincided with the Consumer Electronics Show, Las Vegas' most hectic trade exhibition), the establishment was experiencing a scarcity of cleansing agents.  The front desk attendant attributed this oversight to an unforeseen dearth in inventory, purportedly resulting from an unexpected surge in demand.  It appears that the management of Alexis Park failed to anticipate this predictable predicament, thereby distinguishing themselves as singularly inept among their industry peers.  I shall emphatically avoid future patronage of this institution, and will ensure that my colleagues are apprised of my unfavorable experience."

"To put it mildly, this establishment is utterly deplorable, and my description of it as 'horrible' is, in fact, an understatement. The premises are in a state of utter disarray, with an abundance of both large and small cockroaches scurrying unchecked across the utensils, rendering the notion of consuming food prepared with such implements utterly reprehensible. Furthermore, my colleagues and I have had the misfortune of encountering questionable business practices, including the unauthorized retention of a credit card on file, resulting in an unsolicited charge of $50 mere days after a meal was purchased. The staff has also demonstrated a flagrant disregard for customer satisfaction through their consistent botching of orders and a general attitude of discourtesy. Needless to say, I would strongly advise against patronizing this establishment, lest one risk ingesting unsavory and potentially hazardous substances, such as cockroach parts, within one's pizza."

"Vincent's Pizzeria, a culinary establishment situated in close proximity to the intersection of Interstate 10 and Ray Road, has recently incurred a significant loss in clientele, including myself, due to an unfortunate experience involving a telephonic order for their advertised $19.99 one-topping pizza and wings special, which led to an ill-fated decision to upgrade to their bbq chicken pizza at an additional cost of $7, only to discover that the quality of their barbecue sauce and chicken left much to be desired, and when taken in conjunction with the subpar nature of their crust, rendered the entire dish utterly unsatisfactory; furthermore, upon endeavoring to rectify the situation via a subsequent telephone conversation with an individual named Jack, who purported to be a manager but displayed a glaring deficiency in customer service acumen, I was offered a discount of fifty percent on a subsequent pizza, which, upon closer inspection, proved to be merely a rehashing of the original one-topping pizza special that I had already purchased, thus precipitating my dissatisfaction and disillusionment with Vincent's Pizzeria, and ultimately leading me to conclude that this establishment is perhaps not destined for longevity in the realm of culinary enterprises."

My husband and I had dinner here last week. The food was mediocre and the prices are on the high end. While we were there, we witnessed the owner, the waiter confirmed,  reprimanding a hard working busboy rather loudly, so that the customers could hear the verbal abuse. We also learned that at least 4 other employees have quit in the last week. Because of this persons behavior, we will never return to or recommend this restaurant to anyone. Too many other nice feeling restaurants in the area.

"Gag, they utilized a vintage pail of H2O to cleanse the interior, which emitted a foul stench that permeated the atmosphere and necessitated the lowering of the automobile's windows to facilitate ventilation.  Subsequently, I had to navigate my vehicle homeward with the windows in a state of descent, which allowed the noxious odor of the antiquated aqueous solution and the putrid rag employed for the tires to waft into the cabin, thereby creating an unpleasant ambiance.  Moreover, the location of this establishment, situated on the southernmost periphery of the commercial complex, proved challenging to pinpoint, rendering it arduous to locate and ultimately leading me to recommend avoiding it altogether."

"If you're seeking favorable evaluations, it's advisable to continue your search. Having resided here for a year and a half, I can attest that the quality of this community has substantially deteriorated since its acquisition and rebranding as The Huntington Apartments. The office staff exhibits a lack of cordiality, organizational skills, and effectiveness in addressing concerns. There is an persistent issue with pests that remains unresolved, despite the efforts of the pest control company. Furthermore, the management's communication breakdowns have resulted in missed appointments and confusion regarding scheduling. Based on my experience, I strongly advise against recommending this residence to anyone. Notably, the community experiences frequent visits from individuals rummaging through trash containers early in the morning. Additionally, law enforcement officials are frequently present due to numerous instances of criminal activity and disruptive behavior among certain residents. In summary, this living space is plagued by multiple issues, and a superficial cosmetic approach cannot mask the subpar quality of life and customer care. For those seeking suitable accommodations, I recommend continuing your search, as better options are available."

They label this culinary creation as pizza? Upon entering the establishment, I opted for a singular slice, and it required a considerable amount of time, specifically thirty minutes, to prepare. Notwithstanding, the foundation of the dish, that is, the crust, was rather satisfactory. However, my enthusiasm was promptly diminished upon the discovery that the toppings and cheese were not merely lukewarm but indeed refrigerated. As a native of Chicago, I possess elevated standards regarding this quintessential dish, and my expectations were unfortunately not met by this particular venue. Perhaps my criteria were excessively lofty for any pizza purveyor within the state of Arizona. Regrettably, this experience yielded the most unpalatable pizza I have had the misfortune of encountering.

The only reason to go here was the excellent low-calorie desserts. It turns out they lied about the calorie content and they are actually high-calorie excellent desserts. \n\nCheck the stories in the newspaper for more info. I will never go here again.
Showed up to get oil change. One car in garage and two open bays. Informed it will be over 30 minutes before they can even get my car in.

By the standards of luxury accommodations in Las Vegas, this hotel should be classified as a one-star establishment. The recently renovated Tropicana epitomizes the phrase "lipstick on a pig," as its superficial enhancements fail to conceal its inherent deficiencies. The guest rooms lack adequate soundproofing, rendering privacy a distant memory, as the sounds of neighbors' conversations, bathroom usage, and other disturbances permeate the thin walls. Furthermore, the service at this establishment is abysmal, with staff displaying a flagrant disregard for customer satisfaction and guest relations. Therefore, it is futile to lodge complaints or expect any semblance of helpfulness from the hotel's personnel.

I shall be delighted to proffer an assessment of their assistance upon successfully establishing communication with a sentient being capable of arranging a scheduling for an appointment, provided that said individual possesses the capacity to engage in a dialogue regarding the aforementioned service! I procured a Living Social coupon for a duration of three hours, specifically for the purpose of sanitizing and organizing my domicile, and have thus far been unsuccessful in my endeavors to get in touch with a representative for a span of twenty-one days; it appears that this establishment does not employ any living, breathing entities during their operating hours. My attempts to utilize their digital platform were similarly futile, as there was no provision for indicating the aforementioned Living Social purchase. This entire ordeal has been quite vexing, and I cannot help but wonder about the quality of service they provide, given their apparent inability to manage a simple telephone call from a patron.

We placed a pizza order at 12 pm and arrived at the domicile 1.5 hours later, only to discover that the pizza had become frigid; thus, I elected to return it. Upon endeavoring to communicate with the manager, a discourteous female, who declined to divulge her name, informed me that it would require approximately 45 minutes to an hour. She adamantly refused to provide me with any information regarding the manager, citing that such information was personal and confidential. Their sole solution was to offer a 20% discount, recreate the pizza, and redeliver it. I would strongly advise against dining at this establishment and will diligently spread the word among my veterinary comrades and acquaintances to avoid ordering their pizza. I fervently hope that the manager or proprietor peruses this posting and chooses to contact me at Navy.dav91@gmail.com.

Stay away from this place, the owner doesn't want your business. We went in and he was yelling to pretty much all if his customers what they should or should not touch. Tanked guys did nice frame for a bed, but on the bed there was only one very nasty looking mattress left, where you were allowed to lay on, but as soon as anyone did so he started yelling to be careful with the $35000 bed!!! Really? Also the fish in the tanks had no oxygen coming in. How this guy is in business is beyond me. He really doesn't deserve to be in business.

Beyond disgusting. Food was cold. And old. If you like eating bad leftovers that have been reheated time and time again, you will love this place. Restaurant was filthy. And while we were there the manager actually turned away a party of 5 because they wanted to sit at an 8 top. The restaurant was 3/4 empty and this was Friday night at 6:30. Save yourself and never come here. Can I give it less than 1 star?

"I had an imperative requirement for my mobile device to undergo repair services today, and thus, I visited the establishment at approximately 3:30 PM. However, much to my dismay, I was not attended to until 5:03 PM, which ensued in an extensive and unwarranted delay. Unfortunately, this has become a recurrent phenomenon during my visits to the store, which transpires with alarming frequency due to the inherent fragility of my phone's hardware."

I had the occasion to partake in a culinary excursion to this establishment on a previous occasion, specifically during my initial relocation to Las Vegas several years ago. My gastronomical expectations were not adequately fulfilled, which I found rather perplexing given my unwavering fondness for Asian cuisine. Consequently, I did not feel compelled to revisit this eatery until today, when my spouse and I were in dire need of a rapid and satisfying dining experience that did not necessitate an extensive waiting period. Motivated by the notion that this restaurant might have improved over time, I opted to grant them a second chance. Unfortunately, my hopes were quickly dashed, as the quality of their fare proved to be not merely subpar, but indeed inferior to my previous recollection. Furthermore, the ambient atmosphere in the rear section of the establishment, specifically the right-hand corner, was tainted by an unpleasant and potent odor reminiscent of a combination of a portable toilet facility and a senior citizen residence. This distressing blend of scents significantly enhanced the overall unpleasantness of the dining experience, rendering it nearly unbearable for me to consume my meal and prolong my stay within the premises. In light of my underwhelming encounter, I would strongly advise against allocating time and resources to visit this buffet, as there exist superior local alternatives that offer comparable pricing but vastly superior culinary delights.

"The pizza's appearance was initially appealing upon its arrival; however, upon commencing consumption, my expectations were abruptly and starkly disillusioned. The viscous nature of the cheese used rendered it an unpleasant, runny consistency, which not only hindered its structural integrity but also precipitated an unfortunate seepage onto both the plate and the table. Unfortunately, this issue persisted even after the pizza had cooled, transforming it into an unpalatable, amorphous mass that was utterly repulsive and thoroughly unappetizing. Moreover, the quality of service was subpar, characterized by an absence of attentive, responsive care and an extended presence of vacant dishware on our table, ultimately compelling us to assume the role of servers ourselves. Notwithstanding the sole redeeming aspect of the evening, which was the engaging performance of a live musical ensemble, I would strongly advise against patronizing this establishment."

FUGGHET ABOUT IT! I personally know one of the male cooks who works there and from what he tells me the pizzas are left out way past holding times, no one uses gloves, money is touched then the same hands touch pizza. You couldn't give that to me for free! Yuck.

I have been an ardent devotee of H&M for an extensive period of time, however my fervor has been significantly diminished due to my recent visit to this particular store. Upon my arrival, I was met with an unexpected and unfortunate turn of events, specifically, a sudden power outage! It appeared that several other shops in the vicinity were operational, albeit, according to certain bystanders, the electric company was cognizant of the issue and actively addressing it. Thus, I ventured towards adjacent establishments in the hope that the power would be restored shortly, which indeed transpired. Following the restoration of power, I returned to H&M, only to be met with a noticeably disgruntled staff. One employee was overheard expressing her discontent at being required to remain on the premises, while other affected stores had been granted permission to close early. The demeanor of the staff members was utterly unacceptable. Shortly thereafter, the power suffered another outage, and I opted to remain outside, accompanied by several other individuals. Despite our presence, the employees declared that they would be shutting down for the evening. Within a mere two minutes, the power resumed, and I personally witnessed a woman attempt to gain entry, only to be met with a vociferous declaration that the store was closed, from none other than a sales girl herself! While it is understandable that technical difficulties may occur, it is entirely unacceptable for employees to display such discourteous behavior, particularly when they are simply eager to conclude their workday!

"Upon placing an order for a special combination, I was presented with a complimentary beverage, which marked a satisfactory initiation to my dining experience. Following a twenty-minute wait, during which I eagerly anticipated the arrival of my sandwich, I grew increasingly discontent due to the delay. Prompted by my mounting frustration, I chose to investigate the status of my order. To my chagrin, it transpired that a duo of patrons who had placed their orders subsequent to mine had opted to advance their positions in the queue, thereby relegating my own order to the rear. This sequence of events struck me as particularly unfortunate, given the high premium I place on considerate and attentive client service. After a total of thirty minutes had elapsed, I finally laid eyes on my coveted sandwich; regrettably, however, its contents proved to be woefully scant. Despite this disappointment, I remain committed to affording the establishment a second chance, in the hope that they may redeem themselves and provide a more satisfactory encounter on my next visit."

This was my spouse and my initial visit to this eatery. Initially, we were enthusiastic about their signature Pad Thai dish, however, upon arriving at the point of sale and being met with an absence of acknowledgement, we promptly began questioning the wisdom of our decision to dine at this establishment...We placed our order, received our beverages, and proceeded to take a seat. Midway through consuming my drink, I observed that my glassware bore an unmistakable trace of lipstick. My husband conveyed the tainted vessel to the front counter, whereupon he demonstrated the issue to the staff and requested a substitute glass. The response from the personnel was utterly inadequate, devoid of any expression of regret or concern; they simply replaced the glass without uttering a single word of apology or explanation. It is my conviction that the unsatisfactory nature of the service at this restaurant can be attributed, in large part, to the youthful composition of their staff. I find it disconcerting that younger individuals do not manifest a greater degree of respect towards others. In light of these circumstances, it is unlikely that we shall patronize this establishment again in the future. Notwithstanding, I did assign a rating of one star, as the Pad Thai, while lacking in seasoning, was not entirely without culinary merit.

Avoid this Einstein! As an individual who works in close proximity to this establishment, I periodically visit this location to indulge in a morning meal prior to commencing my work shift. Despite my repeated attempts to provide this location with an opportunity to demonstrate improvement, I have regretfully concluded that it would be more judicious to exclusively frequent the location situated at the intersection of Rainbow and Flamingo (Note: Exceptional customer service!).  
Upon entering the premises, I am consistently greeted by a manager, a red-headed woman who appears disheveled, who extends a seemingly forced smile and a tardy "good morning" salutation. Following this encounter, I proceed to place my order, tender payment, and await the announcement of my name. However, it has come to my attention that a duration of thirteen minutes is required to prepare a toasted Nova Lox and bagel sandwich, despite there being merely four individuals ahead of me in line. Furthermore, I have expressly requested that my bagel be toasted, yet it is consistently served unto me in an un-toasted state. Additionally, patrons who have entered the queue subsequent to my presence have received their orders prior to mine. Moreover, it has been observed that the creamer is habitually depleted when I request coffee.  
In light of these circumstances, I feel compelled to deduce that the sole factor contributing to this establishment's continued operation is its geographical location. It is my conviction that a modicum of pride in one's work would not be remiss.

"The sole aspect of this gaming establishment that elicits my approval is the contiguous Sobe Ice Rink, which serves as a unique amenity for patrons who relish in the joys of ice skating. However, for individuals residing in the eastern sector of Las Vegas, the convenience of accessing this recreational facility is significantly diminished due to its remote location, necessitating an arduous journey by automobile. Furthermore, the alternative ice rink situated in Henderson proved to be subpar in terms of size, thereby rendering it unsuitable for my preferences. As for the affiliated Fiesta Henderson casino, I refrain from offering any remarks or opinions pertaining to its quality or attributes."

This place used to be great back in the heyday. Every time I would go on the hunt for gauges in the area (since I used to live relatively close to this location), they always seemed to be out on some sort of make or model of gauges I would want. I've also noticed a lot of their gauges don't come in pairs, and generally are missing or out of stock completely. If you're lucky enough to get a good pair that's discounter it could work to your benefit on saving money, but other than that this location has really fell in business and in service. What was a little aggravating is that the person I talked to in regards of spiral gauges didn't even know what a spiral gauge was or what they looked like. Really, now?\n\nI don't believe you should deserve to work at a tattoo shop if you have no idea what you are talking about or you fail to answer questions that are centered in your department.

this was my forth time coming to this restaurant and things have changed (for the worst).

the burger which was the stable of this establishment was a dried out tiny perfectly formed and pressed portion of meat. now  being a burger aficionado, i swear was frozen! a sentiment of my entire group that ordered the burger or burgr. as gordon likes to call them.
 
also the hot dog was rabid.the party that made the mistake of eating it was sick as a dog that eve and could not make it to dinner later that evening. 

the only thing worse than the food was the service which was non-existent. we actually had to run up to the bar to order our drinks.

i'm thinking of starting a reality show where i review various  bad eateries and was going to start here.  a penny for you thoughts (just not one of these burgers), yes?

"It is my conviction that this establishment no longer possesses the quality it once had, as evidenced by the substantial portions of rice in their nigiri, which, regrettably, have resulted in three members of our party experiencing gastrointestinal discomfort subsequent to partaking of the culinary offerings herein. Furthermore, the yakisoba and other introductory dishes did not meet expectations, even when considering the aforementioned shortcomings and health issues. I would strongly advise against visiting this restaurant, under any circumstances."

"Upon procuring a culinary confection for the celebration of my anniversary of birth, I specified a preference for a vanilla butter cream icing and a white cake substrate. Upon retrieving the aforementioned edible creation, it appeared visually appealing; regrettably, upon indulging in the cake, the absence of any appreciable vanilla essence within the icing became conspicuous, its flavor profile resembling an unpleasant admixture of Crisco and sugar, while the cake itself exhibited an unfortunate aridity. Consequently, I shall refrain from patronizing this establishment further."

"Gastronomical disappointment permeated our culinary experience at this establishment, as my spouse and I had eagerly anticipated a delectable breakfast repast for an extended period of time. Alas, the fare provided by this eatery proved to be utterly unsatisfactory, with an unfortunate emphasis on subpar edibles and an unimpressive selection of beverages. Specifically, the coffee, which we had hoped would provide a much-needed stimulus to initiate our day, was instead characterized by an unpleasant tepidity, its flavor profile marred by an unfortunate reliance on ice cubes to achieve a lukewarm temperature. Furthermore, the waffles, which we had envisioned as a fluffy, golden-hued delight, were instead served in a state of unfortunate sogginess, their surface saturated with an excess of syrup that rendered them decidedly unpalatable. To further exacerbate our frustration, the sandwiches presented an uninspired utilization of stale bread, contributing to an overall sensation of dissatisfaction that left us feeling unfulfilled and regretful of our decision to dine at this establishment. In conclusion, our experience at this venue served only to reinforce our preference for preparing our own meals at home, where quality and satisfaction are assured."
When you say your a vegetarian don't recomend the potato soup with Bacon. Then don't mess around with me about the refund, with no mea culpa.

"The individual who responded to my telephonic communication was utterly incompetent and unprofessional, exemplifying the epitome of poor customer service. Upon requesting a delivery, I was met with an abrupt refusal, followed by an unceremonious termination of the call. My incredulity at such appalling behavior prompted me to initiate a second attempt at securing the desired service, only to be met with an equally dismissive and discourteous response, culminating in a hasty conclusion to the interaction."

"This establishment can be characterized as a veritable ghetto, evidenced by the deplorable and lackadaisical approach adopted by its customer service personnel. Upon arriving at the appointed time, I was compelled to endure a protracted wait of thirty minutes, despite the fact that there were merely two individuals ahead of me in line, on a decidedly unbusy Tuesday afternoon. Furthermore, the customer service representative exhibited an utter lack of concern and professionalism, callously interrupting my companion (who had graciously accompanied me for moral support) and displaying an uncooperative attitude when apprised of the situation. The manager, unfortunately, proved to be equally ineffectual in addressing our grievances, leaving us feeling thoroughly discomfited and dissatisfied. It is worth noting that the front office of this branch exudes an air of shabbiness, with scant furnishings and outmoded posters from the 1990s adorning the walls, thereby contributing to an overall ambiance of discomfort and neglect."

Truly awful service and food!  Think of half the quality of Denny's food for three times the price!  I would never go back.  Very sad when you consider there are nice places in Golden Nugget like Vic & Anthony's but the nice places close before midnight on a weekend in Las Vegas?  What are they thinking!??!  Another terrible place to avoid in Golden Nugget is the Chart House.\n\nWayne Gorsek

"The cupcakes we procured for our assemblage of fourteen individuals proved to be an unfortunate disappointment, as they failed to meet our expectations in terms of taste and quality. As an ardent devotee of cupcakes and sweets, my discontent with the desserts was not due to a personal aversion to sugary treats; rather, the cakes themselves were dry and lacked any semblance of richness or depth in flavor. Furthermore, the frosting, which could have potentially redeemed the cupcakes, was applied sparingly and ultimately proved insufficient in salvaging the overall experience. It was evident that the rest of the group shared my sentiments, as not a single individual managed to consume an entire cupcake. Although the establishment itself was somewhat quaint, its ambiance was significantly marred by the overpowering odor of tobacco emanating from the adjacent store. For those seeking delectable cupcakes without the need to venture onto the strip, Gigi's or the Whole Foods located at Town Square would be viable alternatives."
Do not go here. King of like maggianos. I hate it. Huge factory. We had bad experience with almost everything we ordered. If u love french fries then this is your place.\nWe both got sick after.

"The individual responsible for cutting my hair had dispatched an emissary to acquire picture frames during the designated time slot allocated for my grooming session. Despite possessing my contact information, the salon opted not to communicate with me via telephone. Following a thirty-minute wait, I departed the premises without receiving any form of compensation or conciliatory gesture. It appears that the establishment did not value my patronage, as I had consistently demonstrated my loyalty by visiting their facility on a regular basis, settling my accounts in a timely manner, and displaying generosity in my gratuities. Moreover, I had actively endorsed their enterprise and encouraged others to follow suit. Indeed, it becomes increasingly evident that this sequence of events transpired deliberately, and I must commend the salon for their adeptness in executing such a strategy."

"My experience at Circus Circus was utterly underwhelming, to say the least. My brother and I were exhausted upon arrival at the hotel, and the prospect of venturing out to dine elsewhere seemed entirely too arduous. While the menu prices may have been considered 'cheap' by some standards, the addition of a beer brought the total cost to approximately $30 per person, which hardly seemed a bargain. Furthermore, the culinary offerings appeared to have been frozen previously, and the ambiance was reminiscent of a school cafeteria rather than a relaxing vacation setting. The only redeeming quality of the establishment was the friendly demeanor of the staff, and even that was not enough to compensate for the subpar fare and uninviting atmosphere. In conclusion, it is advisable to avoid this restaurant and instead opt for a more satisfactory dining experience, such as McDonald's."

"We endured an exorbitant wait of over sixty minutes for our culinary delights, only to be utterly neglected by our server, who, subsequent to securing our order, failed to tend to our table with even a modicum of expediency, leading us to conjecture that our meals would be delivered in a timely manner. However, much to our chagrin, two adjacent tables, having been seated a mere quarter of an hour prior, were already savoring their delectable victuals, while we languished, famished and ignored, for yet another ten to fifteen interminable minutes, ultimately prompting our decision to abandon our dining experience altogether. As we departed, our server, seemingly impervious to our plight, remained steadfast in her indifference, offering no explanation or apology for the egregious disparity in service, thereby necessitating our reluctant departure and precipitating a singular, unfortunate rating, as zero stars seemed an insufficient reflection of the establishment's profound shortcomings."

Waited in line to see how long a wait would be for three people. A gentlemen waiting in the opposite line psychically grabbed me and pulled me back and said that he was in front of me. I told him that there was clearly two lines and that my party was larger than his party of two so either way I'd still be waiting much much longer than him. The hostess told me to head to the end of the line and wait once again even though I had all ready waited in the double line for 10-15 minutes.

Absolutely terrible customer services and something I wouldn't expect from PF Changs...a place I often visit at my home town which I won't visit anymore.

I'll never be back!

```
Grossly disillusioned, I visited this establishment with the expectation that it would be a premier venue in Las Vegas, but unfortunately, it failed to meet my expectations by a considerable margin. Do not squander your financial resources on such an inferior experience.
```

The original text uses simple language and short sentences to express the author's disappointment with their experience at a place in Las Vegas. The modified text, on the other hand, uses more complex vocabulary and longer sentences to convey the same message.

Here are some of the changes made in the modified text:

* "Extremely disappointed" becomes "grossly disillusioned," which means feeling completely misled or cheated.
* "I came to this place" becomes "I visited this establishment," which sounds more formal and professional.
* "Thinking it was truly the best place in Vegas" becomes "with the expectation that it would be a premier venue in Las Vegas," which better conveys the idea that the author had high hopes for the place.
* "It's not even close to good" becomes "it failed to meet my expectations by a considerable margin," which is a more formal way of saying that the place did not live up to the author's standards.
* "Don't waste your money" becomes "do not squander your financial resources," which uses more formal language to convey the same message.

Overall, the modified text uses more complex language and sentence structures to convey the author's disappointment in a more formal and professional way.

Beware the Graveyard Menu, a seemingly innocuous bill of fare that belies its pernicious nature. As an habitue of this establishment, I have heretofore enjoyed a satisfactory dining experience; however, my most recent visit proved to be a gastronomical debacle of monumental proportions. In conjunction with a companion, I opted to partake of a platter of fried clam strips and peel-and-eat shrimp, an apparent innocuous selection. Upon the arrival of the former, my initial reaction was utter disbelief, as the clams appeared to be of an unprecedented magnitude, measuring no less than five inches in length. This anomaly notwithstanding, I decided to proceed with consumption, albeit with a modicum of trepidation. The ensuing taste was passable, yet the texture was somewhat rubbery, leading me to harbor lingering doubts as to the authenticity of these mollusks. Unfortunately, my skepticism was soon validated, as within a span of five hours, I experienced severe stomach cramps, followed by an episode of vomiting that expelled the entirety of the consumed fare, accompanied by an additional hour of intense dry heaving, ultimately culminating in a febrile state that necessitated an absence from my place of employment. It is with profound regret that I must inform you that Shucks has lost a patron, whereas my associate, having indulged in copious amounts of alcohol subsequent to our repast, remains impervious to any adverse effects, thus far.

I am totally baffled why this place gets such good reviews. I have been there a few times because it's close to my work and I received some gift certificates for my birthday. Unfortunately after the last experience, I can't go back.  Although they are very nice and have great prices, I have to reveal the ugly truth: 
1. They don't put any effort into sanitizing the tools or the pedicure bowl. I actually saw them clean the brushes and tools in the water I was soaking my feet in and then just rinse out the bowl after they were done... not spray, soap, nothing!
2. Reason #1 probably explains why my heals cracked so severely after my pedicure that they began to bleed.  I had to use peroxide, neosprin, and bandages for almost a week to get it heal. 
3. They water down their nail polish... so much that it destroys the bond and polish never actually dries. 
I hate to bash a business with good customer service, but these practices are simply unacceptable.  I obviously won't be back. =(

My significant other is employed within this shopping plaza, and he has an affinity for culinary items offered by the on-site delicatessen; thus, I ventured to Vons to acquire some economical bean and cheese burritos from the deli department, with the intention of also procuring a freshly prepared sandwich, as I am not particularly fond of the fried alternatives offered by the establishment, and the menu presented several appealing options, including a turkey pesto variation, the specifics of which escape my recollection at present. However, while waiting at the counter, I observed the two staff members engaging in various activities unrelated to their duties, such as socializing and indulging in personal conversations, instead of expeditiously attending to my needs, resulting in a considerable delay of approximately five minutes. Upon contacting my boyfriend regarding this issue, he informed me that such sluggishness and indifference was customary for the deli section of this particular retail establishment, and that placing an order from said department was often met with reluctance and brusqueness on the part of the employees, leaving me feeling understandably displeased and frustrated, ultimately leading me to opt against making any purchases from them.

"Auto Unlimited is the most atrocious automotive dealership I have had the displeasure of encountering. Their flagrant disregard for ethical business practices and their owner's reprehensible behavior are sufficient reasons to avoid this establishment at all costs. During my recent purchase, I explicitly conveyed my concerns about the vehicle's tendency to pull to the right, and the salesperson assured me that the issue would be addressed. However, after two inspections, the problem remained unresolved, and the owner callously dismissed my concerns with an utter lack of empathy or customer service skills. Moreover, I discovered that the vehicle had an active Diagnostic Trouble Code (DTC) for a sensor malfunction, which the dealership had conveniently cleared mere days before my purchase, in direct violation of consumer protection laws. In light of these events, I strongly advise potential buyers to exercise extreme caution and steer clear of Auto Unlimited, as their modus operandi appears to prioritize deception and manipulation over honest and transparent business practices."

"In light of a recent visit, I have opted to revise my previous assessment of three stars, as it has become apparent that certain aspects of the establishment's ambiance have undergone a significant transformation since my last visit, specifically in regards to an unpleasant olfactory experience that permeated the entrance area and served as a deterrent to our initial intention of partaking in their happy hour offerings; thus, I deem it appropriate to adjust my rating accordingly."

The administration's brusque demeanor and curt comportment left much to be desired, particularly when juxtaposed with the ostensibly salubrious nature of the spa's services. Perching precariously on the precipice of an impending departure, I was taken aback by the discourteous dismissal proffered by the staff on the auspicious occasion of Mother's Day, owing to the fact that the gift certificate in question had, in fine print, expired. As I reflected on the experience, it became apparent that, in addition to the provision of a superior massage, exceptional customer service was also a vital component of the overall encounter. Regrettably, the establishment's inability to strike a balance between these two fundamental aspects rendered my visit an unmitigated disappointment, thereby precluding any future patronage on my part and compelling me to share this disconcerting account with my associates.

This dental practitioner exhibits a pleasing demeanor, yet I cannot help but harbor skepticism regarding certain aspects of his recommendations. Specifically, he suggested installing an enamel backing on my anterior teeth due to their alleged cracks. However, I find it implausible that such a condition would escape my notice, particularly since my dental structure has always featured a distinctive central ridge. Moreover, my current dentist has attested to the pristine state of my front teeth, negating the necessity for any corrective measures. Furthermore, the dentist proposed a profound teeth cleaning procedure, which I was unfamiliar with, and he elaborated upon its nature, accompanied by a $200 deductible. Following a consultation with my mother, a former dental hygienist, I was advised that such a treatment is typically reserved for individuals afflicted with periodontal disease, and thus, it was unwarranted in my case, given the healthy state of my teeth and gums. In response to my concerns, the dentist offered to waive the deductible and misrepresent the procedure to the insurance provider. Although taken aback, I consented, and the dentist performed a superficial five-minute cleaning with a specialized instrument. In retrospect, I realize that this purported "deep cleaning" paled in comparison to the routine cleaning conducted by my new dentist, whom I now entrust with the care of my pearly whites.

"The taxi exuded an unpleasant odor and the operator displayed flagrant discourtesy towards me during the journey, expressing discontent regarding the distance to my destination, which was merely three miles, and demanded payment of the metered fare, which amounted to $8, in addition to which, I was obligated to remunerate him with an airport pickup minimum charge of $16; albeit comprehending the necessity of such policy, I found it rather vexing that he voiced his disapproval of my utilizing credit as a mode of payment, prior to my entry into the vehicle, he could have easily communicated his preference for cash; furthermore, he exhibited audacity by labeling my $10 gratuity, which represented a generous gesture on my part considering the brevity of the ride and the unpleasantness of our interaction, as insufficient, thereby solidifying my resolve never to employ their services again."

This lodging establishment is as deplorable as it can possibly get. My sojourn at this hotel was utterly abysmal, and the most distressing aspect was recognizing the substantial profit they yielded from my stay. The personnel at this hotel are utterly unprofessional and display a profound lack of comprehension regarding the check-in procedure. The room cost a whopping $109! I opted to vacate the premises the following morning and sought refuge at the Fiesta Resort, a five-star establishment offering complimentary Wi-Fi, for a mere $72.

Here is an exhaustive catalog of the deficiencies and shortcomings that plagued my accommodations and the hotel in general:

1. The shower tub was obstructed, which warranted a discount, in my opinion.
2. The bath towels were antiquated and emitted a strong chlorine odor.
3. Each time the air conditioner activated automatically, it emitted a pungent odor.
4. The beds were unyielding and seemed to remain stationary, without being rotated periodically.
5. The carpet exhibited conspicuous stains.
6. The decor was reminiscent of the 1970s era.
7. The bathroom was cramped and confined.
8. The accordion-style bathroom mirror was incomplete, lacking the mirror component.
9. The hair dryer demonstrated limited functionality.
10. The remote control could only operate within a meager range of approximately six feet from the television set.
11. The television set suffered from poor reception quality.
12. The hangers could not be extracted from the closet track conveniently.
13. The sliding glass door proved challenging to open.
14. The shower nozzle appeared diminutive, corroded, and economical ($8 nozzle).
15. The hotel management levied charges for Wi-Fi connectivity.
16. Noticeable stains were visible on the exterior surface of the building.
17. The hotel staff displayed unprofessional behavior and lacked adeptness in their duties.

In conclusion, this hotel is a blatant swindle. Potential guests should avoid it vigilantly, and it must cease operations promptly, making way for a new proprietor who will commit to renovating and revitalizing the establishment.

If I can give a 0 star I will !!!!!! I order a Tostada of ceviche there for 6,45 dollar a combo an they only gave me this !!!!! Never go back here !!!! Never order a tostada of ceviche !!!! NEVER AGAIN!!!!

It is truly unfortunate that this establishment has been forced to cease its operations, as it offered an exceptional variety of beverages, including a delectable chai and an array of frozen coffee concoctions that were undoubtedly worthy of praise. The absence of these delightful offerings shall indeed be felt by those who had the pleasure of partaking in them, and it is with a heavy heart that we bid farewell to this beloved venue.

I had two diametrically opposed experiences at this \"deli.\" My first visit was pleasant enough as I had good, homemade latkes and a Chicago hot dog! I'm telling you the latkes were really good (perfectly spiced, moist and crispy), and my Chicago dog was prepared just right with just enough char!\nOn the second visit the the latkes were nauseatingly bad. They were the worst latkes I've ever had! Terrible flavor and preparation. Did a two-year-old make this? Were these made of rotten potatoes and onions mixed with garbage? Feh!!!!\nI also ordered the pastrami! This pastrami was obviously low-grade store-bought value-brand drek. Did this even come from a brisket, let alone a cow? It was possibly the worst pastrami I've ever had. It tasted like a cheap hot dog, and that, my friend, is not how the sexiest of the cured meats is supposed to taste! I would not chance eating their pastrami again!
Every time I have called to book an appointment I've been put on hold forever. Also, when I've gone in, I've been told to come back much later. DISLIKE

"As an individual who does not possess a propensity for difficulty, I would have never believed that I would be capable of consuming a meal at a Montreal establishment known as Bocadillo; however, on rare occasions, I have indulged in their exceptional sandwiches. Recently, at approximately 11:50 PM, I happened to pass by the aforementioned eatery, only to discover that they were closing at midnight. Disappointed, I opted to order their remaining empanadas, which, much to my surprise, proved to be remarkably delectable. As I awaited my order, I couldn't help but notice a small rodent scurrying across the floor between the counter where patrons waited for their orders and the kitchen area. This unexpected sighting left me feeling somewhat perplexed, yet simultaneously intrigued. Notwithstanding this brief encounter, I must admit that the quality of the food at Bocadillo has consistently met my expectations. It is worth mentioning that this restaurant is affiliated with the Lebanese restaurant Sarah, should you require further information."

Extremely disappointed and would not recommend consigning fairly new and nice furniture items.. I brought in 3 pieces of furniture that were purchased within a 2 year time period and were still in the store catalogs.  I gave them the receipts and they had priced them less than 1/2 of what they were purchased for and that was okay, but what disturbed me was, they were marked down within 2 weeks of being in the store and I was told that they had a lot of interest and it was priced to high.  The two desirable pieces sold as soon as they were marked down and the 3rd piece which was less desirable was never marked down ???.  I still can't figure that one out. When I questioned the man on the floor,  his response was we need to price that down too.  Very arrogant attitude and I learned my lesson the hard way.  There are many Consignment stores out there and they wait 60 days before they mark down an item and you split the purchase 50/50.  If it's a nice item, I'd go else where..
The highlight of our dinner was the beef ribs, prime rib and gelato. service was good but I couldnt reccomend this to family or friends visiting unless its comp.

"I have had the pleasure of frequenting this establishment on multiple occasions during my tenure at MCC, and while the culinary offerings were indeed satisfactory, the proprietor's behavior left much to be desired. Specifically, I recall two instances that marred my dining experience. The first occurred when I attempted to engage in conversation in Japanese, as part of my language-learning endeavors. Unfortunately, the owner responded by berating me and admonishing me to speak English instead. A subsequent visit by a friend of mine yielded an even more distressing encounter. Upon expressing gratitude for the meal in the customary Japanese manner, the proprietor audibly muttered a derogatory term, 'Henna Gaijin,' beneath his breath. Such conduct not only betrays a lack of respect for cultural diversity but also undermines the very essence of hospitality. As such, I have elected not to return to this restaurant, opting instead to seek out establishments where a more welcoming atmosphere prevails."

Hotel and room were fine but I was very disappointed that they wouldn't let the shuttle take us to or pick us at the light rail station. The other hotels in the area had their shuttles running without trouble. Probably won't stay here again.

"The verdant strata permeating the entire confectionary creation was brought to my attention by my sibling, who employed the succinct phrase 'that's mold!' to convey her observation. The culinary item in question had been procured merely two hours prior at the PV Chompie's establishment, and was now positioned before our spouses and offspring. I digitally captured an image of the cake, which must be visualized to be truly appreciated. The extent of fungal growth within the edible substance raises concerns regarding its age and quality. It is utterly astounding that culinary experts would permit such a hazardous product to be consumed. We promptly returned the item to the place of purchase and received a refund. The General Manager offered us an alternative and alluded to discussing the matter with the bakery. However, this particular circumstance cannot be rectified by a GM's efforts to placate the customer. The provision of harmful sustenance is irreparable and indicative of a potential systemic issue in food handling within the eatery. No thank you; we decline your substitute pastry and any other comestibles you may offer. My family's well-being holds greater importance than the risk of consuming your fare once more."

Recently partook in a midday repast, and while the initial offerings were satisfactory, the primary dish left much to be desired. Specifically, the beef broccoli lacked any semblance of flavor, rendering it unpalatably insipid, while the pad Thai was utterly revolting. In contrast, numerous alternative Chinese and Thai establishments in Henderson provide vastly superior culinary experiences.

My better half, a dedicated patron for an extended period exceeding twelve months, experienced an unfortunate cutaneous response encircling her follicular region subsequent to undergoing pigmentation treatment, prompting her to contact Vincent, the manager, who assured her that he would conduct an inquiry and subsequently revert with his findings; however, this communication marked the final exchange between them. This unfortunate occurrence served as the proverbial "last straw," compelling my spouse to seek alternative salon services, with the additional expense of forty dollars for a straightforward blow dry following a treatment, deeming it utterly exorbitant and unreasonable; thus, it is judicious to explore other options.

The sandwiches have taken a huge downhill turn. AVOID, even though they are dirt cheap at $2.99. This location uses stale bread, end slices of tomatoes, brown lettuce and the most minimal amount of turkey possible. Pathetic excuse for a sandwich.If your desperate, it still is Boars Head, so strip the turkey and use your own bread and condiments.

Just AWFUL...  I was in town for a Bridal Shower and the service was horrible!!  There was only 12 of us women and they couldn't get it together.  They forgot to bring out 2 salads and missed 3 entrees.  Our waiter Kevin was the worst and the manager Kelly was non-responsive.  DO NOT ever plan a party here.  I felt bad for the bride.  The day was supposed to be about her, but everyone was focused on the slow, lousy, rude service

We would not advocate visiting this establishment to any individual seeking an enjoyable dining experience, as our own visit on a Friday evening proved to be utterly disappointing. It is conceivable that the dearth of patrons at this time may have been attributable to the uninspired musical selections being played, which, despite occasional glimpses of promise, were generally of poor quality and failed to enhance the ambiance. In light of these factors, it becomes apparent that a trip to this restaurant is hardly worthwhile.

"Although the donuts were merely average in terms of culinary excellence, I was pleased to observe that they were sourced from a local bakery, thereby supporting the regional economy and fostering a sense of community. However, my dining experience was unfortunately marred by an unsolicited and rather vociferous expression of political views by one of the establishment's employees, which I felt was inappropriate and somewhat off-putting. In my opinion, a restaurant should maintain a neutral stance on political matters and focus primarily on providing an exceptional gastronomical experience for its clientele. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, I must admit that the business model employed by this particular eatery appears to be quite astute, as it capitalizes on the growing demand for sustainable and eco-friendly practices within the food industry. By occupying a relatively small physical space, utilizing a highly efficient production process, and catering to a demographic that places a premium on environmentally conscious consumption, this enterprise has managed to achieve a remarkable level of profitability with minimal overhead expenses. Moreover, I must commend their commitment to using biodiesel fuel in their company vehicle, as it exemplifies their dedication to reducing their carbon footprint and contributing positively to the local community's environmental well-being. If the quality of their donuts can be improved to a level that meets or exceeds my expectations, I would be inclined to revise my assessment upward and perhaps even become a regular patron of their establishment."

This establishment purporting to provide automobile cleansing services is, without a doubt, the most abysmal in the vicinity. The experience, from the moment of arrival to departure, is utterly wretched. Upon entering the premises, one is accosted by questionable individuals, ostensibly former convicts, who aggressively promote an array of additional services. Even when requesting a standard wash, these employees will endeavour to persuade customers to indulge in extraneous services such as waxing or leather treatments. Subsequent to this dubious encounter, the vehicle is subjected to a mechanical wash, employing tracks that scratch the rims and heavy beaters that damage the paint. Following this ordeal, the automobile is transported to an enclosed area where disgruntled attendants perfunctorily wipe away a few droplets before vociferously declaring the car ready. It is highly unlikely that a car wash is intended to leave vehicles in a more dilapidated state than prior to the service.

"The gastronomical offerings in the form of burgers and fries at this establishment are palatable, albeit for individuals with a pronounced predilection for lubricants and sodium chloride. Furthermore, the cost of procuring these comestibles is rather exorbitant. It is worth noting that during the initial stages of their operations, when novelty and curiosity served to attract a copious amount of patrons, the commercial performance of this eatery was on a steady decline."

"It is utterly preposterous that such a renowned establishment would permit an individual, specifically a member of their security personnel, to engage in such boorish and unprofessional behavior towards patrons. The sheer audacity and impudence displayed by this person, who insisted on persistently harassing me despite my explicit expressions of disinterest and discomfort, are truly reprehensible. Furthermore, the fact that his colleague felt compelled to intervene and admonish him underscores the egregious nature of his conduct. Suffice it to say, my expectations for an enjoyable evening were thoroughly dashed by this unfortunate encounter, and I shall henceforth exercise caution in considering Hakkasan as a viable entertainment option."

"The epitome of unpleasant dining experiences in Montreal, this eatery exemplified squalor, with chairs in disrepair and tables straining under the meager weight of the culinary offerings. The fare itself was abysmal, consisting of a sandwich fabricated from stale, tough bread and a paltry scattering of meat; the hummus was passable, while the salad was an uninspired medley of bitter lettuce and a token drizzle of dressing. Furthermore, the server's inability to furnish adequate change led to an awkward predicament wherein I was coerced into relinquishing an excessive gratuity, merely to avoid the tedium of awaiting her solicitation of spare change from numerous patrons. Needless to say, Shahrazad should be relegated to the bottom of one's list when seeking a convivial dining experience."

I didn't eat here, just walked in and tried to sit down at lunch time. The people were nasty so we walked out. Plus there's a $50 minimum per person. Gotta give it to 'em - they went all the way with the ridiculous minimum.

During my recent sojourn at the Vdara Hotel, I had the misfortune of encountering an unpleasant experience, which not only tarnished my expectations but also raised concerns regarding the establishment's commitment to providing an optimal guest experience. Upon arriving at the hotel, I decided to take a brief nap on the bed, only to be abruptly awoken by an intense itching sensation emanating from one of my legs. Upon lifting the quilt, I was taken aback by the presence of numerous black spots scattered across the sheet. My initial incredulity quickly gave way to utter dismay, as I had anticipated a higher standard of cleanliness and hygiene from a reputable hotel chain such as Vdara. I promptly contacted the housingkeeping department and requested that they replace the compromised linens without delay. Subsequently, I solicited the attention of the manager, who arrived shortly thereafter to inspect the issue firsthand. The African American manager, seemingly taken aback by the situation, proceeded to capture a photographic record of the offending stains and assured me that he would submit a report to the appropriate authorities and provide compensation for the inconvenience caused. However, much to my chagrin, I remained awaiting a response from the hotel for two days, with no resolution or reparation forthcoming. It appears that Vdara may not place sufficient emphasis on prioritizing customer satisfaction, thereby rendering it a less-than-ideal choice for travelers seeking a pleasant and worry-free stay.

The plethora of evaluations pertaining to this establishment appear to be marked by inconsistency, with my personal experience falling squarely into the latter category; specifically, the quality of service was subpar and the hostess's demeanor was utterly unprofessional, bordering on outright hostility. Moreover, the dining area was not particularly crowded, which made the prolonged wait for our meals all the more vexing. Furthermore, the culinary offerings, once we were finally able to sample them, were merely average, and the wine arrived belatedly. In light of these factors, I must conclude that my expectations for an undiscovered gem were woefully misplaced, and instead, I found myself confronted with an unmitigated disappointment.

"What possessed me to venture into this decrepit establishment? I had visiting family members from out of town seeking souvenir t-shirts to bring back to Nebraska. Bonanza offers an array of t-shirts, albeit mediocre imitations and risquÃ© attire unsuitable for public wear in any respectable setting beyond the confines of Fremont Street. If one is in pursuit of kitschy Las Vegas-themed trinkets, questionable CSI merchandise, secondhand playing cards from Harrah's, and an assortment of colored dice, then this gift shop might prove to be a veritable treasure trove. However, be prepared to encounter overzealous security personnel who regard customers with suspicion and subject them to antiquated checkout procedures. Furthermore, a staff member stationed at the entrance will inspect receipts, a futile endeavor considering the prevalence of theft. It is unfortunate that the employees themselves appear to be a collection of disgruntled individuals bemoaning their fate. Following my visit, I cannot help but wish that the ongoing demolition on the northern portion of the Strip had extended slightly farther northward, encompassing this wretched establishment. Perhaps when the SLS Las Vegas breathes new life into the Sahara, a perceptive developer will eradicate this unsightly blot. Although I advocate for preserving historic Vegas, photographs of this gift shop will suffice instead of maintaining the actual eyesore. This critique pertains solely to the gift shop and not the adjacent liquor store, which may be the sole redeeming feature of this woeful excuse for a retail establishment."

"The sole aspect of this eatery that piques my interest is the entrance via the culinary quarters. However, the ambiance is marred by the brusque demeanor of the mixologists, a duo whose comportment falls short of hospitable standards. While the comestibles are palatable, it would be an exaggeration to describe them as exceptional. This establishment seems to benefit from an inexplicable leniency, perpetuating a reputation that is undeserved. The antiquated flock wallpaper and geriatric waitstaff only contribute to an overall mediocrity that renders it unremarkable among its peers. Numerous alternative dining options exist, rendering this venue unnecessary."

At first, I presumed that I was destined to partake in a remarkable experience at this establishment, primarily due to their extensive assortment of merchandise, which catered to the preferences of both fervent alcohol connoisseurs and aficionados of wine-related paraphernalia. However, my expectations were utterly dissipated by the discourteous and unpleasant demeanor exhibited by the female staff members who were present during my visit.

As a recently turned 21-year-old individual, I have become accustomed to displaying my identification, and I do not harbor any reservations about doing so. In fact, I am cognizant of the legal requirements and would never deliberately put a business at risk of being penalized for serving an underage patron. Nonetheless, the women were excessively impolite when they demanded that I display my identification prior to even inspecting a wine. Furthermore, after I had presented my identification to one of the more amiable staff members, the others appeared to be utterly disconcerted and fixated on the fact that I was consuming an alcoholic beverage. Their repetitive remarks regarding the potential fines that would be imposed if they served me while underage were not only superfluous but also rather vexing.

It is regrettable that the staff's behavior was so uncivil, as we were on the verge of purchasing several bottles of wine and some decorative items.

"In the year 2007, I encountered an unfortunate situation where my vehicle's alternator malfunctioned, leaving me stranded. Subsequently, a tow truck driver recommended a repair shop that supposedly possessed the expertise to rectify the issue efficiently. Upon arriving at the facility, the technician declared that the process of replacing the alternator would be arduous due to its location, and thus, demanded an exorbitant fee of $385 for both parts and labor. Despite my initial reluctance, I relented and authorized the repair. However, fast forward to the present, my vehicle has accumulated 120,000 miles, and the same alternator issue has recurred, albeit with only 50,000 miles on the replacement unit. When I contacted the establishment to inquire about their warranty policy, they refused to honor it. In light of this, I opted to pursue a more economical solution by watching a tutorial on YouTube, which enabled me to execute the replacement myself. By purchasing the necessary components from Auto Zone and adhering to the instructions provided in the video, I successfully installed a new alternator with a lifetime warranty within a mere 45 minutes, including two trips to the store. Conclusively, I strongly advise against utilizing the services of this particular repair shop, as their practices are unethical and their claims are blatantly false."

Horrible service.  

Could not understand the clerk taking my order, then of course it wasn't what I wanted.  The clerk then tries to blame me for the mistake - what???  

The person making my drink acts like it's such a pain to make what I wanted.  Then, she makes it wrong again anyway, so I just had to walk away, with no drink, or else many awful things may have come out of my mouth!

"A plethora of demeanor and gastronomical mediocrity? My gratitude is withheld. 

There exists a pernicious cycle in relation to forming presumptions regarding one's clientele. One assumes, 'They appear youthful and opted for tap water. It is likely that they will not expend considerable financial resources here. I shall disregard them.' Well, you see, when one fails to perceive their server again throughout the evening and is compelled to request assistance from managers, the outcome is often an inadequate gratuity. 

We requested several glasses of sangria, specifically the crimson variety, which proved to be satisfactory yet unremarkable. Subsequently, we ordered a few platters of tapas, as a means of initiating our culinary experience. The risotto was utterly disappointing, and a few additional dishes were also sampled. The sole exceptional aspect of the meal was the ceviche, although I have undoubtedly encountered superior renditions. The cost was exorbitant, and the quantity of sustenance was minimal, relative to the price. 

There are numerous superior alternatives available. My intentions do not include a future visit."

"Subpar culinary experience with too much repetition in ambiance and insufficient flavor profile, save for an abundance of condiments; however, the server's hospitable demeanor almost compensated for the deficiencies, misleading us into assuming a connection to authentic Mexican cuisine due to the proximity."

I have had the privilege of utilizing the services of this laundromat for an approximate duration of two years. During my visits, I have encountered courteous females (provided they are not engrossed in their mobile devices, indulging in lengthy conversations). However, my most recent visit proved to be my last, as I have since relocated from the surrounding area (much to my relief). Following my departure, I have attempted to contact their customer service department through the designated telephone number, only to be met with an automated response, assuring me of a return call within a twenty-four hour period. Unfortunately, several days have passed without a response, leaving me feeling frustrated and disillusioned. Furthermore, I have noticed an increase in unsavory individuals, including beggars and intoxicated persons, taking refuge on the premises, with seemingly no attempts made by management to address the issue. Needless to say, I am relieved to no longer be burdened with the responsibility of frequenting this establishment.

"Upon perusing the ambiance of this establishment, one cannot help but harbor trepidation regarding the state of one's health and wellbeing. Following numerous traversals of the vicinity, a coterie of acquaintances and I opted to partake in the purported 'Tuesday wing night', only to be met with an experience that engendered a collective sentiment that we would not be revisiting this venue in the future. Although I am currently free from any discernible symptoms of illness, the uncertainty surrounding the potential ramifications of consuming food and beverages obtained from such a source leaves me apprehensive regarding the possibility of an unpleasant awakening come morning. In light of the aforementioned, it is my conviction that one would be well-advised to seek sustenance and refreshment at a different location within the neighborhood, lest they wish to risk the prospect of ingesting something potentially harmful or subpar in quality. As an alternative, a journey of merely half a mile in distance to acquire a pizza from Fiori's would likely prove a more salubrious and satisfying option."

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are of satisfactory quality, however, the hospitality extended by the staff is subpar, particularly in the absence of the proprietor, Rajiv. Moreover, the delivery process is fraught with difficulties, resulting in unacceptably tepid fare, and the personnel tend to shift the responsibility onto the customer in the event of a failed delivery. It is imperative that the management addresses these shortcomings in order to provide a more satisfactory dining experience for their clientele."

On July 31st, 2014, in commemoration of my boyfriend's birthday, I treated him to a culinary excursion at this establishment, during which I had the misfortune of consuming dumplings that were uncooked on the inside, as evidenced by the accompanying image. Following my observation of this flaw, the waitress merely removed my plate without providing any solution to rectify the problem. Consequently, I ingested raw pork owing to their carelessness, which has precipitated my current state of dizziness. I emphatically declare that I shall never engage in commercial transactions with this enterprise again.

I fervently wish I had perused some of the critiques prior to visiting this Korean BBQ eatery, as my experience was marred by a series of unfortunate events stemming from the staff's discourteous behavior. Despite my ethnic background, the hostess displayed visible disdain towards my lack of proficiency in the Korean language, which set the tone for an unpleasant dining experience. The waitstaff, though sparse in their interactions, conveyed an air of disinterest and aversion towards me, exemplified by the waitress's curt demeanor and reluctance to provide adequate service. The cuisine, characterized by the unremarkable pork bulgogi, fell short of my expectations, and the prolonged delay in receiving my bill only exacerbated my frustration. The absence of a cordial atmosphere and the staff's seeming indifference towards ensuring a positive customer experience left me feeling disappointed and disinclined to revisit the establishment, save for the necessity of using the restroom facilities.

"The customer experience at this establishment is subpar. Yesterday, I entered the premises due to technical difficulties with my iPhone. Upon approaching an associate at the Genius Bar, I communicated my concerns and was informed that I would need to return in three hours' time to receive assistance from a specialist. This response was met with incredulity on my part, given the fact that there were at least five representatives engaged in a social gathering, none of whom were attending to clientele. Suffice it to say, I promptly departed the location and sought assistance from T-Mobile, whereupon I encountered exceptional customer service. Disillusioned with Apple, I am unlikely to make future purchases from the company."

"The San Gennaro Feast, once a celebrated event, has degenerated into an overpriced and underwhelming experience. Initially, it showcased promise, but subsequent years have witnessed a steady decline in quality. 

A comprehensive sampling of the festival's offerings has revealed a consistent mediocrity, with the exception of the lemonade stand, which remains a steadfast and reliable option. The sausage, once a highly anticipated delicacy, has succumbed to the pitfalls of mass production, resulting in a desiccated and unappetizing fare that few are willing to purchase at the exorbitant price of $10 or more per sandwich. 

Furthermore, the entrance fee, considered in conjunction with the relocation of the festival to a venue removed from the Strip, is seen as excessive and unwarranted, contributing to an overall atmosphere akin to a 'Gypsie fest.'"

This place has completely given up. I don't know if they have had new owners within the last 4 months or so but its gotten really bad. Unless your one of the regulars who have probably been drinking since 11am you don't get much attention here.

Just went there tonight for the 35 cent wings on Monday night. Waited 5 minutes before the lazy waitress decided to come greet me. Placed my order right away as I could tell how often I would see her again. Just got 2 dozen wings. ....... 45MINS LATER my wings show up. Not exaggerating at all. NEWSFLASH- Wings take 8mins in the fryer...why would I have to wait 45mins??? When they finally showed up I let her know Ill just take them to go since Im out of time. She didn't seem to care at all I was clearly upset. Also NOT ONE TIME did she refill my drink...not one time. And to top of the whole fun experience I get the check to find out they have stopped the wings deal on Monday. 

Its sad cause I used to go here with all my friends every Monday and this place had good waitresses who cared but like I said earlier these people now don't care one bit. NEVER AGAIN. Thank Jackie for the great experience and hope you can find another dump hole to work in 6 months when this place is closed.

this store started out nice, but within about a year it had already destroyed itself. The floors are already dirty, the lot is ALWAYS  a mess, the people inside are rude and HATE their life apparently. Ask them a question and they might just cut themself with their box cutter. This location NEVER  has enough lanes open and the self-checkout employess are never to be found. To top off everything else, the prices are actually really high. It makes me sad that people just let walmart lie to them about having the lowest prices, because they most certanly do NOT. I've price compared a few different places and the Target across the 215 actually had the lowest average prices on food and HBA. It's got a full grocery on the Garden Center side so that is where I will be going for groceries for now on, I will never step foot in this lying, filthy, horrid trap again. Now if only the moron \"security\" guy would get the hell out of the way!

"Greetings! My spouse and I have been inhabiting a residential unit within the Crosswinds apartment complex located in Chandler, Arizona. Lamentably, we have not been experiencing an optimal living environment due to the presence of Blattodea, commonly known as cockroaches, which have been proliferating at an alarming rate. The pest control measures implemented by the management have been inadequate, as the utilization of peanut butter in the cabinetry has served only to exacerbate the infestation, resulting in a sizable colony of Periplaneta americana taking up residence within our convection oven, a kitchen appliance gifted to us on the occasion of our nuptials and valued at a sum of three hundred dollars. Furthermore, we have discovered entry points for these unwelcome intruders in the form of fissures situated behind our stove, within the walls. Considering the presence of our two beloved pets and our reluctance to subject our possessions to potentially harmful chemicals, we are hesitant to resort to bombing our dwelling. Instead, we suggest that a comprehensive pest eradication effort be undertaken throughout all structures within the complex, given the widespread nature of both Blattodea and Cimex lectularius, or bed bugs, affecting numerous tenants. Our endurance in addressing this matter has reached its limits, and we expect a prompt resolution to this distressing situation, lest we be compelled to seek restitution for any further damage incurred in safeguarding our home against these unwanted arthropods."

This place was absolutely terrible. The server had me YELL MY ORDER ACROSS THE ROOM.

Our food was disgusting, wilted and contained mystery ingredients and missing others. The manager comped our entire meal and drinks then offered us dessert to go. It was so bad, we declined. So horrible! Be warned! Holy rotten macaroni! 

Guys seated nearby us left when we did, shook my hand for saying something to them. Absolutely beyond ridiculous.

"This establishment is unequivocally subpar. Initially, we proceeded to check in and were instructed to return at 12; however, upon our return at 12, we were informed that our room would not be available until 3. Perplexed and annoyed, we decided to temporarily vacate the premises, only to discover upon our return at 3 that individuals without prior reservations had been accommodated at 12. The incongruity of this situation incensed both myself and my family to an immense degree, but we opted to dismiss the matter for the time being. Later that evening, I noticed that the bedding appeared unclean, with a conspicuous stain on one of the pillowcases. My dissatisfaction with the state of the lodging increased substantially. Furthermore, while traversing the corridor the following morning, I observed dishes and drinkware strewn about the floor. Although we did not attribute much significance to it at the time, their continued presence later that night raised concerns regarding the adequacy of the hotel's upkeep. In light of these experiences, I am emphatic in my decision never to return to this establishment."

With Walmart being so big, they lack customer service. Pressed for assistant more than 3x at the fabric section and no one showed up. They just keep losing sales over and over. Will it ever get better??!!!! Such a disappointment.
