"Having had the privilege of being immersed within the hospitality sector for a duration of twelve years, I feel compelled to share my sentiments regarding the establishment in question, albeit with the understanding that my viewpoint may be subjective and open to interpretation. The location, while improved from its previous iteration, presents itself in a relatively diminutive format, which, in conjunction with the subpar culinary offerings and sluggish service, does little to inspire confidence in the venue's ability to provide an enjoyable dining experience. Furthermore, the dearth of patrons during our visit, despite the absence of any notable ambiance or charm, should perhaps serve as an indication of the restaurant's limited appeal. While I might consider returning with my offspring for the purpose of entertainment, I would unquestionably refrain from partaking in the edible offerings, especially given the abundance of superior alternatives in the surrounding area. It is worth noting that, based on my extensive exposure to the industry, I have witnessed numerous establishments with comparable shortcomings falter and ultimately shut their doors. Thus, barring any dramatic transformations, it remains uncertain whether this particular business can sustain itself in the long term."

I would much rather give this place zero stars. I scheduled a pick up and they sent me a window when they would be there and no one showed up. However I got a call saying he's running. A few Minutes behind I can understand. Here I am not calling customer service talked to 3 diff people aside from the guy Jason who called me the last guy then told me that the driver just went back to the warehouse then left and the best the could schedule me for was 2 weeks from now. Annoying. Never going to them again now that I sat at an empty apartment and wasted 7 hours of my day waiting for them.

went to metro pizza on sky point dr. last night ordered a large triple play pizza. over $24.00 for a large pizza!!!! it was a thin crust ridiculous! one of the most expensive pizzas we ever ordered! it was ok but $24.00 wasn't worth it. if that wasn't bad enough my brand new car got keyed on the whole passenger side!!! car's 4 months old hasn't even had first oil change yet. I know it wasn't metro's fault but we were parked in their handicap parking {we're both handicapped and hung our sign up} trouble with this metro  their parking lot is way off to the side and far from the restaurants entrance so yeah makes easy target to vandalize patrons cars.called police filed complaint and talked to metro's manager on duty.advised him to maybe put camera out in parking lot and for him to call police so they can watch parking lot when cruising the area. told me he will have owner give me a call. of course that never happened! yesterday evening ended up making this the most expensive pizza we ever had.typical owner could give a damn about trouble we had outside his restaurant!!! we will never set foot in metro pizza ever again.just a warning to all the public be wary of eating in this establishment cause your vehicles will be at risk when you park in metro's parking lot.

I ordered delivery because of the good reviews. I ordered garlic knots and a hawaiian pizza. When the food arrived, the garlic knots were stale and crunchy. I could not eat them. The pizza wasn't much better. The cheese was already rubberized andbthe grease soaked through to the bottom leaving a floppy, soggy crust. I wouldn't recommend eating this to anyone. It was one of those times that trying something new over the usual was a disaster.

Sorry, this place sucked. It was crowded, the service was absolutely awful and the food was mediocre. I was literally asked for my I'D 3 separate times (I'm 45 by the way) AND you're only \"allowed\" 1 drink at the bar per ID.... even though the waitress at the table took at least 45 minutes between rounds..... yeah,  NEVER going back to this establishment.

My spouse and I have had the pleasure of dining at this esteemed establishment on a previous occasion, and our culinary experience was nothing short of exceptional. However, upon our most recent visit, we encountered several issues that warranted a solitary star in our review. Firstly, the queue was utterly absurd, with a wait time of over an hour, even with only four patrons ahead of us. Secondly, and quite astonishingly, we were informed that no individual under the age of 21 was permitted to partake in the gastronomic delights offered by this restaurant. This revelation was utterly perplexing and left us feeling incredulous. Our group consisted of my husband, our 13-year-old daughter, and myself, and we had ventured quite some distance from the strip specifically to indulge in the delectable fare offered here. After approximately 40 minutes of waiting, during which the line had failed to advance, a staff member approached us and informed us that our presence was no longer desired due to the age restriction. Needless to say, we shall not be returning to this establishment, either with or without our offspring, at any point in the future.

We have been here few times and never in my life have I been in a place of business that blatantly targets a table of paying customers for their race and their heritage. A group of us sat, not bothering anyone, trying to have dinner, when we were attacked by the owner of the restaurant for being Asian. When we called him out on it, he just continued on. He even finished the night by saying \" I will be here next week but that table won't be.\" What a terrible waste of space.

"Underwhelmed and disillusioned by an unsatisfactory culinary excursion, I entered the establishment in the company of a companion, only to be confronted with an acrid and unpalatable beverage, further exacerbated by a lackadaisical and inhospitable demeanor on the part of the staff. The prolonged delay in receiving our simple repast, juxtaposed with the expedited departure of other patrons who had already obtained their sustenance, served only to intensify my dissatisfaction. Unfortunately, this constitutes the second instance of an unfavorable encounter, thereby casting doubt upon the likelihood of my future patronage."

"The culinary experience was utterly disappointing. As an astute gastronomic aficionado, I would strongly advise potential patrons to seek sustenance at an alternative establishment located a mere one block south of this subpar eatery. It is highly likely that this particular business will cease operations within a span of three months due to its apparent lack of quality and customer satisfaction."

I would give them zero stars if it were possible. 

My wife tore her ACL on a Saturday, went to the ER. Visited her PCP the following business day to get a referral.  SW Medical sent her here. They initially told her they couldn't see her until FOUR MONTHS LATER!!!! I fought through their BS after hours of hold times and finally got an appointment to see someone three weeks after the injury, only to have them cancel on her the business day before the appointment. What A-holes! They pretty much told us to go F ourselves....What is the reason you ask for cancelling? Apparently, they aren't contracted with the ER that she went to (even though our insurance is) and that is where the HMO sent us-so they refused to treat her. 

In a way this review is unfair because she never actually got to see any of their doctors, but I am just giving you the facts of what happened and how terribly we were treated by the staff. I have worked for 13 years in healthcare and have never had an office treat me or any of the patients I work with so poorly.

We contacted our insurance and found another orthopedist who was happy to take our carrier and was able to get her in ASAP, so if your insurance tells you that Nevada  Othopedic and Spine Center is where you should go, tell them to give you other options to avoid a terrible experience like ours.

"The culinary excellence of pizza consistently meets expectations, but service staff would benefit from adhering to fundamental sanitary standards, such as securing their hair, to maintain a positive ambiance reminiscent of the establishment's former glory days along Mill Avenue."

"Deplorable. Sergios' installation of sod at my domicile was accompanied by an egregious lack of a crucial tool, specifically, a roller. Moreover, the so-called 'crew' exhibited an abysmal ignorance regarding the implement's very existence. Following my telephonic communication with the office, I was assured that a subsequent team would arrive later in the day to execute the requisite rolling process. Unfortunately, this promise proved to be an empty assurance, as the anticipated personnel failed to materialize. Consequently, the task was completed in an unacceptably subpar manner. My attempts to obtain redress via message were met with utter disregard and neglect. In light of this experience, I emphatically advise seeking the services of a more scrupulous and esteemed provider."

We went to Buddy V's for a late lunch around 2:30. The restaurant was less than half full, plenty of seating, no wait. There were 4 of us, with two more on the way. The not so pleasant manager said they do not sit incomplete parties...are you joking, there were so many open tables!! We said we'd like to be seated to order drinks, they refused. So we waited a few minutes, went back up to the host stand asked if they really couldn't seat us with all the open tables, it seemed a little ridiculous.  Still a very rude no. We left went to another Venetian Italian restaurant, got seated right away.  Will never go back, horrible service. I understand if your busy, but they weren't, just very rude and unaccomadating.

"The solitary visit underpinned my unenthusiastic appraisal, thus it is advisable to consider it with a pinch of salt. I opted for the spicy basil chicken lunch special, which incorporated a choice between white or fried rice (I chose the former) and either soup or salad (I opted for the latter). The egg drop soup was merely passable, as the peas and carrots within lacked authenticity in terms of flavor. The spicy basil chicken, while registering a moderate level of heat on a scale of 1-5 (I requested a 3), was unfortunately devoid of any discernible basil essence and instead, its taste was rather unpleasant. However, a notable aspect of their beverage offerings was the palatable Thai tea. It would be inaccurate to label this establishment as Thai, as the majority of their menu items are of Chinese origin."

"Subsequently, you individuals opt to label us as deceivers; an excellent approach to conducting yourselves in a professional manner, I procured two beverages and a few cheese sticks, for which I compensated. The incompetent 'employees' are the root cause of your issues. You proffer me a sample of your frozen treat, subsequently attempt to charge me for it. Absolutely laughable."
Where is 2470 W Happy Valley Rd.  It's not near the large 2480 number on the building in the middle of the block on the north side of the street.

I will not be returning. My insurance coverage encompasses a routine examination, inclusive of dilation. Upon arriving at the facility, the attendant presented me with documentation to sign, which incorporated an agreement to substitute an electronic scan for dilation, at an additional cost of $39.00. Both the attendant and the paperwork conveyed the impression that this alternative was essentially obligatory. To decline this offer, I was compelled to complete a form and express my refusal to two separate attendants, emphasizing that I was unwilling to incur further expenses. During my consultation with the physician, she informed me that my ocular health was optimal and that I did not require the aforementioned segment of the examination, despite my previous experiences at other optometry clinics. Notably, the medical professional denied me access to my inter-pupillary distance. Following my query, the doctor claimed that the eyewear personnel prohibited her from disclosing this information. In turn, the eyewear staff asserted that the doctor refused to permit them to share this detail. After fabricating several pretexts, the doctor reluctantly divulged that they preferred to maintain secrecy regarding this measurement to prevent individuals from ordering eyewear independently online.

"Prior to the events transpiring on the aforementioned Friday, this salon held the esteemed position of being my preferred establishment for pampering and grooming purposes. However, due to the unfortunate turn of events that occurred during my most recent visit, I fear that I shall not be returning to this once beloved salon. Specifically, I requested the upgraded callous removal treatment, which I had successfully received on previous occasions, but unfortunately, the female nail technician employed an excessive amount of force, resulting in raw, scabbed toes and heels, only on my right foot. Furthermore, despite my explicit request for Tom, my preferred nail technician, he was regrettably unavailable, even upon my specific inquiry regarding his availability for my scheduled appointment. While the ambiance and staff of this salon are undoubtedly pleasant, the actions of said nail technician have irreparably tarnished my overall experience, leaving me no choice but to seek alternative establishments for my future grooming needs."

Me and my mother arrived at approximately 2 pm to partake in a late luncheon prior to collecting my son from his educational institution. We did not require an extensive duration to peruse the menu, as we were already cognizant of our culinary desires. Following a cursory examination of their menu, I requested the waitress to serve me the most piquant sushi roll available. My maternal figure opted for a straightforward Teriyaki Chicken dish from their Lunch Special Menu.

Fifteen minutes elapsed before my order was served. To my disappointment, the sushi was not nearly as fiery as I had anticipated. Nonetheless, I appreciated the fact that the slices were somewhat diminutive in size, thereby preventing me from appearing ravenous. (I couldn't help but laugh at this minor victory.) It remained unclear whether this was mere happenstance or if they were genuinely served in such a manner.

After devouring my meal, my mother's order had yet to arrive. At this juncture, she grew increasingly irate. Considering it was a late lunch and we had placed our orders with reasonable haste, awaiting food for thirty minutes proved quite vexing. My mother elected to cancel her order, and we departed without offering a gratuity. While I felt regretful, I could not rationally defend the quality of service rendered at this establishment. Given that it was 2 pm, a mere three tables were occupied, including our own, and the remaining tables accommodated merely two to four patrons each.

I do not intend to revisit this restaurant, nor would I recommend it to others. In essence, the service was deplorable.

AVOID THESE WALGREENS ON THE STRIP AT ALL COSTS!! They are merely TOURIST TRAP BUSINESSES, capitalizing on unsuspecting visitors' lack of familiarity with the area and charging exorbitant prices for even the most basic items. For instance, I entered one of these establishments and brought my Arizona Iced Tea and a pack of.99 cashews to the checkout counter, mentioning to the cashier that the iced tea was on sale that week. She inquired about my possession of a coupon, to which I responded negatively and inquired as to whether the store had a sales flyer for that week. The cashier replied in the negative, prompting me to retrieve a receipt from a previous purchase at a different location and display it to her, pointing out that I had not received a coupon at that time either, yet the store still offered a sales flyer to accommodate its patrons. The cashier proved unhelpful, leading me to request the manager's assistance. 

Upon the manager's arrival, I presented my receipt and emphasized that I had never encountered a Walgreens that failed to provide a sales flyer or refused to honor its weekly sales paper. I expressed my dissatisfaction audibly, characterizing their actions as nothing more than "tourist gouging." Following this exchange, I departed and vowed never to set foot in any of these strip stores again, opting instead to voice my grievances to Walgreens management via their customer service hotline (1800-763-0547). Heed my warning and avoid these strip stores like the plague!

Where to initiate the process of securing a reservation for a celebratory gathering of six individuals proved to be a formidable challenge, as I was curtly informed by the hostess that access to a table would not be feasible until 10:30 PM, purportedly due to the presence of multiple large groups that evening, although I conveyed our intentions to consume beverages and would not be deterred by the prospect of waiting, the hostess remained unyielding in her stance, furthermore, upon our punctual arrival, the hostess demonstrated an acrimonious demeanor and refused to accommodate our request for a table, despite the fact that several members of our party did not intend to partake in culinary indulgences, and instead, opted to await the availability of a vacant table, the manager, possessing an equally disagreeable attitude, joined the discourse, and, with a hint of incredulity, expressed reluctance to proffer a solution, ultimately, the interchange concluded with my decision to seek alternative venues for our festivities, thereby depriving the establishment of potential revenue.

Upon awakening from my brief slumber, I experienced an intense yearning for chicken enchiladas, which compelled me to persuade my significant other to accompany me on an expedition in pursuit of sustenance. Following a brief excursion, we arrived at Super Burrito, a venue unfamiliar to me, whereupon we placed an order for a carne asada burrito, a dish of beef enchiladas for my companion, and a comparable dish featuring poultry for myself, accompanied by a medium-sized container of Coca-Cola. Upon receiving our repast, we proceeded to consume it while in transit, halting briefly at various establishments at the behest of my companion. Eventually, we returned, and I began to experience sensations of disappointment and frustration upon discovering that the contents of the first takeout container did not align with my expectations, specifically, beef enchiladas. Perplexed and disconcerted, I opened the second container, only to find cheese, a development akin to ordering a hamburger and receiving merely a bun with a slice of cheese, prompting me to query the whereabouts of my principal component. Thus, I remain unsatisfied and irritated.

We were thrilled to finally get a Cafe Rio in our area.  However, after several visits we are ready to say goodbye to our new location and travel back to the Stephanie or Eastern locations.  The service here is horrible, the restaurant is freezing cold and the food is less than mediocre.  The servers are rude and when I ask for extra pico, I am treated like I am asking for something impossible!  \n\nIt is time for management to step-up and take control and make some much needed changes!!!

"Well, it is with profound disappointment that we must recount our recent dining experience at this establishment, which, regrettably, fell short of our expectations in terms of customer service and overall satisfaction. Upon entering the premises, we were met with an enthusiastic welcome from two young hostesses, whose cheerful demeanor and warm smiles led us to believe that our visit would be a pleasant one. However, our optimism was quickly dispelled as we were left unattended for an unacceptable duration of time, despite our anticipation of prompt and attentive service. Indeed, it is no exaggeration to say that we endured an interminable wait of 18 minutes, during which not a single staff member took the initiative to approach us, offer refreshments, or even acknowledge our presence. The utter lack of regard for our time and comfort was truly disconcerting and, quite frankly, inexcusable. Suffice it to say, we departed the establishment in search of a more hospitable environment, leaving behind the same two hostesses who, in a striking display of obliviousness, bade us farewell and expressed their gratitude for our visit, seemingly impervious to the fact that their negligence had effectively nullified any chance of our return. It is worth noting that this unfortunate series of events transpired on Sunday, July 9th, 2012, at approximately 2-3 PM."

Do not order sushi from here. The rolls are 3km in diameter and the soy sauce is so salty you may dehydrate on the spot. They use chicken fried rice in their sushi  Chow mein is also questionable. Save your money and your taste buds.

I would write a "0" review if I could. I cannot review the food. I did not get a chance to eat there. Me and my Hawaiian friend went there to grab what I heard was some great Indian food, during one of the "Unblurred" Friday evenings. The concierge looked at us disdainfully, and was talking about how the 3-4 empty tables we saw was reserved. No "reserved" signs were in sight on these tables and dude did not mention when any seating would be freed up. 

Whether or not he was prick or or a racist prick, I have no idea. He seemed more interested in getting us out of there than he was in trying to serve us. It is Garfield, so may be he has had issues with the local denizens causing trouble, who happen to look like me. Dunno. All the white people get to eat, we do not? 

With the exception of the Awesome Spak Brothers, I would not bother eating anything on Penn Avenue. Ever. I spend more time focusing on the surrounding crap than I do with actually eating.

"This particular venue does not possess the qualities that would render it an ideal location for a revisit, as the staff's demeanor towards patrons exhibits a conspicuous lack of warmth and hospitality, and requests for customized nail art designs are met with incredulity and disbelief, culminating in an unsatisfactory experience; thus, it is preferable to seek alternative establishments for a novel manicure."

"It is my conviction that I must have encountered them on an exceptionally unfavorable day, as my sentiments regarding their culinary offerings can be succinctly articulated as 'YUCK,' and, furthermore, I consider their fare to be a fiscally irresponsible investment, akin to purchasing chewing gum at a highway rest stop. Indeed, the quality of their comestibles does not appear to justify the premium price point, leading me to discard approximately ninety percent of the food in question."

"My anticipation to experience the culinary offerings of this novel eatery was immense, particularly in light of my unrelenting yearning for an authentic barbecue experience. Following a meticulous perusal of their online menu, I was convinced that this establishment would satiate my gastronomical desires. However, upon arriving at the venue on a Saturday evening at approximately 8:30, I was taken aback by the stark contrast between the ambiance and the quality of the fare. Despite the extensive variety of delectable options, the actual consumption of the food proved to be underwhelming, as the texture of the ribs resembled rubber and lacked the rich flavor I had expected. Similarly, my spouse's pulled pork sandwich was devoid of any discernible taste. Considering these factors, I would not recommend this restaurant to others, as there are superior alternatives available, such as Stacy's BBQ in Phoenix and The Pitt's Again in Glendale. Nonetheless, the adjacent Sugarbowl provided a satisfying conclusion to an otherwise disappointing dining experience."

I have been an intermittent patron of this establishment for an extended period, during which time I have consistently encountered subpar service and unfriendly demeanors. Despite these unfortunate experiences, I have persisted in my attempts to procure the items I require from this store, primarily due to the scarcity of alternative needlework retailers in the Phoenix area. Most recently, I endeavored to place a special order for a canvas, which I communicated via both Facebook messenger and telephone calls. However, after a protracted two-week interval, I received a voicemail response that conveyed utter bewilderment regarding the identity of the canvas in question. It is worth noting that I have successfully ordered similar canvases from this store in the past, with prices ranging in the hundreds of dollars. Therefore, it is perplexing that such confusion could arise, particularly given the fact that I provided the complete title and artist information in my initial Facebook message. In light of this unsatisfactory exchange, I have opted to purchase the canvas from an alternate source. Furthermore, I cannot help but wonder whether this treatment stems from an inherent dislike towards me specifically, or if it is simply a result of being an outsider to their exclusive clique. As a word of caution, I would advise potential customers to exercise great care when choosing to shop at this store, especially if they do not identify as a member of the so-called "Stepford Stitchers" group.

I had arrived at this venue several years ago with the intention of attending a spoken word performance by Henry Rollins, which, I must say, was utterly captivating and thoroughly enjoyable, earning it a well-deserved perfect rating of five stars. However, the seating arrangement within the auditorium left much to be desired, as the seats were excruciatingly cramped, providing patrons with a meager amount of legroom that made it challenging for individuals of above-average height to maintain a comfortable posture. In fact, even when positioning my legs laterally, I found myself still pressed up against the adjacent row, resulting in an agonizing experience akin to being trapped in a prolonged and rigid yoga pose for the duration of three hours. It is worth mentioning that the rows of seating were situated in such proximity to one another that only my sister-in-law, who stands at a mere 5'1\", could manage to sit comfortably without enduring any discomfort. Therefore, I implore the management of Celebrity Theatre to consider augmenting the distance between rows, as even a slight increase in size would significantly enhance the overall viewing experience for patrons. Those who claim that size is irrelevant are either misinformed or deceitful.

Nancy Erdmann was very rude and insensitive. I felt rushed.  Sadly, I'm someone that's going through a tough time health wise and I'm just looking for a good doctor to listen and help me.  The search continues...

The food was good ... the service at this location is HORRIBLE. They are slow never check in with your table and take forever to bring something once you ask for it. Never coming back to this location. Going back to the one on DI their service is amazing and the atmosphere is so much nicer.

Don't do it. Just don't. You're better of with some frozen boxes out of the freezer section of the grocery store. 

Our dish was half hot, warm in the middle, and cold on the other side. The dessert was stale and bland. 

BF was BLOATED like he was in his third trimester and miserable for TWO days after. Ew.

I went here in a Saturday afternoon and I have to say it was a mistake. 

The beer was stale, soapy, and flat. The food was bad and our waitress was just slow. 

I have nothing positive to say about The Comedy Club.

"It has come to our attention that the culinary offerings at this establishment are purportedly exceptional; however, due to the unfortunate circumstances that transpired during our visit, we were unable to experience them firsthand. Despite our reservation being secured seven days prior to our planned visitation, and for a party of six individuals no less, we were regrettably subjected to a series of fallacious statements proffered by the hostess. It appears that she engaged in a systematic campaign of deception, deliberately misleading both ourselves and other patrons, as we witnessed a group of seven individuals being seated before us - ostensibly possessing a reservation themselves - while we awaited our turn in vain. Furthermore, we were informed that our table was on the verge of becoming available, allegedly due to the previous occupants having settled their bill, when in reality, no such transaction had occurred. Such conduct is not only unethical but also utterly bizarre, especially considering our extensive experience dining at various locales globally. Consequently, we elected to redirect our financial resources elsewhere."

"The quality of customer service in a subpar bakery leaves much to be desired, as evidenced by our multiple visits, with each experience yielding disappointment and disillusionment. Despite our willingness to grant them the benefit of the doubt, the bakery has consistently failed to meet expectations, with the most recent encounter involving the refusal to honor a coupon that had allegedly expired mere hours prior, rather than the stipulated time frame of thirteen hours later. Furthermore, the staff displayed an utter lack of remorse or contrition, which only serves to reinforce our decision to seek alternative establishments for our future patronage."

This is more than a yogurt bar. They've got burgers and apparently waffles. The air was heavy with oil when I walked in.
I like to try several favors when I visit a yogurt bar. My first attempt was the mango sorbet. When I pulled the trigger a bunch of thick liquid globbed out. We asked about the sugar free "dairy free" vanilla and the cashier proceeded to tell us it's not really dairy free. 
The flavors of my selection were disappointing.
This was the worst yogurt bar experience I've had.

Never did I imagine that I would be composing a review for The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf. Having previously served as a supervisor for the company and having garnered experience at multiple other cafes, I tend to be rather indulgent and empathetic towards all baristas across the globe. However, my girlfriend and I were eager to acquire some coffee for the road prior to checking out of our hotel, and our expectations were not entirely met. The establishment had employed an expeditor to take orders in an effort to expedite the line, and we placed an order for a regular hazelnut iced coffee and a large Orchard Peach iced tea. Following payment, we awaited our beverages, but instead, we received two regular-sized drinks. While this was not a catastrophic occurrence, we graciously brought it to the barista's attention that we had, in fact, requested a large iced tea. Conflict resolution within a coffee shop setting is relatively straightforward; the cost of averting an argument and gratifying a patron far surpasses the cost of re-preparing their order. Nonetheless, the staff member who elected to display a defiant demeanor, insisted that we had paid for a regular drink, despite the expeditor's efforts to inform her otherwise, and then proceeded to walk away after presenting us with the incorrectly prepared tea, seems to hold a differing viewpoint. Therefore, it is imperative to thoroughly examine and verify your order upon checkout, as mistakes are unlikely to be rectified.

I have had the pleasure of frequenting this establishment on numerous occasions, and I must say that the culinary offerings and hospitality have consistently met, if not exceeded, my expectations. However, my most recent visit, which took place in the company of my spouse's colleagues, proved to be a notable exception to this rule. Upon being seated at one of the bar tables, we were greeted by a bartender named Bo, whose striking red hair was unfortunately matched by his brusque demeanor. Despite our intention to indulge in a more substantial meal, Bo insisted that we were obligated to order food, given that we had opted to occupy a table rather than a spot at the bar. Our initial reluctance to comply with this stipulation was further exacerbated by Bo's evident irritation at our decision to proceed with caution in terms of our order, as we opted to sample the fried oysters and avail ourselves of the happy hour specials on offer. As the evening progressed, Bo's behavior became increasingly erratic, vacillating between marked indifference and solicitousness, the latter manifesting itself primarily during the settlement of our bill, when a generous gratuity was proffered. Suffice it to say that while the edibles at this venue are undeniably palatable, the unfortunate interaction with Bo left a decidedly sour taste in my mouth, and I would counsel him to adopt a more convivial attitude towards patrons, lest he wishes to court further dissatisfaction and potential loss of clientele.

"The culinary offerings possessed a certain degree of palatability, however, upon partaking of the repast, I encountered an unfortunate presence within my sandwich, specifically, a human hair, which understandably engendered a profound sense of disillusionment and precluded me from completing my meal."

When my fiance dropped off ten items to be cleaned at the Gilbert location on Val Vista, he was quoted $4.25 per item. At pick up, the price had increased 20%. Not only that, a $300.00 shirt was spotted with grease. We will not be using this location again.

"My experience at this establishment during its initial stages was relatively satisfactory, specifically in regards to the musical offerings. However, upon returning a year later for my sister's bachelorette celebration, I encountered an unfortunate series of events. Following six months of meticulous planning, I opted for Tryst as the final destination for our Vegas excursion and contacted the management team a month in advance to secure a table. The manager assured me that there would be no issues and recorded my name. Interestingly, this was the first occasion wherein I arranged for a table at a bar without the requirement of a credit card, which seemed peculiar. Unfortunately, upon arriving with eight companions, we were informed at the entrance that our reservation was non-existent. Following a lengthy delay, the individual I had booked with eventually returned my call and offered an apology, which proved insufficient considering the circumstances. The consequences of their blunder were detrimental, as it not only confused eight individuals but also marred the evening for my sister, which remains distressing to contemplate. As I cannot rectify the situation, my trust in this venue has been irreparably damaged. Needless to say, I will not recommend it for future gatherings, such as my cousin's impending birthday festivities."

To the owners of NYW,

I have been here before and I know you're about equal too but NOT better than BASHA'S fine bakeries for half your prices...however...you read the parts on YELP reviews where people say, "the counter help is depressing"...(?)

...  and that's why I will never set foot into your 1950's dirty attempt to be a New York qualified establishment  in the respectful town of SUN CITY.

The OWNER, heavy female with glasses, mid 50's, has all kinds of issues with customer service and it figures the employees imitate her!!!!

New York...NO! 
Like with the PIZZA, give up the ruse.

"Uncertainty permeated the atmosphere regarding the culinary offerings presented at this dining establishment, particularly with regard to the authenticity of the barbecue, which, as a native Texan, I would not venture to classify as such, given the conspicuous absence of a profound smoky flavor profile in the pulled pork, further accentuated by the lack of a discernible bark, suggestive of abbreviated exposure to the smoker; additionally, the unconventional nature of the so-called 'brisket,' characterized by an unfamiliar cut and an unorthodox preparation method involving immersion in a brine solution, only served to heighten skepticism; regrettably, the sluggish pace of service did little to assuage concerns, with an interval of nearly sixty minutes elapsing on a Tuesday, ostensibly due to the precooked nature of the fare, which, in theory, should have facilitated a more expedient delivery; furthermore, the server, seemingly perturbed by the obligation to attend to a mere handful of patrons on a weekday, contributed to an overall experience that fell short of expectations and ultimately dissuaded me from pursuing future visits to this purported barbecue venue."

"By virtue of the fact that a solitary celestial body of luminosity is employed as a metaphorical benchmark for assessing the quality of a culinary establishment's frozen dessert offerings, it logically follows that an absence of such stellar references would be indicative of an uninspiring dining experience; specifically, a dearth of rich, velvety smoothness characterizes the texture of the frozen treat in question, while its frigid temperature belies a lack of flavorful substance, rendering it akin to a mere frozen liquid rather than a truly satisfying gustatory indulgence. Furthermore, the purported 'bottled water' served alongside said dessert is, in reality, nothing more than a reprehensible attempt at profiteering through the guise of repackaging a freely available resource as a premium product, thereby constituting an egregious example of fiscal exploitation."

I have been an ardent patron of Home Depot for an extensive period, and this specific store is, by a considerable margin, the most unsatisfactory one I have had the misfortune of visiting throughout the country. Having recently acquired a residence in the proximate vicinity, I have had the occasion to frequent this particular establishment numerous times over the past ten months, and my experiences have been utterly disheartening. The personnel exhibit a profound lack of expertise, helpfulness, and responsiveness, which is nothing short of appalling, to put it mildly.

The perplexing sequence of events transpired subsequent to my placing an online order, which culminated in the receipt of a burnt pizza and a soggy mess, ostensibly attributable to my selection of a thin crust and vegetarian options, as conveyed by the kitchen manager, who offered a pecuniary reimbursement, albeit belatedly, following my explicit request for an apology, which was initially met with feeble excuses rather than a sincere expression of regret.

"Following an exhaustive day on campus, I opted to procure sustenance via delivery, which resulted in a total expenditure of $13 for a gyro, fries, and a soda. Although I am not typically averse to compensating for a delectable culinary experience, the fries were merely lukewarm upon arrival, while the gyro proved to be merely satisfactory. Consequently, I did not obtain the gastronomical satisfaction that I had anticipated, and thus, I do not intend to revisit this establishment in the future."

"Well, well, well, it appears that we have encountered yet another instance of unacceptable customer service, my dear. It seems that a recent visit to a local automobile dealership resulted in a rather unfortunate encounter with a certain individual by the name of David Culp. Evidently, this person, who purports to be a manager, saw fit to adopt a rather condescending and boorish demeanor towards us, thereby creating an atmosphere of acrimony and discomfort. Furthermore, it appears that this same individual saw fit to impose a rather stringent set of criteria upon us, insisting that we commit to purchasing the vehicle in question prior to even being afforded the opportunity to lay eyes on it. Needless to say, such an approach struck us as being both unreasonable and unprofessional, and we therefore felt compelled to seek alternative arrangements. Suffice it to say, we shall not be returning to this establishment in the future, and we would advise others to exercise caution when dealing with such an individual."

I am not hasty in bestowing an unfavorable critique upon an eatery, particularly those of a diminutive stature and local provenance. However, my reluctance to disparage was utterly futile in the case of this particular establishment, as the experience was thoroughly unpleasant and conspicuously marred by a multitude of shortcomings. The staff's demeanor was discourteous and taciturn, bordering on the verge of incivility, while the culinary offerings vacillated between mediocrity and outright gastronomical disappointment. Furthermore, the menu boasted an option to tailor wraps to conform to vegan preferences, which I inquired about, only to be met with a flippant and dismissive response from the server. When questioned regarding the absence of vegan alternatives, he retorted with an air of incredulity, "Fake meat? No," thereby betraying a glaring lack of comprehension and regard for dietary diversity. This interaction not only offended me, a non-vegan individual, but also underscored the restaurant's disingenuous attempt to project an image of inclusivity and accommodation, all the while openly ridiculing the very dietary preference they purported to support. In conclusion, my experience at this establishment was decidedly unsatisfactory, and I would not recommend it to anyone seeking a pleasant dining experience.

"Epitome of 'Ghetto'. 

In the event that you intend to lodge here, kindly refrain from harboring elevated expectations. It would be prudent to exercise skepticism regarding the notion that this lodging establishment purports to offer five-star accommodations; such an assertion is, put mildly, dubious. Do not anticipate the presence of a flat-screen television or the prospect of having your bed linens altered regularly! The ambiance of this establishment harkens back to a bygone era, specifically the 1970s. The dimensions of the sleeping quarters are diminutive, and this characteristic is not exclusive to the rooms themselves, as the furnishings and appointments within them are similarly Lilliputian. The slumber-inducing qualities of the beds are subpar, to say the least; indeed, it is not uncommon for guests to awaken with back pain, which is hardly surprising given the inferior quality of the mattresses. The management and staff of this hotel manifest a callous indifference toward their patrons, so any hopes of receiving exceptional service are likely to be dashed. The buffet offered by this establishment is lackluster, and the cost, $29.99 plus tax, is hardly justified by the quality of the fare provided. Moreover, internet access is limited to a single computer via a telephone line, and additional devices will incur an extra fee. The pool area is minuscule and appears somewhat unclean, while the gaming facilities, in comparison to those of other hotels, are paltry and lacking in variety, thereby necessitating excursions outdoors. 

The sole redeeming feature of this hotel is its location, situated as it is in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip, making it an optimal choice for individuals who relish nocturnal revelry and are unfazed by the prospect of sacrificing sleep."

"It would appear that the present moment may necessitate the termination of our association with Time Warner and Road Runner, as we have been deprived of email services since the early morning hours and have yet to receive a definitive response regarding the resolution of their technical difficulties. It has become a recurring phenomenon for me to engage in telephonic communications on a weekly basis, seeking clarification regarding issues pertaining to email and/or internet connectivity. Unfortunately, my experiences with TWC have been utterly unsatisfactory and marred by unreliability, prompting me to consider alternative options after a fifteen-year tenure."

Last evening, we went to an event here and I had purchased 5 tickets through groupon. I admittedly made the mistake of buying one for the wrong date for my child for a circus. I called once I noticed the mistake and was told I would have to purchase another one. I asked if the general manager( their boss) could call me back ( she never did.) Then when we arrived at the event they again said we would have to buy another ticket and at that point the general manager stepped in.  I asked why I had to pay again when they had already gotten paid for the ticket and that the event was over 1/4 unsold so they clearly had extra tickets!!!! ISN'T THAT STEALING PEOPLES MONEY!!!! THIS PLACE HAS EXTREMELY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE, ESPECIALLY CONSIDERING IT WAS A TICKET FOR A CHILD FOR A CIRCUS!!!!!

"Excrement. Subpar service. Inadequate personnel. Encountered an problematic situation approximately four weeks prior, which ultimately culminated in a brief yet unpleasant interaction with an individual whose comportment and demeanor were utterly reprehensible and, quite frankly, intolerable. It is worth noting that the gentleman in question, who shall remain nameless, bore a striking resemblance to a certain Mr. Corona, although one cannot be entirely certain given the dearth of information at hand."

"The morning repast we partook of was utterly unimpressive. My spouse's breakfast sandwich was merely passable, whereas my egg burrito was an unmitigated disaster. The eggs were severely overcooked, possessing an unpleasant, rubbery texture that bordered on the inedible. It is truly perplexing how such a simple dish could be so drastically misprepared. Furthermore, the service we received was woefully inadequate. Our server seemed to be entirely oblivious to the menu's offerings, compelling us to summon his attention repeatedly for additional coffee. Moreover, a dash of congeniality or even a modicum of cordiality would have been greatly appreciated from this individual."

My daughter and I ate sushi there last Friday night and came down with a terrible case of salmonella food poisoning!!!  This place needs to close ASAP!!!\n\nYOU risk your life if you EAT THERE!!!  BEWARE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This establishment fails to meet expectations, as evidenced by the prolonged waiting period of an hour and a half to gain admittance to the lounge area, which we were advised to avoid. Furthermore, upon being seated at a table that was not properly sanitized, we were neglected for a duration of 15 minutes, prompting us to depart and never return.

After perusing a few critiques, I presumed that this pizzeria would be a suitable selection, but my expectations were utterly confounded. I placed an order for a 14-inch pie adorned with fresh tomatoes, in addition to a Greek salad. Unfortunately, the pizza was remarkably insipid, devoid of any discernible flavor! The salad, too, was uninspiring and lacking in texture, rendering it impossible for me to relish it. In conclusion, I would not advocate this establishment to anyone, nor would I consider returning.

Filiberto food with high restaurant prices. Tried it once before and thought maybe I got something bad. But I was wrong. This is just average mexican good posing as fine food. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for good Mexican food. I would recommend restaurant Mexico on mill if you want great Mexican food that doesn't try to church up it's prices

Was excited to try this place because it had great reviews. However, we were really unimpressed. First of all the waitresses argued over which one was actually going to wait on us, after we had already been waiting for quiet sometime. The waitress barely understood basic English. My husband ordered no beans with his meal and I got no beans with mine which I wanted. My husband said his chicken enchiladas tasted like chicken from a can. I wasn't impressed with my meal as well. We ordered fried ice cream for Desert and it wasn't good at all the ice cream was hard as a rock and couldn't even spoon it apart. Don't think we will be returning.

"The culinary excellence of the fries remains unparalleled; however, a perceptible decline in the establishment's overall cleanliness has become increasingly evident, with an unfortunate resemblance to the ambiance of a Chinese buffet now apparent, which may be attributed, in part, to the frequent turnover in management staff that has occurred since the venue's inception."

"The culinary offerings at this establishment exhibited a flavor profile reminiscent of reheated microwave fare, with the exception of the complementary tortilla chips and salsa which demonstrated a modicum of gastronomical merit. Alas, the principal dishes lacked any discernible gustatory characteristics, yet still managed to induce an unpleasant sensation in my stomach several hours later, perhaps due to the utilization of non-fresh ingredients. As a lifelong consumer of Mexican cuisine, I must categorize this experience as a resounding disappointment."

I endeavored to facilitate the process of fueling my vehicle at one of the designated dispensaries, but unfortunately, the apparatus was not functioning properly. Following my notification to the attendant, I received an initial dismissive response, which was subsequently replaced by a suggestion that the machine required resetting to prevent any further unauthorized transactions on my card. However, upon expressing my reluctance to incur any unintended expenses, the attendant became agitated and began vociferously berating me, implying that she bore no responsibility for extraneous purchases made with my card and even went so far as to suggest that I might consider patronizing an alternative fueling station in the future. This unpleasant encounter was further exacerbated by the attendant's continued grumbling and display of discontent towards me, which drew the attention of nearby patrons. Ultimately, I left feeling thoroughly dissatisfied with the service I received and would unequivocally rate this experience as the most unpleasant I have had the misfortune of enduring at a gas station.

The broth is weak and there's a funny taste in the meatballs. The one on rainbow used to be one of my favorites. The food quality and flavor have really slipped with the expansion. Much better Pho one block either way.

"Although I am cognizant of the potential futility of expressing my personal opinions regarding the culinary offerings of PF Chang's, I nonetheless feel compelled to convey my experiences in order to discharge my perceived civic responsibility to alert any individuals who may still harbor the misconception that this establishment serves authentic Chinese cuisine. It is, in fact, a fusion of various culinary traditions, with a pronounced emphasis on Americanized flavors and preparation methods. Furthermore, I must caution that my encounters with PF Chang's have been consistently associated with an unfortunate gastrointestinal consequence, which I have come to attribute, perhaps unfairly, to the restaurant's culinary practices. Despite my recurring attempts to assess my tolerance for their fare, PF Chang's has reliably defeated my digestive system, eliciting an unwavering response that I have come to regard as a personal affront."

This eatery is a catastrophe!  The cost does not mirror the inferior quality of the edibles.  I requested the rib eye steak and it was extremely lean, coarse, and overcooked and it was topped with a sauce that failed to enhance the remainder of the meal.  The steak was no better than what one might receive at Denny's at two o'clock in the morning.  This establishment is drastically overpriced and the culinary offerings are subpar.  Todd English must reassess the trajectory of Olives.  I experienced similar sentiments during my initial visit and opted not to voice my concerns; however, following my second dining experience at the restaurant, I could not allow my dissatisfaction with the cuisine to go unacknowledged.  The public must be aware that this restaurant is an exorbitant scam.  If one desires palatable fare, they should patronize BOAS or the Stratosphere instead.
I think this place has closed. Couldn't find it and ended up at Cheeba Hut. I think it was in the same strip mall?? Cheeba Hut was great though!

After experiencing a regrettable gastrointestinal incident attributable to the ingestion of a subpar iteration of Mongolian Beef at this very eatery, it is my conviction that any subsequent interaction with this culinary establishment should be deliberately avoided to preclude the possibility of recurrent gastric discomfort.

Pamela's constitutes an egregious affront to the concept of a respectable breakfast establishment, representing the antithesis of culinary excellence in every conceivable aspect. Despite the questionable quality of the fare, patrons are subjected to an interminable waiting period of twenty minutes, followed by a dining experience characterized by cramped and uncomfortable seating arrangements. For reasons that defy comprehension, this restaurant enjoys immense popularity, ostensibly due to the presence of a singular item on the menu: a crepe-like pancake offering a satisfying crispness on the edges, albeit achieved through the utilization of a highly suspect, margarine-like substance that invariably leaves this author feeling somewhat nauseated. The coffee served is unremarkable, the eggs are merely adequate, the bacon is inexcusably chewy, and the lyonnaise potatoes are reprehensibly limp, with the latter two items suffering from an excessive absorption of the aforementioned artificial spread. In light of these circumstances, it is strongly advised that individuals seek alternative dining options, such as Coca CafÃ© or Square CafÃ© for a more refined experience, or DeLuca's or JoJo's for a more casual, unpretentious meal. Indeed, this writer would readily opt for the uninspired, institutional offerings of Eat 'n Park over the gastronomic monstrosity that is Pamela's. At least the former establishment has acquainted itself with the concept of butter.

You had to pay $15 per day for Internet access.  The beds were uncomfortable.  The room keys did not work in the parking garage even though they claimed to fix them twice.  The bar us hideously overpriced.

Want a sode in the middle of the night?  Gotta buy it from the gift store before it closes.  1 coke = $300.  

I will NEVER be back.

No no no no no. NO!
Saw this with my friends on Saturday (5/31/14). We decided it would be fun to see a traditional Vegas showgirl performance, and, well, Jubilee! is apparently the only one left.

Lack of competition should be no excuse for the mess that we saw. Oh Lord!
First of all, we bought discount tickets and my friends each said that the show wasn't even worth the 50% markdown. I didn't mind as much, because I was intoxicated and at least got a good laugh.

This review is not a criticism of the talent. Most of the performers were fit and good at what they did, although there were a few outliers... 

There were a few scenes that had all the pomp and circumstance that I expected, like the Samson and Delilah scene... and the finale.

But overall there were waaaay too many males onstage (is that normal? Idk but it was unexpected), and it was SO SO disjointed. The show was just a thrown together mess of scenes- all over the place chronologically, not enough showgirl stuff, and some of the most God-awful music.

The classic recognizable songs were okay, but often matched to boring and redundant choreography.  The Beyonce references were random and irrelevant, which is sad because I am a Beyonce fan.

All in all, it was very much a middle-school caliber show in terms of plot/theme/cohesiveness, which is not Vegas-appropriate, to say the least.

I sincerely hope someone steps in and fixes this mess because it would be SO sad if the showgirl went extinct! Help!

We experienced an unfortunate sequence of events during our visit, as we were informed that the establishment had depleted the necessary components to prepare their signature breakfast sandwich, which was the primary reason for our visit, at an unusually early hour on a Saturday. Furthermore, the children's menu was limited to a single unimpressive pancake accompanied by a beverage, priced at $4.99. Our order took an unacceptable 45 minutes to arrive, and the server made a half-hearted apology after a 30-minute delay, citing a sizable gathering in the rear dining area that was only just concluding. Upon inquiring about altering my order, the server failed to respond and instead, indulged in a prolonged conversation with a group of acquaintances who had entered the establishment, ignoring my visible discontent. Eventually, she reluctantly confirmed that my order had indeed been initiated, much to my relief. The entire experience was thoroughly unremarkable, and we have no intention of returning.

"Despicable practices are ubiquitous at International Marketplace, where they flagrantly manipulate and fabricate expiration dates on select comestible items, an egregious offense that warrants unqualified condemnation. When I brought this issue to their attention, they were utterly dumbfounded, rendered speechless by my revelation that the expiration date sticker I had removed from the product revealed its true, albeit expired, state. Their customer service, or lack thereof, is utterly deplorable, a travesty that defies comprehension. Furthermore, the Filipino section of their store is rife with expired snacks, devoid of any semblance of an expiration date, a reprehensible oversight that jeopardizes consumer safety."

Just came back from there, and was pretty disappointed. 

The inside dining area was a wreck (dirty tables, food on the floor, table side order phones out of order, etc).  They weren't particularly busy, and several employees were hanging around talking to one another.

My food came out relatively quickly, but was not complete, and even after alerting them of this and waiting on them, I had to remind them five minutes later to give me my missing items, at which point they seemed even more confused. 

To top it off, the restroom was filthy and there were no paper towels, and I even saw an employee go in and use the restroom, and come out without remedying the situation...hope he at least washed his hands :/
Given the state of this place, I have to wonder. 

I want to like this place, but it scored an F on this visit.  
Fast food doesn't have to be messy, crummy, and lacking in service...just look at chick-fil-a.

"Subs are acceptable. Slightly superior to Subway, yet priced significantly higher. However, here's the rationale behind their mediocre rating: I paid $30 for three adults and a child, which, while somewhat steep, was tolerable. I didn't leave a gratuity since I didn't believe it was necessary. The individual who processed my payment (or another staff member) seemed to disagree, as evidenced by the appearance of an initial authorization for $30 and a final charge of $33 on my bank statement. They effectively awarded themselves a $3 tip without obtaining my consent. Following my submission of a message through their platform approximately seven hours ago, I have yet to receive a response."

I'm absolutely APPALLED at this Taco Bell! I used to actually frequent it rather often, but went on a bit of a fast food hiatus. I had a craving for Taco Bell and thought, "why not?"

Oh, I found out "why not" in short order! First- the wait at the drive through was kind of ridiculous. Not just sitting in the line of cars, but once I'd placed my order, I sat at the window for quite awhile waiting for the food to be ready. When you're hungry and in a hurry, that's not the best thing. It is called "fast food" for a reason, right? Apparently not here.

Ok, food obtained. I get home, get settled, and go to open the mini chicken quesadilla. WHAT THE HELL IS THIS? First of all, the cheese is so melted that I can barely unrwrap the aluminum foil. Once I do get it open...my stomach lurched. The pile of BURNED, gooey, mess that is in the foil is absolutely disgusting. I can't believe that anyone thought it was a good idea to pass this off as food and serve it to anyone. I took (and posted) a picture, but it went straight into the garbage.

The chalupa was luckily in good shape, and the only reason this wouldn't get a ZERO star review. (other than the fact that we can't award zero stars here).  Obviously, I won't be returning.

"This establishment, situated in the confines of Terminal 4 B gates, boasts an impressive magnitude, surpassing its contemporaries in terms of both size and aesthetic appeal. The conspicuous porcine effigy adorning the wall, complemented by a retro-inspired typography, endeavors to counteract the ubiquitous and unavoidable ambiance associated with airport food courts. 

The hospitable demeanor of the waiting staff and the expedient manner in which they attended to our needs did little to assuage our disappointment with the culinary offerings. A grilled cheese sandwich, lacking in flavorful distinction, was accompanied by a tomato soup that bordered on excessive saltiness, reminiscent of a canned variety. A subsequent request for coffee, intended to provide a modicum of warmth, arrived at our table in a state of lukewarmth, prompting skepticism regarding the authenticity of the service we received. 

Despite the aforementioned shortcomings, the memory of this dining experience shall linger, serving as a cautionary tale against patronizing this particular establishment during future travels to Las Vegas via the corresponding airport."

I wouldn't stay here again, ever. I was in town for a technology conference and the Internet didn't work in the conference area or in the rooms. It was very spotty wireless and wired. The room decor  was very dated. But here's the worst: First morning my sinks back up while shaving. One sink backed up with my water and the other backed up simultaneously with a black smelly liquid. I also complained about the lack of seal at the bottom of the connecting door between my suite and the one next door. I could hear everything in that room like it was happening in mine. (Imagine that) I insisted on being moved to a new room. In the new room on my last morning... I hear a gurgling noise and then smell something foul. I walk into the bathroom to see black liquid coming up through the shower drain. I reported it on check out and they didn't seem to care. Any other hotel would have tried to make it right. Not these guy... Harrahs should be ashamed of this property.

I've stayed at most of the hotels on the strip, but Bally's has been one of the worst hotels I've been in.

- It's the oldest looking with air bubble filled wall paper and crusty chipped paint. 
- They try to charge you $16 if you checkin before 4pm.
- All the other hotels always had toothpaste and other amenities, Bally's doesn't
- Furniture is from the 80's

The regular room at Palms Place makes the Suites at Bally's look like a joke.

"An ambiance reminiscent of the 1950's, albeit somewhat tainted by the pervasive cacophony, permeated the establishment. A morning repast comprising of eggs, ham, and what was purported to be 'home fries,' but in reality, were merely frozen potatoes procured from a bag, was devoured. The accompanying biscuits, also of a frozen variety, left much to be desired in terms of both taste and texture. The service, while not exceptional, was adequate enough to meet the needs of the patrons, who primarily consisted of an older demographic, specifically those above the age of seventy."

Worse service, we had a bday there and the boss didn't even let us fridge the bday cake says it can be contaminated, but yet any other restaurant would've done it for us, the food was not good, we got the salmon and it literally tasted like they just added soy sauce to it, my friend ordered the glazed salmon and it tasted bad for her as well.  The only part that we might have liked was the appetizer fish sushi, not recommended and definitely my first and last time there, last but not least the bill came out to 800!! I could've had better food and service at Mcds

This establishment has a profoundly detrimental impact on my emotional wellbeing; it truly does. I became enamored with a particularly forlorn feline juvenile during my visit, and upon extending my hand through the metallic barrier to offer a gentle stroke, I was taken aback by its emaciated physique. Despite my preexisting multifeline household, I was resolute in my determination to liberate this diminutive creature from its unfortunate circumstances, as I harbored grave doubts regarding its ability to survive another week in its present state.

Upon inquiring about the price of the kitten, I was taken aback by the exorbitant sum of $899.99, particularly given the animal's dubious health and questionable lineage. It is utterly reprehensible that such a sickly specimen would be offered for sale, and I am deeply disturbed by the notion that it may still be languishing in its squalid environs.

My concern for the welfare of this unfortunate creature is further compounded by the melancholy appearance of the canine denizens of the establishment, whose living quarters appeared decidedly unsanitary. A solitary bright spot in this dismal experience was the avian caretaker, whose fervent dedication to his feathered charges was patently evident. It is my ardent hope that additional personnel possessing similar qualities of compassion and expertise will be engaged to alleviate the manifest suffering of the animals housed within this facility.
Waited for an hour during lunch. They took my order, waited forever, and ended up having to leave without eating because I needed to get back to work.

I was present at the location in question during the late afternoon hours of December 31, at which time an unidentified individual utilized a sharp instrument to inflict damage upon the lateral surface of my automobile, as well as the posterior panel, resulting in a total of $1200 in pecuniary loss; furthermore, I did not receive a formal apology from the manager of Harkins, necessitating my composition of a missive to elicit a token of contrition.

"I have had the pleasure of partaking in culinary indulgences at an array of establishments specializing in waffles, thus I possess a certain level of familiarity with the standards of quality associated with such dining experiences. However, it is unfortunate that my expectations were not entirely met during my visit to this particular waffle house. While the quality of the edibles was satisfactory, the service left much to be desired. Specifically, it took an unacceptable amount of time for an employee to take our beverage orders, and the table was not adequately cleaned prior to our seating. Furthermore, I observed multiple employees engaging in unprofessional behavior, including the use of personal electronic devices while preparing food and consuming beverages in close proximity to the food being prepared. Although I acknowledge that this establishment may not be the most luxurious, I expected a higher standard of conduct from its staff."

"The culinary experience was satisfactory, however, the hospitality was subpar. Our server's interactions were limited to a meager ten words, and her demeanor conveyed a lack of enthusiasm for her occupation. Notwithstanding, the manager's presence was conspicuous, as he traversed the dining area without pausing to inquire about our satisfaction with the victuals. My request for an iced tea was fulfilled with a solitary glass, which remained unreplenished despite the owner/manager's observance of its emptiness during two separate passages. The waitress delivered the comestibles, disregarding the vacant glass, and the busser, who traversed our table thrice, failed to proffer additional refreshment. I was compelled to solicit her attention for a subsequent serving. A dinner coupon, stipulating a 20% gratuity, was presented, resulting in a paltry $17.00 remuneration for the server, considering the abysmal quality of service. Disappointment was the sentiment evoked, and a vow to avoid future patronage was resolutely uttered. The eatery would benefit from a modernizing renovation, as its present ambiance exudes an antiquated character. Preserve your financial resources and seek alternative dining establishments."

If you are seeking an unparalleled dining experience that embodies the essence of mediocrity, then look no further than Diablos, where the culinary offerings are reminiscent of a novice chef's futile attempt at creating a semblance of Mexican cuisine. Tragically, the fare served at this establishment is tantamount to an insult to the rich gastronomic heritage of Mexico, with dishes that are seemingly concocted by an individual who has never ventured beyond the confines of their own kitchen.

The ambiance, too, is an affront to the senses, with a decor that appears to be the result of a haphazard assortment of items procured from a local thrift store. The lighting is dim, casting an eerie pallor upon the already unappetizing victuals, while the soundtrack, a cacophony of clashing notes, serves only to exacerbate the overall feeling of discomfort.

My visit occurred during the so-called "happy hour," a time when one might expect a modicum of festivity or, at the very least, a cursory attempt at creating a convivial atmosphere. Alas, such expectations are swiftly dashed upon entering the premises, as the staff, seemingly apathetic to the presence of patrons, display a marked indifference to the notion of customer service.

My order, a pitcher of mango margaritas, was prepared with all the finesse of a novice bartender, utilizing canned kerns nectar and house tequila, rather than the promised premium tequila listed on the menu. The end result was a drink that could charitably be described as "inadequate."

The nachos, too, were an unmitigated disappointment, resembling as they did two-hour-old leftovers from a gas station convenience store. The taco platter, my main course, was an unfortunate concatenation of flavors, each one more bland than the last, resulting in a culinary experience that was utterly devoid of even a hint of pleasure.

In conclusion, I would strongly advise against patronizing this establishment, unless, of course, one's sole criterion for dining out is the ability to consume subpar liquor in copious quantities while enduring reprehensible customer service and an atmosphere that can only be described as "dismal."

Awful service.  Did not get my full order going thru drive thru.  Realized it after I got home.  Drove back and went inside to complain.  The guy actually tied handing me the bag of food that he forgot to give me after it had been sitting there for 20 minutes.  Asked for a refund for compensation, but they refused!

Before I actually set down and ate I had been feeling pretty pleased with myself.  I saw the huge line, I smelled the delicious smells of French fried potatoes and I also observed all the literature on display about all the awards that Five Guys had won for their famous burgers and fries.  I knew for sure that I would be well fed. Yes, that of course was before I actually took the first bite of my burger.  My dream quickly turned into a nightmare.  My bun was wet with perspiration.  My hamburger had a chunk broken off it and was smashed to smithereens and the cheese on my sandwich was cold.  Another swing and a miss for me and Oakland dining.  How many guys does it take to ruin a lunch 5 hahahaha?

"I am utterly perplexed by the prevalence of five-star reviews bestowed upon this establishment, unless, of course, the proprietor is the sole practitioner that these patrons have had the pleasure of visiting. In my personal experience, I engaged in four sessions with the artist, and to my utter dismay, my tattoo failed to exhibit any signs of fading. In contrast, I visited another artisan twice, and the results were nothing short of astounding, with a significant reduction in the vibrancy of my body art. However, I had purchased a Groupon for this particular location, entitling me to four sessions. During my maiden visit, I queried the artist regarding the brevity of the treatment, to which he responded by feebly attempting to cover my tattoo with an uninspired flourish, akin to a child aimlessly scribbling on a piece of paper. Needless to say, my tattoo remained completely intact, sans any evidence of scabbing or fading. Throughout the ensuing three sessions, I implored the artist to adopt a more forceful approach, but my entreaties fell upon deaf ears, as the outcome remained unchanged. It is conceivable that the artist's lackadaisical attitude towards his craft may be attributed to the fact that I held a Groupon; if such is the case, then it stands to reason that he is culpable of squandering both the clients' time and financial resources. My sincere apologies for the negative critique, but I feel compelled to caution potential patrons against investing their hopes and funds in this establishment."

5 years ago when I lived in this area I love the Montana Meat Company.  Sadly, that has changed.  I have dined there twice within the last month and it seems everything has gone south.  Food quality, food portions, service, speed, friendliness... all have grossly deteriorated.  Montana Meat Company is now on my personal list of \"never again's\", which is not an easy task to accomplish.  If you are in the area and looking for a decent steak there are few options, other than Giuseppe's on the weekends or the Summerlin venues which are a bit further of a drive.

This was just bad pizza.  For the money I expect that the toppings will be cooked on the pizza.  The cheese and pepparoni were added after the crust came out.  Also the mushrooms were out of a can.  Do not waste money here.

"Upon conveying my urgency to the representatives of Purrfect Auto, I was assured that my vehicle would be attended to forthwith. In light of this assurance, I opted to await the completion of the necessary procedures, anticipating the prompt resolution of the issue that had brought me to their establishment in the first place. However, as the minutes ticked by, my automobile remained stationary outside the garage, with no signs of impending servicing. My ire began to rise, yet I chose to persist in my vigil, trusting that the promised attention would soon be bestowed upon my vehicle. After an additional ten-minute interval, I approached the mechanic who had been observed scrutinizing my car while annotating his clipboard, and reiterated my initial assertion of haste. He responded by offering an assurance akin to 'We are diligently working on your conveyance, my good fellow. It shall be expedited forthwith.' I refrained from vocalizing my skepticism and elected to continue waiting, only to find that my car remained untouched even after a further ten-minute period had elapsed. Succumbing to frustration, I decided to abort my visit to Purrfect Auto and seek assistance elsewhere, vowing never to return to their facility again."

"To all those individuals who opt to become members of Planet Fitness, it is imperative that they peruse their contractual agreements with utmost diligence, for it is stipulated within the aforementioned documents that upon reaching the culmination of a one-year period, said contract will automatically renew on a month-to-month basis, thereby necessitating a comprehensive understanding of its contents lest one desires to avoid any unforeseen repercussions."
I'm all about the tiki thing and the patio but this place is just trashy. It's obvious that this is first on the list for every guy who just turned 21. Everything had a thin layer of barf on it.

"It is my conviction that McDonald's culinary offerings have diminished in both quantity and quality, prompting me to express my displeasure by stating 'yuck' emphatically. My sentiment stems from a recent visit during which I opted to sample the McRib, motivated by a wave of nostalgia owing to its temporary availability. However, my gastronomical experience proved to be an unfortunate blunder, as the taste and texture of the dish failed to meet my expectations, inducing nausea by the third bite. It is my belief that the subpar quality of McDonald's fare, coupled with the fact that it is no longer affordable, raises questions about the sustainability of the business model. Furthermore, I ponder whether establishments serving superior cuisine must feature a drive-thru option, given that contemporary society appears to prioritize convenience over the quality of sustenance, leading individuals to consume unpalatable dishes without leaving the comfort of their vehicles."

I found a half-foot strand of thick hair in my Pho Dac Biet. I give props to the waiter for not apologizing and keeping a smile on his face the whole time there. Also accompanied by noisy waiters, dull atmosphere, and crappy foreign music, I could not stay a second longer. If you're a tourist reading this review, let Vietnamese wait until you get home. There are better ways to spend your money in Vegas and gambling is one of them.

It hurts me to give The Bellagio Buffet 1 star, but the food was absolutely horrible. If my husband says the food was bad then it was bad. I had to ask for a fork 3 times because every fork I received was dirty with either dried food and soap scum! The rotisserie chicken was drier than a sponge, the homemade mashed potatoes taste like they were made with spoiled milk and the beef brisket looked like a patio desk, it was completely dried out. 

For $49 at The Bellagio, I expected mouth watering selections and got the total opposite. So if you're hungry and don't care about the taste and it's convenient, then enjoy, but I just wasted $50. 

Oh and no Crab Legs until 3:30pm and no creme brûlée, I'm SO done. The buffet at The Paris hotel tasted MUCH better than The Bellagio. Only gave this review one star because I had to and that goes to the poor waitress Cici! Thanks for a HORRIBLE last meal in Vegas. I won't be back and I do NOT recommend.

"The dining experience was utterly disappointing, characterized by an absence of courteous and attentive service. Specifically, upon requesting additional sauce for my meal, it took an unacceptable 15 minutes to arrive, and only then did I receive it, well after I had completed my meal. Furthermore, I was not informed prior to receiving the bill that there would be an additional $1.50 charge for the sauce, which I found to be quite perturbing. It is imperative that establishments clearly communicate any supplementary charges in a timely manner, so as to avoid unexpected and unwelcome surprises. Moreover, the culinary offerings were excessively salted, and my repeated requests for more water went unanswered, despite the presence of five adults and two children at the table. To add insult to injury, a mandatory 20% gratuity was tacked onto our bill, which I deemed to be patently unfair, given the glaring lack of attentive and responsive service. In light of these numerous deficiencies, I am unequivocal in my decision never to return to this establishment again."

"Utterly unimpressed, I opted to sample the culinary offerings of the hotel's eatery on this particular occasion. Unfortunately, the delay in receiving my meal was a whopping 40 minutes, which seemed interminable, and the flavor of the pasta sauce was akin to that of a store-bought variety, lacking the richness and depth one would expect from a purportedly high-end establishment. In fact, I could have easily prepared a superior meal in the comfort of my own room using the hotel's microwave facilities."
