We were thoroughly disillusioned with our dining experience, despite the favorable yelp reviews that had raised our expectations. My dinner companion and I opted for the premium rare bone-in filet, in addition to a diverse selection of appetizers. Unfortunately, the initial steak was drastically overcooked to an extent that rendered it inedible, necessitating its return to the kitchen. Upon its replacement, we were presented with a second steak that, although cooked to the correct temperature, was marred by an abundance of fatty gristle dispersed throughout the cut. When I inquired about the quality of the meat, I was met with a defensive and dismissive response from the chef, who seemed to take umbrage at my decision to reject the first steak. The unfortunate implication was that the inferior quality of the second steak was a deliberate attempt on the part of the chef to compromise our dining experience, motivated by a desire to demonstrate his indignation at our initial rejection. Disappointingly, the steak failed to meet the high standards that one would reasonably expect for a meal priced at $83, and the unsatisfactory dining experience left much to be desired.

Horrible how the hell do you lose my package when I'm less then 10 mins away from your facility? Also the driver marked it was delivered twice for some reason. I wasted a whole day with these people and the weren't even sure if the driver even dropped it off at all and supposed the driver lost it. After a 2 minute call with Amazon they were very familiar with OnTrac's inconsistencies and gave me an instant refund. They ruined my first and last Amazon experience. Looks like I'm going back to eBay and ups.

From the instant we stepped foot within the confines of the edifice, it became patently evident that our decision to dine at this establishment was an egregious error in judgment. The juvenile personnel, who were ostensibly tasked with providing hospitable services to patrons, exhibited a flagrant lack of concern for their responsibilities, thereby creating an atmosphere of utter indifference. Furthermore, the menu offered a meager selection of culinary options, and the quality of the fare served was, at best, mediocre.

This critique pertains exclusively to the culinary offerings and beverages served on the outdoor terrace. The panoramic vista is undoubtedly breathtaking; regrettably, the fare and potables failed to impress. Having previously been employed at this establishment during the latter part of the 1980s, I must confess that the kitchen's unhygienic state left an indelible impression, rendering me reluctant to partake of their cuisine ever againâdespite its former excellence. Recently, while en route to my mother's residence, which lies in close proximity to this resort, we decided to give their patio dining a chance. Unfortunately, the quality of the food leaves much to be desired, raising questions about the kitchen's current level of cleanliness, although one would certainly hope for improvement in this regard.

My spouse consumed a meal at LoLo's, brought back a culinary experience for my personal satisfaction, specifically a poultry-based dinner. Unfortunately, the avian component of the dish was deficient in moisture and suffered from an excessive thermal treatment, resulting in a lack of flavorfulness. Furthermore, this particular gastronomical offering did not possess a sufficient cost-to-quality ratio, considering the pecuniary investment required to acquire it.

"If you presume scheduling an appointment will preclude you from waiting, you are sadly mistaken. This salon's proximity to my domicile has led me to frequent it on multiple occasions, with each visit yielding a subpar experience. Absent being the initial patron through the doors in the morning, anticipate a protracted wait. Indeed, having an appointment may even prolong your wait, as the proprietors tend to underestimate the duration of their delays. It is particularly vexing when they assure you that your wait will be merely a 'few minutes,' yet the actual delay extends upwards of 40 minutes. My most recent visit exemplified this phenomenon, wherein my 1:00 PM appointment translated into a 1:40 PM actualization. Upon inquiring about the extent of the delay, the male proprietor repeatedly offered the same dismissive response: 'a few minutes.' In offering constructive feedback regarding the importance of accuracy in estimating wait times, I suggested that such information would enable patrons to effectively manage their time, perhaps by running errands or returning at a later hour. However, the proprietor retorted that if I were dissatisfied with their service, I was free to seek alternatives, as their establishment enjoyed ample clientele. Furthermore, considering my generous gratuities, I was taken aback by the proprietor's curt demeanor. The combination of the salon's consistent tardiness, coupled with the subpar quality of their gel polish and pedicures, led me to question the efficacy of my efforts to support this local business. Ultimately, I shall not return."

I will not succumb to the temptation of revisiting this particular Burger King establishment, ever! As a novice customer, one would anticipate a heightened level of quality and attention to detail, yet my experience was marred by an egregious oversight - the absence of fries accompanying my meal order. Furthermore, when the fries did arrive, their questionable freshness and unpleasant texture, reminiscent of cardboard, only served to exacerbate my disappointment. It is worth mentioning that the two sandwiches I had the misfortune of consuming were equally underwhelming, their taste eerily reminiscent of those pedestrian offerings found at a convenience store. Suffice it to say, my expectations were not merely unfulfilled but utterly decimated by this location's subpar culinary offerings. My patronage shall not be bestowed upon this establishment again.

"Caesars Entertainment's 'Bait and Switch' 2 for 1 promotional cards are being distributed in a manner that reeks of desperation, indicative of a struggling business model. My recent visit to one of their establishments was marred by an encounter with the most discourteous and belligerent bartender I have had the displeasure of encountering in my lifetime. The preferential treatment accorded to other patrons, at the expense of my own comfort and convenience, was nothing short of appalling. As a loyal Caesars Seven Stars member, I have never felt more unwelcome in a place of business. My experience was so unsettling that it compelled me to pen a negative review, a rarity for me, as I typically reserve praise for establishments that provide excellent service. Given the writing on the wall, I would wager that Fizz will meet its demise within a year."

I would not advocate visiting this establishment due to the subpar culinary offerings and inadequate customer service. Besides the fries, which were palatable, the remaining items on my plate failed to impress. Our server, who demonstrated forgetfulness in fulfilling our beverage requests, ultimately brought them to us, albeit with an unsettling substance floating within one of them.

Bad. Very bad. I had to walk down 16 flights of stairs yesterday with my luggage. Our toilet didn't work our lights didn't work. And we got stuck in handicap room when all i wanted was a bathtub. \n\nWe waiting to \"complain\" but the lines were FOREVER long. Just don't go here, avoid at all costs.

"The Skinny: A brief synopsis of our experience reveals a perturbing encounter with impolite personnel. \n\nThe Fat: Making a hasty halt at this shopping center, we were initially optimistic about its potential, given its seemingly adequate appearance. Alas, our expectations were quickly dashed by the discourteous behavior of the staff, leading us to deduce that even in the midst of Arizona's arid landscape, such unpleasantness was undeserving of anything more than a solitary celestial body."

"The culinary offerings were satisfactory, and the iced coffee was also palatable, albeit the establishment seemed reluctant to provide an adequate amount of the beverage, as evidenced by the initial visit, during which a standard-sized iced coffee was received, only to discover that it was essentially a container filled primarily with ice, though its flavor was indeed enjoyable, thereby prompting a return visit the following day, at which time a second iced coffee was requested, this time with a specific request for reduced ice content; however, upon receipt of the beverage, it was observed that the cup was merely three-quarters full, leading to a sarcastic inquiry directed towards the cashier regarding the seemingly deliberate lack of fulfillment in terms of volume, to which the cashier responded somewhat dismissively, stating that the request for less ice had been accommodated, ultimately resulting in disappointment and a desire to seek alternative venues offering superior quality iced coffee."

Have Big O Bigfoots all around on my truck.  One on the rear came apart on the freeway, the entire tread came off and damaged the rear wheel well and quarter panel.  Tires were still under warranty and I even had extended coverage.  Waited for an hour last week to find they didn't have the tire in the store!   Been about a month since the blowout and getting jerked around by their insurance so feeling like I'm SOL on the damages.  Ahhh insurance companies and lawyers what keeps our country great!

These individuals are the absolute pinnacle of reprehensibility. They attain a minuscule modicum of authority over others and promptly metamorphose into tyrannical oppressors, callously mistreating those unfortunate enough to fall under their purview with utter capriciousness and an utter lack of justification. It is as if they derive perverse satisfaction from perpetuating unbridled malevolence, their conduct eerily reminiscent of the Nazi regime in its heyday. Utterly detestable and unwavering in their resolve to inflict misery upon others, they are the antithesis of everything that could be considered even remotely humane. Dealing with such entities is an exercise in utter futility, as they are consummate masters of the art of being curt and impersonal. It is advisable to avoid them at all costs, lest one desires to be subjected to an unrelenting barrage of unmitigated cruelty. They have the temerity to refer to themselves as a law firm, yet in reality, they are nothing more than a collection agency devoid of even the most basic semblance of a personal touch. They do not rely on the possibility of repeat business from their clients, and this fact is painfully evident in their interactions with others. I have never been moved to compose a review prior to this moment, but my recent telephonic encounter with an individual named Christine has left me feeling compelled to do so. To those who value their own emotional well-being, I wish them the best of luck in their future endeavors.
Not review for this location.\n\nThe bathroom was so gross and small. GROSSSSSS! I thought I would give local coffee a support. Too disappointed!

I have had the privilege of being a member of this esteemed establishment for an excess of three years, during which time I have witnessed a precipitous decline in the quality of service and maintenance, with the refuse and disarray remaining unattended until approximately 7 a.m., much to my chagrin, given that the premises are accessible three hours prior to that time, resulting in an environment that is utterly chaotic and unkempt, and I have reached a point where I can no longer tolerate such conditions.

"FRESH & EASY has become a veritable farce, perpetuating an egregious mockery of advertised'specials' that are, in reality, nonexistent. My ire has been piqued by the absence of 'rain-checks' for out-of-stock items, only to be met with a dismissive and flippant attitude from store managers who seem to relish in the dissatisfaction of their loyal customer base. Case in point: the elusive tri-tip steak, purportedly available for the paltry sum of $2.99, yet invariably ensconced in an impenetrable veil of scarcity, only to reappear at the full price of $2.99 once the'sale' has ended. A similar scenario unfolds with pineapple, touted at an economical $.99 cents, yet persistently 'out of stock,' much to the chagrin of would-be patrons. It appears that FRESH & EASY has adopted a dubious policy of deliberately misleading their clientele, fostering a culture of disdain and disrespect towards those who have heretofore been faithful customers. In light of these developments, I have opted to take my business elsewhere, seeking refuge in the welcoming confines of Trader Joe's, where genuine value and esteem for their patronage are upheld. Farewell, FRESH & EASY; may your impending downfall serve as a cautionary tale for corporations who prioritize duplicity over dedication to their clientele."

I had previously had the experience of visiting this establishment on one occasion prior to this particular instance, and my initial impression was that it was adequate, bordering on satisfactory. However, due to its proximity, I opted to give it another chance, unfortunately, it failed to meet my expectations on this subsequent visit. The young woman who attended to me displayed a lack of warmth and professionalism in her demeanor, engaging in frivolous conversation with her colleague instead of attending to my needs, and responded curtly when I attempted to ask a question. Moreover, during the pedicure process, she applied excessive pressure while buffing my toenails, causing discomfort that lingered for an extended period afterward, leaving a visible cut on my skin. Such an unpleasant experience leaves me no choice but to avoid returning to this salon in the future.

The occurrence of criminal activities poses a significant concern, as personal belongings can be pilfered and individuals may feel vulnerable in public spaces. For instance, I fell victim to thievery when my cellular device and keychain were surreptitiously taken from my person while I was engaged in aquatic recreation at Dowd. Furthermore, my child's caregiver also experienced an automotive break-in during her visit to the same location, which is alarming and raises questions about the adequacy of security measures. These incidents have transpired within a brief span of two months, rendering it dubious to engage in physical exercise at a facility where both individual safety and security of possessions are compromised.

We thoroughly enjoy dining at Chipotle; however, this particular establishment provided us with an unfortunate culinary experience that ranks among the most unsatisfactory encounters we have had the displeasure of enduring at any of their restaurants. They were unfortunately devoid of chips (a glaring omission, considering the fundamental role they play in Mexican cuisine), and their lettuce supply had also been exhausted. Furthermore, the black beans exhibited an unsettling crunchiness, leading us to surmise that they had recently emerged from a can. The restrooms were also in a state of disarray, while the tables remained uncleansed and unkempt. This series of unfortunate events transpired on a Saturday evening at 8 pm, rendering the lack of essential food items inexcusable.

"It is utterly reprehensible that such an egregious display of incompetence and discourtesy could occur at your establishment, whereupon my spouse endured an unpleasant encounter and was denied the tangible radiographs she had transported to your facility; instead, they opted to dispatch digital copies via email, which is patently unacceptable. Furthermore, I had arranged for a visit, but it was unilaterally abrogated due to my better half's negative assessment, without any prior communication or consultation with either myself or my wife. It is utterly mystifying that such a draconian measure would be taken without proper investigation or verification, leading one to wonder about the veracity of your enterprise's operations and the extent to which you are truly cognizant of the goings-on within your organization."

Typical buffalo wild wing. A little bigger than normal . Got seated quickly only to have 5 servers walk past us. 3 of which sat and had a conversation what tables they had or didn't. We where the next table over. Waited about 8 minutes until walking out. Servers all seem to be more into talking to each other than working.

I made an eleventh hour decision to embark upon a journey to Las Vegas to partake in a familial celebration of a birthday milestone, whereupon my kinfolk were lodging at the esteemed Bellagio resort for a period of four nights. However, due to my tardy deliberation, the tariffs at the aforementioned establishment had escalated beyond my desired budget for such a brief sojourn. Consequently, I elected to seek accommodations at the nearby Planet Hollywood, which offered a comparatively reasonable rate and was situated merely across the street from the Bellagio. Although my experience at Planet Hollywood cannot be described as utterly deplorable, I must confess that it fell short of my expectations. The guest quarters exuded an air of antiquation and did not radiate an aura of fastidious cleanliness. Furthermore, the decorative elements within the rooms seemed rooted in a bygone era, specifically the 1990s, and lacked the contemporary flair that I have come to anticipate from upscale Strip hotels. It appears that Planet Hollywood's ambiance aligns with that of its primary entertainer, Britney Spears, whose performances are characterized by a faintly tawdry quality. Various deficiencies in my lodgings included: an absent drawer front, an unpleasant odor emanating from the faucet water in the sink, and pull chain shades that exhibited a propensity for sticking. While I can appreciate the appeal of Planet Hollywood's lively atmosphere during my youthful years, at present, I prefer amenities that cater to my desire for comfort and modernity, such as those found at Aria.

I wanted to like this place, but the service was so horrible that it ruined my evening. Our waitress was blond and arrogant and really couldn't be bothered to serve us. She took our food order and then literally never came back. Our starters came and I bugged the delivery waitress for another drink, but soon realized that not only were we not getting our waitress back, but we weren't getting the rest of our food. Finally, after an hour we cancelled the rest and went to find dinner elsewhere. It wasn't just us. The rest of the guests were ignored as the staff sat and chatted among each other. Not worth the time or effort.

This place used to have awesome food.  It was a great buffet.  Then the location changed and I am guessing the cooks did too.  The food was terrible.  Buffets in Las Vegas that are good are slammed with people even the mediocre ones have lines.  This place, was dead at 7 pm on a Wednesday.  We go out to eat on Wednesdays and we sometimes go to Buffets.  When we do go to Buffets they are slammed with people and have long lines.  This place you just walk right on up, pay you money and go grab a plate.  Problem is, is that buffets rely on turn over so the food doesn't just sit under the heat lamps and get old.  This place had nothing but food under the heat lamps that looked old.  They had Prime Rib but every last piece of it was cooked well done.  The whole place was terrible food.  To many good buffets in town with a comparable price to eat here.

"This culinary experience constituted the most egregious example of gastronomical fraud and reprehensible Japanese cuisine I have had the misfortune of encountering, particularly given its proximity to my domicile. The so-called 'teriyaki vegetable' dish was composed of an uninspired medley of steamed carrots, cauliflower, and broccoli, all of which appeared to be crafted from frozen vegetables of inferior quality. Furthermore, the dish was bereft of any discernible ginger or soy sauce flavor, save for a meager sprinkling that seemed almost perfunctory. The vegetables were suspended in a watery bath, suggesting that they had been hastily microwaved and inadequately drained. At a cost of $8, this dish represented an unmitigated disaster and a flagrant affront to the principles of culinary excellence. So profoundly disillusioned was I by the abysmal quality of this fare that I felt compelled to chronicle my discontent in the form of a review, marking the first time I have ever felt impelled to do so for any eatery. Indeed, even the rice accompanying the dish fell short of expectations, rounding out a truly forgettable and regrettable dining experience."

Parking is a farcical debacle, characterized by an acute dearth of spaces, thereby necessitating an exasperating quest for a spot, ultimately culminating in a futile endeavor to secure a place to park. Moreover, the seating arrangement within the establishment is woefully inadequate, particularly indoors, resulting in an overcrowded atmosphere that is further exacerbated by the presence of a throng of rowdy college students and self-proclaimed business professionals who frequent the Mill Ave. area. This confluence of factors renders the dining experience utterly insufferable. It prompts one to ponder the rationale behind the proprietors' selection of such locales, especially in areas notorious for their abysmal street parking, where the daily phenomenon of overflowing parking lots is an inevitable occurrence, thus effectively sabotaging the entire experience from its inception. It appears to be a deliberate ploy to create the illusion of high demand by artificially limiting seating and parking, while simultaneously maintaining an interminable waitlist.
 If one has the foresight to arrive promptly upon the establishment's opening, it is occasionally feasible to secure a seat at the bar, thereby rendering the experience marginally more tolerable. In this case, it is advisable to order individual slices accompanied by beer, as this will facilitate a relatively swift and efficient service. Additionally, the music volume has not yet been cranked up to an ear-splitting level, providing a brief reprieve from the cacophony that typically permeates the atmosphere. The fried spicy ravioli, while undeniably delectable, serve as a solitary bright spot in an otherwise lackluster culinary excursion.

I had previously been employed at the Starbucks situated across the street from this establishment, but subsequent to partaking of a friend's General Tso's chicken and a singularly greasy mouthful of egg roll that I have ever had the displeasure of consuming, I made the conscious decision to abstain from ordering anything other than dumplings from this location.  It was evident that the dumplings were poured directly from a bag that had been stored in a frozen state, which led me to infer that the grimy kitchen could not possibly contaminate them to an appreciable extent.  Notwithstanding the fact that my fried dumplings typically arrived charred, I would immerse them in sauce, and they served as a source of sustenance that enabled me to endure numerous closing shifts at the Bucks.  Nonetheless, it is my conviction that this particular Chinese restaurant is the most inferior one I have had the misfortune of visiting.

"I hereby retract my previous laudatory remarks regarding Riverview Toyota, as a succession of unfortunate events has transpired subsequent to my initial expression of satisfaction. Specifically, multiple instances of lost paperwork and an inoperative gas cap have prolonged the rectification process, warranting a three-week wait for a response, during which time the vehicle's fuel efficiency has proven to be a blessing. Following numerous unreturned calls, I finally had the opportunity to communicate with a corporate manager, only to discover that the financing process had inexplicably stalled. In light of this development, I have taken matters into my own hands, and I shall provide updates on any progress regarding funding. It is worth noting, however, that the absence of post-sale support has been a source of considerable frustration."

In light of Just J.'s inquiry, it is imperative to note that Just J. Corliss, the erstwhile proprietor of the eponymous enterprise, effectuated a sale of his business concern to the esteemed H&R Block conglomerate in the recent past. Prior to this transaction, our association with Mr. Corliss spanned eight years, during which time we experienced unwavering and satisfactory service. However, subsequent to the acquisition, we have been inundated with telephone calls from H&R Block operatives who persist in invoking Mr. Corliss's name as a marketing ploy to secure new clients. When queried about the possibility of scheduling an appointment with Mr. Corliss, these representatives offer appointments with other accountants under their employ, without divulging the fact that they are, in reality, H&R Block personnel. 
It is worth mentioning that Mr. Corliss himself informed us of his decision to sell his business and retire last year. Unfortunately, the ensuing experience proved to be a calamitous imbroglio, characterized by deplorable office management and a succession of incompetent office managers. 
In conclusion, it would be injudicious to allow oneself to be deceived by the lingering presence of Mr. Corliss's name in association with the enterprise; for, in point of fact, it now falls under the purview of H&R Block, whose performance has been subpar, to say the least. Therefore, it is strongly advised against seeking their services.

"Gracious me! Upon perusing these copious accolades, I had anticipated an exceptional indulgence, but alas, my expectations were utterly deflated. Firstly, my visage, auricular region, brow, and cervical area received an excessive amount of attention, with an exhausting repetition of the same technique that left my epidermis feeling scorched. Good heavens! Surely, a modicum of emollient would have been appreciated. Secondly, my dorsal region was in a state of considerable tension, yet my masseur dedicated merely a paltry five minutes to the area of greatest need. Thirdly, as my therapist hovered above me, an unfortunate belch escaped his lips, imbuing the atmosphere with an unpleasant odor that significantly marred my overall encounter. Notwithstanding, I derived a modicum of pleasure from the podiatric massage segment, although even that was marred by an inordinate focus on my hallux, which struck me as somewhat bizarre. Ultimately, I found the experience to be rather awkward, and as an individual who regularly indulges in therapeutic massages, I would not consider revisiting this establishment."

I and a friend dined here tonight, following the suggestion of a friend who said it was outstanding.  It isn't.  Though it starts off well with the perfunctory greetings, it went downhill.  The wine sommelier had a hard time opening the wine we brought.  My soup arrived at barely above room temperature.  Our entrees took FOREVER to arrive, and once again, mine was barely above room temperature.  The waiter, to his credit, did apologize for the delay in getting the food out to us.  And he did so twice.  That was a bad sign when he had to inform us twice.  The manager tried to make it up with bring out desserts and dessert wine.  I just don't like sweets.  For the wine we brought, the restaurant did comp the corkage fee, and the desserts and dessert wine (which were unwanted) were also comp'ed.  I will NOT go back to this place.

Based on their digital platform (visually appealing graphics, festive ambiance, economic drink specials, varied options), we presumed it would be a suitable establishment to visit. Upon entering, the venue appeared tidy and well-decorated. We arrived on a Thursday evening and the crowd was moderately dense. The gentleman manning the bar seemed to be novice, as he displayed a lack of familiarity with their offerings. Our charcoal remained unchanged throughout our duration, despite numerous requests. En route to the restroom, I encountered our server, and respectfully requested that she replace our charcoal. She agreed but failed to follow through. Several minutes later, a different female staff member approached, inquiring about our well-being. I brought to her attention the neglect regarding our charcoal replacement. She vanished momentarily, only to return, assuring us that someone would attend to us shortly. Unfortunately, no one ever came. Due to the persistent disregard for our needs, we opted to proceed directly to the bar area to settle our account. It is worth mentioning that my companion and I were the sole Asian patrons within the premises. This detail may have played a role in the discourteous service we received, as a server nearby attended to adjacent booths yet deliberately bypassed us. Should you not identify with the dominant demographic, it is unlikely that you will receive favorable treatment at this establishment. We certainly did not.

The room and service were fine. I had a studio so the fridge is 18ft (5.5m) from the bed and the compressor can get noisy. The hotel is nicely situated in downtown. The walk from the Via Rail/central station is slightly uphill and 10-15 minutes, a nice, scenic walk. A ride from the hotel to Old Montreal via taxi was $12CDN with tip, and a taxi to the airport was a fixed rate of $38CDN w/o tip. I stayed in a room on the 14th floor, in an odd-number room, floor#\"03\", and there is a nightclub across the street that pounds music all night, and has loud patrons outside until I don't know when (I put in ear plugs). If you are a light sleeper, stay on the even side room numbers of the hotel and don't face Peel St. Or, stay somewhere else. \nThe workout room is good sized and on the top floor with two treadmills, two elliptical, some free weights, and lots of room. Breakfast is on the mezzanine and was, meh, pretty average, but included. I'd spend the extra $40/night and stay at the Marriott-proper just a bit south again, when I come back. Views are better from there too, and it's more convenient. 1-star for the all night boom-chick-boom-chick music which made the stay very unpleasant, as well as the screaming patrons exiting the club. Eliminate the noisy music, it's a 3-3.5 rating.

"Hold on a moment, allow me to assimilate the information you've just provided... It appears that despite being seated at 5:40 am, I am unable to peruse the post-6 am menu offerings, as certain culinary experts specialize in specific edibles, thereby precluding the inclusion of bacon or sausage in my repast. Furthermore, my comprehension is further challenged by the fact that even after opting for an item from the limited pre-6 am selection, the arrival of my cuisine is delayed until after 6:30 am. 

 Permit me to elucidate further... My acquaintance is unable to partake in a meal consisting of scrambled eggs, bacon, and home fries; instead, they must choose between scrambled eggs without bacon and French fries or chicken fried steak accompanied by a biscuit, gravy, and, once again, home fries. These seemingly arbitrary guidelines are perplexing, to say the least. 

Additionally, I find it curious that while the salad featured on the menu is unavailable, the ahi tuna and chicken and waffles, which are nowhere to be found on the menu, can be ordered. Such inconsistencies only add to the already labyrinthine nature of the dining experience. 

Upon successfully navigating the complex process of placing my order, I was then presented with a menu adorned with crosswords and puzzles, yet the sole writing utensil within the establishment was nowhere to be found. It is my sincere hope that the chefs responsible for the culinary offerings will take note of these discrepancies and strive for improvement, as the quality of the food left much to be desired. Overall, this dining excursion has been utterly disappointing."

"My experiences at this establishment have been less than satisfactory, with two previous visits marred by subpar service and unpalatable confections. Specifically, the cupcakes served during my initial visit were dry and lacking in flavor, while the second encounter proved equally disappointing, with a distinctly unappetizing quality to the frosting. Suffice it to say that my expectations for future visits were decidedly low. However, I was recently presented with an opportunity to sample their wares once again, and I must admit that my taste buds were subjected to an unpleasant assault. The cupcake in question was characterized by an unfortunate aridity, its texture suggestive of a prolonged sojourn in a desiccator. Furthermore, the icing, which I had hoped would provide a modicum of redemption, proved instead to be cloyingly sweet and vaguely chemical in nature. In short, my third experience with this bakery has done little to alter my previously formed opinions regarding its overall quality."

"The absence of attentive and responsive waiting staff, coupled with the serving of unpalatable culinary offerings, the lack of potability in the mixed beverages, and the overall squalid ambiance, left much to be desired. In fact, it was utterly reprehensible. My dissatisfaction knew no bounds."

Underwhelmed by the experience, I was left unimpressed with too much repetition in the decor, which, albeit aesthetically pleasing, failed to compensate for the inadequacy of the service and the culinary offerings, as I was forced to wait extensively for both seating and order taking, followed by an unacceptable delay in the arrival of my meal, which, regrettably, was not only undercooked but also incorrectly prepared, rendering the entire excursion overly expensive and, thus, not worth recommending to others.

"What in the world?! I provided the individual with a $20 bill and the fuel dispenser only yielded $19.89 worth of gasoline, leaving a paltry 11 cents short of the total amount. Although seemingly insignificant, the discrepancy symbolizes a breach of integrity and trustworthiness, as the normative behavior of gas pumps typically involves ceasing dispensation prior to reaching the maximum capacity, thereby enabling consumers to continue filling their tanks until the designated amount is achieved. However, this particular pump appeared to deviate from the standard operating procedure, as its trigger mechanism proved to be defective and refused to function properly, thereby prompting my utterance of profanity and signaling a potential issue worthy of attention and resolution."

"Korean bbq possesses an unparalleled degree of culinary excellence, and my expectations for this establishment were elevated due to the copious amount of laudatory reviews it has received. However, upon entering the premises, I was immediately struck by the diminutive size of the dining area, which was compensated for by the presence of grills positioned at each table. Unfortunately, the staff failed to display even a modicum of enthusiasm towards my associates and me, despite the fact that it was a tranquil evening and their presence would have been greatly appreciated. Not only did they neglect to replenish our beverages, meat, and side dishes in a timely manner, but they also appeared completely indifferent to our needs, opting instead to focus their attention on the boisterous television situated nearby. Furthermore, it took an unacceptable twenty minutes for them to present us with the bill, and their request for the table next to us to vacate their seat in a hasty manner was utterly discourteous. The state of the restrooms was deplorable, leading me to speculate about the cleanliness of the kitchen and refrigeration areas. It is my belief that had I been of Korean descent, the quality of service I received would have been somewhat improved. My Korean companions concur with me in regards to the subpar nature of the service provided. Needless to say, this experience was a tremendous letdown, and I would advise potential patrons to seek out a dining establishment that values its clientele and maintains a level of cleanliness that does not pose a risk to one's health."

Disgusting.

I've been to Kelly O's twice.  The first time the food was anything special - so I decided to give them a second chance.  

I order the Eggs Benedict.  I received a plate with raw potatoes, over cooked eggs, and yellow syrup that they claimed was Hollandaise sauce.  I sent the dish back.  

On the second attempt I asked them to leave off the Hollandaise.  This time I received cold potatoes and undercooked fried eggs - the whites of the eggs were mostly clear.

I asked the waitress why the eggs were fried (if you can it that) instead of poached.  At that point she decided to lecturer me about their kitchen, the cooking methods of their chief, the speed of the wait staff, etc. etc.

"Good grief! That's an abysmal level of customer service. The employees' demeanor is utterly discourteous. I have a profound sense of dissatisfaction with my dining experience, which, while not entirely unpalatable, warrants only a solitary star in my rating. I shall not bother to return to partake of their culinary offerings again."

"In the event that one's employer mandates a visit to this establishment for purposes related to a work-related injury, it is strongly advised to seek alternative medical attention at an emergency room or personal physician's office, as the experience at this location is likely to be utterly unpleasant and inefficient. The staff exhibits a flagrant disregard for patients' time and well-being, subjecting them to interminable waits that can stretch on for hours, and the medical director, Dr. Klausner, appears to prioritize cost-cutting measures over the necessary steps to ensure proper diagnosis and treatment, callously postponing crucial diagnostic tests such as X-rays and MRIs, and displaying a blatant disregard for patients' continued suffering and injury, all in the interest of expediting their return to work, thereby creating an environment that is not only excruciatingly painful but also utterly aggravating, rendering it judicious to seek medical attention elsewhere."

I was under the impression that pharmacists were entrusted with the responsibility of assisting individuals in need, but my recent encounter with the female pharmacist at this establishment has led me to question that notion. If it were possible, I would award less than one star for the deplorable service I received. This pharmacist displayed an appalling lack of empathy towards her patients, treating them with suspicion and disdain, as if they were drug addicts seeking to exploit the system. My sister, who had recently been discharged from the hospital after undergoing a cholecystectomy, was denied the necessary medication by this very same individual. Such reprehensible behavior has left me feeling utterly disillusioned and inclined to seek medical attention elsewhere. In fact, I ardently wish there were more tangible ways for me to express my dissatisfaction with this experience.

If you like sausages, EDM and the smell of bleach, this place is for you! Trying way too hard to be swank in a town much better suited to chill lounge. The only good thing is that I discovered Ami's next door.

This establishment boasts an abysmal clientele servicing proficiency, replete with gaping chasms in their duty of care towards patrons, culminating in a traumatic experience for my canine companion, wherein they were subjected to lacerations and subsequent irritation, only to be met with a dismissive and unyielding demeanor by the proprietors, effectively nullifying any prospect of a fruitful reconciliation; furthermore, the exorbitant tariffs levied upon unsuspecting customers serve as a testament to the egregious nature of their commercial practices, hence, I would recommend exploring alternative options, such as Best Friend Groomers, located on Grand Avenue and Dysart Road, for a more satisfactory and wallet-friendly encounter.

"LAS, a woefully inadequate airport, is plagued by chronic overcrowding and an utter lack of efficiency in its meager facilities, leading to interminable delays and an unmitigated passenger experience. The C/D security checkpoint, in particular, is a veritable nightmare, with wait times frequently exceeding sixty minutes, while the A/B checkpoint, though somewhat less chaotic, is nonetheless prone to lengthy queues due to the sheer volume of travelers passing through its gates on a daily basis. Moreover, obtaining a taxi from LAS is an exercise in futility, with the constant din of slot machines and the incessant drone of advertisements in the baggage claim area creating an atmosphere of unadulterated bedlam that can only be described as soul-crushing."

We have not partaken of a meal at this establishment for a considerable duration of time, and now I am reminded of the reason behind our hiatus...ordered the flatbread pizza appetizer. Upon its delivery to our table, the server inadvertently allowed several fragments to fall onto the surface, prompting my declaration that we would not be consuming it. In response, the server offered to procure additional specimens, which I presume were merely inverted and returned to us...unpalatable!! Refrained from consuming that item!! Subsequently, the cobb salad arrived, lacking the vitality of fresh romaine lettuce and the anticipated presence of bacon...underwhelming experience!! Our server's demeanor mirrored that of Casper the Friendly Ghost, vanishing without a trace for an extended period of time...disappointing.

On August 15th at precisely 8:30 pm, I partook of a dining experience at this establishment, and while the ambiance was not overly crowded, the quality of the service was quite satisfactory. Furthermore, the culinary offerings, specifically the BLT, were also quite palatable. However, I must admit that I was rather fortunate in not having to utilize the facilities prior to consuming my meal, as the odor emanating from the men's restroom was quite unpleasant, due to an apparent issue with the sewage system. Upon bringing this to the attention of the waitstaff, their response was somewhat lackadaisical, with a dismissive acknowledgement of the problem and a lack of initiative to address it. Subsequently, upon settling my bill, I once again mentioned the issue to the manager, who expressed a similar lack of concern and failed to provide a satisfactory solution to the problem.

"Each and every bartender, irrespective of their tenure or experience, exhibits an egregious lack of knowledge regarding the fundamental components constituting myriad beverages commonly consumed by patrons, which raises questions about the criteria employed during the recruitment process, suggesting that cerebral acuity or proficiency may not have been a primary consideration."

We ordered 4AYCE sushi buffets on a Friday evening for 90. I received a coupon in the mail, Buy 3 buffets, get 1 free.

- Wonderful welcome. Nice smiles and quick to order drinks. 
- We got there at 6. As it got towards 630 - 7ish, service fell apart big time.
- When you enter, it will say SERVER WANTED! What they need are more EFFICIENT SERVERS. 
- Servers can't spell! I had to spell out LASAGNA for her. It literally took 1min. Others also, Jones roll...ect..
- Our orders NOT going to our table. I saw my hamachi nigiri being handed off to another table. It wasn't just that, it happened on 2 other occasions.
- We ordered UDON, and our ICE CREAM came first. WTF...no more udon. CANCEL
- Servers look so CONFUSED. we had ALL THE TIME IN THE WORLD to OBSERVE their every move bc there was NO FOOD on our table. "UHH, WHAT TABLE? 7! 7! no, 9! HUH?" LOL. you can see the sushi chef popping a blood vessel. 
- BTW, only one sushi chef! ONE!? WTF. the other guy was probably the sous chef.
- We had quite a bit of sushi rolls. In general, all I can say that they tasted SOGGY! they DRENCH their sushi in this spicy sauce. it makes it worse..ughh FAIL
- Salmon skin roll is good. WIN
- This establishment is going down...that coupon wasn't even worth it. 
- AVOID..
Quite disappointed, my green beans had worms in them. Customer service was bad, still charge me full price for everything. Nobody even apologized. It was just a plain horrible experience.

Had better service at motel 6. Advised front desk of drunk patrons kicking my tires while awaiting valet with my toddler.  Front said \"I'm sorry to hear\", then walked away. Dirty towels and bed linen did me in... going back Motel 6 on next visit.

This establishment fails to meet my expectations, as it consistently lacks the essential items that I require, and the few products they do offer are exorbitantly priced. Were it not for the convenience of its proximity, I would not bother to frequent this subpar location. It is imperative that management consider implementing improvements, such as the installation of an AM/PM or QT, in order to enhance the overall experience for patrons. Notwithstanding, I must acknowledge that the cashiers are indeed courteous and friendly.

"The quality of customer service has been consistently subpar, and I must emphasize, invariably disappointing during my visits to this establishment, and it's not just limited to the food, which, might I add, has been merely satisfactory, with the bowl of plain white rice being the sole redeeming feature of my dining experience, yet, I persevere in frequenting this restaurant, despite the unwavering mediocrity."

This retail establishment exudes an aura of costliness, uncleanliness, and serves as a convenient destination for pedestrians who have imbibed excessive amounts of alcohol and are thus unable to operate a motor vehicle to procure additional quantities of fermented beverages from a more traditional and comprehensive purveyor of groceries.

During my tenure at this illustrious establishment, I had the misfortune of encountering a surly security guard whose demeanor seemed to suggest that he was experiencing a particularly disagreeable evening, as evidenced by his admonition to cease my rhythmic movements lest he be compelled to utilize his footwear in a manner that would result in facial injury. Such an instance of customer service in the VIP section left much to be desired.

Well I can't really say anything seeing as I wasn't able to get in. I know they do not take reservations and it is walk in only. I tried calling to see what the wait time would be and nobody answered the phone. I was transferred to hotel concierge who wasn't able to get ahold of anyone either. So far not a good impression. I'll try again another time

I order Za Jiang Mein noodles from them before many times.  Za Jiang Mein suppose to be hot.  I went there and waited 35 minutes for the noodle and there were only two other customer there.  So I ask my server why takes so long? she replies because you came here at this time. We only have one chef is making the food.  OK fine, when the server brings me the noodle i notices its cold noodle! So, I ask the server again why its cold. first she thought its not right and should not be cold.  She went to ask the chef.  I can hear the chef yelling from the kitchen because the noodle is rinsed in cold water so we can stir in the za jiang sauce.  (even if its rinsed in cold water, it still should be at warm temperature. ) I told the server maybe the chef forgot about our noodle is being rinsed.  Maybe its being soaked in cold water too long.  after I heard the chef and food server is talking shit in Chinese in the restaurant. At this point, I don't want to eat there anymore.  It was their mistakes and they do not admit and blame to the customer.

Dave is an amazing person who will do well at whatever he does, but I am afraid he stood us up this morning and when we contacted him to find out where he was, he told my husband that he is really no longer in the sprinkler business.  This makes me very, very sad! I loved him and I adored working with him.

If you seek an unpleasant aquatic encounter, then this particular pool may be suitable for your preferences. However, we would advise against visiting this pool, especially on Saturdays around 11 am, as the water tends to appear turbid and unappealing. Additionally, the pool's dimensions are rather diminutive, which may not accommodate those who desire a more extensive swimming experience. Furthermore, we encountered an inconvenience at the bar, where the bartender erroneously interchanged our credit card with that of another patron, resulting in a perplexing situation that left us without a functional debit card for the remainder of our excursion. Our attempts to rectify the issue were further hindered by the ineptitude of the staff members present. Consequently, we strongly advise against frequenting this establishment.

The dearth of culinary alternatives within the establishment is conspicuous, and the quality of the victuals on offer leaves much to be desired, as it is palpable that they have been stationary for an extended period of time, thereby compromising their freshness and palatability. Furthermore, the level of service provided by the staff is inadequate, and one cannot help but wonder about the whereabouts of the managerial personnel, as the employees appear to be merely idling and engaging in frivolous conversation.

"The eatery's interior appeared unkempt, with a grimy, unhygienic counter and floor that seemed to have been neglected for an extended period. The cashier's demeanor was discourteous, displaying an evident lack of interest in serving us, perhaps due to our ethnicity or our interruption of her conversation with a companion who was loitering at the counter. The sole table within the establishment remained uncleared of the remnants of a previous patron's meal, while the two outdoor tables were likewise littered with rubbish, prompting us to opt for takeout instead. For individuals who relish stale, crusty bread accompanied by wilted vegetables and desiccated meat, this venue might be worth considering."

"Garlic toast with a profoundly burnt flavor profile. Oh, I presume there's supposed to be an abundance of garlic on that particular menu item? Passable wings, albeit approximately half of the one-pound plate consisted of battered and deep-fried nugget-like appendages. And the pie, a culinary atrocity with an uncooked, soggy dough crust. Additional napkins were provided to facilitate the copious amount of grease absorption required for this half-baked monstrosity. The service, regrettably, was deplorable, prompting us to vacate the premises without lingering for dessert. My apologies, but I cannot in good conscience recommend this establishment to anyone seeking a satisfactory dining experience."

Horrible service for a half empty restaurant.  45 minute wait before being sat in an empty station.  My friend's knife was dirty ok things happen but then after our meal the table behind us sends a plate back because their's was dirty as well.  Really slow service granted yes we were told kitchen was backed up but again 45 minutes for sundaes.  The server asked how everything was going and left before getting an answer.  Overall the restaurant survives on the hype, don't go for it.  Save your money; this place is not worth it.

"I had the most unpleasant encounter I have ever experienced in my existence. The general manager displayed an excessive amount of discourtesy when I politely requested that he replace the pancakes with an alternative option. His response was utterly unprofessional, as he informed me that there would be an additional fee, but he could offer me a 'SLICE OF TOMATO' complimentarily. The tone he employed was utterly unnecessary, particularly given the time of day (Saturday afternoon) and his position as the GENERAL MANAGER. It is unsurprising that this establishment has received unfavorable reviews, considering that such personnel are responsible for its reputation. Regrettably, the culinary offerings were unable to redeem this Original Pancake House, as the flavor of the pancakes was the least appealing I have ever had the misfortune of consuming. The general manager's demeanor suggested that he was discontent with his occupation and did not desire to be present at the establishment. Consequently, I will not consider returning to this venue in the future."

"My ardent affection for Chipotle remains steadfast, albeit, regrettably, not towards this particular establishment. Perchance, an inordinate amount of time spent awaiting my delectable burrito bowl, approximately thirty minutes to be precise, in addition to a supplementary ten minutes required to traverse the extensive queue, ultimately culminating in a total duration of forty minutes, might potentially deter me from indulging in their scrumptious offerings. It is conceivable that such an experience may evoke frustration and disappointment, especially considering the fact that the personnel appear to lack proficiency and seem perpetually flustered. Therefore, I must bid farewell to this location, as it fails to meet my expectations. Notwithstanding, I typically visit this establishment during non-peak hours, specifically 2:30 pm and 8:00 pm. It is rather perplexing that the staff's performance does not align with the quality of the food, compelling me to question the management's training methods. Moreover, it would be greatly appreciated if the staff could be taught proper hygiene practices, such as changing their gloves regularly, especially after engaging in personal activities like nose-wiping, to ensure a more pleasant dining experience for patrons."

"It has been an unpleasant experience thus far...I have had to visit this establishment twice due to my quest for a skilled manicurist. Unfortunately, it appears that my search will continue, as this particular salon has failed to meet my expectations. The proprietor's demeanor is rather brusque and authoritarian, which has made for an uncomfortable atmosphere on both occasions. During my second visit, she exhibited an unusual level of impatience, abruptly interrupting my drying process with a demand for payment. Her tone was rather gruff, leaving me taken aback and feeling somewhat indignant. It is unfortunate that the other staff members, who have been relatively pleasant, are overshadowed by the owner's discourteous behavior. I fear that I shall not be returning to this salon in the future."

I recently endured an unmitigated disaster of a massage experience, which unequivocally ranks as the most atrocious and reprehensible treatment of its kind that I have ever had the misfortune of encountering throughout my existence. Under no circumstances would I consider returning to this establishment, as the notion of parting with $80 for a service that involves little more than a superficial application of oil to the skin, devoid of any appreciable pressure or therapeutic benefit, is utterly preposterous and inconceivable to me. In fact, this experience was so profoundly disappointing and objectionable that I am compelled to issue a cautionary warning to others, marking the first instance in which I have felt impelled to post a negative critique of a service provider.

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are satisfactory, albeit the expediency of their preparation is somewhat impressive. However, the dearth of customer service acumen among the staff is palpable. Specifically, the lunch special terminates at 4 p.m., and despite our arrival at approximately 3:55 p.m., our attempt to place an order for the promotion was met with resistance from the server. Following a brief conversation between the waitstaff and the presumed proprietor/manager/supervisor seated nearby, we were granted a one-time exception to partake in the special. Notwithstanding this indulgence, we were informed that certain staple items such as fried rice and noodles were unavailable, which seems incongruous given the eatery's namesake. Furthermore, the personnel appeared to consume their meals in full view of patrons, fostering an ambiance that some might interpret as unprofessional. Suffice it to say, our experience did not engender a desire to revisit this dining spot."

Maybe it was the oppressive heat, maybe the diarrhea brewing in my gut, but I truly hated this place.  Didnt like the long line to get in, didnt like the music, didnt like the misting nozzles driping god knows what bacteria in my beverage, didnt like the 50 year old dude claiming he was 30 something trying to make time.  Anyway, I got the hell out of there and spent some quality time on the toilet.  What happens in vegas stays in vegas.

They can't get the orders right.  I always have to double check my bag before leaving the drive thru. They're open late, but they have no lights on at night. Poor service. I'd rather go to Sonic's down the street.  This Mc Donald's needs improvement.  Bad

"Upon perusing my credit card statement, I noticed an anomaly in the form of an augmented gratuity appended to a particular transaction with this merchant. Specifically, the tip amount had been inflated from $110.58 to $210.58, ostensibly due to an alleged error on the part of the establishment's staff. When brought to the attention of the proprietor, Schuyler, he refused to acknowledge the possibility of unethical behavior on the part of his employees and instead maintained that I had indeed left such an exorbitant tip. Furthermore, he asserted that generous gratuities of this nature were commonplace among his staff, which I found both dubious and disconcerting. Consequently, I am compelled to take measures to protect myself from potential fraudulent activities by involving law enforcement, which unfortunately entails additional expenses for all parties involved."

During our brief sojourn at the Golden Nugget from February 8th to 10th, our group of five individuals encountered considerable difficulty in obtaining any substantial payouts from the establishment's slot machines, which seemed to be deliberately designed to minimize returns and thus discourage prolonged engagement. Despite our initial perseverance, we ultimately decided to seek alternative gaming venues with more favorable odds, as the meager offerings of the Golden Nugget's machines failed to provide even modest incentives for continued play. As out-of-state visitors, we felt compelled to share this information with others, in hopes of averting similar disappointment and financial loss for future patrons.

"It is emphatically advisable to seek sustenance elsewhere! During a brief respite at the Charlotte Airport, I made the unfortunate decision to partake of a meal at this establishment. Upon being seated and unwrapping my repast, I instantaneously lamented my choice. The victuals appeared overly processed and utterly unappetizing. I had requested the Kung Pao chicken and rice; however, they did not offer plain white rice, only its fried counterpart. This constituted an excessively substantial meal given that I was about to embark upon another prolonged aerial journey lasting four hours. The culinary offerings were, in point of fact, completely revolting. Following two tentative bites, I discarded the remainder. It is utterly incredible that I squandered ten dollars on such deplorable fare. Subsequently, I traversed to Burger King, whereupon I procured a $1.75 cheeseburger that, by comparison, seemed to emanate from a five-star eatery."

"In conjunction with the desire to convey a package to her offspring as a birthday present, my acquaintance accompanied me to this establishment, seeking to dispatch the aforementioned parcel. However, the individual behind the counter, who introduced himself as Bill, declined to facilitate the shipment due to his insistence that my companion authenticate and confirm the address displayed on his printed document. Despite my friend's candor regarding her inability to peruse the address, Bill maintained an unyielding stance, adamant that he would not proceed with the shipment until she had visually examined and validated the address on his printout. Furthermore, when my friend divulged her legal blindness, Bill remained unsympathetic and steadfastly refused to assist her, thus thwarting the transmission of the package."

"By a considerable margin, the most deplorable dry cleaning establishment in the vicinity. I had entrusted an expensive shirt to their care for laundering, and upon its return, the front pocket was inconceivably located on the interior side! Such an egregious error could only be attributed to a clumsy attempt at restoration, subsequent to an unfortunate incident involving the detachment of the pocket, which was then amateurishly reattached in a reverse orientation, sans my knowledge or consent. When I visited the store to express my dissatisfaction, the staff responded with hostility, refuting any possibility of such an occurrence. I proffered photographic evidence of the garment's previous state, but they persisted in their contentious stance. I would emphatically advise against patronizing this business, and have accordingly lodged a formal complaint with the Better Business Bureau. Vigilantly avoid this establishment!!"

"Considering the expansive nature of the salon, it is my belief that the quality of one's experience will be directly correlated with the stylist selected. Personally, I opted to procure a Groupon for a level three haircut accompanied by a moisture treatment. Unfortunately, the stylist, Ken, only dedicated a meager five minutes to the actual cutting process, while devoting an excessive forty minutes to blow-drying my hair and engaging in superfluous conversation, ultimately neglecting the moisture treatment altogether. His technique left much to be desired, as the cut lacked any semblance of layers and failed to maintain a consistent levelness across the horizontal plane. It became apparent that Ken was not taking his work seriously, and I would strongly advise against selecting him as your stylist should you decide to visit Dean of Shadyside. In contrast, MCN offers a vastly superior experience, making them a preferable choice."

I placed my confidence in this malefactor, entrusting him with a valuable and sentimentally significant weighted 88 key MIDI controller, anticipating a straightforward repair involving the replacement of an internal battery; however, after numerous futile attempts at communication, spanning over three months, characterized by a diverse array of frivolous excuses proffered during each telephonic interaction, I reluctantly resigned myself to the likelihood that this individual was perpetrating a fraudulent scheme, whereby he would persuade unsuspecting victims to relinquish their prized possessions, only to subsequently peddle them for personal gain.

"My sentiments regarding Macaroni Grill are, for the most part, overwhelmingly positive; however, my recent dining experiences at this establishment have been marred by subpar service. Specifically, during my previous visit, my wife and I encountered an inattentive waitress who repeatedly neglected our needs, resulting in a thoroughly unpleasant meal. Despite my innate propensity for forgiveness, we opted to give the restaurant another chance, only to be met with a similar lack of dedication to customer satisfaction. This time, the server failed to provide adequate attention to our table, even though the dining area was nearly deserted. Such an egregious display of indifference prompted me to solicit the assistance of a passing waiter merely to obtain the bill and expedite our departure. It is my contention that exceptional clientele service is a sine qua non for any successful eatery, and Macaroni Grill has, unfortunately, fallen short in this regard."

"Proceeded to visit the establishment in close proximity to Cave Creek, whereupon I opted to consume the bacon chicken fajitas, only to unfortunately experience an adverse reaction, specifically food poisoning, a perilous situation indeed; thus, I must caution others to exercise vigilance when partaking of culinary delights at this particular venue, and, consequently, I shall be taking a temporary hiatus from frequenting this establishment."

Always cherished this establishment, however, during my most recent visit, I was unable to indulge in the luxury of having my nails painted due to time constraints associated with my occupational responsibilities. Despite my repeated attempts to return for the aforementioned purpose on subsequent occasions, the salon appeared to be perpetually beset by an overwhelming influx of clientele, thereby precluding me from receiving the desired service. Thus, I opted to procure a novel set of nails today, harboring the expectation that the business might offer some form of monetary compensation for the omission of the previously mentioned service. Unfortunately, such was not the case, and I was compelled to leave without receiving the anticipated adjustment. Furthermore, I have been a faithful patron of this establishment since its inception and have consistently demonstrated my appreciation through generous gratuities ranging between 20 to 30%. The absence of consideration exhibited towards regular clients such as myself is truly disconcerting and reflects unfavorably upon the overall quality of customer service provided by Vy's. Consequently, I shall refrain from patronizing this establishment in the future, and I shall endeavor to dissuade my acquaintances and loved ones from doing so as well.

"I decided to indulge in a culinary excursion to this sushi establishment, situated in close proximity to my domicile in Summerlin, by opting for a takeout order. Alas, my expectations were not met, as the sushi dishes did not exhibit an aesthetically pleasing appearance, with the rolls being haphazardly assembled. Furthermore, one of the rolls I had selected, specifically the salmon variety, was not only cooked but also lacked the freshness I had anticipated, thus leading to a disappointing gustatory experience."

"An excessive amount of sodium chloride was present on all menu items, which, although I am a proponent of this essential mineral, rendered the culinary experience unpleasant due to its overwhelming presence. Specifically, the vegetable fries, which I had eagerly anticipated consuming, were nearly inedible because of their extreme salinity, which overpowered any other potential flavors they may have possessed. Furthermore, the poultry dish was problematic, as it was abundant in adipose tissue and lacking in any discernible taste aside from the previously mentioned, ubiquitous layer of salt. Notwithstanding my friend's enthusiastic endorsement of the establishment's hamburgers, I would not consider dining at this venue again, even if the meal were gratis. In fact, I found the entire experience to be quite nauseating."

This conservative POS rag makes faux news look like NPR. You got Scaife, himself pumping ten million a year from his own pocket to keep the paper up and running. No one reads it, the Post Gazette is the REAL newspaper in this city.

The wife, baby and I stopped in for Brunch this past Sunday due to my friends kept raving about this place.  Upon entering the cloth curtains, the room was 75% full. In the room we were in, there were only two waiters waiting on everyone and we stood for 5 minutes unnoticed.  The bartender to the right didn't bother to greet us either.   It felt awkward and after noticing many customers still waiting to be served, we figure it'll be a long wait since they're under staffed.  It was a dissapointing first impression.  Maybe we'll return again in the spring and hopefully they'll be better staffed.

"My affection towards Best Buy is unwavering; however, my experience at this particular store was utterly disappointing. The staff demonstrated a lack of cordiality, proficiency, and attentiveness, leading me to seek alternative options. Subsequently, I visited Sam's Club to acquire a new television, and although I intend to return to Best Buy in the future, I will not hesitate to depart empty-handed if I am met with similar treatment. It is unfortunate that the company has failed to recognize the significance of quality customer service, as studies have consistently shown that consumers are willing to pay a premium and travel farther distances for a more satisfying shopping experience. I implore Best Buy to reassess their approach and prioritize employee training to avoid losing loyal customers like myself."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."
That's how one could summarize their time at this particular gaming establishment, which failed to live up to the standards of its renowned counterparts, such as Hard Rock Hollywood or Fort Lauderdale. Upon entering, it became apparent that the ambiance was lacking in comparison to other casinos, with an atmosphere that felt more akin to a long, narrow corridor rather than a spacious, open gaming area. Furthermore, the slot machines proved unaccommodating, yielding no victories for this writer, nor, it seemed, for anyone else within the vicinity. In conclusion, an unremarkable visit, save for the disappointment elicited by the absence of a truly satisfying gaming adventure.

Purchased a six inch with combo at this subway and I was charged $8.50. The soda and the drink was half the price of my sandwich? When I went to a different subway for the same meal I was charged $6.30. Won't be going back to this subway.

Only 2 things bring me to McDonald's, the coffee and.cheap desert. I do give credit for McDonald's on how they operate like a machine. They get you in and out, but unfortunately not this one. 10 minutes for a cup of coffee? Only 4 tables in the place and every single table got up to complain about their food quality, missing food etc. Where's management? Obviously they didnt graduates from hamburger u.

"Refrain from expending your valuable time patronizing this establishment, as it offers subpar culinary experiences at exorbitant prices. Despite the passable service, the overall assessment indicates that it is unwise to opt for an overpriced fast food meal at this venue. Instead, consider dining at Addiction, where the cost-to-quality ratio is more favorable."

"Deteriorated, exorbitantly-priced, raucous, unrefined, economical, congested with a plethora of rowdy, boisterous individuals partaking in a collegiate furlough, interminable queues for every amenity, outrageously overpriced potable water at a whopping four dollars for a minuscule container of Dasani, and a surly, haughty demeanor exhibited by those tasked with catering to the needs of patrons...rhetorically speaking, what could possibly induce one to visit such an establishment?"

The query regarding the feasibility of bestowing a rating inferior to one star arouses curiosity, prompting an investigation into the intricacies of the culinary establishment in question. Specifically, it appears that patrons of Asian descent familiar with Taiwanese or Chinese gastronomy may find the venue unsuitable for their refined tastes. Allegedly, the quality of service leaves much to be desired, with the proprietor exhibiting a discourteous demeanor. Furthermore, discrepancies in the timely delivery of dishes have been reported, with primary courses arriving before appetizers, resulting in an incongruous dining experience. Additionally, beverages offered fail to impress, and the beef noodle soup, in particular, is described as subpar. In light of these shortcomings, potential customers are advised to exercise caution when considering a visit to this establishment.

"Amble into an eatery during a peak hour when the staff-to-patron ratio is disproportionate, and observe how the lone server exerts himself to accommodate the multitude of clientele, albeit receiving quizzical glances from patrons at the conclusion of his valiant efforts. 

Querying my opinion on Mr. Tofu's culinary offerings, I must aver that they fall short of my expectations. Opting for their signature tofu soup and supplementing it with an additional $7 for short ribs, I was disappointed by the lackluster taste, overcooking, and questionable quality of the meat. 

Furthermore, my experience with their bulgogi dish only serves to reinforce my belief that SOYO remains the superior choice for Korean cuisine enthusiasts. Thus, I avow never to return to Mr. Tofu and instead, solely indulge in SOYO's offerings for my future Korean food cravings. A single visit suffices, Mr. Tofu; your establishment does not align with my gastronomic preferences."
I got a horrible haircut...will never go back...I am not very picky and all I asked was for my stylist not to take much off...she cut almost 5 inches...unacceptable

"This establishment is utterly inadequate and subpar in terms of its customer service and overall experience. Specifically, the cashiers at this location exhibit a flagrant disregard for customer satisfaction, as evidenced by their dismissive and unhelpful demeanor. My request for a carne asada burrito with red sauce on top, which I colloquially referred to as a 'wet burrito,' was met with an unequivocal refusal, with the cashier expressing a blatant lack of interest in fulfilling my order. This response not only exemplified an unacceptable level of rudeness but also raised questions regarding the company's policy on accommodating customer preferences. Furthermore, when I inquired about the absence of a manager to address my concerns, I was met with an incredulous response that the establishment did not possess such a position. In light of these events, I am left with no choice but to boycott this business and seek alternative dining options that prioritize customer satisfaction."

"If gastronomical satisfaction is your sole criterion, this establishment may prove satisfactory. However, my previous visit was marred by an unfortunate incident that has left a lingering negative impression. My companion and I placed individual orders, with mine being a kimchi stew that arrived promptly within 15 minutes. Unfortunately, my companion's bulgogi dish did not follow suit, and we were compelled to wait an additional 15 minutes beyond the time it took for my meal to be prepared. Upon inquiring about the delay, I was taken aback by the server's response, which seemed to imply that we had not, in fact, placed the order correctly. This allegation struck me as patently false, as I distinctly recalled verbally confirming the order with my companion. Moreover, the server's deficient communication skills and lack of accountability only served to exacerbate the situation. Suffice it to say that our experience was tarnished by an absence of culinary synchronization and an unhelpful attitude on the part of the staff."

I possess a fallacious citation to patronize Best Buy once more, subsequent to a previous purchase of a portable computer device from their establishment in December, which ceased functioning appropriately following an software update, prompting me to engage in an extensive telephonic conversation with the manufacturer, who conveyed that Best Buy would be responsible for addressing the issue, only to be met with utter indifference and disinterest by the retailer's representatives when I presented the malfunctioning device for their perusal, despite my efforts to ensure its preservation by retaining the original packaging and accessories.

I have had the pleasure of partaking in culinary indulgences at Max's in Glendale, California on multiple occasions, thus, the news of a Las Vegas establishment elicited immense excitement within me. My anticipation was centered around savoring Max's delectable Beef Caldereta, complemented by a serving of garlic rice. Unfortunately, my expectations were not met, as this particular location did not offer such a delicacy. Instead, they provided a limited selection of basic dishes.

My gastronomical adventure commenced with Chicken Sigsig, which failed to impress my taste buds. The dish's flavor profile was subpar, resembling a mixture of mayonnaise, stale chicken, and jalapeÃ±o slices. For a more satisfying Sigsig experience, I would recommend visiting Cafe Moda.

The whole chicken entrÃ©e was cooked to perfection, boasting tenderness and juiciness. The crispy chicken skin was an enjoyable texture contrast. However, I remained perplexed by the supposed uniqueness of the chicken's flavor, as it seemed to be lacking in depth.

Garlic rice, a staple accompaniment, was prepared satisfactorily.

My culinary exploration concluded with the Halo-Halo, a refreshing delight that ranked among the best in Las Vegas. Kudos to the hospitable waitstaff for their cordial and friendly service.

Notably, it is advisable to request bottled water instead of tap water, which is unfiltered and hard.

In summary, the cuisine underwhelmed due to its lack of authentic flavors, while the menu prices were considered steep. A revision of the menu, focusing on genuine offerings and reasonable pricing, would be beneficial for Max's Las Vegas branch. Nonetheless, I shall return for the Halo-Halo. My recommendation for this Max's is to adjust their prices accordingly, considering the quality of the food and the fact that they are still establishing themselves in the area.

"The most accommodating Starbucks, alas, management necessitates devoting additional time interacting with staff members. Upon ordering, my name was incorrectly rendered despite meticulously enunciating (MARTIN, admittedly, does not pose a significant challenge in terms of orthography), followed by a request for an assortment of sweet baked goods; however, only a solitary item was proffered. Furthermore, it appears that a caramel macchiato at this establishment does not contain caramel, much to my dismay. Notwithstanding, I did receive a radiant smile from one of the comely young women employed therein, thereby warranting the lone star appended to this review."

"Deplorable. The service was subpar at best, and I surmise that our server was none other than the proprietor herself. Her countenance exuded a discernible scowl, and her demeanor was far from hospitable. As for the victuals, my order of corned beef hash resembled a culinary abomination, evoking the unpleasant texture of a shredded washcloth. Such an unfortunate presentation rendered it unpalatable, leaving me no choice but to decline consumption. This establishment's disregard for gastronomic excellence is utterly reprehensible. The bread, though tepid, constituted the sole redeeming quality of our repast. However, my sympathies for the proprietor did not preclude me from disposing of the remnants in the nearest waste bin during my departure. An unmistakable atmosphere of impending doom permeates this eatery, fostering an indubitable conviction that its downfall is imminent. Needless to say, I shall not return, and instead, I would enthusiastically recommend patronizing Bagel Cafe, where the corned beef hash is not only superior but also a gastronomic masterpiece."
As of 11/03/13 they appear to be closed by order of the courts and there is a for lease sign in the window.

"My experiences at this establishment have been far from satisfactory, with the first encounter being particularly unpleasant. The nail technician applied an excessive amount of acrylic, rendering my fingers unusable; I was forced to seek assistance from a different salon to rectify the issue. Despite this disappointment, I opted to give the salon a second chance, this time for an eyebrow waxing service.
