Furthermore, I would like to request that the onions be obtained from the rear storage area, rather than the front tray where your fingers, which have previously come into contact with tomatoes, may have contaminated the vegetables. It is essential that you adhere to my instructions meticulously and refrain from expediting the process at the expense of my safety. A momentary delay in the execution of your duties could potentially prevent a life-threatening situation, whereas a hasty approach could result in catastrophic consequences. It took three attempts to fulfill my request successfully, with the initial two attempts resulting in the inclusion of tomato seeds, which could have had fatal consequences. Would it not have been more judicious for you to heed my warnings and adopt a more measured approach in order to ensure that your team comprehended the gravity of the situation and executed my requests accordingly?"

"How exasperating! I had aspired to compile a comprehensive baby registry, but alas, my efforts were thwarted by an inadequate kiosk experience. Following the creation of a unique password, I was dismayed to discover that it did not conform to the prescribed format, thus necessitating assistance from a store representative. However, their response was less than helpful, as they maintained that no solution could be provided on-site and instead directed me to contact a distant hotline. Perplexed and frustrated, I couldn't fathom why I had even bothered visiting the store in the first place."

"Upon conveying my automotive conveyance to the establishment for repair, I was informed that the problem I had articulated was not, in fact, the actual concern, and that a more comprehensive disassembly of the transmission would be necessary, incurring a cost approximating $1000. It is rather amusing how the presence of engine oil emanating from the rear main seal can bear a resemblance to fresh transmission fluid; however, this was not the case. The justification provided by the mechanic for this diagnosis was based on an uncontaminated zone adjacent to the transmission pan, despite the fact that the leak was located farther up on the opposite side of the engine. While their proficiency may be adequate, it is certainly advisable to seek a second opinion, as they appear to capitalize on individuals who possess limited knowledge in this regard. Ultimately, my familiarity with the predicament and its associated costs, coupled with my awareness of the requisite repairs for my specific vehicle, enabled me to recognize the attempt to exploit me financially (either due to a lack of thorough troubleshooting, expertise, or a deliberate attempt to take advantage of my presumed ignorance)."

I recently endured the most unpleasant episode of my existence. I have been a member for six months, yet this was my maiden visit. I was led to believe that I could bring an acquaintance along, hence I brought my companion... he was the individual who inspired me to attend.  Upon arriving at the reception desk, I was informed that my associate could not gain admittance. Brandon, the manager, displayed a discourteous and condescending demeanor towards me. I requested the opportunity to converse with his superior; however, Pat, another manager, declined to communicate with me. This exchange consumed approximately five minutes, at which point the police arrived and instructed us to vacate the premises. Brandon failed to request my departure; instead, he summoned the authorities and had them order us to leave. I have never had the police summoned on me. Officer Stranger subsequently obtained my personal information and treated me as if I were a criminal, ultimately escorting me and my companion out of the building. If Brandon had merely asked me to leave, I would have complied. In light of this incident, I intend to terminate my membership and pray that I never encounter such a distressing situation again. The establishment demonstrated a complete lack of customer service and seemed indifferent to my concerns.

First and foremost, it is an unmitigated disaster that in a metropolitan area of this magnitude, there are no taxicabs readily available on the thoroughfares. Particularly in one of the primary nightlife districts, during the hours of 2-3 am when establishments are closing their doors, the absence of taxis cruising the streets is nothing short of a calamity. It is utterly reprehensible that in a city of this size, with a population density of this magnitude, there are no cabs accessible on the streets. Is it truly the objective of taxi companies to maximize profits or are they merely engaging in business as a leisure activity? 

Secondly, it is absolutely imperative that when a taxi is summoned via telephone, the taxi company in question dispatches a vehicle in a timely and efficient manner. It is utterly inexcusable for a taxi company to fail to deliver a taxi in a reasonable time frame, particularly after multiple assurances have been given to the effect that a taxi is en route. The experience of waiting thirty minutes for a taxi that never materialized, followed by a subsequent fifteen-minute wait that also proved futile, is simply unacceptable. 

Thanks to the incompetence and ineptitude of Yellow Cab, we were forced to trek 1.5 miles back to our place of lodging, which, under normal circumstances, would not have constituted a significant hardship. However, considering the lateness of the hour (3:30 am), our collective state of exhaustion, and the fact that one of our companions was afflicted with a painful knee injury, the entire ordeal was nothing short of a debacle. 

In light of the aforementioned grievances, it is with great animosity that we express our dissatisfaction with Yellow Cab. We shall be compelled to explore alternative transportation options in the future, with Green Cab being the prime candidate for our patronage.
Horrible horrible horrible service. We sat for 10 minutes and were not greeted so we got up to leave and all they did was wave us goodbye

This dining experience was unequivocally the most unpleasant culinary encounter I have had the misfortune of enduring at an MG establishment, with all five entrees (ordered for a large family) being served at an unacceptably low temperature, bordering on frigidity. Following a hasty reheating process, which was ostensibly executed via microwave, we were appalled to discover that each diner was engaged in a discourse regarding whose dish was the most insipid and lacking in flavor. As frequent patrons of MG, we were utterly dismayed by this anomalous occurrence, and our expectations for a satisfying meal were regretfully left unfulfilled. However, there were two notable exceptions to this generally unimpressive repast - the house salad dressing and the bread, both of which demonstrated a modicum of culinary proficiency.

"Extremely dissatisfied! They possess a regular customer program that they inadvertently exploit due to their inability to accurately monitor visitation frequencies, thus refusing to provide a physical document or card as evidence of one's attendance. This has led to unfortunate instances where my acquaintance has been wronged twice, totaling just a few dollars, yet they persist in their reluctance to rectify the issue despite our repeated attempts to address the problem. Furthermore, their service delivery is excruciatingly sluggish, exemplified by the prolonged two-hour duration required for a complete set of nail extensions. I strongly advise against patronizing this establishment. They have callously lost two devoted clients today, and their nonchalant attitude towards this situation speaks volumes about their business practices."

"It is with profound disappointment that I must convey my utter dissatisfaction with the reprehensible level of customer service I received during my multiple visits to this establishment, which, quite frankly, has left me feeling utterly disillusioned and disheartened. Specifically, I must draw attention to the flagrant lack of warmth and hospitality displayed by the staff during my visits, which, I must emphasize, were characterized by an unmitigated chilliness that bordered on outright hostility. Indeed, it is with great consternation that I recall the manner in which I was ignored and disregarded by the staff, despite my conspicuous efforts to engage them with a smile and direct eye contact. Furthermore, I find it utterly inexplicable that my husband, who entered the store subsequent to my arrival and was greeted with a cheerful 'hello,' was accorded a welcome that was patently denied me, leading me to wonder if there exists some sort of invidious criterion that determines the extent to which customers are acknowledged and addressed. Regrettably, this was not an isolated incident, as I have experienced similar treatment during my previous visits to the store, which has led me to the inescapable conclusion that it is futile to expect any semblance of cordiality or respect from this establishment. Consequently, I have elected to sever my patronage of this business and seek alternative vendors who value and appreciate their clientele."

"Alright, so I perpetually opt for placing an order here for delivery. I habitually procure a substantial quantity of orders during each instance, and have hitherto been content with the culinary offerings. However, whenever I request curry, they pose the query regarding the intensity of spiciness on a scale ranging from 1 to 5, and I customarily respond with a rating of 3. Nonetheless, upon receipt of my order, everyone who partakes of it expresses their sentiment that it resembles a rating of 5 in terms of piquancy, which is unfailingly 10 to 15 minutes behind schedule. It is rather vexing that they profess a specific duration of waiting time when they are unable to adhere to it punctually, particularly when I consistently place sizable orders, remunerate delivery charges, and extend generous gratuities! Notwithstanding these factors, I persist in placing orders, and on one occasion, I requested curry and specified a rating of 1 out of 5, mindful of the fact that there was no discernible divergence in the fiery nature of the curry relative to the customary rating of 3 we had previously employed. This continued unabated until the present day, whereupon I am indisposed and opted for soups and curry. She inquired about my preference for spiciness and was apprised that I did not relish it pungent, not even at a rating of 1 out of 5, given my current state of health. She conveyed an estimated waiting period of 30 to 40 minutes, to which I assented. And lo and behold! The wait extended beyond an hour, and the curry? It was excessively fiery! I am simply incensed by their consistent tardiness in deliveries and their ineffectuality in upholding the designated levels of spiciness, and it is my conviction that they should refrain from inquiring about the degree of spiciness desired by patrons, since they demonstrate a lack of proficiency in maintaining uniform standards across the spectrum of intensities ranging from 0 to 5."

"Conserve your financial resources.  As an individual who was brought up with the melodic offerings of the legendary Michael Jackson, I must say that my expectations were not met by this production.  In point of fact, it was a tedious and juvenile display that failed to captivate my attention for even a brief period of time.  Moreover, the seating arrangement was such that my line of sight was obstructed by the person positioned in front of me, which further detracted from my overall experience."
Worst service ever.  No one cares, was lied to, wasted my time, twice and ended up demanding a refund and taking business elsewhere.  NEVER AGAIN.

First time at Rio - check in at 5 took 20 minutes - now at taxi everyone trying leave Rio - this place suck & will never stay again - I stay cuz of friends - not worth my time or money!!! Stay away if u under 35

"Genghis Khan's military campaigns were thwarted by the formidable barrier of the Great Wall of China; regrettably, Arizona's borders do not possess the same level of security. We entered the establishment at 8 pm on a Saturday, and owing to the dearth of patronage, I conjectured that the venue might be in the process of closing. However, upon perusing the menu, it became apparent that the options for vegetables were somewhat limited, as certain items were available solely in a mixture, while others were either frozen or not adequately replenished. Furthermore, the selection of sauces was disappointingly meager, consisting of a few thick, gloppy varieties that were served in small metal ramekins. It is worth noting that the starch component of the dish was provided in the form of noodles or rice, although the latter was conspicuous by its absence following cooking. As the bowl was brought to our table, a gratuity was expected. Unfortunately, my culinary experience was not satisfactory, as the ingredients were not adequately cooked, resulting in some vegetables remaining raw, while the sauces were unremarkable despite generous quantities. Moreover, the peanut condiment tray was devoid of contents. In light of these factors, I shall be inclined to frequent YC's or MuShu instead, and would advise others to follow suit."

Wow...we came to this place by accident -- well my friend's husband wants to see their largest pint advertisement and it was huge, but that's about it.

There was live music playing, sound system wasn't the greatest so it was really really really loud. Be careful with your eardrums! 

I got my usual drink - a long island and man, they messed it up! They put a whole chunk of tequila instead of balancing it with rum, vodka, and gin! It was nasty. 

The boy got a cider and that too was eh. 

Overall, definitely a locals only bar...

"It appears that the ambiance and quality of this establishment have diminished significantly, as evidenced by the prolonged waiting period for unremarkable culinary offerings, which has led to a rather lackluster dining experience."

I created a yelp account just so i could comment on this restaurant because I w disgusted by the experience.  The waitstaff was horrible. The restaurant was not even busy. As people arrived, they made them wait 30 mins and then seated them at tables that had been open the entire time. The food was good but I will never go back given the horrible experience.

"Overpriced and underwhelming, I comprehend that when green beans are referred to as haricot verts, an elevated cost is anticipated; however, when ordering a dish and being presented with the option of haricot vert as a side, it appears unethical to incur an additional fee of $8. Such practices seem incongruous with the local demographic's financial means. Geographically adjacent to the Ritz Carlton, perhaps the establishment seeks to capitalize on the affluence associated with its illustrious neighbor; nevertheless, for those residing in the surrounding area, this eatery does not appear to be a suitable choice. Furthermore, the server's attention seemed to be diverted by the staff meal she was consuming, rather than attending to our needs. Thus, we express our gratitude and decline further interaction."

If I could give this place less than 1 star I would!  The drive thru service here is totally ignorant. All they have to do is read the screen and put the right food in the bag, in my case put the right amount of food. I've been here 3 times and every single time they have forgotten something. This is my first review and last from this place. Go down the road and get your orders right!!!\n\nThis management here is ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE.

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. We needed an inexpensive room for the weekend. Checking in was easy, staff was quick and courteous. We were told we would be staying at the Manor. The benefit to staying there was our car was close for us to use. However, you are not attached to the casino. The room was older as was the furniture. The king size bed was very new and very comfy, as were the pillows. We had a keurig for am coffee (something our friends at a higher end hotel didn't have). \nMy huge complaint is that 1 1/2hours prior to checkout our water was shut off. ( no flushing the potty, hot water to shower, washing your face/brushing your teeth). Water was returned 10 mins before we left. \nThis was not my first time in Vegas but it was the first and last time I will stay here.

"Extremely disheartened! My spouse and parent ventured to acquire hamburgers for the evening meal, given that I am nine months pregnant and not in the frame of mind to partake in culinary indulgences outside of the home. They placed the order and transported it back to our residence. Unfortunately, they failed to provide the restaurant staff with all of the necessary items, a fact that we did not become cognizant of until their arrival. Moreover, the omission of my order was particularly egregious, as it included a milkshake that lacked any semblance of sustenance or flavor, essentially rendering it a glorified glass of flavored milk. Furthermore, the exorbitant price point of four dollars and some cents for an Oreo chocolate shake is utterly unjustifiable. In light of these circumstances, my spouse has embarked on a mission to rectify the situation, while his own meal grows increasingly cold. Our attempts to contact the establishment have proven futile, as the phone line merely offers the option to communicate with headquarters, which would serve little purpose in addressing our grievances. Aggravation and frustration abound; it is unlikely that we shall return to this particular Smashburger in the future."

So I'm waiting in line to order take out and watch the 2nd round of the NFL playoffs, and the hostess informs me I have to be seated to order take out. Really? Fail!\n\nI'd like to give no stars if yelp allowed!

I am cognizant of the fact that reviews are ideally composed in a prompt manner subsequent to experiencing the event, however, I am compensating for lost time by penning this review and procrastinating the completion of a scholarly paper. My visit to this establishment transpired during the sweltering summer months, shortly after my unsuccessful attempt to gain admittance to Tryst (a nightclub renowned for its exclusivity and opulence). Regrettably, this venue was characterized by an excessively congested atmosphere, with patrons packed tightly together, rendering navigation through the throng a formidable challenge. Moreover, I was taken aback by an individual whose intentions were less than honorable, as he endeavored to touch my person in an inappropriate manner, prompting me to display remarkable physical strength, reminiscent of a protective parent, by forcefully repelling him against a nearby surface. Following this unsettling episode, I opted to sample a potent, albeit costly, Tokyo Tea, which unfortunately was not accompanied by a refund of my change, totaling twenty dollars, from the rather unscrupulous bartender. Although the bustling ambiance made it challenging to ascertain the accuracy of my claim, I ultimately received my rightful refund after a brief exchange. This nightlife destination is recommended for individuals seeking a casual romantic encounter, without being overly concerned with conventional standards of courtship. It is worth noting that what transpires in Las Vegas may potentially become the subject of discussion on social media platforms such as Yelp.

This establishment appears to be in a state of disarray and disorganization, evidenced by the prevalence of waste and rubbish throughout the premises. We had procured two tables and opted for the bottle service, which proved to be an unfortunate decision. The security personnel seem to lack proficiency in their duties, as demonstrated by their inadequate response to our innocuous comment regarding cannabis, which was made in a lighthearted manner. Subsequently, we were compelled to vacate the premises, with security personnel exhibiting aggressive behavior by extinguishing my cigarette and escorting me out. It is worth noting that smoking is permitted within the establishment, which may be a source of discomfort for some patrons. Our experience was further marred by the dearth of female attendees and the exorbitant entrance fee of $50, which seemed disproportionate to the quality of entertainment offered. In light of these factors, it is our recommendation that potential patrons seek alternative venues for their socializing needs, as this establishment appears to be in decline.

Had the taboule there. If it wasn't for me being as hungry as I was with little other options at the food court I would not have ate it. What was supposed to be bright green was bordering on brown. It resembled the color of canned spinach! Of course it looked like they threw a handful of fresh herbs in there to make it appear fresher and to get away with extending the life of this salad that should have just been tossed!! I had an upset stomach for 2 days after eating here. Yuk..

My acquaintance and I have visited this establishment on two consecutive Sundays, with the intention of observing the Chicago Bears while partaking in the culinary offerings and beverages provided by the Ventura Grill. The outdoor seating area, commonly referred to as the patio, is quite impressive, and the variety of beers available for consumption is satisfactory. However, it is unfortunate that the quality of service does not complement the ambiance and menu options, as it falls short of expectations, specifically in terms of timeliness and attentiveness. Our experiences have demonstrated prolonged waiting periods, both for acknowledgment and receipt of orders, which have surpassed reasonable time frames. For instance, the duration between placing an order for a hot dog and fries and its actual arrival has exceeded 45 minutes on multiple occasions. Additionally, replenishing one's beverage requires proactive planning, as the likelihood of receiving a refill in a timely manner is low, unless the current drink is nearly depleted. The root cause of these issues may be attributed to understaffing or inadequate operational planning, but regardless, it has resulted in disappointment and dissatisfaction with our dining experience.

One hour till closing and the teenagers they have running this place are shutting down the line and leaving the nastiest looking food on display --- and 8 customers walked in expecting something professional.\nI'm heading over to Signal Butte next time.

"Abysmal apothecary! Myriad occasions have transpired wherein they have botched my medications, and upon each occurrence, their response has been a dismissive 'once it leaves the pharmacy, nothing can be done,' accompanied by a complete lack of client-oriented demeanor. Consequently, I shall prolong my journey by 15 minutes to procure pharmaceuticals from a more competent and hospitable establishment, thereby avoiding future interactions with this inadequate and discourteous institution."

"My enthusiasm for Revs has waned considerably in the aftermath of their extensive refurbishment, as my recent dining experience was marred by various shortcomings, including the arrival of my meal in a frigid state and an unfortunate tendency towards overcooking, which rendered my table's beverages superfluous; furthermore, the cacophonous ambiance created by the blaring music made it challenging to engage in even the most basic conversations, and the prolonged duration between courses only exacerbated the already sluggish pace of service, culminating in an abrupt and unsolicited clearing of my table and the presentation of the bill, all of which contributed to an underwhelming and disappointing dining experience that is unlikely to induce my return on any regular basis, particularly on half-priced Mondays."

Just called for reservations was told to call back they were busy. Wow really that's how you treat customers? Thank goodness there are soo many other great options -restaurants who understand what good customer service is

"Desirous of sampling the culinary offerings of Beach Pizza, given its relative proximity in comparison to my customary haunt, Roccos NY Pizza, I opted to peruse their menu and assess the quality of their fare. A large three-item pizza, accompanied by a chicken parm sub and an order of buffalo wings, constituted my inaugural order. Unfortunately, the entirety of the cuisine proved to be lacking in substance and flavor, with the buffalo wings eliciting particular disappointment due to their unpleasant aroma, greasy texture, and meager quantity of wing sauce, leading me to consume only a few before discarding the remainder. The chicken parm sub, characterized by an overabundance of bread saturated with excessive amounts of sauce and cheese, resulted in a mushy texture that detracted from the overall dining experience. Furthermore, the pizza itself, reminiscent of Domino's, exhibited a cardboard-like crust, which, while not necessarily the worst, fell short of expectations. Considering the prices charged, the value offered did not seem particularly reasonable, especially when compared to establishments such as Pizza Hut, Dominos, or Papa John's, which offer comparable fare at a lower cost. Notwithstanding the preceding criticisms, the staff maintained a friendly and welcoming demeanor, and the speed of service was commendable. However, owing to the subpar quality of the food, I do not foresee a future visit."

I really want to like Zoe's Kitchen. I do. I really, really do. 

I have been to Zoe's more than 5 but less than 10 times, and yesterday was my last visit, unless I want to stop in for some limeade and chocolate cake. 

I have tried MANY things at Zoes, and I try to listen to what others like .... I don't like their bread at all, so every sandwich I've had has been bad. The quesadilla is OK, but I'm not a big fan of flour tortillas. The chicken roll ups (I think that's what it's called) that I had yesterday (after a good friend's recommendation) were kind of soggy and yuck-o. I don't like the pasta salad .... or the potato salad ... or their slaw .... or cold rice .... 

Do you see my challenge here? The decor is adorable, and I really want to love the place, but I think I've paid my very last visit to Zoes. 

So, so sad!

"The most unpleasant and distressing residential unit I have had the misfortune of inhabiting! My tenure in this domicile has only spanned two months, yet my wretchedness has already reached an unprecedented level. I would strongly advise against renting here, as the management team has displayed a flagrant disregard for tenants' well-being and privacy. Their discourteous behavior has led to five instances of harassment in just two months, and they have brazenly entered our apartment without consent on two separate occasions. In light of these facts, it is imperative that prospective residents seek alternative accommodations."

We invested an abundance of time with our offspring in the 2s and 3s class, during which we developed a plethora of apprehensions. In response, I composed a digital missive to the two instructors, in which I lauded them for their unwavering commitment and unrelenting effort. I also articulated our concerns in a detailed and expansive manner. Following an extensive period of interaction with the two educators, I had cultivated a profound admiration, respect, and affinity for them. However, they failed to respond to my electronic communication or engage in any subsequent dialogue with me. We received a message from the director, who, despite our considerable tenure in the classroom, summarily dismissed all of our anxieties and disinvited our son from the educational institution. This turn of events was not only distressing but also unexpected. Nevertheless, it ultimately proved to be a salubrious development for him. We successfully enrolled him in a play-based school that offered a more suitable environment, providing him with the necessary resources, including toilet training, nourishment, and a more reasonable tuition fee, as well as fewer and more flexible holidays. Furthermore, I have learned that the teacher is now instructing older children, which I believe is a more appropriate match for her skill set. Although the institution boasts a commendable staff and faculty, a picturesque setting, and charming pupils, it fails to offer a satisfactory value, catering conveniently to working parents while featuring an excessive number of holidays. We have concluded that Love & Logic does not align with our values and principles. I am left to ponder whether a pervasive atmosphere of pride hindered their capacity to engage in a productive discussion regarding my misgivings. Nonetheless, the notion that they are above scrutiny or criticism epitomizes arrogance and has resulted in the loss of a exceptional student, dedicated parents, and a positive evaluation.

We arrived at this establishment with the expectation of partaking in a delectable morning repast, based on the acclaim bestowed upon it by various online review platforms. However, it appears that we may have selected an inopportune moment to visit, as evidenced by the prolonged duration required to receive beverages and place our orders (approximately 10-15 minutes). Furthermore, our request for a creamer was not fulfilled in a timely manner, as the gentleman responsible for attending to our needs failed to return with the requested item, despite his initial assurance that he would do so. Instead, we were compelled to solicit the assistance of a busboy, who provided us with a soiled creamer replete with fresh jam residue on its base. Upon requesting a substitute creamer from our server, we were eventually furnished with a replacement. Disappointingly, our culinary selections did not meet our expectations. Specifically, the eggs benedict dishes we ordered (Florentine and crab, respectively) were subpar. The Florentine iteration was particularly underwhelming, as the eggs were unacceptably runny, and the asparagus components were minuscule and fragmented. As an ardent devotee of eggs florentine, I was taken aback by the absence of fresh asparagus, which was replaced by what appeared to be chopped artichoke hearts. Additionally, the English muffins accompanying our dishes were excessively buttered, thereby detracting from the overall quality of the meal. Ultimately, our experience at this venue was unsatisfactory, with the coffee being the sole redeeming aspect of our visit. Perhaps our selection of dishes was not optimal, leading to our disappointment with the restaurant's offerings.

Terrible service, waited 10 - 15 minutes for someone to show up at pharmacy and she was the most disgusting, nasty and inhospitable person I have ever encountered in my life.  Also bums hanging out at front door asking for money and when you do not give them money they curse at you, what a disgusting, nasty, awful place!

"Based on the five-star reviews posted here (two, to be precise), I opted to give this establishment a try. Unfortunately, it turned out to be a regrettable decision. Having had the pleasure of indulging in sushi at various renowned locations, including Tokyo's fish market, San Francisco, NYC, Stockholm, and Buenos Aires, with some being impressive and others lacking, this particular venue ranks among the poorest. A simple examination of the photograph I captured reveals the evident lack of freshness in the fish. The proprietor's Vietnamese background served as an ominous indication, which I should have heeded. The quality of the service was subpar, with the staff displaying an utter lack of courtesy, not even extending a cursory expression of gratitude. Furthermore, despite the presence of a Wi-Fi network detected on my mobile device, the owner asserted that it was reserved for exclusive use, a policy not commonly adopted by neighboring restaurants offering complimentary internet access. My order consisted of a 15-piece combination and seven avocado sushi rolls, accompanied by a bottle of water, totaling nearly CAD $20. The two five-star reviews appear suspicious, likely originating from acquaintances of the proprietor. This experience left me feeling utterly disillusioned."

Upon embarking on an exploratory excursion within my immediate surroundings, I stumbled upon an eatery that aroused my curiosity. Subsequently, I composed a critique of my visit, which unfolds thusly: Upon gaining ingress into the edifice, I inferred that the ambiance was somewhat incongruous with my preconceived notion of a traditional Thai culinary establishment. Specifically, the dearth of pungent seasonings typically associated with Thai cuisine, such as fish sauce and fiery peppers, struck me as peculiar. Furthermore, my companion's order of pad Thai fell short of expectations, eliciting a sense of disappointment due to its unremarkable flavor profile. Similarly, the Thai ice coffee and tea failed to impress, their mediocrity only exacerbating our collective disenchantment. In conclusion, my experience at this purported Thai food venue proved underwhelming, prompting me to formulate a steadfast resolution never to return.

"I returned to the aforementioned establishment, as I had encountered an unfortunate situation involving a flat tire, which necessitated towing services. However, upon my arrival, I was dismayed to discover that the warranty on my tires would not be honored, allegedly due to excessive mileage. It is worth noting that I had previously invested $2100 in both rims and tires at this very location. The staff then attempted to coerce me into purchasing Sumitomo tires, which I have since learned are of inferior quality. In order to avoid further dealing with such dubious business practices, I opted to procure tires from a nearby Discount Tire store, located just across the street. Suffice it to say, my experience with this particular enterprise was utterly unsatisfactory, and I would strongly advise against patronizing them in the future. This unfortunate sequence of events transpired approximately one and a half years ago."

"It is with profound regret that I must convey my utter dissatisfaction with the Indian cuisine served at this establishment, which unfortunately failed to meet my expectations in terms of quality and freshness. The culinary offerings presented before me were not merely unimpressive but also lacked the pungency and aroma that are quintessential attributes of authentic Indian fare. As an individual hailing from India, I possess a discerning palate that can readily distinguish between freshly prepared dishes and those that have been recycled from previous days' menus. Unfortunately, the latter was the case during my visit to this restaurant, which resulted in a disappointing gastronomic experience that did not justify the financial outlay required for such a meal."

"We encountered an analogous predicament with the 45-minute prior check-in requirement. It has come to my attention that certain airlines, including Allegiant, adhere to a 30-minute threshold prior to check-in, purportedly due to security concerns. We found ourselves at the 35-minute mark, thus, we were unequivocally denied boarding by the gate agents. Furthermore, we were informed that the computer systems had been deliberately halted as a safety measure, a stipulation mandated by federal regulations. This peculiar occurrence seemed to contradict our previous experiences with Allegiant, which did not implement such stringent policies. \n\nConsequently, we were compelled to spend the night in Reno and await the next available flight. Upon attempting to board, my acquaintance was notified that his luggage exceeded the maximum size restrictions for overhead compartments, thereby incurring an additional fee. Moreover, a couple situated ahead of us in the queue had a piece of luggage weighing 51 pounds, surpassing the permissible limit by a single pound. The woman began to vociferously express her discontent and promptly removed various items from her luggage, transferring them into carry-on bags. While I comprehend the importance of adhering to established guidelines, I cannot help but feel that such rigid enforcement and lack of flexibility regarding minor infractions undermines the fundamental principles of customer satisfaction. Therefore, I shall persist in favoring airlines like Southwest and Allegiant, which appear to prioritize passenger contentment."

Absolutely the worst choice for our first meal in Vegas. This place is completely overpriced and the staff was inattentive. Miguel seemed annoyed we didn't want to order right away, but chose to enjoy an appetizer first. The sushi is about the same as the local convenience store. I would rate it zero stars.
We got there late at 9 am.  Such A LONG line, but there were tons of tables so I don't understand.  Waited thirty minutes and left.  It was 11/11/13 .  I'll use open table next time.

One of the most unpleasant hotel experiences I have had the misfortune of encountering. Initially, it is worth mentioning that we paid a mere $62, inclusive of tax and resort fees, for a single night's stay, thus our expectations were not particularly elevated. Nonetheless, we explicitly requested a non-smoking room, yet we were assigned a room that reeked of cigarette smoke, which was utterly repulsive. 

We were, however, upgraded from the most basic and smallest room category to a so-called "King Suite." Regrettably, this upgrade merely translated to a slightly larger bed, which was modestly comfortable, and an irregularly shaped room that was somewhat more spacious. The television set was positioned at such a distance from the bed that the remote control proved ineffective unless we physically rose from bed and traversed the room. 

The room was clean, albeit somewhat antiquated, and despite setting the air conditioning unit to 66 degrees Fahrenheit, my companion and I both awakened in a state of perspiration during the night due to the oppressive heat. 

The WiFi connection, which is frequently complimentary in even the most affordable hotels, cost $12 for a mere 24 hours. Moreover, unlike the Cosmopolitan, where I could access the internet from any location within the building, my connectivity was restricted to the confines of our room, and the signal was not merely patchy but also prone to frequent disconnections. 

Lastly, the shower in our bathroom only yielded tepid water in the morning, which was thoroughly disappointing. In conclusion, we were eager to vacate this establishment as soon as possible.

My daughter got very sick from eating a burger here and when we complained the manager did give us a free meal if we returned. We went back a few months later and my husband got sick this time after eating some wings. I have not been impressed with the food  overall here and the service has been even worse. I have never been to the bar area here...only the restaurant. I would never go back and would not recommend this particular Native New Yorker.

So, I feel like a complete idiot for getting sucked in by Winder Farms a second time. Too many extra fees, you have to babysit the delivery man and accounting for credits due, overpriced milk, bread and produce that never lasts until the expiration date, and of course the small print in the contract that requires 40 deliveries before cancellation or a $50+ cancellation fee. It doesn't seem like a big deal until you realize what a waste of money it all is and find yourself skipping every delivery. You are better off buying your milk and bread at Trader Joes or Fresh & Easy and your produce at the farmers' market.

"It appears that the staff members are experiencing a profound sense of dissatisfaction with their current existential state, which is manifesting itself in a perceptible aura of discontent and despair. Moreover, we were compelled to endure an unacceptable duration of 15 minutes before the server accorded us even a cursory acknowledgement, which only served to exacerbate our already mounting frustration. It is my conviction that a judicious administration of vitamin D would significantly enhance their quality of life and overall well-being."

This particular venue purportedly caters to local patrons; however, it is utterly absurd and inexplicable that the establishment would intentionally operate in such a manner. The prices for beverages are exorbitant, and the customer service is subpar, according to accounts provided by individuals who reside in the vicinity. If your objective is to experience enjoyment and amusement, it is recommended that you visit the South Point Casino on Fridays, where the price of well drinks is a mere $2, and the atmosphere is more welcoming and hospitable. It appears that the primary focus of this establishment is to extract funds from patrons for the purpose of enhancing its physical appearance, rather than providing an genuine and satisfying experience for visitors. Additionally, it is advisable to avoid utilizing the pay phones located within the premises, as the charges can be unexpectedly high due to a third-party service provider that operates under questionable business practices.

Let me start by saying, I had hoped for great things  at Rao's. I mean the place was packed, we had to wait to get in. The food looked and smelled great. But then after waiting over a half hour, we finally get seated, and then reality hit! Rao's is great if you have no sense of taste and love bland food. They are known for their meatballs so a few of us ordered those. Let me tell you, the meatballs in the frozen section at the supermarket were better. Very bland. The lasagna? Again, not the worst I have ever had but very far from the best. Again, the ladies at the local church make better pasta dishes than Rao's and their lasagna does not cost $30. But the worst of the meal was the peas, onions and prosciutto.  What were they thinking? The  prosciutto was so tasteless! How do you make it so bland? \n\nAnyhow if you are thinking of eating at Rao's, don't. If you want to spend big bucks on a meal in Vegas, go over to the Bellagio and try their buffet, the locals love it. Or try FireFly Tapas over on Paradise Rd. I'm a foodie that's been coming to Vegas for 10 years. Don't waste your money here, unless of course, you enjoy spending big money on food with no flavor at all.

I really been wanting to try this place for a while but unfortunately my experience was a sad one :(. The good stuff i saw: a good variety of beers and drinks, extensive menu  and online ordering available.

I got 3 tacos and 1 arepa, the food was really good but I don't think I'll be waiting another 45 minutes for some tacos, especially when the concept of the restaurant is fast food. 

The tables were really dirty and no one was checking this aspect of the place after people were leaving their tables. I think that it has great potential if it's properly staffed and some training is involved for customer service.

Having so many fantastic establishments in Charlotte, I won't be wasting my patience here again :(

I am currently stationed at the bar, indulging in a prolonged period of sitting that has thus far transpired over the course of 20 minutes, and yet, much to my utter dismay and profound disappointment, I have yet to be acknowledged, let alone greeted, by a solitary member of the bar staff, including but not limited to bar tenders, waitresses, or indeed any other employee who might be presumed to be responsible for extending a modicum of hospitality towards patrons such as myself.

Unless you possess an absence of alternative venues, refrain from visiting this establishment. The ambiance exudes antiquity and neglect, while the culinary offerings are subpar. My experience with the taco salad exemplified this sentiment, comprising primarily of wilted iceberg lettuce, canned olives, desiccated shredded poultry, and a solitary dollop of guacamole and sour cream. The combination elicited a strong aversion, prompting me to consider acquiring sustenance from a nearby convenience store, specifically a bag of chips and beef jerky.

My wife and I were only in Phoenix for a night, and figured we would try some Mexican food  seeing as we had never been in the Southwest before.  Our 1st restaurant down the street never got around to serving us, so we came to Rosalita`s figuring it might have authentic Mexican cuisine.

It was brutal.

The service was atrocious, as one poor guy was working both the bar and the "lounge" area which had about 8 tables full.  He was pleasant, but completely overwhelmed.

The food itself tasted as if it had been left out all day and simply reheated.  The chips were stale and the salsa tasted suspiciously like the crappy Ortega stuff you buy in the supermarket.  My shrimp dish was so disastrous that I only ate half of it because I was afraid it might make me sick.  The shrimp were overcooked to the point of turning into rubber, and the sauce was nauseating.  The rice was overcooked and dry, and the green salad of lettuce and carrots was steamed!   This was without a doubt the worst mexican I have ever eaten in my life.

My wife thought her tacos were bland, but much more edible than my shrimp, even though the cheese was not authentic, or tasty at all.

The culinary experience at this establishment underwent a transformation in 2004, whereupon the proprietorship shifted hands and the gastronomic offerings underwent a significant metamorphosis, resulting in an unfortunate diminution in quality, as attested by a disgruntled patron who expressed profound disappointment with their recent luncheon visit, citing the uninspired fare and lackluster service as primary factors in their dissatisfaction, thereby warranting a rating of zero stars.
Sloooow service. Basically they seat you and forget about you. I watched it happen to everyone who came in. Food wasn't very good, either.

"Tick, tock; the relentless cadence of time's inexorable passage, mocking my impatience with its methodical rhythm. Tick, tock; the line, stationary, yet seemingly alive, taunting me with its unyielding stasis. Tick, tock; my mind, clouded by the lingering effects of last night's indulgences, craves the stimulating elixir that only a steaming cup of coffee can provide. Tick, tick, tick; the anticipation builds, as I rummage through my wallet, extracting the Starbucks RedCard, a symbol of my commitment to supporting AIDS research, while simultaneously taking advantage of the complimentary wifi. Tick, tock; the tension mounts, as I await my turn, only to be met with disappointment, courtesy of an empty croissant display case and a curt dismissal, due to their non-acceptance of their own Starbucks cards. Tick, tock; time appears to slow, as I endure the interminable wait, only to be met with further frustration, at the discovery that the establishment does not offer wifi. FINALLY, my turn arrives, but alas, the experience has been marred by the staff's brusque demeanor. Time's up; this place, a utter waste."

I am utterly unable to provide an assessment of this establishment due to the extremely distressing occurrence that transpired during my most recent visit. Previously, I had frequented this bar accompanied by a group of 5-8 individuals on each occasion, and we had always relished the culinary offerings and enjoyed engaging in gaming activities. The servers had consistently displayed exceptional levels of professionalism and courtesy towards us. However, upon entering the premises on Saturday, February 11th, 2012, in the company of my romantic partner, with the intention of partaking in lunch, beverages, and viewing a sporting event featuring the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, we were met with a situation that was utterly unprecedented and profoundly disconcerting. Specifically, at approximately noon, every table and chair within the establishment was reserved, despite the fact that a significant portion of the seating area remained unoccupied. In response to this unexpected development, a robust gentleman emerged from the kitchen and, without bothering to address us directly or solicit our preferences, proceeded to inquire of a nearby couple whether they would be willing to accommodate two additional individuals at their table. Now, while I have never been averse to sharing a table with strangers, the particular arrangement he offered us was highly unsatisfactory, as it involved seating us with our backs to the primary televisions and necessitated that we gaze obliquely across the room in order to observe the smaller screens. Upon requesting an alternative seating arrangement, we were met with open hostility and discourteous behavior on the part of the aforementioned gentleman. It is my considered opinion that this episode constitutes a grave indictment of the quality of service provided by this establishment, and I must confess that I harbor serious misgivings regarding the propriety of their customer relations policies. Furthermore, I am compelled to wonder whether a more enlightened approach, predicated upon the principle of first come, first served, might not have obviated the unfortunate events that transpired during my visit.

"Having concluded a medical consultation, we opted to halt at this establishment in light of our pressing hunger. Upon entering, we were ignored by the cashier who appeared preoccupied with resolving a payment processing dilemma. Following a brief interval, she condescended to acknowledge our presence with a cursory greeting and led us to a table that still exhibited evidence of the preceding patrons' generosity. A protracted waiting period ensued during which no hospitality was proffered, compelling us to vacate the premises in search of more attentive service and affordable fare. Our culinary quest ultimately led us to a nearby Farmer Boys restaurant, where we savored a satisfying repast for approximately half the cost of the proposed Denny's expenditure."

If you are seeking a luxury condominium, it is imperative that you conduct a thorough search to ensure that you procure a residence that aligns with your expectations. It is essential to recognize that these dwellings are, in fact, apartments and not condominiums. The presence of speed bumps and limited parking spaces can be a significant hindrance to the enjoyment of your living space. Furthermore, the private ownership of these residences enables anyone to inhabit them, often resulting in a cohabitation of diverse individuals with varying levels of respect for the noise level and consideration for fellow residents. Moreover, the security personnel assigned to maintain order within the community often display a lackadaisical attitude towards their responsibilities, rendering them unreliable in times of need. Additionally, the occurrence of break-ins and vandalism within the gated community serves as a testament to the inadequacy of the security measures in place. The Homeowners Association (HOA) proves to be of little assistance in addressing these issues, and the allowance of HUD residency further diminishes the property value of your home. The Points recreational area serves as a temporary haven for those who are unable to escape the cycle of high mortgage payments for an apartment that does not meet their standards. Therefore, it is crucial to exercise caution when purchasing a residence and ensure that it meets your requirements to avoid dissatisfaction.

After my previous unsatisfactory experiences, I made a solemn promise to myself to only visit this Sonic establishment during their Happy Hour promotion, when beverages are offered at a discounted rate. Unfortunately, it appears that the establishment was unable to fulfill their obligation to provide the advertised special, as my husband and daughter, who both ordered drinks containing Nerds, did not receive the promised candy component. We proceeded through the drive-thru and had nearly reached our destination when I requested a sample of my husband's beverage, and upon tasting it, I observed that while the cherry flavor was satisfactory, the Nerds were conspicuously absent. My husband concurred with my assessment, stating that he had not detected any Nerds in his drink either. We then examined our daughter's beverage and found that it too lacked the Nerds that were advertised. Considering the distance we had traveled and the inconvenience of returning to the establishment, we decided against pursuing the matter further, though we were undoubtedly disheartened by the experience.

"I would not advocate for patronizing this establishment, as my companion and I experienced an unfortunate sequence of events. My companion had an intense craving for beignets, which led me to inquire with three separate individuals within the restaurant regarding their availability. They assured us that beignets were indeed available that evening. Upon being seated and placing our order, including beignets and French onion soup, the wait staff returned several minutes later to inform us that, regretfully, they did not possess the aforementioned pastry. Furthermore, the French onion soup we received was excessively salted, rendering it inedible for my taste buds. Considering the abundance of authentic French cafes along the Strip, I would suggest exploring alternative options."

"Today, we visited the establishment and encountered an extremely discourteous server. Subsequently, another server brought us complimentary tortilla chips and salsa, which our party erroneously presumed to be an integral component of the meal, thereby prompting us to consume them. The primary server then inquired as to who would be responsible for the cost of the chips they had provided gratuitously... We categorically declined to compensate for the mistake, which was not attributable to us. 

The server repeatedly queried us on three separate occasions regarding the method of payment for the total of eight individuals. We requested the separation of bills each time, to which she responded with visible irritation and a dismissive tone, uttering, "Okay, then..." in a manner that could be perceived as derogatory. Based on this experience, it is unlikely that we will return to this specific venue. 

Furthermore, we were compelled to request water and the beverages we had ordered on three separate occasions before they were finally provided. Ultimately, the manager intervened to address the situation, which partially redeemed the excursion. Notwithstanding the aforementioned issues, the culinary offerings were, in fact, quite satisfactory..."

"It is abundantly evident that my culinary expectations were not merely unfulfilled, but utterly decimated during my recent visit to this establishment, as the putative 'fried shrimp' dish I opted for not only lacked even a modicum of gastronomical sophistication, but also precipitated a profound sense of nausea and disgust, prompting me to discard the offending item and seek refuge in the relative safety of my own digestive system; furthermore, the dearth of competence exhibited by the cashier, who appeared to be oblivious to the fundamental concept of a 'combo meal,' only served to exacerbate my already considerable frustration and disillusionment with the dining experience as a whole."

"Have you ever had the unfortunate experience of dining at an establishment where the culinary offerings were satisfactory, yet the quality of service and customer care was so subpar that it precludes any future visits? For me, that was the case at Rosati's this evening. Following my perusal of their online menu, I opted to place a telephonic order, as the prices listed seemed reasonable. However, upon querying the total cost to the cashier, she presented me with a printed copy of the menu, which revealed discrepancies between the prices on the website and those on the physical menu. When I brought this to her attention, she offered an explanation that lacked coherence. I countered by positing that, in my opinion, it would be appropriate for them to honor the prices advertised on their website. Her response was taciturn and dismissive, as she merely handed me my change without even a cursory expression of gratitude (a clear indication of a discourteous demeanor). My request to confer with the manager was met with an assertion that he was unavailable, which only exacerbated my frustration. Were I the proprietor of such an establishment, I would unhesitatingly ensure that the prices on the website were aligned with those on the physical menu, sans any equivocation or surliness. Alas, it appears that Rosati's has failed to recognize the importance of providing adequate customer service, thereby compromising the overall dining experience and fostering a negative reputation. This unfortunate incident serves as a prime exemplar of the adverse effects of poor customer service on an otherwise respectable eatery."

"Due to factors that remain enigmatic to my comprehension, I endeavored to partake of a culinary experience at this establishment during the evening hours. As has been customary on previous occasions, securing a seat presented a formidable challenge, irrespective of whether the venue was occupied to capacity or not. Upon successfully acquiring a table, I was confronted by an individual who elected to engage in conversation with the patrons seated behind me, while simultaneously emitting noxious fumes from an electronic pipe. This occurrence prompted an incredulous response from me, characterized by utter disbelief and indignation. Holding the management of this restaurant accountable for permitting such a flagrant breach of etiquette, I have decided to sever my association with this dining establishment. If given the option, I would unhesitatingly select a rating of zero to convey my profound dissatisfaction."

It appears that the culinary offerings at this establishment are of exceptional quality, and I regret not having had the opportunity to sample them. However, I must admit that the dismissive behavior exhibited by the staff towards me upon my entrance was sufficient enough to deter me from patronizing this business further. Specifically, upon entering the premises, I was met with complete disregard, despite my cordial greeting directed towards the individual stationed behind the counter. Subsequently, I proceeded to the counter, only to be snubbed once again. When I finally managed to place my order, I made an attempt to utilize a promotional coupon, but was curtly informed that it was invalid. My query regarding the matter was met with an unhelpful and terse response, leaving me feeling disrespected and annoyed. Considering that I have been subjected to such discourteous treatment while wearing a name badge, I deemed it unnecessary to continue interacting with this establishment. Consequently, I elected to take my business elsewhere, which elicited an indifferent shrug from the staff member in question. Ultimately, neither party has suffered a significant loss as a result of this incident.

I eat at cafe rio at least once a week. Not once has it crossed my mind to write a review because the food speaks for it's self. Unfortunately I had a horrible experience with the cashier at this location so I felt the need to write a review. The line was extremely long and not to order your food, to pay. Might want to look into hiring competent workers, who actually want to work and not gossip while the line backs up.

We had the pleasure of convening a group of thirteen individuals for a dual-purpose celebration, specifically a birthday and football gathering. I must say, our experience at this particular venue was utterly disappointing and subpar. Upon attempting to gain entry, we were met with an unfriendly and unaccommodating demeanor by the door attendant. It is truly perplexing that such an establishment would fail to recognize the potential financial benefits of accommodating a sizable group of patrons on a Sunday afternoon, especially given the popularity of football in the region. Furthermore, our attire was suitable for the occasion, rendering the door attendant's behavior all the more baffling. In conclusion, I strongly advise against allocating funds towards this establishment, as there are numerous superior alternatives in the vicinity of Scottsdale that can provide a more satisfying experience for your social and culinary needs.

I infrequently compose reviews; hence, for me to register and draft a review implies that the service was APPALLING. Commencing from the outset, I paid in excess of $40.00 for an oil change and an upgraded car wash, only to be left with an interior that was FAR FROM SPOTLESS, side door panels that were UNTOUCHED, and a vehicle that began LEAKING a substance following the supposed'maintenance'. The technician persistently endeavored to coerce me into compensating for supplementary services... articulating, "I merely observed a singular entity..." prior to recognizing ANOTHER "entity" and subsequently ANOTHER "entity" whenever I declined to finance the aforementioned "entity". Furthermore, abrasions on the exterior of my automobile came to my attention, which I had not noticed previously, and my offspring bore witness to one of the staff members displaying GANG SIGNS. Suffice it to say, even when my vehicle was leaking fluid subsequent to my excursion, I was NOT GOING TO TAKE MY CAR BACK... NOT EVER.

I have always had a good time at Top Shelf, but last nights visit proved different.  Are server was preoccupied with a baby at the bar then taking care of his customers.  I ate 2/3 of my dinner without anything to drink because he didn't check on us.  My food was cold and my tacos were so greasy that the grease was pouring out the bottom and the shells fell apart. While still finishing my undelightful  dinner, the server finally asked if we needed anything else or wanted desert.  I asked for water and my husband asked for more tea.  It took over 5 minutes to get the drinks.  My husbands tea glass was completely packed with ice and 2/3 full with tea, there was so much ice that he could not even mix a sweet n low in it. I will try one more time, but think I may have to love on to somewhere else.

I have afforded this establishment multiple opportunities to demonstrate its proficiency in providing adequate customer service, but alas, my efforts have been consistently thwarted by the egregious behavior of the staff. The garments sold here may be of sufficient quality for a fleeting duration, but the reprehensible demeanor of the sales associates precludes me from ever considering a return visit. It appears that the human resources department has accomplished an impressive feat in amassing such an unpleasant assemblage of individuals. Moreover, the ear-piercing, high-pitched alarm that incessantly emanates from the cash register only serves to exacerbate my already unfavorable opinion of this store. In light of these factors, I shall redirect my patronage to a more suitable retailer, such as the one located at Fashion Square.

I had the displeasure of partaking in a family outing to this establishment with my three offspring, and the experience was utterly disappointing, to say the least. The financial investment of forty dollars was not only unjustified but also thoroughly lamentable, as the quality of the food and service failed to meet our expectations. In light of the abundance of superior alternatives in the local area, I would strongly advise against visiting this buffet, as it falls short of providing an enjoyable dining experience.

"Abysmal. I failed to experience any semblance of satisfaction during my initial visit. My gel manicure exhibited an unacceptable level of imperfection, manifesting in the form of unsightly bubbles and cracks. Upon returning a fortnight later for a routine polish alteration, I was subjected to an excruciating procedure by Cindy, the individual responsible for the mutilation of my digits. She instructed me to immerse my fingers in acetone for a mere second before employing a dremel to ravage my natural nails, mindless of the fact that they were not artificially enhanced. The traumatic ordeal left six of my fingers with lacerations on both the cuticles and epidermis, while the remaining four fingers remained unscathed, an enigma that continues to elude me. Following this harrowing episode, I was coerced into submerging my injured fingers in both acetone and alcohol, intensifying the agony I endured. The outcome of this distressing escapade left me with six hemorrhaging phalanges, yet I was still expected to tender the full payment. I emphatically advise against patronizing this establishment; there are numerous alternative nail salons that offer superior service and expertise."

I went to the bar last night (sat) and it took FOREVER to get my drink. I order a Long Island, when I got it the drink was CLEAR! I told the bartender \"Ashely\" that my drink wasn't right and she had the nerve to take a drink out of my drink and told me \"it taste fine and I not making you a new one\"! WTF don't ever go here!

The acquisition of a LocalDine prompted an eager anticipation to experience the culinary offerings of the establishment, however, upon arriving on Friday, May 24th, 2013, it was discovered that the contract had expired five days prior, thereby rendering the July expiration coupon invalid, which resulted in a profound disappointment regarding the quality of the fare, specifically, the meager portion of turkey in a sandwich priced at nine dollars, which elicited a strong negative reaction, ultimately leading to the decision not to return.

I am an individual with fastidious inclinations when it comes to the quality of service proffered by restaurants; thus, I anticipate and demand competent and attentive service, which, in turn, determines the extent of my gratuity. In this instance, the service met my expectations, yet the culinary offerings left much to be desired. Specifically, I sampled a half-rack of the establishment's purportedly acclaimed baby back ribs, only to find the meat devoid of any discernible flavor and unacceptably desiccated. Furthermore, the two sides I requested, specifically the fried okra and macaroni and cheese, were subpar, with the latter bearing a striking resemblance to a store-bought Kraft Macaroni & Cheese product. Additionally, I opted for the three-item sampler, comprising onion straws, fried pickles, and burnt ends, which arrived swimming in an excessive pool of oil, rendering the entire dish soggy and unpalatable. For the sake of comparison, TGI Fridays' baby back ribs boast significantly superior flavor and texture, making them a vastly preferable option. Suffice it to say, I shall not be revisiting this establishment in the future, and my overall assessment warrants a solitary star, solely attributed to the satisfactory service I received.

I personally entered the establishment and inquired about the status of my computer that was purportedly being mended, to which the staff member retorted with a query of his own, the essence of which was, "Are you capable of doing so?" His rejoinder was not only discourteous but also engendered an atmosphere of unease and discomfort. Subsequently, I was compelled to endure a protracted waiting period of approximately twenty-five minutes during which the employee remained stationary, exhibiting an utter lack of concern or expediency. Ultimately, my experience at this particular business was unsatisfactory, and I would strongly advise against visiting it.

The servers were extremely rude and rushy. \nThe man wouldnt allow us to get our table until everyone arrived. Even though 5/7 people were already there. We didnt get our drinks until 25 mins after we were seated. Food wasnt that flavorful. The servers don't make eyecontact with you and The tables are extremely close to each other.

"The culinary experience offered by this establishment fails to impress, as the fare provided is unremarkable and overpriced, particularly in light of the fact that the grilled options are marketed as a premium feature. Furthermore, the dining area appears to be poorly maintained, as evidenced by the presence of insects on our table, which the staff seemed to dismiss as a fabrication until further sightings necessitated a cursory cleaning of the surface with a dishrag. Considering the substantial cost of our meal, which exceeded one hundred fifty dollars, we anticipated a higher level of service quality and a more fastidious approach to maintaining a sanitary environment. In contrast, Ohjah offers a superior dining experience, characterized by a more pleasant ambiance, flavorful cuisine, fresh sushi, and a markedly improved level of customer service."

I have been a loyal patron of Sprint for over a decade, during which time I have consistently paid for their services on a monthly basis. However, despite my dedication to the company, I have yet to experience the benefits of utilizing a 4G phone with rapid service speeds. In fact, Sprint has been making the same promises regarding the installation of new towers for the past five years, but they have yet to follow through on these claims. As such, I would advise against investing in their services until they can demonstrate tangible improvements in their network infrastructure.

"Uncertainty permeated the atmosphere as I endeavored to comprehend the unforeseen transformation that had beset the establishment, which had hitherto been renowned for its exceptional culinary offerings and hospitable ambiance. Previously, I had visited this location multiple times, typically during the early afternoon hours, and had always been impressed by the superior quality of the food and the attentive demeanor of the staff. However, on this particular Friday afternoon, at approximately 4 pm, I was taken aback by the stark contrast in the level of service I received. Specifically, I encountered an unprecedented degree of discourtesy and indifference from the staff, who seemed to be utterly disinterested in my presence, despite my repeated attempts to solicit their attention. As a seasoned Wahoo enthusiast, having patronized the original location in Orange County on numerous occasions, I was taken aback by the stark disparity in the quality of service between the two establishments. Furthermore, I was compelled to request a menu, a task that proved to be remarkably challenging, as it required me to hail the attention of the server/bartender, who appeared to be preoccupied with other patrons. Subsequently, I was informed by the manager that I would need to relocate, as there were patrons who wished to engage in the video gambling machines situated in the bar area. This pronouncement was accompanied by a gesture that struck me as peculiar, specifically, the manager patted the bar counter in front of the machine, an action that seemed to underscore the notion that the establishment's primary focus was now centered on gambling, rather than the traditional emphasis on providing an enjoyable dining experience. I must confess that I found the cold shoulder and curt attitude displayed by the staff to be entirely unwarranted, and it is with a heavy heart that I must forgo my Wahoo fix until such time as I find myself back in Orange County, where the authentic spirit of Wahoo remains alive and well."

"The personnel within this establishment exhibit an egregious lack of proficiency in their roles, rendering them utterly incompetent and unworthy of employment. It is a travesty that such individuals are recruited while capable job seekers remain unoccupied. Their discourteous behavior towards certain patrons, including myself, is particularly reprehensible. During my recent visit, the young woman attending to my order abandoned her post mid-transaction, leaving me ignored for an extended period of approximately five minutes. Her eventual return was prompted by my vociferous summons. The culinary offerings were unremarkable and suspiciously reminiscent of reheated leftovers, which only exacerbated my dissatisfaction with the prolonged wait of over twenty minutes for a simple sandwich and pizza slice. My experience was so dismal that I felt embarrassed to be associated with this enterprise in any capacity, and I strongly suggest that the staff familiarize themselves with the concept of treating all clientele with dignity and respect."

"Comprehensive Evaluation of Pros and Cons: 

Advantages:
Convenient location for individuals residing in close proximity

Disadvantages:
Frequently encountered unprofessional and discourteous staff (three instances out of three visits)
Consistently tardy appointments, even during mornings, raising concerns regarding attendance
Inadequate climate control, resulting in an uncomfortable atmosphere reminiscent of the 1960s, with patrons gazing at one another anxiously while the temperature outside surpassed 100 degrees Fahrenheit
Experienced prolonged waiting periods exceeding an hour, followed by an unclear response regarding the approximate duration of my wait, ultimately prompting my departure
In Conclusion - Individuals seeking to avoid mental distress caused by staff, unnecessary delays, and potential exposure to influenza amidst a chilly ambiance, are advised to visit the conventional Summerlin Labcorp facility, despite a slightly longer commute."

I just purchased a glazed and chocolate covered donut here. Both were very stale and must have been sitting on the shelf for a  very long time. I took one bite from each then threw them into the trash where they belong. You would think Dunkin Donuts would keep fresh goods on their shelves.

Beware, individuals possessing a darker complexion or failing to conform to the dominant culture are at risk of facing discriminatory treatment. Avoidance of such establishments is crucial to prevent perpetuation of harmful stereotypes and prejudices. My companion and I experienced a twenty-minute delay in receiving our culinary order, which typically requires only a few minutes preparation time. We have resolved to refrain from future visits, as our expectations for a welcoming environment were not met. It is disheartening to recognize that such biases continue to persist in modern society...smh
Overpriced and food wasn't good! It was a wild place with all the going on with the employees dressing up going around giving free shots etc., but food was bad and pricey!

I rarely allocate sufficient time to express my sentiments regarding subpar accommodations; however, I feel compelled to voice my disappointment with regard to our recent stay at "the Paris" hotel. The staff's behavior was discourteous and unprofessional, exemplified by the waiters, valets, and housekeeping personnel. The room itself was unsanitary, featuring conspicuous stains, outdated amenities (absence of an iPod docking station), and a chipped bathtub. In contrast, I have had the pleasure of experiencing superior hospitality at various establishments in the downtown area. It is worth mentioning that upon hearing a knock on the door, it is imperative to hasten one's pace and ensure a prompt response, lest the housekeeping staff unceremoniously enter the room while its occupant is in a state of undress. Suffice it to say, I shall never again consider "the Paris" as a viable lodging option.

I procured a Groupon voucher valued at $16, redeemable for a sum of $8, at this particular Quiznos establishment. It is reasonable to assume that an individual of high school graduate age should possess the cognitive abilities necessary to accurately process said transaction by subtracting $16 from the total cost and providing the remaining balance. However, this expectation proved to be erroneous, as the employee in question deducted $7.36 prior to taxation and an additional $8 following taxation. This resulted in a discrepancy of $1.34, which is unacceptable given the already inflated prices of this Quiznos location within a strip casino food court. Therefore, I strongly advise potential patrons to exercise caution and consider alternative dining options.

food was 7/10, however the service was absolutely atrocious.  the place is understaffed and nobody took our order or even offered to get us drinks for 15 minutes. the couple sitting next to us had been waiting even longer.  this is such a shame for a restaurant to be held back its service, of all things.

"Upon reflecting on my experiences at this establishment, I must say that my expectations have been consistently disappointed. Despite my attempts to afford this location the benefit of the doubt, the recurring themes of subpar service and questionable cleanliness have rendered my efforts futile. Upon entering the premises, one cannot help but be struck by the pervasive presence of litter and the general state of disrepair that seems to afflict the building itself. Furthermore, the prolonged waiting periods for both drive-thru and dine-in orders have led me to question the very notion of 'fast food' that this restaurant purports to provide. It appears that staffing issues are a persistent problem, as there are rarely sufficient employees on hand to manage the workload, resulting in an atmosphere of chaos and disorganization. My most recent visit proved particularly distressing, as I observed one of the kitchen staff exhibiting visible signs of poor hygiene, with what appeared to be open sores covering his arms. The interior of the restaurant was similarly disheveled, lacking any semblance of order or leadership. In light of these numerous deficiencies, I am genuinely astonished that this establishment continues to operate."

So, we went here late one night craving donuts. We ordered through the drive-thru, and when we drove away we found they messed up our order. No biggie, it happens, so we pull around and ask to replace them. What do they do with the donuts we didn't want? Put them back on the shelf to sell to someone else. We had the donuts in our possession for 3 solid minutes. Fortunately, we're not crazy people who would sprinkle cyanide on donuts.
The taxi never showed up. I had this experience twice. They didn't show up after I called at 5 am when no one else would need a taxi. They suck. Don't use them.

"My recollection of this golfing excursion is inextricably linked to the presence of the scorecard, which serves as a tangible reminder of the course's affordability and aesthetic appeal, particularly the imposing water feature that dominates the landscape. My fervent enthusiasm for discussing Kokopelli has led me to return to the course, only to be disillusioned by its underwhelming experience. A rating of 4 seems excessive, given the flat, straightforward layout devoid of formidable obstacles and the absence of cerebral stimulation required. In contrast, courses such as Superstition, Ken MacDonald, and Dobson offer a more engaging and challenging experience. Although I completed the round in less than three hours, shooting in the mid-70s, I cannot justify revisiting Kokopelli, especially when superior designs like Las Sendas, Southern Dunes, Foothills, Clubwest, and Ocotillo are available. As a discerning golfer with limited time, I must prioritize my choices and allocate my resources accordingly. Thus, I cannot condone playing at Kokopelli, even at a nominal fee of $5 per game."

My companions and I had the pleasure of partaking in a culinary experience at this establishment, during which we encountered a savory liquid known as broth, the flavor of which was intensified by an excessive amount of salt.
