Ultimately, it is the profound cultural significance and cerebral stimulation that this locale offers that truly renders it a must-see attraction.

I have been frequenting this establishment since prior to my relocation to Las Vegas, and I must say that the multi-level layout, while uncommon in other eateries, is a necessity given the immense foot traffic it receives. Located at the furthest end of The Forum Shops, connected to the illustrious Caesars Palace, accessing this venue can be somewhat arduous, especially considering the considerable distance from the casino and the occasional prolonged waiting period. However, these minor inconveniences are more than compensated for by the exemplary service and delectable cuisine proffered by the knowledgeable staff. Furthermore, the proximity of this eatery to a captivating aquarium and an elaborate animatronic performance featuring both fire and water serves to mitigate any potential tedium. Thus, if you find yourself ambulating about Las Vegas and hankering for a satisfying meal from a familiar establishment, I would highly recommend giving this restaurant a try.

"Greetings Cafe Zupas, it is a pleasure to make your acquaintance! I extend a warm welcome to our community and express my hope for your establishment's longevity. The culinary creation that is your BBQ chicken salad has left an indelible mark on my palate, and I must say, the beverage bar replete with options for customization elevated my dining experience to a new echelon. My spouse, too, expressed gratification with their summer chicken salad and turkey bacon panini. And let us not forget the crowning touch that was the complimentary chocolate-covered strawberry; a sweet indulgence that capped off a thoroughly satisfying repast. I must commend your eatery for striking the perfect balance between satisfaction and portion control, offering a contemporary, health-conscious menu at an affordable price point."

Siam Terrace is one of my favorite Thai restaurants in Urbana. It's also memorably one of the few restaurants I have a favorite dish at just because they make a red curry so well. Don't let that detract you from choosing something else on the menu though. The rad nar, pad thai, and other options are all excellent choices. I'm just particular I guess.

It's not quite five stars just because sometimes it does feel a little cramped if you have four or more people (and the proximity of the tables feels a tad off), but I'd have to say it's more than four. Appetizers are alright, it's hard to go wrong with basic fare although the shrimp appetizer is quite good and I heartily recommend it.

While I put it at $$ it's more like $ and a half. Prices are very reasonable, with my favorite red curry starting at $8.99 or so for the vegetarian, chicken, or tofu options, and a bit higher for meat entrees (usually no more than $12 in the case of seafood).

I was initially acquainted with this culinary establishment during my temporary residency in Fort Worth, Texas, which lasted for a year. I thoroughly enjoyed my dining experience at this restaurant! It's a Brazilian churrascaria, which can be literally translated as a Brazilian cowboy barbecue, although it's significantly more sophisticated and impressive than a simple barbecue. Indeed, it's an all-encompassing, unrestricted meat extravaganza, similar to none other than the exceptional dining experiences offered by this very establishment. It's an extensive buffet, but with a unique and intriguing twist; servers stroll around, bearing sword-like skewers overflowing with the most tender and flavorful cuts of meat, expertly prepared to perfection. Patrons are provided with a tiny disk that can be effortlessly flipped from red, indicating "no, thank you" to green, signifying "please, do indulge me with an abundance of delectable meat." This exceptional aspect of the dining experience is undoubtedly the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance of this fantastic eatery. However, one must not overlook or undervalue the salad bar, boasting an array of mouthwatering items, such as the succulent prosciutto and an assortment of exquisite cheeses. Furthermore, this superb dining establishment also features a well-stocked bar, offering impeccable service and an extensive selection of refreshing libations.

This place is a trip to morocco! Try the tea and the date shake. The bread is awesome. The owner is a gracious host and gave us a bunch of stuff to try. I love the decorations in the place too! A fun trip out

We tried a variety of tacos here (3 for $10). Tacos were all unique and tasty, but the \nSuadero Azteca (queen's special) was the standout. It was incredibly flavorful and tender and was topped with really yummy veggies. Definitely get your own of this if you are sharing. The fried fish and fried shrimp ones were tasty too. This is a great place to try inventive tacos, but can get a little pricey. I think you need to ask for chips and salsa here, as they didn't bring us any without us asking, but once brought, it was tasty :)

The name is as good as the food. You can go in and take out, you can sit down and get served, and if your close enough they will deliver. It a mom and pop Asian food place with all or your favorite taste liker teriyaki and orange chicken! worth a stop and food is always great!

Fine place for any-time beakfast (certainly a step up from Dennys or IHOP). Good omlettes and if you can take the heart-clogging properties, biscuits & gravy. Also serves sandwiches, salads and smoothies.

After being regaled with tales of Il Pizzaiolo's culinary prowess for an extensive period of time - we're talking years here - I finally had the privilege of partaking in their gastronomic offerings last week, in the company of some colleagues. Let me tell you, it was an unforgettable experience! 

First off, we indulged in some vino. Now, the wine list was nothing short of exhaustive and utterly perplexing, so we sought the expertise of our waitstaff. She guided us towards the house wines, cleverly designated as #1, #2, and #3. If memory serves me right, they consisted of Pinot Grigio, Pinot Noir, and Merlot. I shared two carafes of the latter with a fellow coworker and found it to be quite delectable. 

We also sampled two appetizers, Panzarotti and Fiori de Zucca. While the fried zucchini slices that comprised the Fiori de Zucca were undoubtedly palatable, it wasn't exactly my cup of tea. On the other hand, the Panzarotti stole the show. Imagine a heavenly fusion of fried risotto and mozzarella, all neatly packaged into a single bite. I simply couldn't resist claiming the last one, even if it meant risking a bout of embarrassment due to my gluttonous tendencies. 

For my main course, I opted for the Ravioli alla Caprese. Now, this dish may have been straightforward in its composition, but boy, did it deliver! Each bite was a masterclass in culinary execution. 

In conclusion, I eagerly anticipate my next visit to Il Pizzaiolo. It's safe to say that I won't be waiting another year or two before indulging in their mouthwatering delights once again.

DH was getting pizza at #1 Brothers so I originally tried to order from the Japanese restaurant in the same plaza, but they failed to answer the phone after we called FOUR times!  Thank goodness.  Went to Ari and got the usual excellent service and good sushi.  What made me feel good---I was explaining to the girl who answered the phone that I had ordered the spicy tuna handroll before and had been disappointed in its consistency and our server had suggested a order it more coarsely chopped.  The young lady on the phone said: \"Oh, yes, that was me---I was your server and I remember.  I know exactly what you want!\"  And she did.  My spicy tuna handroll was exactly what I wanted and I felt good that she had remembered such a trivial incident when she deals with hundreds of customers.  Also, when I explained to her what my favorite specialty roll had been back at my old sushi joint, she was able to suggest a roll that very nearly the same and very good.  Actually, wait.  This was a Four star rather than a three star experience---let me go change my rating.  I feel like I have found my forever sushi place!  Thank you, Ari, for making me feel like a valued customer and not a faceless diner.

I hesitate to write a review on here since I don't want this place getting too busy.  I really like it here.  I go on a regular basis for pedicures and I have had Julie and Tammy work on me.  They always give great service.  I only remember one instance where the pedicure got a bit rough for my taste but I just let Julie know and she backed off a bit.  They are attentive, friendly and the salon is always clean.  I usually pay $20 for a pedicure with a $5 tip but now that Summer is here I think the price for a pedicure is $22.  Still very reasonable.

I had great service when I went in to buy paint for my house. The employee working the paint section helped me out a lot. I have never really bought paint for a house before so I needed a little guidance. She helped me get the right type and mixed it for me. I had all my questions answered and was out of there pretty quickly. I had great service and was happy with the price I paid.

I love having this place so close to home.  You can depend on them for all the basics when you're feeling a little Asian inspiration in the kitchen.

I especially like the people who work there.  They're always friendly and will help you out if you can't find what you need.

The fresh produce/meat/fish components of this shop are a little . . . well, kinda dicey, but otherwise, thumbs up all the way.

Friendly, casual atmosphere with very tasty pizza.  Huge variety of toppings and an excellent olive oil base.  I find the pizzas with tomato sauce to be a little bland, but all of the rest have been fantastic.  Salads are huge and fresh.

My family and I have eaten here for years, as it is close to our house.  Restaurant has a nice local following, and many of their diners are Take Out diners.  Their menu is limited but the items served is hot, fresh and flavorful.  My husband loves their sushi.

When you arrive, you are immediately greeted and seated.  Be sure to check the specials listed on the chalk board near the entrance.  I like the decor, and facility, dining plates, utensils and glasses are clean.

Staff is efficient and accommodating.  The menu is concise but has enough available for almost anyone.  Prices are reasonable and portions are above average.  Definitely will return.
Cool place...burgers are fresh and good...don't taste like a grease bomb like 5 guys!!!  Only thing is, it is a little spendy for a burger...can't beat in-n-out for overall quality and price!!!

Dairy Queen really does not need a review.  Only place better for icecream is your mom and pop stores.  Place was clean, service was quick (oh yeah, we were the only ones in there).  $7.80 seems a little high for 1 wafflecone and 1 icecream in a cup.

"I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at this establishment, as the ambiance was remarkably pleasant and the culinary offerings were of exceptional quality. This dining venue deviated significantly from the conventional diner format, which made it an refreshing alternative. Due to its popularity, I strongly advise making a reservation prior to visiting, especially if you intend to bring a large group of children, as securing a suitable table may prove challenging. The menu catered well to diverse tastes, offering an array of delectable options that garnered widespread approval from both adults and youth. Additionally, the service we received was truly impressive, as the staff demonstrated remarkable proficiency and attentiveness throughout our visit. Overall, this restaurant proved to be an ideal setting for introducing our Cleveland-based acquaintances to the unique essence of Montreal, while also providing a welcoming environment for families."
Just as good the one in Scottsdale, AZ. Great bartenders, lots of TV and lots of great beer on tap.

This is my local Salisbury's and where every Monday I do my weekly shop. 

It is a large store, but what bothers me as half the store is not food. This in my eyes defeats the purpose of a supermarket as surely they are food first and TVs second? Clearly it works for them but it does get annoying as choices are limited. The freezer section is very small which for a poor student means I have limited choices in frozen chips. I also find there is a lack of alternatives to brand names i.e. supermarket own brand. On some occasions I would much prefer to just buy the supermarket brand but because this shop has a limited selection of food I can't do this all the time. 

I do enjoy the "Oops!'' section though. As a first year and an Asda shopper, the Oops section was like finding gold. For those who aren't in the know, this is the reduced section. They always have reduced meat which is handy for throwing in the freezer. 

The staff here are very friendly and chatty which is a novelty for supermarket staff.

The selection is pretty vast -- European, upscale specialty brands (up to $24 for a 3 oz bar!), bulk malt balls in 3 flavors that are wonderful, house-brand hot chocolate mix, and lots more. It's fun just to browse around and know all these choices exist.

I've had pets my whole life and my observation has been that when the 's front desk staff is nice and proffesional , the doctors are not and when the doctors are great, the front desk leaves much to be desired.  This was not the case at Alta Vista.  First off, there hours are great.  Secondly. the front desk people (Sam), the techs and the doctor (Dr. Sean Penn), very friendly and courteous.  And finally, the price was reasonable. That, along with the place being clean and not smelling like wet dog when you walk in made having to take my dog in on a Sunday afternoon as pleasant as could be.  So far so good.

The view here is amazing. Can't comment on the food but I'm sure it's good. Just sat down at the bar and conversed with our man, Harold?, who served up a few dirty martinis with a twist. Amazing service even after one in our party lost a bit of balance and drink in the process.\n\nJust be nice to the doorman at the elevator and you'll get upstairs to enjoy the view and drinks.

My husband and I loved this place. The staff was very helpful with ordering and allowed us to sample six of their most popular items. We had enough food for leftovers the next day for under $25. It was great to see everything from ties to tatoos having a good time. My only complaint is that the restaurant could be a little cleaner.

"Ambient luminosity prevails, fostering an agreeable ambiance within the establishment, which I find particularly appealing when seated at the bar, whereupon I relish the opportunity to partake in delectable fare such as nachos or enchiladas in the company of my spouse; the attentive and hospitable service complemented by the culinary offerings' quality."

"Three stars for their Bun Bo Hue, indeed. Upon entering this establishment, my expectations were set rather high, considering the positive reviews I had perused prior to my visit. However, upon partaking in their signature dish, I must admit that I was left feeling somewhat underwhelmed. The broth lacked the depth of flavor and spicy kick that I had anticipated, and the pork blood, though sparse in quantity, was surprisingly dry and chalky in texture. Nevertheless, my companion's rice dish proved to be relatively satisfying, and the coffee, with its subtle hint of coconut flavoring, was truly delectable and well worth the price of admission. A Yelp check-in, incidentally, afforded us the opportunity to indulge in said coffee at a discounted rate of two dollars."

"An exceptional culinary establishment situated within the luxurious Golden Nugget hotel, offering an impressive dining experience marked by attentive service, delectable cuisine, and an extensive menu catering to diverse tastes. Our group of 14 individuals thoroughly enjoyed the meal, with each dish showcasing its unique flavors and presentation. Specifically, my caprese salad starter was a delightful symphony of fresh mozzarella, tomato, and basil, while my main course - Scallops accompanied by Brussels sprouts and grits - was cooked to perfection and left me thoroughly satisfied. Similarly, my spouse relished every bite of his succulent Maine lobster, and our nephew's king crab legs elicited pure delight, albeit at a premium price for a three-year-old companion. Moving on to desserts, although not utterly captivating, they still offered palatable sweetness. The pecan ball, essentially a sizable scoop of vanilla ice cream enrobed in crunchy pecans, lacked that extra je ne sais quoi. In contrast, the bread pudding, complemented by a side of rich caramel ice cream, featured a subtle hint of rum, resulting in a gratifying, albeit not mind-blowing, conclusion to our meal. Unfortunately, a single drawback marred our otherwise pleasant experience: a used pineapple juice cup adorned with conspicuous lipstick stains, raising concerns about hygiene and aesthetics. Nonetheless, considering the size of our gathering, the wait staff performed admirably, and the quality of the food generally met expectations. Definitely worth a visit!"

"This particular Target store boasts an advantageous geographical positioning, rendering it easily accessible for patrons seeking a wide range of products and services within a convenient setting. During my residency in the surrounding area, I had the pleasure of visiting this Target location on multiple occasions and was consistently satisfied with the quality of customer service and breadth of merchandise available. Its placement within the Surprise Town Center shopping district, surrounded by numerous other esteemed retail establishments, further enhances its appeal to potential customers."

Love the location on 7th st. I passed by it after 5pm and saw that it was closed so I went to this one instead. Ordered an XL bean and cheese burrito America's way! So good. Don't know why this spot only has a 2 star review.

Mama-Mia-American-Pizzeria constitutes a suitable dining establishment for Jungleboy, owing to its vibrant, multilevel structure, replete with alcoves and indoor window openings. The proprietors have embellished the walls with a surrealistic mural, depicting flying mushrooms, chili-pepper butterflies, and a heroic Pepperoni-Man, engaged in a valiant endeavor. Upon entering, we opted for a table designated for two individuals and proceeded to peruse the menu. We elected to order a nine-inch pizza, adorned with three toppings of our choice - specifically, pepperoni, mushrooms, and chili-peppers. Notably, the pizza was generously portioned and boasted an assortment of flavors. Furthermore, the crust was palatable, which is not typically my preference. Our server exhibited a relaxed yet attentive demeanor, ensuring our satisfaction and inquiring about our well-being. Additionally, they offered prompt beverage service and accommodated our request to take leftover slices with us upon departure. Although I experienced a slight chill near the entrance, I observed numerous curious onlookers gazing inside, piqued by their curiosity. In an attempt to convey the quality of the establishment, I smiled and waved at these individuals, only to notice their hasty retreat from the windows. Despite this, I would recommend Mama-Mia-American-Pizzeria for either a brief visit or a leisurely afternoon meal/snack with a group of acquaintances or loved ones, given the availability of a sizeable cartwheel pizza designed to cater to larger gatherings.

The quaint eatery boasts an extensive array of culinary options, ensuring that every patron can find something to suit their gastronomical inclinations. The alfresco seating area provides a tranquil ambiance, which enhances the dining experience. The miniature burgers, or'sliders,' are a particular highlight of the menu, showcasing the chef's skill in creating delectable, bite-sized delights. Such a satisfying dining encounter leaves an indelible mark on one's palate, making it highly likely that repeat visits will occur in the future.

Stopped in here to meet up with an old friend and of course down some beers.  Their selection of beers isn't too vast, but what they have is perfect.  It takes away from me reading the menu for an hour and randomly selecting a beer.  Now for the venue.  The inside is dark and pubby, but the outside is what shines.  It feels like you are at a backyard cookout.  Giant jenga blocks ( seriously 2x4's), giant chess, cornhole all over the place, and three ping pong tables. At first I was like they just took someone's back yard and put a bar with a window next to it.  After playing a few games, I realized this wasn't such a bad thing.  Its a great place to go especially during the afternoon.

Had a great afternoon lunch on a Saturday. The food was great, the beer was bar none the best and the staff knows their beer. We did a tasting and had a lot of fun talking \"beer\". The place overall is a little down on its heels. The waitress said they do a beer dinner and I can betcha it would be great!

So happy about this addition to my 'hood!   Beautiful renovation of a long-neglected architecturally unique (odd?) building on Central.   Things are a 'happenin' Uptown! 

Had such a nice experience with our table of 7 - which turned into 8 - wait - now we have 9 - on First Friday no less!    Staff was completely accommodating to us, friendly, upbeat, fun.  The owner Dana stopped by and chatted, making sure we were having a good time. Food was great, we shared everything.   Weather was perfect for the patio.

Ahh... these are the times, this is why we live here.

It took us a considerable amount of time, approximately forty minutes, to be seated at our table, despite the fact that it was only nine o'clock on a Tuesday evening. Furthermore, we found the prices to be somewhat high, but then again, this is Las Vegas, after all. We opted for a light dinner consisting of five individual portions, accompanied by two tapas plates per person. Notably, the gin and tonic beverage was truly exceptional, boasting an impressively smooth texture, visually appealing presentation, and uniquely shaped ice cubes that added an extra layer of sophistication to the overall experience. Additionally, we highly recommend the marinated mussels served in a small tin container, as well as the steamed mussels, which were cooked to perfection and paired excellently with a slice of bread to soak up the savory juices. Other notable dishes included the meat platter, featuring a selection of expertly cured meats that were thoroughly enjoyed, a delectable Brussels sprout salad, flavorful sauteed shrimp, tender skirt steak complemented by a grilled bell pepper, and a side of asparagus, albeit slightly pricey at twelve dollars plus, but accompanied by a delicious sauce that paired perfectly with a piece of bread. Lastly, the quail dish was a highlight of the meal, comprising a small yet scrumptious bird that left a lasting impression on our taste buds. Throughout the evening, we received top-notch service and enjoyed a tranquil ambiance, making for a truly memorable dining experience.

I came to this Lenscrafters after not being able to find what I wanted at the Chandler Mall location. As soon as I came in, i was greeted by Donna, who was very helpful. I tried on many pairs, taking a break in between to give my baby a bottle. Donna called to verify my insurance and noticed there was a proble. Due to the optometrust where  got my eye exam, my insurance indicated I wasn't eligible fir frames. donna called to rectify the situation, but wasn't able to because the optometrist was closed. Donna let me know that I would have to wait until the next day so my insurance could void the issue at the optometrist. We went back the next day, and Donna had already taken care of the situation. I got my glasses, and am happy with the service I received. Donna and Heather were the wo shinih stars at this location!

This is my go to spot for lunch appointments and even dinner with my wife. It has a great local feel. Friendly staff, clean, and great tasting food. I can't get enough of the green tomatillo salsa. I recommend the salmon and shrimp tacos. The service isn't the best because all of the servers are young local kids with probably their first server job so they are learning. But that's part of what makes it a cool local place.

Great food! Friendly environment! Modern decor! Gay! All of these things describe Switch to a tee! I had been telling my wife for months that I had heard great things about this restaurant, especially their brunch menu. Unfortunately for me, she is not a big fan of Sunday Brunch, so when we did finally make it there last Sunday, I had already missed out on the brunch menu and the $3 carafes of Bloody Marys. 

We ordered a carafe anyways... only $6 for approximately 4 good sized Bloodys! They were made well, but for the most part tasted pretty generic, yet still exactly what I expected for only $6!! I ordered one of the tastiest burgers I've ever eaten, topped with guacamole, salsa and jalapenos! Each plate was also served with a small house made ceasar salad, which I thought was a nice touch! Our service was very prompt and friendly!

I will definitely be coming back to Switch for my favorite meal of the week: BRUNCH :)

"Although my affinity for MadHouse remains unwavering, I must bring attention to an anomaly pertaining to their digital presence; specifically, whenever I attempt to access their website, my browser invariably issues a trojan warning, suggesting that the site may be compromised by malicious software. I felt compelled to voice my concern in the hopes that the proprietors of MadHouse will take cognizance of this issue and address it expeditiously."

"Star Nursery is the epitome of excellence in the realm of plant nurseries within the Las Vegas area, offering a wide array of superior quality plants and landscaping materials that cater to the diverse needs of both residential and commercial clients. My personal experience working at a plant nursery during my formative years has instilled in me a profound appreciation for the intrinsic value of such establishments, which has culminated in my pursuit of a degree in landscape architecture and subsequent ownership of a successful landscape company. Upon perambulating the premises of Star Nursery, I am overcome with nostalgia for my former profession, as the verdant splendor of the flora and the meticulous attention to detail accorded to each plant specimen serve as a testament to the exceptional standards upheld by this esteemed institution. The inventory of plants and landscaping supplies available at Star Nursery is truly impressive, encompassing everything from ornamental bedding plants to majestic trees, all of which are fastidiously maintained and presented in a manner that showcases their inherent beauty. Furthermore, the staff at Star Nursery possesses a depth of knowledge and friendliness that is unparalleled, making them an invaluable resource for anyone seeking expert advice and guidance in selecting the most appropriate plants and materials for their specific landscaping needs. Thus, if you are engaged in any sort of landscaping endeavor at your residence or place of business, it would be tremendously beneficial to patronize Star Nursery, as their exceptional quality and commitment to excellence are unmatched by the likes of Walmart and Lowes."

When in Vegas,

1) buy a delicious "adult slurpee" in a delicious flavor right outside the Imperial Palace
2) bring said special, yard-long beverage into the Imperial Palace Karaoke Club
3) sing or mock karaoke
4) enjoy!
5) your pre-game is complete... time to go out!

Love this place but giving it a 4 star as it can be somewhat slow and few healthier options to select from. Yeah I know, penalizing them for not "healthy" is probably silly as you know when going to let's say a fast food joint you are not eating so good. That being said the food at Defalco's is very high quality - almost as if you are in Italy and am not comparing it to fast food.

I suggest you wait to try out Defalco's when not in a rush as its worth the wait. There order system is very similar to local places back east (basically avoiding technology) and that probably ties into part of the slower process of ordering and getting your food. I am from back east (NY area) and finding a good Italian deli / grocery store in the Phoenix area is not an easy task. A friend introduced me to Defalco's and anytime I am headed south on Scottsdale road (which is often) and after passing Thomas my stomach seems to pick up we are near Defalco's as it starts giving me the rumble noise.

I have tried many things on the menu such as Eggplant Parmigiana, Chicken Parmigiana, and Cheese steak and three of those are worth a shot. I recommend to bring a friend and each get a different large sandwich and share.

We had the Travel Zoo coupon which gives you the app/entree/dessert. Ordered the combo app of course. Alligator was tough and so were the frog's legs. Crabcake was great. Gumbo is good. jambayala was great...Not quite New Orleans but pretty tasty. Atmosphere was nice and New Orleans looking. Large portions for the money.

Classy, quiet restaurant. You'll see some white haired Montreal politicians every time. The place you'd go for a special birthday or anniversary. The waiters are polite, pleasant, and funny if you get them going. The food is downright perfect, french cuisine. Be sure to get the Escargot.

Usually come here on Friday nights with my friends who are regulars.

Food is pretty solid the lamb meatballs and Johnny's nachos are very popular with our group. Even their ranch dressing is really good and I am not a big ranch fan. I also like the Guinness stew.

The only thing keeping this place from being a full 5 stars is that it's probably a bit on the pricy side for what it is. Beers start at $6 (i think I haven't had one cheaper) and pretty much any food item is $10+ with sandwiches at $12. Shave a couple bucks off and they would be in solid 5 star contention.

The service here is also good as all the servers are friendly, keep up well with groups and splitting checks (always hard since our group can be anywhere from 4-12), and they are willing to joke around with us and not throw us out (always a possibility with our non-pc humor and discussions).

"A bowl of rice and an extremely reasonable price point coupled with an abundance of spices is what attracts me to this establishment. Specifically, I can acquire a salmon bowl accompanied by brown rice and an ample amount of fiery seasoning for a mere $7 or less. Upon entering the premises, I noticed a queue leading up to several cash registers and a menu displayed prominently on the wall, featuring an array of traditional Japanese dishes such as chicken teriyaki bowls, providing options for a diverse group of patrons. For my part, I opted for the aforementioned salmon bowl at a cost of $5.99, which represents an excellent value considering it includes fish that has not been deep-fried, thereby making it a suitable choice for a midday repast. However, I must confess that I find the teriyaki sauce to be somewhat overpowering, so I requested that it be applied sparingly. Furthermore, for an additional $0.25, I was able to enhance the nutritional value of my meal by selecting brown rice instead of the standard white variety. After receiving my bowl, I made my way to the condiment station, whereupon I discovered a variety of hot chili powders, sauces, and sliced green onions. The latter particularly caught my attention and appreciation. It is worth mentioning that the negative assessments of this eatery may stem from the fact that Japanese cuisine generally lacks the potent flavors associated with Chinese and Thai culinary traditions."

Since this place is popular, the line for this buffet is long, but I guess there's nothing that can be done about that.

The servers were attentive and removed our plates. One minor nitpick I have is that even though I'm glad they leave the utensils behind, they tend to place the utensils on the table, which I personally like to avoid since I usually put them on napkins. It would be nice if they offered replacement utensils other than just the ones on the table, although I guess maybe it's like that so that too much water isn't wasted.

There were a large variety of food dishes to choose from. They make the price of $40/person a good deal by offering a lot of expensive dishes. There were crab legs, lobster ravioli, prime rib, and creme brulee. They also offered complimentary drinks like raspberry iced tea and sodas.
This place is a wonderfull place to go to... inexpensive and very friendly bartenders and some sexy ones at that... woo hoo!!! Love the screens in there and the food is excellent!!!
This place is wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Fat free - new, clean place, plenty of parking - nice staff - and did I say fat free?  Great spot!

Marquee is an utter debacle, albeit an aesthetically pleasing one, characterized by an air of bedlam and disarray, yet, quite paradoxically, the doormen and bouncers manage to maintain a semblance of order amidst the chaos, deftly orchestrating the entrance process with aplomb; there exists no stringent dress code policy, which, rather unfortunately, leads to a somewhat lackluster ambiance, as some patrons opt for decidedly casual attire, such as flat shoes and leggings, while others sport athletic footwear and plain t-shirts, rendering the overall atmosphere somewhat less than glamorous; navigating the club's interior can prove to be a somewhat arduous task, as the stairs can be quite treacherous, and the dance floor tends to become oppressively congested, giving the impression of being packed into a small, confined space, much like sardines in a can, but these drawbacks can be readily overlooked; the disc jockey and other performers are truly exceptional, the sound system is impressive, and the bartenders are not only visually appealing but also quite affable.

I think this is one and only Indo-chinese restaurant in Phoenix area. Nice and clean place. Food was really good. We went on a Thu with reservation and was not crowded. \n\nTry the Manchurian Chicken ... Tasty

"Prior to purchasing tickets, it is imperative that you are cognizant of the fact that the performance will consist of a scathing critique of the audience, with the majority of the jokes relying heavily on stereotypes pertaining to race, gender, sexual orientation, age, and physical characteristics. Therefore, if you are easily offended, it would be advisable to avoid this production altogether. While the material presented is largely novel, there may be some instances of repetition, such as the quip regarding the notion of pondering one's mother's lips performing fellatio on one's father during a familial greeting. As an ardent devotee of comedic entertainment, I have had the privilege of exposure to a vast array of standup routines broadcasted on various platforms, including Comic View, Comedy Central, HBO, and Showtime, thereby increasing the likelihood that I have already encountered such humor. Nonetheless, the show promises to be an amusing experience, albeit not suitable for juvenile audiences due to its explicit nature (rated NC-17/R).\n\nThe venue's intimate setting is reminiscent of academic institutions, wherein attendees will be subject to unwavering scrutiny, analogous to the atmosphere of a high school or college environment. Consequently, it is essential to acknowledge that participation in the performance is mandatory, and individuals must be prepared to assume an active role in the show, as there are no hiding places."

The crab cake is the best in town. If you order the Caesar salad with salmon, request it to be blackened. Game changer. If you are into beef, go for the marinated flank steak. Heaven on a fork. 

The bar is very good sized and has full service for food and lots of TV's. 

Bon apatite.

Decent mocha. Hipster heaven. Loud and angry music. Brought me back to my youth.

The culinary offerings appeared visually appealing, and the beverages were economically priced. I aspire to revisit the establishment for the "remedy," a potion consisting of ginger and whiskey.

"The most advantageous aspect of the Excalibur Hotel and Casino is its comparative economic efficiency in relation to other luxury hotels situated along the Las Vegas Strip. The accommodation cost for a single night's stay was $27, which was booked through the online travel agency Expedia. However, it is important to note that an additional daily resort fee of $15 is charged, which grants access to various amenities, such as wired internet connectivity within the guestroom. The package also included a complimentary $20 food and beverage credit, redeemable at select on-site dining establishments, including primarily bars and the pricier Steakhouse restaurant. Furthermore, guests were offered a complimentary play at the Dungeon, also known as the midway arcade. Unfortunately, the provided coupon book did not feature any match plays. 

The guestroom itself was spacious and well-appointed, boasting a sizable television set. An Ethernet cable was thoughtfully provided for guests to connect their personal computers to the internet, although the speed of the connection was somewhat sluggish. 

The sleeping quarters were found to be satisfactory, with three plush pillows available for added comfort. 

The elevators were strategically divided between floors 1-18 and 19-up, ensuring prompt and efficient service for guests seeking higher floors. It is recommended to reserve a room on floor 18 or above for optimal elevator performance. 

In terms of the casino, it was observed that the blackjack tables implemented continuous shuffler machines, which are not ideal for seasoned players. The minimum betting limits for most table games were around $10."
First time going to this restaurant.  The service was great. The staff is very friendly.  Will definitely come back. I would recommend this place to anyone.

I had a reservation at another noted steakhouse near the strip and wasn't in the mood to follow through. So I started at the south end of the strip and thought I'd walk until I found something to suit my mood. Stepped into a few spots and kept walking. I swung through Cosmopolitan and an irresistible steakhouse aroma clutched me. I asked a hotel concierge to tell me the source and in a short walk I was sliding on to a stool at the STK bar- fine for a solo. I liked the atmosphere which was lively and busy with a great DJ mix as a backdrop. The volume issues that I've read from others was not an issue for me because I wasn't engaged in any challenging conversations. 

I had the foie gras french toast, bone-in rib and a moscow mule. I enjoyed everything about them. 

I will say that I can't appreciate the rest room format. Get in line outside? Wait your turn? Follow the attendant's commands? Sir, may I use the bathroom? NO! What? Fix that.

I'll be visiting Vegas again soon to celebrate my son's birthday and I'm pretty sure he'd like it as much as I, so I'll be back.

I have not been to Nello's in ages.  A friend suggested for lunch.  The three of us show up and the place was getting busy.  We were sat immediately.  Got to have pizza here, right?  We ordered a large pizza:  thick crust, bacon, basil, mushroom, and 1/2 with sausage.  OMG... It was good but they forgot the basil.  =(  The garlic bread was very good too....  \n\nThe waiter was eye candy and he provided great service!  =)

"WOW!! What an undiscovered treasure in Las Vegas! We visited the Rio to attend a performance and opted to have a meal prior to the show. Unfortunately, we failed to make reservations (which I highly recommend), but the hostess kindly offered us a charming spot at the bar. We gladly accepted the offer and were seated at the bar. We had the pleasure of savoring a delectable meatball appetizer, which was enthusiastically endorsed by a fellow patron. Indeed, it was an exquisite culinary delight that warranted a return visit! We also sampled the daily specials, with one scallop dish and a sea bass entrÃ©e for my companion. Both dishes were brimming with flavor, had an exceptionally fresh taste, and were, on the whole, outstanding culinary creations! I would unhesitatingly return to this establishment! As a side note, locals who possess a T.Rewards card and a Nevada ID can enjoy a 25% discount. Additionally, if you are attending a performance, presenting your ticket stubs will grant you a 20% discount. This is truly an incredible bargain for a remarkable dining experience!"

I opted to partake in a culinary excursion to the Bar + Bistro in downtown Las Vegas last night, as I had tickets to a performance and wished to indulge in a pre-show repast. Unfortunately, I committed an error in my planning by failing to account for the fact that it was the first Friday of the month, which meant that the eatery offered a truncated menu for the evening. Despite this setback, I elected to persevere and sampled a pair of their tapas offerings alongside a sweet treat. My gastronomic journey commenced with a steaming bowl of roasted tomato soup, which proved to be a flavorsome and satisfying initial course. Next, I ventured forth and relished their 5 cheese mac and cheese, a harmonious medley of smoked gouda, sharp cheddar, fontina, Manchego, roasted tomato, piquillo peppers, and parmesan crisp, all nestled within a bed of gigli pasta. The pasta dish was indeed delectable, and I rounded out my repast with a warm chocolate ganache cake, accompanied by a diminutive scoop of sorbet that served as the perfect finishing touch. While I would have preferred to visit the establishment on a night when the full menu was available, I was still afforded the opportunity to experience a sampling of their delectable fare. Although I found the prices to be somewhat elevated in relation to the portion sizes, my overall experience was enhanced by the charming ambiance, which featured tables fashioned after artists' palettes and adorned with metal wells. Furthermore, I must admit that I was repeatedly taken aback by the cleverly designed tables, as the splattered paint embellishments led me to mistakenly believe that I had accidentally spilled something upon them. This playful detail added an element of whimsy to my dining experience.

Its been said before, but they deliver until 3 AM.  We were not in the state of mind to drive and have been getting a little sick of hungry howies.  It took a solid hour for our food to arrive, but that seems pretty normal for late night Tempe. Everyone raved about the food.  It was very good for late night delivery.  The chicken bruchetta pita was excellent although a little small.  I recommend 2 pitas for anyone with any kind of appetite.  You might not get through both, but the one was just a little too small to satisfy.  My only complaint, and the reason for 4 starts instead of 5 was the traditional hummus.  I didnt not think it was very good at all.  Many places in Tempe have much better.

Lovely looking place with gorgeous high ceilings. Really nice coffee to be had here and every member of the staff is friendly and warm. I come here for lunch now and then as it is close to my office. The little toasts are always super good and come with all sorts of toppings: Russian egg salad, tuna, smoked salmon, various types of meat, etc. The desserts are all quite gorgeous looking as well, but usually I am too full to go there! I will say that it is kinda pricey, but at least the food is good, so that helps to take the sting out of the lunch bill.\n\nThey lose a star for saying that the soup was vegetarian...it had chunks of bacon and the guy shrugged when he saw me picking them out.

We went for a friends birthday party. I like the intimate setting. I'm usually not a comedy fan, but I laughed quite a bit at 3 out of the 4 comedians. There was a Fetish Ball going on next door, which confused me at first b/c I didn't understand why leather masks and nipple clamps were the dress code for a comedy club, but once I saw the little neon \"Comedy Spot\" sign, I figured it out. Overall its a great place to go on a  weekend. Assless chaps optional.

Absolutely delicious Thai food offered by a pleasant server.  Ordered green curry with extra veggies and tofu and it was so yummy I ate the rest for dinner. My friend had the broccoli chicken and spring roll and she was really impressed. Ambiance is very hole-in-the-wall and kitschy, but that's not why you go. You go for the delicious food and good service, and you won't be disappointed.

I have been very happy with the care my dog has received at Squaw Peak, they take good care of my pug. The staff is very kind, I can always get a last minute appointment, and I never have to wait. They treat my dog as if he is their own, as others have said.

A puppy was found at work, and when I brought him in to Squaw Peak, he was diagnosed with distemper, and the best course of action was to put him down. When I asked about the cost, the vet was kind enough to take care of it at no cost. 

They have also been willing to bill me for needed vet care and allow me to make payments when I was having financial difficulties, however, I was not pleased about receiving a collections notice from the office after making a payment that covered the majority of the amount owed. The person in charge of billing told me I could make another payment for the remaining amount ($70) this month, and I just needed to call in and make arrangements. Given my positive experiences, I can only assume this was an oversight.

Finally got here for dinner, heard about this restaurant from my friends many times! The food quality is good, environment is not bad, doesn't feel like those typical Japanese restaurants, I definitely will come back again!! Had a great dinner here!! Love it..!!!

Excellent!\nI love the ambiance of this restaurant. We were seated next to window with a peek of the fountain show. Foie grois was great and hamachi was good. I ordered medium duck. Unfortunately it was not seasoned well & was too chewy. Server was in tuned & offered to exchange dish for a sea bass. It was delicious!

On June 22nd, we arrived with a considerable assemblage during the evening hours and were accommodated at a spacious table that featured the option of engaging in recreational activities such as checkers and scrabble while awaiting the culinary offerings, which we thoroughly relished. My spouse opted for the miso salmon, while I selected a burger and fries, both of which proved to be satisfactory in terms of gastronomical quality and service efficiency, until the presentation of the bill, that is. Although the bill was meticulously itemized for each individual party, much to my appreciation, a cursory examination revealed an unsolicited inclusion of a gratuity charge, which, while not necessarily problematic in and of itself, did strike me as somewhat dubious, particularly given the lack of transparent communication regarding its addition, leading to the possibility of unwitting duplication of tips by certain patrons, which, in turn, prompted me to bring it to the attention of those seated nearby, who expressed gratitude for the heads-up. While it is conceivable that this practice may not have been the intentional policy of the eatery per se, but rather that of the server, it remains, in my estimation, a questionable custom that warrants scrutiny.

Probably one of the best steaks in Las Vegas. Comfortable seating and busy. Very busy. Lobster appetizer was a bit pricey for the little, but delicious amount you got. For a new restuarant the staff was very well trained. Looking forward to next visit, minus lobster app.

3.75 stars\n\nOther than the outlet LV store in Japan, this is probably the first lv store i went into.  The security guards were a little bit intimidating, staring at you and looking bored out of their minds.  In other nice stores at caesars, they at least smile or say have a good nite.  Anyway, like Fern mentioned, the purse bar was kind of interesting and fun.  Once the associate found out my aunt might get something, she pulled out 7-10 bags for us to see and took off the protection tape on each.  I forgot her name, but she was very patient and very helpful.  She disappeared for a long while after we decided, but I would still recommend it if you are seriously looking, and even though they would probably ignore me if I was by myself!
They have a good selection for their lunch buffet (have both veggie and meat options). Always love their dessert options and garlic naan. Staff is friendly.

"Ambient culinary establishment, offering an array of delectable victuals, specifically a diverse selection of midday sandwiches, constituting a judicious balance between sustenance and temporal efficiency, thereby facilitating a prompt and seamless dining experience for patrons. Furthermore, the carbonated beverage infused with raspberry essence proves to be an exquisite accompaniment to the fare, elevating the gastronomical indulgence to a truly satisfying level."

I have consistently experienced a sense of euphoria upon departing this establishment, which boasts an exceptionally stylish bar adorned with illuminated bottles that create a vibrant ambiance. Despite the unfavorable lighting conditions, I find myself drawn to the tables situated adjacent to this captivating bar, perhaps due to the unsettling yet intriguing effect of the dim lighting, reminiscent of the eerie glow of a flashlight positioned beneath one's countenance. When perusing the menu, I am invariably inclined towards the Sesame Crusted Ahi Tuna as my initial course, principally because the tuna is presented atop a bed of delectable slaw imbued with a savory soy dressing, accompanied by a side of wasabi that can be incorporated according to personal preference. Although this eatery does not specialize in seafood, I frequently develop an intense craving for fish dishes and discover that their Blackened Fish Sandwich is cooked to perfection, complemented by a tangy sauce that enhances its flavor. Additionally, the steamed broccoli is typically served in generous portions and maintains a consistent freshness. However, I would advise against ordering the honey roasted carrots, as they are often overwhelmed by an excessive amount of sweetness, resulting in a taste that is akin to plain sugarcoated carrots - an unfortunate departure from the natural flavors that vegetables should exhibit. Lastly, while I do appreciate desserts and possess a particular fondness for chocolate, I regret to say that none of the offerings from this establishment have managed to impress me, potentially attributable to an overabundance of white chocolate in their confections.

I would say that this is easily the best place to go in in Sun Prairie.  We have been here about 6 times and it has consistently been good.  I have ordered steak, fried fish, entrees... it's all pretty good.  The kids meals are well portioned and the kids eat it.  They rotate their menu and the beer on tap - that makes repeat business worth while.  It can be pretty busy on a Friday night.  They have filled a need in town.

The Filet Mignon was absolutely delicious and I couldn't get enough of the sauce. I did not even need steak sauce to enhance the taste. The service was wonderful, my boyfriend and I had a nice conversation with the waiter. Our waters were constantly refilled, which is always a plus for me because I drink my water like a whale. The price wasn't to shabby either, especially for a good steak. The only complaint  that I have are the frites (i think that is what they are called). It is way too salty. All in all, its a great place to have lunch on a beautiful day.

Great place to stay. Rooms are spacious and clean. The price is fair. It's at the end of the strip so there's less foot traffic which is a blessing. The air is cleaner vs other hotels. Lots of things to do in the hotel: beach, mall, bars, clubs, spa, many others.

Although we had to wait 30 minutes for a table, it was well worth it. We sat outside, which is beautiful and great for people watching. I ordered a caesar salad and within what seemed like five minutes it was on the table. It was delicious, I loved the cheese and dressing. I also ordered the classic quiche lorraine. I'm a big sucker for quiche, my grandmother made it countless times for me when I was little and I have to say eating this quiche sent me back to my childhood. It was AMAZING..and incredibly filling. I couldn't even finish all of it!\n\nOur waiter was very friendly and attentive. Not only that but the food comes out so quickly that I barely had time to finish my caesar salad before my lunch was served. My boyfriend got the warm chicken and brie sandwich. It had thin slices of apple and caramelized onions on top. Absolutely delicious.  All in all a great experience, great food and an elegant yet not pretentious atmosphere. When we go back to Vegas we will definitely be dining here again.

This is a pretty cool store to shop in! They have a ton of interesting, high end kitchen appliances available. It seems like everything is chrome, very high end, and awesome looking. Plus, they will give you a coffee while you're shopping when they are demonstrating their high end coffee maker. It's a fun experience for sure.

Maybe I prefer my clothes a little more urban than the average white guy but, I liked this spot and love the idea of being able to look fly on a budget.\n\nIts HUGE!  Lots of variety.  Urban wear to suits and everything in between.  Accessories too.  My only complaint is that there wasn't much service outside of the fitting rooms.  But at these prices, that was expected.

Union Pig & Chicken has some of the best BBQ that I've found in Pittsburgh. The brisket is soft and falls apart with a fork, although some of the pieces can be overly fatty. Every time I've been the service has been decent, but slow. Union is also a surprsingly good place to go for lunch, The sandwiches they serve are delicious. One last note, definitely get the mac & cheese. It's that good.

Went here with the husband and our 2 teens and we all get something different so we could share. Everyone enjoyed their smoothie and the employees here were very friendly. \n\nI just wish these dang things were a little less pricey...and i would eat em more often, they are like having a meal.

Walnut Grill represents an establishment that I hold in high esteem, particularly for its provision of an ambient setting conducive to enjoying a post-work libation or a rapid, delectable repast. The menu showcases an inventive fusion of traditional American cuisine with subtle contemporary nuances, while the wine list boasts an impressive array of vintages carefully curated to complement the culinary offerings. The recent expansion of the bar area has not only augmented the seating capacity but also introduced plush, inviting booths that enhance the overall convivial ambiance. The service staff, recognizing devoted patrons like myself, display remarkable proficiency and warmth, ensuring a seamless dining experience. Furthermore, Walnut Grill occasionally features live musical performances, adding another layer of enjoyment to an already delightful dining excursion. My patronage of this eatery shall persist with unwavering regularity.

After the manager read my review he contact me and apologized. I have yet to return to the place, but the manager assured me my experience will be different. Since then the server that served me was terminated. Looking forward to going again.

It is indeed a welcome development that Steak N Shake has finally arrived in the valley, bringing with it an unparalleled dining experience that has captured the hearts of many, including myself. My unwavering affection for their delectable Frisco melt is unsurprising, given its rich, savory flavor profile that defies description. Furthermore, the immaculate ambiance and warm hospitality of the establishment only serve to enhance the overall satisfaction of the culinary journey. While I do lament the absence of certain signature elements, such as the peppers, and the limited availability of the menu items, I remain steadfast in my enthusiasm for this esteemed eatery. Notwithstanding the shortcomings, I am more than willing to indulge in my beloved Frisco melt, accompanied by a side of golden fries and a generous serving of cheese sauce.

I know it is a McDonald's. I get it. But as far as a fast food chain goes, this particualr McDonald's has my loyalty. \n\nTalk about your fast friendly service. Whether I am ordering just coffee or a couple hash browns for my boy and I on the way into school I know I will be through the drive-thru in 5 minutes tops!

This is a great late night spot located in the California Hotel. If you're a fan of ox tail soup, you'll love this place. The oxtail soup is only served late night and the entire menu has Hawaiian/Filipino influence. This place is so well known for their ox tail soup that if you check-in on Facebook, it will say it's the HOME OF THE OXTAIL SOUP. \n\nTips: 1. Be prepared to wait in line. 2. Get your oxtail soup without peanuts. 3. Don't forget to get your parking ticket validated.
The location is nice and the food is delicious! I got the market fish, which was very good. The meat was so tender. Other yummy dishes were duck and pork.

Great hotel. The rooms are super clean, there's water in the fridge, and the gym is decent. My only critique is that you have to refresh the Internet connection every 24 hours (and must pay $10 bucks per device - iPhone included), the breakfast is not very good (unless you get it made to order), and they left my previous nights room service tray outside my door until the next afternoon. Besides that, everything else was fantastic. The location is convenient, service attentive, and overall experience pleasant.

A guy from a liquor store recommended this place to me a couple of years ago. Since then, I've been to this place every time I'm in Vegas. I've only tried the pizza & wings. Both are GREAT for those late night drunken munchies! Right down the street from the Stratosphere.\n\nYou can easily tell that this is where the locals go for pizza.

I liked their crab legs. I was second in a huge forming line. They are cracked, so no work has to be done. Sushi was very fresh. They have really cute bite sized desserts, so you can sample a lot of things. The dessert section is hidden away from everything else, so I think there is a good chance a lot of people forget about it. They have gellato in many different flavors like sour cherry. Very cute desserts. I don't know what kind of dessert I was eating. White chocolate with edible silver balls and soft center. Good what ever it was. I am very picky, and I found a lot of stuff I could eat. However for the price, I think I like the Bellagio better. Their is also a buffet on the stip with circular aquariums at the buffet with tropical desserts that are out of this world. Just can't remember the name of it :( I just remember you take an esculator down to get to the buffet. If you love Sushi Todai is a great fish and sushi buffet for reasonable prices. They have chicken and beef too!

Quality 24/7 food in vegas. Pit stop, fill up, drink up, back at the strip!\n\nIf you want good portion sizes, a meal thatll keep you full, and want to pass up on mickey Ds and Dennys, hit this place up.

"Consequently, we arrived at XS subsequent to being unsuccessful in gaining admittance to Hakkansan, and let me assure you that we did not experience any sense of disappointment! The interior of this establishment was truly breathtaking, while the exterior provided an ideal setting for deriving pleasure from the musical offerings and indulging in some fresh air. \n\nDuring our visit, we had the privilege of witnessing a performance by Rusko, which was accompanied by an evening of vigorous dancing that proved to be an utterly enjoyable experience. Based on my personal experience, I would unhesitatingly advocate paying a visit to this venue."

Yep, this is one of the best buffet place among a thousand other Vegas casino buffet.   It was cheap as well.  I would come back again :) good food, cheap price, I can't expect more from Vegas buffets :)
I thought that I could only get some good noodles here on the East Coast but boy was I wrong! I cant stop thinking about how good it was. Next time I am in town, Im heading straight there!
I love the food here omg and 12.45 for 3 well vodka coke drinks!?!? Yummy!  We had a blonde servee...marcia...merc....something... but she was nice :)
Not bad, service was on the slower side, but then again it was lunch time 12-1pm but very friendly and quick cashier

I have read some of the Yelp reviews and at my first visit at the Ingleside Grooming I was not too impressed with curt response to some of my questions as she seemed initially annoyed with my presence, however, I continued to request their services to groom my pet.  When I returned the next day with my pet, I was significantly late at dropping her off for her appointment.  I also told her that my pet is a nervous pet and has always pooped whenever I took her to Petsmart or to the vet.\nThe person who was there (the same person whom I spoke to the day before), I apologize and she was very understanding and did not seem upset at all for my tardiness.  I felt really comfortable at that point.  When I returned to pick up my pet the same person who I have been dealing with was so nice and told me how my dog behaved and how sweet she was and, best of all, didn't poop!  And my dog's new look (she's 3 years old and never had a hair cut, so she was pretty bushy) is fantastic!  and the cost is very reasonable with what comes included!  I highly recommend her!

Found this place b/c of Yelp and glad I did.

Great Sonoran hot dogs.  I got two and was uber full.  The first time I went I recall less than optimal communication.  I asked how many types of dogs they had, and the answer was "how many?".  

Today was the 2nd time and things went much better.  Very helpful and once again a great meal.  I also feel like it was a bit cleaner this time, maybe they straightened up or repainted.

It is in a below average neighborhood but worth the adventure.  Go for the food, not the ambiance.

We were not inclined to pay a visit to this particular location, however, our plans were drastically altered upon encountering an advertisement in the form of a billboard promoting a performance by none other than the renowned comedian, Jerry Seinfeld, which we deemed an opportunity not to be missed, compelling us to procure tickets for the event despite the less-than-ideal seating arrangement towards the rear of the auditorium; yet, much to our satisfaction, the perspective afforded by our vantage point remained quite pleasant, complemented by the superior quality of the acoustics, rendering it an optimal setting for experiencing live performances.

I really liked this show.  There were a couple of cheesy parts but overall I thought it was excellent.  There is something for everyone and it's all quite tastefully and artistically done. 

The twins are hilarious and it's awesome to see a couple of big girls out there strutting their stuff.  The rest of the bodies are lean dancer bodies, for the most part, featuring real breasts.  Hooray for real breasts!

The choreographies are beautiful and tasteful, overall... and some are quite poignant. It's not all about the shock value ...  it's about love,  lust,  joy,  pain,  pleasure,  desire,  distress,  giving,  taking,  the physical, the emotional, the silly and fun ...   The total human animal...    Watch closely. 

Standouts for me were the African dancer, the suspended bondage act, the water gymnasts, the transvestite torch singer ... and that amazing red cape that covers the entire stage is fucking *spectacular*.  

A must see, IMO... and I would definitely go back.  I enjoyed every minute.

Time: 10am. Place: Poppy's. Impulse purchase: Bagels, doz. Intent: I get to play Bagel Fairy all day with a dozen of the best bagels in Charlotte.

I distributed my cache of carb thoughtfully, but thoroughly. And not before eating two in one sitting. Bagelbloat, yeesh.

Coffee was just OK but I honestly don't think they care much about anything except the bagatorial arts up in Poppy's and in that distinguished category, they get an A+. Sad to me that Bore's Head is what they have for slices and cheeses since that stuff is just nasty, but hey.

No more Bruegger's for me. No more terrorizing Owen. I get Poppy bagels, I eat Poppy bagels, I love Poppy bagels.

note - these suckers are such globs of gluten that they don't age very well - freeze 'em, if you must, instead of sitting 'em in the breadbox.

"An exceptionally hip drinking establishment, characterized by an ambiance that exudes a relaxed and welcoming demeanor, courtesy of the affable personnel who tend to patrons' needs with alacrity and cordiality. The menu boasts an array of delectable edibles and potables, available at prices that are eminently reasonable and pocket-friendly, ensuring that indulging in the epicurean delights on offer will not exact an unreasonable toll on one's financial resources. Additionally, the venue offers a diverse selection of libations at reduced prices during the euphemistically designated 'happy hour,' a time when the already convivial atmosphere becomes even more festive and jovial. Despite its diminutive size, which may result in a capacity crowd on occasion, the bar remains an unwaveringly enjoyable destination for those seeking a gratifying and memorable experience."

I engaged in an activity while visiting Las Vegas that I rarely partake in, particularly when surrounded by acquaintances and loved ones; indeed, I relished the opportunity to savor a delectable meal in solitude, thereby earning the esteemed title of "ohitori-sama," a term used by the Japanese to describe a lone diner who is accorded great respect. My culinary escapade transpired with remarkable ease, as I secured a reservation at a prime time, received a warm welcome from the hostess, and was treated to exceptionally attentive and cordial service that struck a delightful balance between the relaxed ambiance of an American bar and the refined elegance of a French bistro. Furthermore, the exquisite cuisine warranted no further deliberation, although this author, hailing from California, found the foie gras to be a notable highlight, boasting a satisfying crispness on its seared surface. Notably, the prices were surprisingly reasonable, given the city's reputation for extravagance, with a four-course menu accompanied by an amuse bouche available for $78, and a streamlined pre-theater option offered for $48 prior to 6:30 pm. Additionally, I took advantage of the establishment's wine list, discovering that half-bottles of Champagne and Chateauneuf du Pape could be obtained for a reasonable $88, while my neighbor, a man of discerning taste, secured a full bottle of Sancerre for a mere $40, much to my admiration. However, my tranquility was momentarily disrupted by a fellow solo diner seated beside me, whose striking appearance and suave demeanor brought to mind a fictional assassin portrayed by actor Jason Statham; regrettably, his proximity shattered the illusion of a romantic French bistro experience, as he engaged me in a lively conversation replete with references to hockey and his native Ottawa.
Every time I go to Whataburger, I get chicken strips. It is the only place I can think of that gives you a piece of toast with your meal.

Service is great, dining room is clean. Our order included the alloush and June's special (mushroom melt). Both are super delicious and were served promptly however a couple of flaws gave the overall rating 4 stars. First, the bread was soggy/ chewy instead of crunchy like the toasted marks implied. Secondly, I like fresh crispy greens on sandwiches (the spinach was limp and soggy. But that might be just my opinion. Anyway, I totally recommend this place but keep this in mind so you can adjust if necessary and have a happier experience!

We've been twice in the past couple years and enjoyed both performances (Simon Boccanegra and Madame Butterfly) immensely. Unfortunately, by the time we fly in and find a hotel (even at Jerry's) we only feel like we can afford the cheap seats. The chairs are a little narrow up there in opera glass country. Might have to open the wallet a little next time. Check if there is a pre-show lecture - worth the time and you might get closer parking in the garage. Parking is a good deal for AZ.

This location is a very good example for what a Starbucks should be.  Usually, the service is good and timely, even if you go during a rush in the afternoon.  The wifi can be hit or miss depending on how many people are using it.\n\nThe reason for the four star rating is the problem that is common to most State St/Campus open areas - the transient/homeless population.  It's not unusual for one table to be taken up by someone's plastic bags or someone to be sitting out panhandling.  It's not Starbuck's fault - you see that at most coffee shops in the area.  There's really not much they can do to control the problem, short of kicking them out.  That's an issue for the city of Madison to deal with.

"An entertainment venue of considerable appeal, located in close proximity to the central thoroughfare, affords patrons the opportunity to engage in people-watching activities while partaking in alcoholic beverages and basking in the ambiance of an outdoor gathering space, with the prospect of a DJ booth slated to arrive in the near future, thereby solidifying its status as a highly recommended destination during the warmest season of the year."

"I have an unwavering fondness for this establishment, which was initially precipitated by my inaugural visit in 1996. The eatery's commitment to catering to vegan patrons is laudable and undoubtedly contributes to its enduring appeal. My most recent dining experience at this venue was marked by the consumption of two delectable dishes: a flavorful papaya salad and an assortment of fresh spring rolls, the latter of which boasted an uncommon mintiness that, while unexpected, did not detract from their inherent palatability. Furthermore, I sampled their 'Dinner #3,' a platter comprising a singularly scrumptious fried roll, a bowl of coconut soup replete with an array of mushrooms and crowned with a pungent garlicky oil (the Thai terminology for which escapes me), and a serving of pad thai that, regrettably, proved too piquant even when solicited with a request for mitigated seasoning. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, the quality of the culinary offerings and the attentive, cordial service I received during my visit left an indelible impression, ensuring that I shall return in the near future to partake in one of their tantalizing lunch specials."

Ikea for President.

Seriously, could you imagine if our government was as efficient, affordable and useful as Ikea? Between the faux wood and the real wood, Ikea offers so many options for your home in all price ranges. The help is 7 out of 10 times helpful, and Ikea provides you with almost everything you need (string to tie something to the roof of your car, big bags/cart/dollys, measuring tape, pencils and notepads).

I'm a big fan personally of the Hemnes line (real wood!) and have purchased it for my master bedroom and living room, so far with excellent results. In the past I've done Malm (haven't we all?) and was pleased with the small investment and the years I got out of that set. 

Only downside to Ikea is the directions they give you to assemble stuff. No words! Just pictures, so make sure that you're well rested and have the patience of a saint when building the larger pieces (personally, I look to my gentleman friend to assemble everything - I throw things within 5 minutes).

I live nearby  and have driven past this place many times. Today my wife called me and asked that I bring her lunch. Needless to say, we were not disappointed by these gyros. Savory meat piled high with the right amount of sauce atop a a fresh pita was a great lunch.

We don't do things just once in my house. It's our anniversary weekend and  I suggest to my husband DW Bistro. I had come two weeks ago on my B-Day weekend with my girls friend and it was amazing. When we walked in the smell alone made my husband jump. He used to own a restaurant so it's hard for me to impress him. 
We split a house salad....what a great salad...mixed greens a little fruit cheese and nuts....it is a must have.
I had the short rib sandwich and he had the salmon....everything was perfectly cooked and the flavor was great.
Our waiter was amazing and very personable....I can't wait to try their brunch!

The acts were great...the type of stuff that you would find making it onto the further rounds of America's Got Talent altogether in one show...with a good variety...good character cast and some stuff I've never seen before. 

Paid $23 (tip included) for a mojito in a thin glass. It was a good mojito and if I wasn't a local but just here on vacation I wouldn't mind, but being a local, I think of all the food that could buy. =p

Overall the entertainment exceeded my expectations, I wasn't sure what to expect.

Capprioti's \"Bobby\" took steroids, bulked up here at Eddie D's, and now calls himself sir \"Robert.\" His exterior is tougher, but deep down inside, he's still the soft, cranberry sweet , lovable stuffing we all have known to love. Robert takes gravy baths now so the chicks will love that.  Most girls will dig the 6 in Robert, but for the heftier gals, Robert transforms into 12 in also.  So don't hesitate, when you're lonely for lunch, hit up Eddie D's and find Robert waiting for your company.

I really like Paradise Bakery, I was at this location every morning for about 2 years. The staff was always friendly but sometimes the line can get long if a lot of people come in at once. It can be a long wait to get served. Being a big muffin fan I always loved the apple cinnamon and blueberry muffins and they are consistently good.

The Paradise rewards are a nice perk, compared to other coffee shops it is easy to earn free drinks and food if you are a regular and would spend the money anyway.

The only reason this location looses one star is the sometimes pushy home business folk that take over every available booth and camp with their laptops. This is during the week. On weekends you get whole families with screaming kids. This does not seem to happen at the other locations in the area, could be the proximity to the hotel next door.

it's already been said in every other review, but the Mattress Factory is pretty amazing.  They have installations that are extremely unique and orginal.  You won't find art like this anywhere else in the city.

I was an ardent devotee of the Avalon in Oakland several years ago, so when I encountered this establishment in Mt Lebanon, I felt compelled to halt my journey! Design: Visually striking attire in the storefront, complemented by a vibrant neon sign, captured my attention immediately. Typical layout found in most buy, trade, and sell shops, featuring pants, shirts, dresses, and other assorted items. However, a distinct section upfront showcased an array of stylish bags and jewelry, while a specialized area catered to the discerning tastes of Mt. Lebanon's affluent housewives, boasting high-end brands such as Prada, Gucci, and Jimmy Choo. Selection: A commendable assortment, although Buffalo Exchange surpassed it with their eclectic and fashionable offerings. Notably extensive shoe selection. Price: Reasonable and budget-friendly. Service: The cashier displayed warmth and kindness during our interaction, engaging in a brief conversation about our shared affection for certain retail establishments. Pros: Unlike many second-hand shops, this location maintained a fresh and clean atmosphere, lacking the pungent odor associated with cat urine. Its well-organized layout and aesthetically pleasing design contributed to its appeal. Additionally, the prices were incredibly reasonable, with both tank tops and dresses available for only $8.00 each. Cons: To improve the overall shopping experience, the store could benefit from clearing out some older inventory, such as outdated Hollister tank tops and plaid shorts from the '90s. Unfortunately, some middle-aged women who frequent the store can come across as whiny. Overall: This store offers an excellent option for those seeking a unique shopping experience without breaking the bank or conforming to the standard Urban Outfitters crowd. Due to its welcoming ambiance and reasonably priced merchandise, I intend to include it in my regular shopping excursions. I highly recommend paying it a visit!
Very upset this place has closed. Please come back! One of the few places in town where you can get healthy take-out.

Very nice hotel - new, modern and non-smoking! It was nice to not have a casino here. We liked being up on the 29th floor - could see a lot. Loved the automatic shades in the room, the large shower, the quick and quietly flushing toilet, and especially the tub!!!\nPrices in the market cafe were a little steep, but that's LasVegas. I appreciated being able to get a latte there in the morning.\nWe took advantage of the free valet parking. The valets were very nice and efficient. We also got to check in early - wasn't expecting that we could but a nice surprise.
Food was pretty good. My smash fries didn't have much on them, tasted almost like reg fries. And the girl who brought us our food was rude when my girlfriend asked for more mayo.

This is probably my favorite hotel I've stayed at in Vegas. I've stayed at at more than 10 different hotels in Vegas and I always enjoy my stay here. I have the M Life card so I've gotten comps and discounted rooms from here and other MGM owned hotels. (If you stay At any of these hotels I highly recommend getting this card.) The rooms here are huge and the staff is very nice. The beach setting at the pool and wave pool are awesome, especially when it's 104 degrees outside. My favorite restaurant here is the Burger Bar! The Kobe burger is great! \n\nThere are 2 minor things I don't like about this hotel, which knocks it down to 4 stars. 1) This hotel has become more of a family oriented hotel over the past 2 years. That's not a bad thing but it's not what I'm looking for in Vegas. 2)The TVs are old and not HD, at least in the rooms I've stayed in.

I've been to Vanguard quite a few times. It is definitely a great spot if your looking for a speciality cocktail or want to try something different. The bar area is nice and clean, and I've never had a problem getting a drink or sitting at the bar on a busy night. 

I tend to drink a lot of different drinks, and will spend time pondering what i am going to have indulge in at other places. Not here though. The Jack Rose. Every time I go, that is immediately what I order. Apple Brandy. Maple Syrup. Black Cherry. Damn I want one just thinking about it. Who doesn't love maple syrup. Believe me, all the drinks are good and after 2 or 3, you'll may need to take a break.
