Right in front of Pure was another guy handing out the same passes and he told us to get into the Guest List line which was shorter,even though we weren't on the guest list. We were inside the club within 5 minutes of entering the hotel. \n\nPure is pretty much a rooftop club overlooking the strip. I danced for hours just looking at the Eiffel Tower. Can't complain about that, now can you? The DJ was awesome and I wish I can remember his name because I loved pretty much everything he played. The drinks were pretty pricey but I guess you can expect that in Vegas. I'd definitely come back!

This place was excellent! The pizza was a tiny bit oily, but full of flavor. The side salad was great and we were able to enjoy a large pizza and side salad for three meals. This place delivered promptly to our hotel as well. Definitely worth ordering if you're tired and want a nice easy meal delivered to your doorstep.

This is the 3rd  version of the Springs Cafe that I know of, and its still about the same.  To be honest, the location and the view get the 4 stars, the food probably warrants about 3.5.

The dining choices are good, and I've never had bad food or bad service, but there is nothing terribly special about the offerings. A solid burger, good wraps, good pizzas, some interesting specials. Again, the food takes second place to the location.

I would definitely recommend coming here if you're in the area, the views of the valley are great. Sit out on the balcony on a warm day an just take it all it.

Great addition to Shadyside! I love the massive beer list, big menu, and bottomless mimosa and Bloody Mary option with the brunch. I had the chicken and waffles today and it was the perfect balance of southern diner meets gourmet gravy with bacon maple syrup. I live around the corner... looking forward to going back.

"This establishment may potentially be classified as a sushi restaurant, located in Henderson, Nevada. I had the pleasure of dining here with a colleague, whom I met during my lunch break, as she suggested this venue due to its proximity to our place of employment. They offer an assortment of culinary options, including cooked dishes and an array of sushi selections, accompanied by a beverage menu that features a variety of refreshments, such as green iced tea. Upon perusing their menu, I noticed they offer several lunch specials, which include a combination of six pieces of sushi or sashimi, one roll from a predetermined list, and miso soup complemented by a salad, all for the reasonable price of $12.50. Additionally, they provide patrons with the option to choose two items from a list, known as lunch bentos. However, it is worth noting that all of the lunch bento options are cooked dishes. My preference was to indulge in sushi, primarily to sample the quality of their rice. Following the soup and salad course, I was presented with a visually appealing plate, boasting generous portions of nigiri and a roll. The selection included two pieces each of maguro, distinguished by its profound red hue, nama sake, and hamachi. The presentation was artfully arranged, creating a colorful pattern. Furthermore, I opted for the spicy yellowtail roll as my roll choice. To my surprise, the quality of the food was quite satisfactory, especially considering our landlocked location. The rice was also well-prepared. Our server was both friendly and efficient, ensuring a seamless dining experience. The ambiance within the establishment is tranquil, enhanced by a painting of a cherry blossom on the rear wall. Overall, this eatery is a suitable choice for a quick, satisfying meal on this side of town."

GREAT food! you know its a good vegan place when your non-veg friends like it enough to go back. everything looked and tasted delicious, packed with flavor! prices are extremely good for the quality and portions of the food. cant complain if you can leave feeling completely stuffed (i eat alot) for about $10.\n\nadvice: might want to avoid friday night dinner rush...it was pretty slammed, and my girlfriend didnt even get her drink until AFTER the meal, about 20 mins after ordering said drink.

Craving a slice of NY pizza and you live in Vegas? I think we all agree, this place is IT!  Some may complain it's too far from the strip or from Summerlin. Trust me, it's worth the drive. Why didn't I give it a 5 star? Because, I've had NY pizza and nothing comes close to that. Go get yourself a slice.\n\nAnd if you don't care what your thighs will say after you've devoured a pint of creamy ice cream then head on over next door...(I don't remember the name). They have great lucious creamy ice cream. yum!
Thus place is very clean! Good seating, and very friendly and efficient staff! Have to say thus subway should be an example on how they should be ran! Definitely will go back again!

How have I never reviewed this place before? It's close by so I do come here. Like once a month I show up. 

It has that great dimly lit dive bar feel. You know you could get laid if you wanted to.  The drinks are cheap and the bartenders are cool. 

I like the people most.... you get such a fun variety the normal alcoholics, people in their work clothes, people hoping not to run into anyone they know, and plenty of stoners. Being a semi attractive girl the mostly male patrons treat you like you are family.... the creepy kind they want to kiss... but still family.   You can be relaxed and grab a few beers or get good and drunk either way you will fit  fit in just fine. 

It's worth a trip and when the drunk people get kicked out of Santisi Brothers they walk to the other side if the parking lot and come here.  If nothing else grab a beer and watch the people that come here. 

Also I might note that they only have 1 stall for women but there is often no line and MOST the time it does not smell like farts and coochie.

"What an extraordinary setting! The alfresco area is utterly captivating and would serve as an idyllic venue for a communal evening meal. We opted to dine indoors for lunch and began our culinary excursion with a platter of crispy tortilla chips accompanied by a creamy guacamole dip. As the main course, I selected the daily special, which consisted of a generous serving of seared mahi-mahi atop a bed of sautÃ©ed spinach. The portion was so copious that I was unable to consume the entire dish, despite my best efforts."

It is my firm belief that Small hole in the Wall BBQ/ Southern places should be given their own set of common customer service rules...I have noticed the small places seem to go at their own pace, forget and change orders midstream and frequently end up treating you like you are visiting at their home not their restaurant. 
Memphis has this type of feel. We got there right at opening and that created "speedbumps" , still counting change,  putting chairs down , food not made yet...but the good news is this place is delicious in my book. 
After finally getting our order straightened out ...I had yummy Beef ribs with a lovely pink ring that scream I have been smoked.  the coleslaw was unususua and I loved it ...guess what it was mustard based..loved the taste and the sweet sour effect of sugar in the dressing with the mustard.  husband had the Pulled pork but it wasn't quite as yummy as my ribs, he didn't adore the sugary bbq sauce that had a peppery back kick. Oh well  guess he should have gotten the ribs.  
So the  next  time you are in Buckeye stop  bye  and give it a try .

Sometimes good things really do come in small packages!  Considering that this is Vegas' first casino and that it was built in 1906, this boutique hotel/casino is classy but simplistic and very nice inside!  I love the row of old style slot machines - very neat touch.  The casino floor and bathrooms are spotless.  The dealers are dressed as flappers at night, which I think is really fun.  

We haven't stayed here but signed up for Club 1906 and it didn't take much gambling (playing joker poker at the bar while enjoying "free" drinks) before we received free room offers in the mail.  Maybe we'll take advantage of this later on if we want to do a downtown staycation.  

If you're downtown and haven't checked out the first Las Vegas casino, stop in for a drink or some craps!  This place is totally fun!

I'm not in the business of enjoying many buffets these days. My girlfriend doesn't appreciate my ever expanding waste line and my new found squishy qualities as much as I do. So where's the first place I go on a weekend away with the dudes? Buffet.

Nope, the food isn't spectacular, the service isn't worth raving about, and the atmosphere is pretty reminiscent of a fancy high school cafeteria. But, it's a buffet. You pay a small, small price for an endless supply of food. Best part? I had steak, New Orleans chicken, gobs of rice, heaps of ice cream, and some other stuff I can't remember because of the food coma, AND all of it was either respectably OK or even fairly enjoyable. 

Golden Corral will forever have a spot in my heart and a gaping hole in my stomach to fill.

I love this place and their selections! They always have red velvet unlike the places that switch out their flavors (ahem, ahem MoJo, yogurtology, etc)!!!!! their newest featured flavors are the bananalicious and hawaiin something and their BOTH delish!\n\nThe ONLY reason they didnt get 5 stars from me is because......THEY DONT FREAKING HAVE JUICE POPPERS!!!! how do you not have juice poppers!?  EVERYONE LOVES JUICE POPPERS!!!

"We opted for a brunch excursion, yet our culinary inclinations led us to select items from the grilled cheese menu instead. I relished in the 'wake and bake,' an unparalleled delight that harmoniously combined the richness of cheddar, the savory essence of maple bacon, and the velvety texture of maple mayo. It was utterly sublime, transcending mere mortal taste buds. My companion had the 'blarney stoner,' an open-faced creation that juxtaposed mashed potatoes, beer cheese, and stout gravy atop a foundation of bread, accompanied by fries and hash browns. While not strictly adhering to the definition of grilled cheese, it was undeniably delectable. All grilled cheese dishes are served with tomato soup and fries; the latter were substantial, sporting a crispy exterior and fluffy interior, and offered in various flavors such as old bay - an unimpeachable choice. The tomato soup presented an interesting dichotomy - while not unpalatable, its viscosity verged on excessive, rendering it impractical as a standalone dish, but nevertheless fulfilling its role as a dip for the fries. Our server exhibited commendable proficiency and promptness, leaving no room for dissatisfaction. Moreover, the establishment boasts an impressive array of beers, ensuring our future patronage."

Just to the left of Atria's on the Roberto Clemente Bridge side of PNC Park is where you'll find The Diamond Pizza. 

Not only do they have really good pizza, the cheese is especially good, but you can enter the park there as well. Never a line.  Friendly ticket taker and bag search person greet you at the door, scan your ticket and provide a program along with any promotional items for the game.

Once inside, order by the slice, grab a beer if that's your pleasure and watch the game on either of the TVs before going to your seats. Another bonus, restrooms are just outside the restaurant as you enter the left field corridor. 

Like most pizza/sandwich shops, this one can be hopping. No frills in the service, mustard working folks trying to make good food for the money. And they do.

Well I went in here looking for gifts for others, but only came out with stuff for myself....hummmm something is wrong with this picture! \nI love Ross stores, I shouldn't have even started looking for stuff for me, it get's me every time!

Old-fashioned convivial ambiance and exceptional deals are hallmarks of this establishment, where the prime rib and lobster dishes are served with an abundance of vegetables and a generously sized baked potato, thereby providing patrons with an unparalleled epicurean experience.

"Holly's endorsement is spot on! As a seasoned participant, this marks my second year engaging in this celebrated event. In the previous year, I opted for the cycling segment, which unfortunately encountered organizational challenges, leading to its absence in the current edition. However, I partake in the 5K walk with great enthusiasm, accompanied by my trusty beard, ensuring a seamless experience. My preferred parking location is the north lot, allowing for a swift departure via Sunset. It is worth mentioning that the burgeoning canine population attending annually raises concerns for me. Nonetheless, I must commend the organizers for maintaining a clean environment by encouraging responsible pet ownership. The pre-event entertainment, featuring renowned performers such as Jabbawockeez from the Monte Carlo, dancers from Fantasy at the Luxor, and even five parachuting Santas descending from a helicopter above the boulevard, contributes significantly to the festive atmosphere. Moreover, the unique opportunity to traverse the Sunset freeway by foot, an experience not commonly had, adds to the appeal of this occasion. Most importantly, this event serves as the primary fundraiser for Opportunity Village, a deserving charity in Southern Nevada. Needless to say, I eagerly anticipate my participation in the forthcoming edition, dressed in my finest attire, of course!"

Another successful transplant from NYC, this place is great.  Spendy, trendy, and a little confusing menu wise if you have a big group like we did.  we had a great waiter that helped us with our order and nobody left disappointed or un-full.  The place is loud and full of energy and beautiful people.

Ask for help with the menu if theres a group.  If youre a couple youre golden.  So many things to try, you could eat here 100 times.

No complaints at all.

Hidden away it is!  I forgot where it was located (some friends drove me here and I was not paying attention as to how we arrived).\n\nThe interior is funky, dark, and small (cool copper counter tops) but that just adds to the character.  I ordered pork enchiladas(?) and shared the sauteed garlic dish (i think that's what it was)?  It was very yummy and left me wanting more.  The only downfall was that the garlic must have gotten into my pores b/c I felt like I smelled of garlic for days!  It was well worth it though and a spot you should certainly check out.

I undertook a personal culinary excursion to this establishment several months ago, and I must say that I am thoroughly delighted that I did, for the consumables served here are indeed delectable. Specifically, I indulged in their spicy meat taco, which proved to be a flavorsome and satisfying experience. Subsequently, I revisited this venue a few weeks later and opted for their burrito, which not only met but exceeded my expectations, surpassing the quality of a similar dish offered by Chipotle. However, I do lament the lack of clarity regarding the nature of the meats utilized in their dishes, as the majority of them are unfamiliar to me, and perhaps a more diverse selection of carbonated beverages or the inclusion of tea would enhance the overall dining experience. Nonetheless, this establishment earns high marks for providing an economical and satisfying dining option, serving scrumptious tacos, burritos, and street corn late into the evening hours.
i really want to give it 5 stars but my carne adovada sometimes is kinda fatty. i love this dish but hate sometimes picking through fat. they do have the best chipotle ranch ever!!!
Best Chai Latte in town. We had a chocolate twist and a quiche lorraine. Both very light and delicious. Brought home a ciabatta boule, which was much more moist than we are used to but very good.

"Delectable culinary offerings, complemented by exceptional customer service, have solidified this establishment as a recurring destination for our gastronomical indulgences. We unreservedly endorse the sesame tofu, a dish that showcases the pinnacle of flavorsome tofu preparation within the realm of restaurants."

The dissatisfaction I experienced with my recent order from this establishment compelled me to deduct a star from my rating, as the Teriyaki Chicken rice bowl I ordered failed to meet my expectations in terms of taste and texture, with an unpleasant, sodden consistency that my colleague aptly likened to a frozen meal that had been reheated, leading me to conclude that I will restrict my future orders to the 5-star wraps and salads, thereby allowing me to avoid the subpar bowls that garnered a mere 2.5 stars.

"Excellent artistic renderings and creative endeavors! The primary male protagonist exhibited remarkable comedic skills and the compact nature of the venue contributed to an atmosphere of familiarity and inclusivity. While I would have preferred a more substantial role for Angel, it was nevertheless entertaining to observe her temporarily deviate from her customary artistic pursuits. \n\nP.S. The absinthe, although not quite comparable to its foreign counterparts in terms of quality and authenticity, served as an effective marketing tool and its presence was appreciated nonetheless."

I went back a second time and they have changed the way they make the Wellington.  It now only comes one way you cannot order it medium well or any other way.  Just thought it was funny after my initial review.  Still very good though!

The review by Jennifer C. is spot on. I had a very similar experience. I'm from Pittsburgh and taking a 'tour' of my hometown seemed odd at first, but this was definitely a unique way to get around town. \n\nThe only reason I didn't give this more stars though was that I have to say this adventure was more Segway, less tour. Riding the Segway was a ton of fun (especially after they turned off the speed limiter) but there wasn't much to the tour itself. The guide pointed out a few interesting facts here and there, but I was hoping for more.

Make certain that your stomach is suitably prepared for an influx of copious amounts of delectable sustenance, lest you risk experiencing a state of culinary satiation bordering on somnolence, should you opt to partake in a dining experience at this establishment; for the servings, far from being modest in their magnitude, are truly enormous and will undoubtedly engender a sensation of lethargy, rendering any subsequent physical activity decidedly challenging. Furthermore, the fries accompanying the various sandwich options are likewise of exceptional quality and will assuredly contribute to your overall sense of gastronomic satisfaction.

What is up with the host's lately in restaurants. They have zero personality and really don't set a great first impression. Anyhow lets get to food and service. Carol is great and really overcomes the original impression left by the podium guards. We ordered a tomatoe caprisi appetizer and it was excellent!  A new variation on a classic. Tomatoes are spread out on the plate and has chopped tomaroes spread around. The new addition to this classic is fresh red onion and then a balsamic reduction and fresh basil. I could eat this dish as an main course but I don't have that much restraint. I orderes pasta franco and it was very food. The combination of olives artichoke hearts and sundried tomatoe makes this dish a little salt towards the end but it wasn't unexpected. I would order it again.  Carol Is very attentive but never pushy and you should definitely ask for her. We don't dine here often enough but we will remedy that.
Come for the coffee, stay (or come back) for the excellent fresh soup, sandwiches and smoothies!  Would be 5 stars if the service was more consistent.
Fast, polite and the food was good.  The Thai Tacos and fried Mac&Cheese was yummy.  Great burgers as well. This is no culinary stop but good fast food.

Great place!  Pretty slow, as you might expect on a Monday night.  Had nice Malbec, great marinaded olives and a perfect-sized sausage and mushroom pizza.  

Decor is very spiffy.  Rather hard to find the place if you're not a local.  Little strip mall right behind the tire store.  Look Arden, as it's worth searching for.

Get in here!!

Eines vorweg: In diesem Chinarestaurant habe ich bislang nur das Mittagsbuffet kennengelernt. Die Bewertung bezieht sich ausschliesslich darauf.


 Mittlerweile gehen wir einmal wöchentlich zu diesem chinesischen Restaurant. Das Buffet wird ständig aufgefüllt, so dass es fast immer genug von allem hat. Meine Lieblingsgerichte hier sind die acht Kostbarkeiten und das Hühnchen in Curry. Fazit: Solide Kost zu einem vernünftigen Preis ohne Wartezeiten.

"Dickey's provided a pivotal salvation to my Thanksgiving festivities by offering a pair of turkey options, specifically the Cajun Fried Turkey and Smoked Turkey, priced at $49.99 apiece, albeit the latter was the sole remaining variety given the dearth of availability at other establishments such as Hash House a Go Go, Mimi's Cafe, Lucilles, and Famous Daves, which had depleted their inventory of turkeys, thereby necessitating a prompt acquisition of the former; fortunately, Dickey's still had one smoked turkey available, which I swiftly secured, much to my relief. The procedure for retrieving the culinary item was remarkably efficient, as I was able to rapidly collect my purchase within a span of five minutes, although it is worth noting that the venue is closed on Thanksgiving Day itself, thus necessitating a pre-holiday collection; furthermore, the packaging was well-designed, as the turkey arrived wrapped in foil and positioned within an oven-safe aluminum pan, facilitating a hassle-free heating process that required approximately two hours to attain an optimal temperature for consumption, much to my satisfaction, given that my companion had recently relocated to Las Vegas and possessed limited cooking utensils, rendering low-maintenance fare a paramount concern; ultimately, the gustatory experience afforded by the turkey was quite enjoyable, with apprehensions regarding the potential lack of traditional Thanksgiving flavors assuaged by its delectable taste, although admittedly inferior to the most exceptional examples I have sampled, yet still meriting appreciation. Moreover, the convenience afforded by Dickey's offerings allowed me to focus on engaging in recreational activities, such as Settlers of Catan and Wii Tennis, rather than devoting extensive time and effort to preparing a substantial avian dish."

We randomly walked into the restaurant, after a long day.  We couldn't find something that used to be on the menu, but the waiter still placed our order.  Ended up ordering our own version of \"Surf and Turf\" - an 8 oz filet mignon and a lobster tail, with mashed potatoes and a salad.  Was incredible disappointed with the salad.  It looked like someone just opened a bag of iceburg lettuce and dropped it in a bowl.  The lobster tail was a bit over cooked and super chewy.  But the filet mignon and mashed potatoes were amazing, but I'm also and meat and potato person. :-)  I still like the intimacy and classiness of the restaurant.  It might have been because we came in so close to closing time.  Been there before with better food, so will definitely give them another chance.

"An exceptional, timeless ice cream parlor, reminiscent of days past, boasting an extensive array of toppings, allowing patrons to craft their own distinctive masterpieces or savor signature creations, rendering it an enjoyable venue with commendable hospitality, complemented by delectable frozen delights, ensuring its status as a mandatory stopover during future spring training excursions."

This eatery, despite being part of a larger franchise, offers a remarkable dining experience, surpassing expectations with its generous portions of delectable, slow-cooked meats and fresh, flavorful ingredients, all at an affordable price point. The tacos, in particular, showcase the culinary expertise of the kitchen staff, with each bite bursting with rich, savory flavors that linger long after the meal is finished. Additionally, the burritos are of considerable size, stuffed to capacity with an assortment of mouthwatering components, including rice, beans, cheese, salsa, guacamole, and your choice of protein. Furthermore, the service is prompt, courteous, and welcoming, with staff members eager to accommodate any special requests or dietary restrictions. To top it off, patrons can enjoy either a complimentary cookie or a scoop of creamy ice cream for dessert, providing a sweet conclusion to a satisfying meal.

Short wait.  Television available in news or sport channel. Bring reading material or tablet to pass the time. Mammography technicians were good. Office personnel really nice but a little disorganized. They really try to accommodate patients in.

"A culinary establishment offering an innovative fusion of Asian gastronomic traditions, which has provided me with an exemplary dining experience on three separate occasions, characterized by the serving of delectable dishes such as garlic crab and salt and pepper calamari, albeit with an emphasis on the utilization of sodium chloride and black peppercorns in the latter dish, thereby rendering it advisable for patrons to possess a predilection for savory flavors; furthermore, the ambiance of this eatery exudes an air of sophistication, courtesy of a live jazz ensemble performing ambient melodies, rendering it an ideal setting for either a romantic evening or social gathering with acquaintances, although it may not be suitable for young children due to the complexity of the menu offerings and the potential for prolonged waiting periods between courses, and, owing to my personal preference for convenience, I typically opt for hired transportation rather than risking the unpredictability of parking facilities in the vicinity."

"The culinary delight known as Cheese Ravioli, accompanied by an Alfredo sauce of unparalleled quality, transcended my gastronomical expectations. For the modest sum of $7, I was presented with an adequate quantity of six ravioli, enrobed in a rich, velvety sauce that was complemented by a warm, soft breadstick. The dish was not only satisfying but also possessed an ideal portion size, which satiated my hunger without inducing discomfort. As an aficionado of Alfredo sauce, I can unequivocally attest that this particular rendition is among the finest I have had the pleasure of consuming, boasting an impressive depth of flavor that was neither diluted nor insipid. Although the pizza offerings at this establishment may be somewhat prohibitive in terms of cost, I am eagerly anticipating my next visit, when I shall indulge in additional servings of their delectable pasta."

You can really taste the inspiration that Dogfish Head and Founders had on NoDa Brewing Company.  

The Hop, Drop 'n Roll is a sharp and citrusy IPA while the  Woody & Wilcox IPA has a bit more gentle earthiness to it.  The Coco Loco was the first NoDa beer I ever tried.  Bold and subtle at the same time, this beer would be a great campfire replacement for smores.  Many of the other beers I've tried are strongly built and carry their own weight while mingling with the others.

The inside of NoDa BC is a typical taproom.  There are tables and a bar.  The patrons are an ensemble of culture as you'll find many types of people here.  Mostly people that take beer seriously, though.

I can't say there is anything that puts NoDa over the top.  It feels like a work in progress...or maybe that's because the beer hasn't really knocked my socks off yet. 

I do know that I like this place and will come back again.

Try:  The Coco Loco (I know...you don't like the gimmicky porters...but try it anyhow)

Avoid:  Being one of the smokers huddled under the awning when it rains outside

Love my pizza Naked! Let's start by saying that I'm just excited to get SOMETHING in the neighborhood that isn't the same ole' same ole' that is on every street corner in Phoenix. So I awaited Naked Pizza with anticipation. 

I expected it to be busy Friday night when I pulled in. I found a parking spot right up front. I was surprised that there was no seating and it is take out/delivery only. But that's ok if it is tasty! We asked for suggestions and we were given a couple of recommendations. We ordered a 10" Superbiotic and a 10" BBQ chicken both on original crust. 

There were a few people in the lobby and ordering. It was clear that they were buzzing around like bees in the back keeping up with orders and the warming oven was full to the brim with boxes of pizzza so they were clearly very busy. I waited about 7 minutes for the pizza and we were on our way. We were very happy with the in-store service. 

When we got the pizza home I was even more impressed. I found the crust to be absolutely delicious. The Superbiotic was as yummy as any $19 smaller pizza in any wood-fired joint. The crust was tasy and good...Now I'm not a huge pizza eater. My favorite is a White pizza....but this I ate every single solitary morsel of. None left for the dogs or anyone else! 

I was back Sunday and Wednesday. 

Welcome to the neighborhood Naked Pizza!!

I have been twice since it opened, the first time we went they made a couple mistakes on our order, but they were quickly rectified and it was understandable since everyone there is new. The food has been excellent with good pricing. It's clean with a fun atmosphere. If you simply compare to Baja Fresh and their pricing it's easy to see how much more you get for your money at Wahoos.

I went here with a party of 6 on Saturday night.  Our table was ready and waiting when we got there which was nice.  It is an older place with tons of charm.  The place was pretty busy and you could tell that the waiters/servers/busers were clearly over worked.

After sitting for about 10 minutes we had to flag someone down to get bread and place our appetizer order.  After that we only saw our waiter every 20 minutes or so so it was difficult to order additional items or to get soda refills.

The service was pretty blah but the food was excellent.  Everything I tried was top notch.  Everything was freshly made and delicious  Probably some of the best Italian cuisine around.  Definitely some of the best gnocchi I've ever had.

I would definitely return but hope the service is better.

The search is over, I have found taco heaven. I sampled a chicken, asada, and pork street taco. The pork was a little sweet and smokey, the asada was well seasoned and smoky and the chicken too was a winner, just not as a flavorful. My husband let me taste the Bombero burrito, OMG, was that Mexican barbecue sauce on the burrito? The dining experience was well worth the 30 minute drive. I would sample everything on the menu. Thanks for the suggestion Bill B.

My sibling and I partook of a culinary experience at this establishment, subsequent to our exposure to an advertisement that portrayed the venue as a popular gathering place among celebrities. The advertisement featured images of notable personalities such as Rachel Bilson and Paris Hilton participating in festive events at the restaurant, thus we inferred that the quality of the cuisine must be exceptional. The eatery was characterized as offering gourmet "college food," which resonated with our nostalgia for the convenience foods we indulged in during our academic tenure, when time constraints precluded the preparation of nutritious meals. We sampled the Mini Kobe Burger sliders and the renowned Buffalo Chicken wings, as well as a portion of fries presented in an aesthetically pleasing spiral container. The culinary offerings we consumed were indeed palatable. Although the prices may be considered slightly elevated, the ambiance and gastronomical quality justify the expense, particularly for patrons who appreciate the appeal of a stylish, trendy dining environment within the Bellagio. If given the opportunity, I would recommend indulging in the steak, as it is purported to be among the finest in Las Vegas, according to various critics and gastronomical aficionados.

If had breakfast at this Ahwatukee spot three days in a row. Weekends are busy but the hostess offered seating at the bar. We waited for a table. The chiliquilas were better than expected. The El Jefe was as advertised.  When I ordered the huevos rancheros I got a pancake on the side. The pancake was fantastic and the ranchero is salsa was great. Service was mentioned in previous posts it was good. Busy restaurants have longer ticket times for your meals on way a busy Saturday morning.

I am a huge fan of the Penn Brewery and if you don't know me I am a bit of a booze hound. I love beer! All types, all colors, all ABV's. So I ran in here today for lunch but I  am not allowed to imbibe during work hours. Woe is me....the world is not fair! My point is if you enjoy a beer, just about any type...this is the place to start. I have been here 10+ times and this was my only non-drinking visit. \n\nI enjoyed the Braumeister Steak Sandwich with fries. The food, service and atmosphere were great. Try to find the time to visit this place. Well worth the stop.

Fantastic food! Had drinks & apps at the bar with a friend. A couple great IPA offerings. I am not a big calamari person, but the stewed calamari was outstanding, definitely recommend! Also had a mozzarella caprese which was good. It's a quiet bar, the Sunday night NFL game was playing on the TVs so wouldn't recommend it for game watching, but great place for a date.

My best friend and I visited Zinburger on a week night and found it to be fairly busy.  Although we could have gotten a table (with no wait) we opted to sit at the bar facing into the restaurant.  Wonderful design element.  We had an excellent view of what was going on and both agreed that the layout and design was excellent.

The food was expensive but it was very good.  We split a kobe burger, double truffle fries, zucchini fries and a bottle of wine.  I was definitely just the right amount of full and left feeling wonderful (maybe that was due to the wine?).  

I'll be back to splurge.  This place was splendid.

Benihana is best enjoyed when you: 
Have money
A large group of people
and a lot of time to spare. 

Probably something to do once or twice a year. I go when my friends from Iowa decide to come visit me and we have time and money to spare. Everyone there is friendly, and I love the cook in front of you style. (Although sometimes the fire tricks make my eyes hurt). 

Please note this place is not known for their sushi. I would recommend anything hibachi and if you look like you're a kid, it's a good idea to get some sort of kids meal  (if they have one, unfortunately I look like I'm 30 something and my babies are too young and wild to bring anywhere nice)  I want to note too, that I personally feel like they have the best  fried rice.

I've read both ends of the reviews on this boarding facility and I have to err on the side of positive rather than negative.

I dropped off my jack russell terrier there for one night and have no complaints.  They are more pricey than I would like to see, but the facility (in a large business park warehouse) was large and was comparable to Pet Smart's hotel.  You make up the price difference when you consider that the dogs are constantly socializing and playing with each other for most of the day.  You don't have to pay extra for the socialization and it gets your dog out of its pen.

For my small dog, I did have a small pen, which had its own cot.  There are tvs scattered around showing dog related cartoons and programming.  There are small, medium, and large sized play areas, depending on your size dog.  You can see some of the areas from the front desk at check in.  Both at check in and at check out, I did see an "accident" or two on the floor in the play area, but given the amount of dogs that were running around, I'd say that's probably only natural.

The staff members were very friendly, and I will book space there again next time I'm in town.  Is it a perfect location?  No, but I have yet to find one that is.  It's getting there, however, and I would have no problem endorsing it.
Great atmosphere, good food and good service. If you are in the Belmont area, a must stop. I had a burger which was great in this little hometown Irish pub.

This cool spot is conveniently located at the MGM Grand if you need a quick break from some slots.  The food was way better than I expected.  I tried the pork belly sandwich and caesar salad and was really impressed.  Both of these dishes are really, really awesome.  I tried the pizza with all the meat lover's fixings and it was extremely tasty but not as crispy as I would have expected (as a native Bronxite, I'm understandably biased).  Overall, I highly recommend this joint!

The tortillas alone could make this place. 

I went at 12:30pm - got food and a table right away. I got the bean and cheese burrito with a side of guacamole. Everything was excellent and fresh. But the highlight, as mentioned, were the tortillas. They appeared to be homemade. And they were incredible.

The menu is limited, but also cheap. So I don't really see room for complaints there. The house the restaurant lives in is cute and cozy feeling.

I liked this place even more when I learned that America was the name of the owner and not some cheesy restaurant title.

"It is utterly astonishing that in this era of unparalleled economic prosperity, a behemoth of an entertainment company such as Cirque du Soleil would struggle to fill a stadium on a Saturday evening, particularly in the premium seating section. Our decision to attend the performance was rather impromptu, motivated by the fervent desire of my youthful companion to experience the production once more. Upon entering the venue, we were fortunate enough to secure prime front-center seats, which afforded us an unobstructed view of the captivating spectacle that unfolded before our eyes. As I watched the performance for the second time, I was struck by the sheer depth and complexity of the artistic vision that permeated every aspect of the show, from the intricate costumes to the elaborate choreography, all of which combined to create a truly immersive experience for the audience."

One of the few choices that you have at the Waverley Train Station  for food before you board the train your destination.

There are always plenty of sandwiches and salad bowls but later on at night a lot of the shelves are empty with not many staff to fill them.

The store is rather on the small side and makes it feel cramped.

"Oh dear, it appears we have a novel contestant vying for the accolade of supreme Thai cuisine in Las Vegas. While everyone is familiar with one rival, it seems there is another entry in the commercial area aiming to seize the crown. Prior to this unplanned luncheon excursion, I was oblivious to the reality that Komol presents truly delectable Thai fare. Thus, I found myself venturing beyond my customary boundaries, sampling unfamiliar and intriguing dishes that I would never have considered previously. My reluctance was overcome not once but twice - initially, to visit this establishment, and subsequently, to indulge in a tofu-based entree. What?! No meat?! It turns out, I have been missing out on something extraordinary. The culinary experience unfolded as follows: fresh spring rolls, delightful and remarkably non-greasy; pad kee mow with tofu, a flavorful and slightly spicy (level 3, given my novice taste buds) dish that I initially approached with trepidation but eventually devoured without sharing; and lastly, Panang curry with chicken, a welcome respite for my carnivorous inclinations, albeit still at a relatively mild level 3. Apologies to seasoned Thai gourmands, my nascent palate cannot currently tolerate the fiery intensity; however, with time, I shall gradually elevate my spice threshold to a 10, and undoubtedly, subsequent visits will warrant an updated review to a 5."

Ive been hear twice now. Once on 4/20 2013 and 1/10/14 both good times. Its Downtown so what do you expect, its not the strip so nice jeans and shirt works. Now on 4/20 day this place was so packed, there was a line to get to the roof top and the place was just to packed. All of Vegas was packed so we got used to it. Dancing was a minimum just to packed. Now on 1/10/14 the place was busy but at least we were able to dance and enjoy the night on top of the roof with a beer in my hand. Drinks a little pricey with a beer and cosmo for 17 bucks. Bartenders drinks, my GF liked, so they knew how to make drinks. Both times we were there we had no issues, good atmosphere so we will be back.

This is my second time here. I like the way they team up on my car if they have extra hands available and get it done fast. And they do a good job. I just got my car painted so I don't want the high pressure hoses used on it. They gladly accommodate by using the regular hose. They offered to bundle and save me money when I asked for a detail on the inside.

The beau and I stopped by on a whim whilest exploring our new city and it's probably the best find so far. 

Walking in for a late dinner we were happily greeted and easily seated. Service was prompt and pleasant. We ordered some garlic naan, chicken tikka masala and chicken vidaloo. All came out within 10 minutes and boy was it amazing! The tikka masala was creamy and fresh. My beau ordered his vidaloo spicy, and it was the perfect amount of spicy.  We've been back at least 8x since and always end up happily full. (ITIS!)

I can't wait to try the lunch buffet!

"Culinary excellence is the primary draw of this establishment, as the ambiance and clientele fail to impress. Despite the diminutive dimensions of the venue and the unremarkable character of its patrons, the gastronomical delights available here are truly exceptional and competitively priced. As such, I have no qualms about frequenting this eatery solely for the purpose of savoring its delectable offerings, even if it means tolerating an environment that falls short of my expectations in terms of both aesthetics and social appeal. While I would readily bestow a perfect rating upon this restaurant were it not for its physical constraints and unsatisfactory patronage, I must deduct a star from my overall assessment due to these factors."

If you are serious about looking like a pimp, this is absolutely your destination.  There are a mix of consignment items and new pimp-gear.  I drooled over the three ties painted with Vargas girls ($100 each).  Oddly, almost everything I looked at was priced at $85.  The woman working there did not get off the phone or offer to help me the entire time I was there.

I like perusing this place! They have many colorful decor items, including furniture, sculptures, furniture, fabric, bobbing turtles...the list continues. I bought some decorative tiles on here for $1 each. These are unique and cheap gifts, a good place to go if you want to give someone an \"Arizona\" present.

Came on a Saturday morning at 9:30am and we were seated immediately, service was very nice.  I greatly enjoyed my Brunch Des Cantons, perfectly cooked beans and various pork.  My fiance liked her Brunch Sucre, but wasn't blown away by it.  Solid Coffee and OJ included with brunch.  All in all a very pleasant experience.

Stayed here September of 07'.  Twice.  WTH?!?

Yeah some allergic reaction mixed with something viral; made my throat close up and could barely breathe; nearly passed out.

Long story short; the nurses are zero supreme (Number 1) and my private room was bangin'!

They actually listened to me when I told them I have "hidden veins" and a butterfly needle would suit me.

My beau, parents and daughter all came to visit and also were pleased at my accommodations.  

God forbid something else unfortunate should happen to me, but if it does, Meriter is my hospital.

Thanks!
Nice to see that Panera is the same here in Madison WI. Good quality food, very nice employees. This is a fairly busy location but they move people through rather quickly.

Well for gourmet burgers it was ok. The server Dominic was pretty awesome. The establishment is clean, friendly, and family oriented. I know this review is coming a few months late but I honestly have nothing memorable about the food except for the bottomless fries and I do remember the burger I ordered was a bit dry and thinking if I come back here I'm never ordering THAT again. Wish I could remember what it was called...That was a plus. I will come by again if I'm in the area...have to give the place a second try. :)

The first time i had Burrito Boyz, I was at a meeting where the food was catered. I had no idea where my mystery burrito fell from. 

My first impression? It was the best burrito I've ever had. Brain: "Wow there like avocado in here too". What else can i say? They put everything you could possible want (and things you didn't know you wanted) in your burrito. 

I've been to the Toronto location a few times the food tastes the same. The quality, service, and price at this location however is not up to par.

But whatever, you came for the burrito.

Hubby and I went here on a date night. Sushi was yummy and so were the drinks. We went on a busy Sat. evening and there was a DJ so it was a little loud not overbearing though. Makes for good people watching. Our waitress was sweet and knowledgeable about the menu. We'll definately revisit this one.

I went here for lunch with my bf. If you bike here or walk, they give a 20% discount or something. Check in on foursquare and use your amex card for 5$ off.

 It was a casual afternoon. I had the trout and he had the happy hour fish and chips. Our food was delicious. I think the only thing I had a bit of complaint was I felt a bit rushed. However, the food and drinks are amazing. The fish and chips were fresh and so crispy. The trout dish had green beans and peanuts. I ordered mash as a side too. Fish was seasoned perfectly and green beans were crunchy not soggy. 

 Overall,  I had a great experience and will return!

"It was indeed a thoroughly enjoyable experience that we had the pleasure of indulging in. My palate tends to be rather discerning when it comes to wine, but that proved to be no obstacle for this establishment, as they were able to proffer an alternative that perfectly met my expectations. The crustacean delicacies, specifically the lobster and crab legs, were utterly delectable and left me in a state of gastronomic nirvana. Moreover, the staff was accommodating enough to allow me to tailor my own unique dessert creation, which further enhanced the overall dining experience. It is worth mentioning that securing an outdoor table during the reservation process is highly recommended, as the accompanying view of the lake, complemented by the captivating light display, serves as the proverbial 'icing on the cake.'"

Toast is an excellent place for a weekend breakfast out. The service is very efficient and all the wait staff seems to work as a team (anyone will refill your coffee or fill any immediate need you may have). Prices are very reasonable and the food is above average, By that I mean their eggs, coffee, corn bread, fruit, etc. are all better than what you would expect from a popular price restaurant - most breakfast entries were $8 and under- but the fruit salad was as good as you have at home, if you had a well stocked kitchen. The place is perfect for young families as service is fast and prices are very moderate. Not only will your children like it but you can bring the grandparents as they will be the only ones who will recognize the music playing. \nIf you find their food is not up to your very high standards then breakfast at The Gallery or Cafe Monte or Zebras and pay two times Toast's prices; for me Toast hits the sweet spot between quality and price,

Pleasantly surprised...thought this was just another delicatessen, but this place had a really extensive menu offering something for everyone.  I just stopped in for a snack, but would like to go back and eat a full meal.

If you strictly  Love Hip Hop and R/B this is you place\n\nGreat place to eat and party, I ate there once on my second time in Vegas I had the fire pit. which is $50 which is steep but worth it. Little that I know Rum Jungle turn into a club after the restaurant shuts down  so my  party stayed instead of going to another venue  and It was live this was in 2005. As I revisit there last November of 2009 It did not let me down Hip Hop and R/B all night Best spot If you like those Genres drink price's was Vegas but I must of been tipping the Bartender good because I got Bay Area  prices for two consecutive nights with the same bartender. So my verdict great atmosphere ,strong drinks,All different type's of rum Hip hop and R/B strictly man I have a hard time going to other club's while in Vegas after experiencing the Rum Jungle.

Prices are good and portions are great. I almost couldn't finish all my food. I've been here for breakfast and dinner and was satisfied with both my visits! The staff was very friendly and you don't have to wait very long for your food. Will most likely return in the future.

Looks can be deceiving!  \n\nWe have passed by this place dozens of times and never thought it was much more than what it looked like from the outside, just another bar in a strip mall.  How wrong we were!  Last night we wanted to go out and have some good Wisconsin 'pub' food, but wanted to try someplace different.  After looking through reviews of numerous places on this site and others, I decided to give this place a try.  My family was a little skeptical at first, but once we entered fears began to ease.  The size, layout, decor and most importantly the food were all top notch for a pub.  The only reason I didn't give it five stars was picayune, but important to me.  Last night was Friday which means Fish Fry in Wisconsin.  Of course this meant I had to partake in the all you can eat version of it!  While the initial plate was plentiful and reasonably prepared, it took FOREVER to arrive and no one ever asked if I wanted more.  I'm sure this was probably due to them being packed, but even so it did detract a little for me from my overall take on the place.  That being said, we are eagerly awaiting our next visit there!

The parking and long wait, mentioned by many, is worth your time if you love Texas style BBQ. The resemblance to Franklin BBQ in Austin is uncanny in quality and concept. Only suckers show up at the longest line at 11:00am, come after the rush at 1:30pm to wait in a shorter line.

I wish we would have spent more time on fremont street when we came to Vegas.  I felt a lot more comfortable here then on the strip.  Its an interesting mix of street performers, historical sites, and new technology.  Its a little seedy, but the strip has a little seedy too.  We took public transportation there and while cheaper, it took forever.  We took a cab back and it was a much more enjoyable experience.  \n\nI liked the vibe of the restaurants and bars here.  Everything is more affordable.  Things are less opulent and less clean, but a lot more comfortable.  I like the throw back vibe to everything, it felt like stepping back in time.  Nobody here takes themselves too seriously as it is Vegas after all.  I really liked the restaurants and bar here, there are some very nice restaurants, but again cheaper then the strip and with a more historical ambiance.  The video screen is very cool too!

"Cleanliness was exemplary, with an immaculate ambiance that exuded a sense of refinement and sophistication. Prices were reasonable and proportionate to the high-quality culinary offerings, ensuring a satisfying dining experience without breaking the bank. The menu was uncomplicated and straightforward, allowing patrons to easily navigate and choose from a variety of delectable options. Particularly noteworthy were the mouthwatering cheesesteaks and crispy fries, the latter of which were cooked to perfection and infused with a generous amount of genuine cheese that added a rich, creamy texture. However, it is worth mentioning that the cheese fries may have been excessively indulgent for some palates, bordering on overwhelming due to their intense flavor profile. Nonetheless, this did not detract from the overall exceptional quality of the restaurant, which warrants a future visit."

I love the furniture here! We went in looking for a coffee table and a large ottoman.  Pricey but all of the pieces are unique. Place was not busy and sales people did not circle you like road kill. They also didnt say hello, so I took a star. We were able to browse through and didnt have any questions so it didn't bother me that they didnt greet us. Large and small pieces to go in any room. Looked like they had a design center. Didn't find the perfect piece today.

Came here with an Australian friend I ran into, we wanted to do the whole American diner thing, and boy was it fun.

Very warm welcome for us, as a Brit & an Aussie we instantly hit it off with the staff and had a laugh.

Food was superb, I LOVED the chilli cheese fries, very hard to find over here and actually enjoy. Had the Chicken Philly cheese steak and it was great, really well prepared and quickly delivered. Prices were fantastic and service efficient and friendly. I'd love to come again for lunch.

"An diminutive, authentic Irish watering hole, characterized by a pervasive wooden motif within its interior, exudes an atmosphere of warm familiarity and conviviality reminiscent of a close-knit community. The Monterey Pub presents itself as an idyllic setting for a leisurely late weekend afternoon or a casual gathering with companions, where one can indulge in palate-pleasing fare and libations of remarkable value. Its proximity to the cultural institutions in the North End renders it an ideal stopping point following a visit to those hallowed halls. The pints are skillfully poured, the beverages are reasonably priced and of superior quality, and the culinary offerings are copious and satisfying, with a particular emphasis on beef dishes that have been marinated in Guinness, imbuing them with a rich, savory flavor. For those who are inclined towards culinary experimentation, the boxty's are an excellent option. It is worth noting, though perhaps self-evident, that the pub's location is situated on Monterey Street, conveniently adjacent to the YMCA; those seeking it out need only look for this easily recognizable landmark."

"The pinnacle of cheese curds, an unparalleled culinary experience that transcends the mundane and enters the realm of gastronomic nirvana. A veritable cornucopia of dairy delight, each bite a symphony of flavors and textures that will leave even the most discerning palate satiated. Pair it with a stein of frothy brew, and the resulting fusion of taste and aroma will transport you to a realm of pure, unadulterated bliss. But be warned, dear gourmand, for such pleasures come at a price; the portion sizes, while generous, may prove to be a challenge for those of lesser appetites, and the prices, while eminently reasonable, may induce a state of financial euphoria that could lead to reckless indulgence. And, of course, we must not forget the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance, the cheese curds themselves, a golden, crispy delight that will leave you craving for more. In short, a dining experience that defies all conventions and redefines the very notion of culinary excellence."

Although they possess an establishment at the Beverly Center in California, I have indulged in culinary delights at this particular venue on the last two occasions that I have visited Las Vegas. I believe that if one is seeking a pleasant, adequate, comfortable, and economical dining experience subsequent to expending a considerable amount of currency gambling, then this restaurant would be an ideal selection. The portions are copious, and we were all unable to consume all of our food! I had the salmon that was prepared in three diverse manners, and I thoroughly enjoyed it! Additionally, we requested the beignets (sp?) for dessert, and it was significantly superior to those offered at Disneyland. I highly recommend this establishment if one does not feel inclined to dine at any of the other upscale restaurants in Las Vegas. However, it is worth noting that our server made an error on our bill by charging us twice for gratuity or something (my companion astutely observed this, while I was oblivious to it), and he only briefly returned to attend to us or replenish our beverages. Furthermore, we consumed our meal on a Sunday evening around 10 o'clock, which rendered the atmosphere relatively tranquil.

I wanted to give their coffee a shout out.  I received two cups of coffee today from a student of mine unexpectedly.  Once was Creme Brulee and the other was Sugar N Spice.  He said to try one or both and spread the love about them.  I gave the other cup to my co-worker and they enjoyed it!  I don't live in that part of town, but thought this was the least I could do.  I'm a big supporter of buying local and spending local.  Tasty coffee with a twist! Hopefully one day I will be in that part of town and will drop by!

I am thoroughly enamored with this establishment, having had the fortuitous opportunity to encounter it serendipitously; however, my familiarity with it has since transcended that of a novice. My spouse, who had previously been unacquainted with such indulgences, capitalized on their special Valentine's Day package designed for couples, thereby inaugurating his initiation into the experience; subsequently, he accompanies me on each subsequent visit. Following our therapeutic session, we both experience a profound sense of well-being; the tariff, a mere $30 for a sixty-minute duration, is truly reasonable, particularly given the exceptional quality of their massage therapy. In my previous residence of Yakima, Washington, such a facility was nonexistent.

"Having been intrigued by this establishment for an extended period of time, I recently had the chance to experience it firsthand alongside a few colleagues. Following a training session in Phoenix, we found ourselves in pursuit of a suitable venue for lunch, which led me to utilize my GPS device to search for nearby dining options. Upon discovering Chino Bandino, I enthusiastically shared my desire to visit this restaurant with my fellow coworkers, who were equally eager to partake in this culinary adventure. \n\nUpon arriving at the eatery during the peak lunch hour, we were immediately struck by the bustling atmosphere and diverse clientele. However, our confusion quickly dissipated as a friendly staff member approached us and offered assistance, prompting us to explain our status as newcomers. In response, he graciously escorted us to a cozy side bar, where we were treated to samples of various delectable dishes, including the signature Jade Chicken, savory Carnitas, flavorful black beans, and expertly prepared fried rice. Needless to say, we were thoroughly impressed and eagerly placed our orders, settling in for a satisfying feast. As the afternoon progressed, we found ourselves suitably satiated, with the delightful Snickerdoodle serving as a welcome complement to our late-day snack. Unanimously, we agreed that this excursion was a resounding success, and we look forward to revisiting this culinary gem in the future."

"Viv B., an atelier of unparalleled taste and refinement, boasts an array of exquisite adornments, artwork, and olfactory delights that cater to the discerning patron seeking a unique and sophisticated shopping experience. Although the boutique's apparel selection may be limited in scope, its carefully curated assortment showcases an unwavering commitment to elegance and style, much like the proprietor's revered grandmother, whose likeness graces the premises with a sense of regal benevolence."

(New patient)Got here at 545, waited til 6 when they opened. Got put into a room right away, waited 20ish mins to see the vet. Told her the issue, she took her back for a full exam. Exam costs $42 (she's a chihuahua so it might vary by size). Clipped her nails (I'm a horrible parent, they were very long, $10).\nShe ended up needing a ton more done (xrays, blood tests, went home w/2 meds) bill was $700 and no diagnosis.. no broken paw or anything abnormal in tests, she's just in horrible pain and can barely use her left front paw/leg.Sent home with pain meds and anti inflammatory. Back a month later for same thing. Super nice doctors, staff can seem a bit in a hurry/rushed/not concerned. but all in all good =] we're back a few times a month for nail clipping

"This venue offers an enjoyable experience, with delectable cuisine and exceptional hospitality, conveniently situated in close proximity to a cinema, thereby allowing patrons to partake in a satisfying meal either prior to or following a cinematic excursion."

Wow this is a really nice place. I've never visited this cinema before, but I was surprised. The restrooms are clean and modern, the theatre is a great size and they have a great selection at the snack bar. I will go back to this theatre for sure.

Firstly, permit me to express my utter satisfaction with the culinary experience offered by this esteemed eatery! The gastronomical delights presented before us boasted an impressive array of flavors, undoubtedly tantalizing our taste buds. Nonetheless, a caveat emerges in the form of a pecuniary concern, prompting a natural inclination to draw comparisons with other establishments offering similar fare at a relatively more reasonable cost. To elucidate, the delectable appetizers proffered by Halcyon, while unquestionably delightful, carried a price tag that some might consider exorbitant, amounting to a whopping fourteen dollars! This observation compels me to juxtapose the former with the Harvest Moon Grille, a dining destination renowned for its superior quality and comparatively greater value. Indeed, a cursory examination of their menu reveals a striking discrepancy in pricing, with the latter offering arguably more generous portions at a lower cost. Furthermore, my personal experience with the Ribeye Spackle served as a prime exemplar of this phenomenon; although the dish itself proved satisfying, the cooking method employed by the chef deviated somewhat from my expectations, specifically regarding the degree of doneness. Admittedly, such inconsistencies may be attributable to isolated incidents or momentary lapses in execution. Be that as it may, the desserts, though undeniably delectable, seemed to carry an inflated price tag, exceeding twenty dollars apiece! In light of these observations, I feel compelled to recommend that ardent devotees of Halcyon consider a comparative analysis between this establishment and its neighboring counterpart, Harvest Moon Grille, in pursuit of a more comprehensive and satisfying dining experience.

After hearing several people Rave about Pho Kim Long, I decided to check it out; and I can say I was not disappointed.

The place is fairly big and we were seated immediatley (there can be a wait but they burn and turn pretty fast). The staff was attentive and we had several people swing by the table to make sure we were doing OK.

The menu is impressive, I was just expecting your average Pho place, but they menu covers much more, apps, Pho, entrees, smoothies, and much much more.

I decided on the #11 Rare Steak and Brisket Pho. I also got an order of the Chinese Doughnuts to start.

My only complaint is that the doughnuts were plain, when I usually order them they're covered in sugar, but a little quick thinking and I was using the remaining Peanut Sauce from my companion's spring rolls for a great dish.

The Food came out insanely fast, the apps were good, but the Pho stole the show. The Steak and Brisket were both tender and delicious. The noodles were plentiful, and the broth was rich.

I will be going back without a doubt!

True to the City of Sin ... this airport is dirty and seedy ... Love it!\n\nGot through security pretty quick ... nothing out of the ordinary.  I don't know what people expect from airport security personnel ... they hear people bitch & moan all day long ... so it's expected that they'd be pissed off all the time, too.  Grab your crap and move on ... cause it just doesn't matter in the grand scheme of life!!!

Been here twice now. Excellent service each time.
Also this is a great hotel for a convention since
that is what I came for. Very spacious convention
area. The room I had was very luxurious and very
relaxing after a day of training, schmoozing, and
cocktails. It's the type of room you can always
completely relax in - so much space. Can't really
comment on the price as I wasn't paying - but a
big thank you to my employer for footing the bill.
Would definitely do it all over again. Love the 
whole Venice theme. I like the casino here and the
restaurants as well. This is also just the right
part of the Strip to be in. Viva Las Vegas!

very solid. great cocktails, especially if you like tequila (i do). tasty nuevo latino treats. duck empenadas (if i remember right) were ridiculously good. casual but upscale, with attentive bar service. fun.

Overall i thought that this buffet was one of the best buffets that i have ever been to. They had many different variety of meats such as lamb and primb rib (which were cooked really well). I am usually very picky with slider but the one at this buffet was amazing. The ramen was decent and so were the crab legs. This buffet had a giant variety of many different types of food and they all hit a good level of satisfaction. Not a big fan of buffets but this one is an exception for me.
Great work day gym to hit during lunch.  Just wish they would stop playing teeny bopper estrogen music in the men's locker room. ... Damn!!!

My go to cheap Chinese lunch spot on Harris Blvd.  The price is right.

Its a great cheap lunch special($5-6 with eggroll) but sometimes the free tea tastes a little funky, so I don't drink it a lot of the time.  The chicken is real meat, the sauces aren't too salty and, there plenty of veggies with every dish.

That said, don't expect to be wowed by some 100% traditional Cantonese or Szechuan food.  This is Americanized Chinese and it gets the 4 stars because of food per $.

This is a cool bar. It's relatively small inside, but it's a cool environment and there's a variety of places to sit - high top tables, bar seating, cushy chairs and couches, etc. \n\nI can only speak for the beverage selection, and it's pretty solid. Typical impressive beer selection evident in most Madison bars and decent drinks. I've heard great things about the food, especially the sandwiches and wraps... looking forward to eating here sometime soon!

"I visited this establishment for the inaugural time and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The cost of approximately nine dollars for lunch was undoubtedly a reasonable price to pay. Although, there were some minor drawbacks, such as a moderate delay and congested pathways teeming with children exhibiting boisterous behavior. Nonetheless, these aspects contribute to the ambiance of a buffet. Equipped with a chocolate fountain bar and a cotton candy machine, I would unhesitatingly recommend this venue to any individual possessing a penchant for sweets. Furthermore, the assortment of cuisine was diverse and satisfactory, with no particularly sophisticated options but neither were there any unpalatable dishes. Considering the cost, I would unquestionably suggest giving it a try."

Good find in the North! 

Fried Chicken - best tasting fried chicken I've ever had! Nice size portion for 2.

Catfish - very good, just wish they gave a little more.

Burgers - ok. tasted like a regular ol' hamburger to me. Which brings me to my next question, why is it called Hamburger Hut when they're burgers are mediocre as hell? Haha

It's a convenient store/restaurant. But more of a restaurant. It seems busy all the time and I hear people always ordering the fried chicken.  That's all imma get here too. 

Parking is limited. Like, only 7 spaces limited.

It was an utter delight to witness your critique of this Eat'n Park, Darren, albeit not entirely unexpected given its propinquity to my former domicile and preferred watering hole, Wilkie's Inn, which unfortunately has ceased operations. Despite the prevalence of unsavory recollections stemming from inebriated acquaintances engaging in physical altercations and heated disputes within its confines, this eatery remains unparalleled in the aftermath of an evening spent imbibing at the aforementioned establishment. Mental images of scrambled eggs, French toast, and delectable burgers accompanied by a side of pickles continue to tantalize my taste buds, not to mention the irresistible Eat'n Park smiley face cookies that have captured my heart. I implore those unfamiliar with Pittsburgh's culinary treasures to indulge in a visit to this Eat'n Park or any other branch, as it is bound to leave an indelible mark on one's gastronomical experiences.

"An indulgent lodging establishment boasting an expansive recreational facility situated atop its structure, providing an unparalleled experience for thrill-seekers! My kin and I acquired accommodations at a remarkably reasonable rate (sub-$100), which, while not lavish, offered a diverse array of amenities. Although not a luxury establishment, it possessed a certain je ne sais quoi. The edifice featured multiple dining establishments and a rooftop aquatic venue (during my visit). The elevated swimming pool presented an unique opportunity for aquatic volleyball enthusiasts, while the observation deck afforded breathtaking vistas of the adjoining amusement park's pinnacle attraction. As guests of the hotel, we enjoyed complimentary access to this exclusive area, strategically positioned in close proximity to the renowned Las Vegas Strip."

This is a nice clean place. I always look for places I can take both family and friends and this once fits the bill. Surprisingly the pizza is really good! Not spinatos or grimaldi's quality but best of the bar food I've had. Thin crust and they have ground hamburger as a topping, yummy! They also have a lot of games, pools tables, shuffle board and TONS of tvs.  Besides the pizza, I'm a fan of the focaccias. Good place to come during a weekend for sports games.

To transported a second-generation iPad from my place of employment to their establishment for the purpose of rectifying an issue, specifically, the device was in need of a new protective glass surface, which was successfully replaced within a time frame of approximately six hours, at a total cost of one hundred twenty-nine dollars, inclusive of taxes, and although the ambiance of the store could be improved, I was generally content with the quality of the service and repair provided, furthermore, they offer a ninety-day guarantee on their work, which served as an additional source of assurance, and the location of the shop, situated directly off Mill Avenue, enabled me to easily park and quickly enter and exit the premises to deposit and collect the device.

If you have been to some of the Asian buffets in AZ, and you've liked them, I'd say you must try Jasmine Tokyo. 

I'm 6'4" and I get "Do you play for the Cardinals?" a lot, so I'm sure that when the proprietors see me darken the door of their establishment they're all like "ohsh*t." Fear not, lil Asian lady, for I am not a glutton. I'm here for the seafood and the sushi and some green tea.

As far as the sushi selection goes, it beats anything AYCE in the Valley that I've seen. There were at least 20 types of rolls and it wasn't just surimi crab and tempura, either. The tuna and salmon and snapper nigiri were really good, too.

If you have room for some fried rice, this one is delicious and so are the Chinese sausages and grilled chicken. Even the raw oysters were good, and that has never happened to me in AZ before.

Service was pleasant, and from the way it's decorated, I'm guessing this was once a Claim Jumper. Anyhow, it's a huge restaurant with a huge selection of items and if you're a vegetarian, you will be in heaven here with more vegetarian offerings than I've ever seen at a buffet. 

Seaweed is a vegetable, isn't it?

ah, Bouchon.  So many people talk about this place but I had never been.  First, it's in a ridiculous location as others have noted.  Everyone else's reviews are very poor in their direction.  I think someone said that it's in the southwest area of the Venetian.  Ok. Who the F**k  has a compass in the F**king casino???    It's by the registration lobby.  That simple.  Take the elevators up and you are there.

There was a small wait for the brunch.  The brunch menu is basically the same as the breakfast (with a few additions).  So. . . .

Chicken and Waffles.  - Glorious.  The waffles have bits of bacon in them and they are amazing.  The Chicken is roasted and not fried.  I have to think that it is better this way because I can't imagine this dish being beat by any restaurant.  You must get this.

French Toast - Looks great but it's not that impressive.  You should try something else.  

Ambiance - I think the restaurant loses a star here.  The decor is dated and the tables too crowded.  There were a couple of single old men sitting by themselves on the small tables and whenever they coughed, I cringed.  Who knows what germs they caught from their respective escorts last night?  

I still highly recommend, even just for the chicken and waffles.

Best coffee in the area! I had their red velvet latte today and nothing else even compares. Friendly employees and cozy atmosphere inside too! My only complaint is it's a little pricey. I'm also a little surprised they don't have any high chairs, but overall I'm happy to give them my business and I will definitely be back!

Organized a business breakfast here and was impressed by how attentive and efficient the service was. We were seated at a great table facing the windows. I really liked the little chair they offered for purses, too cute.\n\nI had the duck hash & eggs which was delicious, although the pancakes looked great too. Tableau is perfectly classy and elegant, yet casual at the same time.

"While indulging in the extravagance of a Las Vegas sojourn, I opted to immerse myself in the opulent ambiance of the NY NY hotel, whereupon I discovered that the establishment boasted an impressive array of amenities and facilities that rivaled those of a mini metropolis. The casino, being one of the more spacious and well-appointed in the city, offered an abundance of gaming options, ranging from traditional table games to state-of-the-art slot machines. Furthermore, the culinary offerings at NY NY were nothing short of exceptional, catering to a wide range of tastes and budgets, from modestly priced fare to exquisite gourmet experiences.  

During my stay, I had the pleasure of occupying a luxurious room on the 32nd floor of the Century Tower, affording breathtaking panoramic views of the iconic Las Vegas Strip and surrounding mountains. The accommodations themselves were both commodious and stylish, providing ample space for three individuals to unwind without feeling encroached upon. Although certain aspects of the room's decor appeared slightly dated, the overall quality and cleanliness of the amenities left little to be desired. Notably, the bathroom featured a separate area for grooming, complete with dual sinks, and the shower boasted high-end fixtures that delivered an abundance of hot water in short order.  

In conclusion, my experience at NY NY was thoroughly enjoyable, and I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a unique blend of luxury, convenience, and entertainment in the heart of Las Vegas."
Never had a bad eating experience at Cheba Hut! The food is Delicious, and the subs are TOASTED... Yummm!!! a must-try if you are new to Mesa or if you've just never been to Cheba Hut before!

first spot me and my gf decided to go when we arrived in vegas.  i was really dressed down, as a matter of fact the only person in the place dressed down.  But still, did the hostess have to look at me like i was a scrub?  cmon, you're a hostess in vegas, probably hoping some rich guy knocks you up.  anyways, the place was crackin, like most spots in vegas.  very nice, upscale place.  the food was great, the best salmon sashimi ive ever had.  i couldnt stop thinking about it 2 days later.  they set a new standard for myself when it comes to salmon.  id also reccomend the baked lobster.  prices are really steep, so if your taking someone here, i hope you get some action afterwards.  minus the snobby hostess, and i would have gave this place 5 stars.

Strictly speaking of the food in the cafe....  The blueplate specials for $8 bucks are great!!!  They come with the soup and salad bar too, and it is a great salad bar (remember this is not the Wynn, but a locals' hole in the wall casino with old carpet).  I make a meal from the soup (2 types daily) and salad bar (with fresh fruit for dessert), and then take the entree home for a later snack.  Do not expect trendy, expect a great value for price paid and a friendly staff.   Dessert specials every month for $2.

Food was great but service was a little strange. You don't order your food from the sushi chef you have to order from the waitress. Also we ordered 3 rolls and some sushi, you would think the sushi comes out first? But they brought out all the rolls and forgot about the sushi until we mentioned we never got it. Overall they're fish quality was great, everything tasted fresh and not fishy :) will be back and they're AYCE is a great deal with a lot of selection :)

When the admission is complimentary, every aspect of the experience appears significantly enhanced. We had the opportunity to partake in one of the evenings featuring LMFAO, and it was truly remarkable. What an exceptional manner in which to conclude a Las Vegas excursion. I thoroughly enjoyed the distinct ambiance of each chamber, particularly the bibliotheca where one can savor a beverage without the inconvenience of jostling elbows. Although my preference remains with the layout of XS, it is invariably fascinating to witness the creators of these opulent nightclubs stretch the limits of inventiveness and, above all, furnish revelers with an exceptional festive environment.

If you need a seafood fix then you need to check out Boardwalk Billy's. My favorite menu item is the steampot; the broth is delicious and I get extra shrimp instead of oysters. The meal is HUGE and comes with potatoes and corn. I also tried the clam chowder and it is wonderful! We go on Thursday nights when there is trivia and 2 dollar drinks. Even the best, local drafts are only 2 bucks! We frequent the Galleria location and the service is prompt and friendly. I knocked off 1 star because their burgers are AWFUL. Stick with the seafood and wings and you will not be disappointed!

"Savory culinary delights and hospitable personnel have been the hallmark of this establishment for several years, and I have had the pleasure of partaking in their delectable offerings within my financial means, despite a recent upward trend in pricing."

We serendipitously stumbled upon this diminutive eatery, nestled within the confines of a nondescript edifice, while perambulating in pursuit of a delectable repast.
