The establishment, ostensibly operated by a tight-knit family unit, boasted an unpretentious facade, which belied the culinary treasures that lay within. My gastronomic curiosity piqued, I opted for their signature offering, a Gyro, accompanied by a side of fries. The latter, though unremarkable in appearance, delighted my taste buds with their crispy texture and satisfying warmth. However, it was the former that truly captured my attention, its generous proportions bursting with savory fillings, satiating my hunger in a manner that few other establishments have managed to achieve. The proprietor, along with what appeared to be his kin, exhibited a warm and welcoming demeanor, expeditiously facilitating our orders with a cordiality that fostered a sense of belonging. Furthermore, the speed at which our victuals were delivered and the precise temperature at which they were served only further enhanced the overall dining experience. As an ardent supporter of local entrepreneurship, I take great pleasure in patronizing such enterprises, and this particular venue has secured a place among my favorites, ensuring that future visits are all but inevitable.

I was surprised by the generous portions of lettuce with that came with my order of spring rolls.  Attentive and quick service.  Never had a problem flagging down one of the 4 servers on duty.  An all around good experience.  The first pho I've had in Vegas.  While not the best broth I've ever tasted, it wasn't disappointing.

I use to be a regular at this place when it was a Starbucks. To see it reopened as a bakery had my curiousity running wild. I tried to visit this place numerous times, but they have strange hours. They are closed certain days, and then open at noon on certain days. I'd call first, regardless of what yelp says before taking a drive here. 
We went in on my nieces birthday. As soon as I seen "stuffed cookies" I was SOLD! 
Then to find out they are stuffed with things like oreos and cheesecake, snickers, and butterscotch. OMG HEAVEN!! 
They also had a huge selection of cake pops. Cool unique flavors like Nerds Rainbow, orange cream, cheesecake, and red velvet. 
There were a few carmel and candy apples, as well as HUGE chocolate dipped marshmallows.  The service was good and so were the prices. 
My only complaint was their odd schedule. Can't wait to return!

I know this is a chain, and I normally abhor and avoid chains, but I really liked this place.  The beer was excellent, the servers were very polite and attentive (Everybody speaks English) and the food was way above average.  First time we went I had a flammekuchen with Gruyere and smoked meat with a slice of dill pickle on every quarter.  Excellent!  My wife had the vegetable version which was great as well.  Second visit I had a meat dish with ham, pork knuckle, sausage and an excellent sauerkraut.  Very, very good.  We had a great time watching the Canadiens at the bar after the meal.  Overall I would highly recommend this place, at least one visit to sample their beers which are a cut above your average brew pub.
Low key atmosphere, on Mondays they have $5 burgers when you buy a $3 beer, great deal and great food.

I'm not really masterfully adept at recognising a good Indian: my weak British mouth can't handle the chilli and often leaves an unshakeable burning sensation for the rest my meal, ultimately ensuring I can't make head or foot of what I'm eating.

Deciding to man up and re-kindle my Indian food knowledge I opted for the BBC's kashmiri curry with a liberal dose of Cobra beer.  Much to my surprise I found I could recognise each flavour rather than  sweating the spices away and subsequently had an enjoyable meal.

Reasonably priced and with a cool name, I'll be back again.

Good sashimi and plenty of rolls with spice.  I've a big fan of rolls with heat and Sushi Fever has a solid selection that feature some sort of tuna/salmon combo.\n\nSat in the room to the left after you enter which featured a massive HD TV.  Comes in handy if you are like me and enjoy a distraction besides porcelain cats and other Japanese decor.

Aaron you have awesome customer service skills and also to the brunette bar tender!  You guys are awesome although the nacho's was a feat that crushed my confidence because of the large portion i will be sure to bring backup next time. Made a few friends too gregg and mariam from cali and mark from nm! Hope you see this hit this place up with a good review!

"Yummo! Authentic Cuban culinary delights abound at this establishment, particularly in the form of delectable sandwiches and pastries that exude an unparalleled level of flavorful excellence. The breakfast offerings, specifically the omelet, are a prime example of the kitchen's commitment to gastronomic mastery, boasting an impressive balance of taste, texture, and satisfying fulfillment that belies its humble price point. Furthermore, the opportunity to indulge in Ironbeer and Materva, beverages that are typically reserved for Cuban eateries, adds an extra layer of excitement to the dining experience. As we were on a road trip back to Los Angeles, we opted to procure some delightful pastries for the journey, which proved to be a wise decision given their exceptional quality. While this venue may draw comparisons to Portos, it is important to note that it maintains its own unique identity and does not replicate the same level of crowd enthusiasm, much to our relief. Although the variety of pastries may not be as extensive, each item is crafted with equal attention to detail and dedication to culinary artistry."

I have had the privilege of inhabiting this resplendent abode for a trifling three years, during which time I have been continually impressed by its unwavering ability to captivate my senses and inspire my spirit. Despite certain drawbacks, such as an occasionally problematic parking situation and an aural assault perpetrated by the raucous revelry of rowdy revellers, I remain steadfast in my decision to designate this magnificent edifice as my humble domicile. The aesthetic appeal of this structure is simply stunning, with each carefully crafted aspect serving to enhance the overall visual experience. Moreover, the ambiance fostered by the harmonious convergence of sleek lines, tasteful colour schemes, and strategically placed greenery, serves to create an atmosphere that is at once both tranquil and invigorating. It is little wonder, then, that I have been able to establish lasting connections with a diverse array of similarly discerning individuals who share my appreciation for the finer things in life. In light of these factors, I felt compelled to bestow upon this esteemed residence a rating of four stars, as it falls ever so slightly short of perfection. Nonetheless, I would highly recommend Optima to anyone seeking a truly exceptional place to call home, as it embodies the very essence of luxury living. My enthusiasm for this magnificent complex is further fueled by the impending completion of Optima Sonoran Village, a sister property that promises to offer an identical standard of excellence.

The occurrence of my presence at a gathering transpired within the parameters of Caesars Palace during the month of May, precipitating my attendance at said event. Preceding this particular visit, I had indulged in numerous excursions to the aforementioned establishment, yet had not availed myself of the opportunity to partake in the hospitality extended by the hotel's accommodations. Subsequently, we were assigned lodgings in the Octavius Tower, which afforded us commodious quarters, characterized by plush sleeping surfaces, well-appointed bathing facilities, and panoramic vistas that proved to be truly captivating.

Only been one time, but it's safe to say I had an above average experience! I ordered the half pound Jalape\u00f1o Jack burger with a side of onion rings. The burger entailed a perfect spice, high quality meat (from Midwestern meats), and flavorful cheese. The onion rings were really great too! Decent portions here, I was definitely full. \nMy only problem is that my bill was $11 and change. A bit pricey for a no frills in and out styled place that caters to those who need a quick bite to eat after work or another event. I didn't even order a drink, mind you. Regardless it's but a minor set back in what was a really solid burger! I'd recommend it to others.

This place reminds me a little like the Italian restaurant, Pompeii, in Chicago where my roommate and I ordered food from there quite a bit. We ordered carry out from here. I wonder since I was visiting her here in Phoenix, she thought about getting us food from this place. I did deviate from what we typically order and got the Salami, Turkey, Ham and Mozzarella panini. It had a red wine vinaigrette that made it taste really good. The ingredients appear to be fresh and well packaged. The prices seemed average to me from Chicago standards, but unsure if it's pricey for the area here. I wouldn't mind trying out some other items here.
Great build your own burgers, crazy servings of fries. Always hot and fresh and cooked and topped to your order.

"It would be a fallacious statement to assert that I have never had the pleasure of visiting this establishment, for indeed, my experiences here have been numerous and gratifying. While it may not rival the grandeur of certain Canadian clubs, it unquestionably surpasses its local counterparts in terms of quality and overall satisfaction."

This place has one of my all-time FAVORITE Asian dishes - the Thai Spicy Noodles. Yeah, generic sounding as heck but it's really thin noodles with woked chicken & shrimp, scallions, egg, cabbage and I can't remember what else, with Thai spice. Squeeze a huge wedge of lemon over it and I'm in heaven. One order is enough to feed me, my hubby and our teen daughter, but we usually get two... it's sooo tasty when it's cold. Breakfast of champions. Their honey chicken is really good, in fact I can't think of any dish that we have not liked. Their appetizers are yummy, and they do both spring and egg rolls. That's handy for a family of mixed disciples. :) \n\nThe service is always very smiley and friendly, and there's never been a wait. Totally good Asian food for a very decent price, in a clean restaurant. What more could you want??

"Hyde's ambiance aligns with its namesake, presenting an ideal setting for an intimate encounter with a significant other, although patrons would be wise to remain vigilant lest they become preoccupied with the captivating physical appearance of the establishment's servers, as the delectable offerings from the kitchen may momentarily take a backseat to the visually striking staff; the culinary selections, particularly the fried calamari, boast an unparalleled crispiness that nearly results in an explosive sensory experience upon consumption, and the meticulous seasoning enhances the flavors without overpowering the delicate palate; however, the wine list, while impressive in quality, comes at a premium price point, and the absence of complimentary refills for soft drinks results in a notable increase in cost, making it the most expensive soda option in Las Vegas."

"Wow, this establishment appears to be quite extensive in its layout, with numerous sections and areas that seem to stretch out endlessly, almost like a labyrinthine maze designed to tantalize and confound one's senses. It's truly impressive, and I must admit that I haven't had the pleasure of exploring every nook and cranny of this vast space, despite my best efforts to do so. There are multiple levels, each boasting its own unique charm and allure, with upstairs rooms that offer an air of exclusivity and privacy for those seeking a more intimate experience. The staff here is incredibly friendly and welcoming, and while some might attribute their warm demeanor to my gender, I would argue that it's simply a result of their inherent kindness and dedication to providing exceptional customer service. Indeed, the performers themselves exude an aura of warmth and approachability, making them feel less like'strippers' and more like gracious hosts who just happen to possess a certain je ne sais quoi that sets them apart from the average individual. They are, in short, a true delight to behold, and their pleasant scent only serves to enhance the overall ambiance of the club."

I just stayed two nights at Aria. It is a great hotel...my company paid for it, which is great because I would never spend that kind of money...and the rooms aren't even the worse of it!! ONE drink at the pool will set you back a hefty sum...which I can't repeat here...just know, it's probably the most expensive on the strip.
We didn't get the chocolates or a turn down service that some other reviewers have mentioned, that's ok..most everything was wonderful.  I was dismayed a bit  at the bath products...a lower end brand, and of definitely lower end quality. 
The restaurants were all really good that we ate at...the Thai place was as good, if not better, than any I've been to in the US.  The casino was nice, not too smokey, and the servers were pretty quick. 
The pool was nice, a few good choices...one that was more adult orientated, so not a bunch of kids having a great time...not something I look for in a relaxing pool day. As usual...I always wish there was more shade and/or umbrellas..but all in all..a great pool experience. 
All in all, a great place, although pricey..that's expected.

This being one of the new hotels on the strip of Las Vegas, it has a modern theme to it. 

PROS -
+ a chill, classy, relaxing resort.
+ clean pool, clean rooms, clean hallways, clean everything.
+ The rooms are extremely modern, with an electric mini-stove, refridgerator, microwave, dinner table, super soft bed, etc.
+Extremly friendly staffs


CONS -
- This wasn't the ideal place to stay when you're in Vegas celebrating your 21st with your girls. (IE - little black dresses + alcohol + stumbling to the room = hard stares)

food wise it would be a 2.5 - 3 at the most, but the place and the coffee made it up for the 4th star.

Let me start with the food. If you've never eaten authentic Spanish dishes, you'll be pleased. Otherwise you'll be disappointed. 

The olives were good. 

The shrimp dish (gambas al pil pil) was also decent.

The traditional paella was good but more a risotto than a paella. Too creamy, different kind of rice (at least the texture is different) but the saffron hint and the chorizo were tasteful.

The tortilla was ok. A little burn and dry but pretty decent.

The wine selection is limited and most of the wines are NOT Spanish, AYFKM? They had one Rivera del Duero and one Rioja. Come on, you have a Spanish themed place and no Spanish wine?

Now the coffee. I tried the cold brew and the kopi luwak. Both pretty good. The coffee paraphernalia is also worth the visit! If you are caffeine sensitive, this might not be for you.

I didn't check if in the menu they include "cafe bombon", a Spanish classic. I'll go back to verify that and if not, at least to get good coffee!

Cheers

When I think of Richardson's, I feel warm and cozy inside.  I've been on several occasions and I love the atmosphere... I always have a good time at this hidden little gem of the city.

The 'Cuisine of New Mexico' is unique... they are known for their green chile potato as well as several other pork dishes.  I usually go for the fish or seafood specials... they have a standard menu and then specials posted on chalk boards around the restaurant.

Most recently I enjoyed the blackened scallop appetizer as my entree along with a huge house salad.  The scallops were a little bit salty but cooked just right.  They were served on a tortilla with rice, beans, and a yummy spicy sauce.  Their salads are really tasty, and many of the entree specials come with a starter salad.  I went with a group of 4 and we had a couple of bottles of wine and a plain pizza as an appetizer to share.  Needless to say, none of us had room for dessert!

Be prepared for a crowd whenever you go, but enjoy your company and the people around you.  Call ahead and make a reservation if you can...  if you do have to wait, sit at the bar or by the fireplace; you can't complain once you have a drink in hand and the scent of the fire mixed with hot food and good energy.  I'll be back again soon, Richardson's!

"If your quest for culinary satisfaction does not direct your attention towards this inconspicuous location, situated within a nondescript strip mall, you may unwittingly overlook it. My companion, Elite Emily, and I had the privilege of partaking in an exploratory venture throughout Henderson, which led us to this unassuming eatery. Upon entering, we discovered that the establishment was remarkably devoid of patrons, with the exception of ourselves. The portions of food, however, were quite generous, necessitating the request for a container to transport the surplus back to my abode. The quality of the cuisine was indeed impressive, leaving me eager to return and sample additional menu items."

Normally the boy does not enjoy museums, but he had a lot of fun in this one.

Lots of historic sex toys and insane sex toys. Video clips, films, demonstrations. Lots and lots of sexually intense items here!

Bondage and pictures, and a relatively in depth visual view of sexual evolution. Incredibly interesting. I would actually come again. Everyone that works there is also sweet and unobtrusive.

I came here on a Sunday so I didn't need a reservation. And I must say, this place is the bee's knees.

Awesome aromas, lovely decor and atmosphere, and incredibly helpful waitstaff.

Once I mentioned I was vegan, the chef pointed out what was readily vegan and what could be altered. Way more sauces have fish/oyster sauce in them than I had originally thought! 

Definitely check this place out. I look forward to the next time I come back. Green curry with tofu... mmmmmm.

I have had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by this esteemed establishment on multiple occasions, and I must say that each visit has been a truly gratifying experience. Most recently, I had the privilege of dining here in the company of some visiting family and friends, and suffice it to say that everyone in attendance left feeling thoroughly satiated. 
  For those seeking uniquely crafted, expertly mixed beverages, this venue is an absolute must-visit destination. The drinks menu boasts an impressive array of libations, each one thoughtfully categorized by historical era and accompanied by a brief description elucidating the origins of its name. 
  During our visit, nearly all members of our party opted to take advantage of the happy hour special, which featured steaks at half price. While one of the filets was unfortunately slightly undercooked, the remainder of the dishes were cooked to perfection. Furthermore, the assortment of side dishes we ordered were, without exception, utterly delectable, with the truffle macaroni and cheese emerging as a clear favorite among our group. I would be remiss if I did not give special mention to the "Farmer" flatbread pizza, whose ingredients included bacon, spinach, and a perfectly cooked egg; this dish is nothing short of a gastronomic masterpiece, and I implore you to sample it for yourself in order to fully appreciate its splendor. 
  As for dessert, while we initially harbored doubts about our ability to consume anything further, our server's vivid descriptions quickly dispelled such concerns. We opted to try both the pizooki (a delightful, crispy flatbread confection) and the homemade doughnuts, and I am pleased to report that both offerings met and indeed surpassed our loftiest expectations. The word "heavenly" does not even begin to do justice to the sublime experience that these desserts provided. In conclusion, I must reiterate my unwavering endorsement of this superlative eatery, whose ambiance, culinary prowess, and expertly crafted potions make it a true gem, tucked away from the frenetic activity of the Las Vegas Strip.
Nice, big patio to enjoy a conversation and catch up with friends. The inside was clean and service was nice. All the pastries looked especially tasty at this location. Nice job.

During one hot spring day in Chinatown I was STARVING (as always, my metabolism  is ridiculous). Tired of my usual Thai Food fix and wanting to seek something new I find HSP on Yelp. 

Initial reaction: HOLYSH!T did this just open!? 

Turns out its located towards the end of the Chinatown Plaza extension on Wynn Rd and Spring Mountain. The lady working told me they've actually been opened for 5 years! I seriously felt like I have been living in a pineapple on the bottom of the sea. I bear crawl my hunger self to there and in front of me was a small shop with smallish quantities of various poke! it must be a good sign that there are small quantities of the poke to maintain the fish freshness. No old poke, yay! I'm not from Hawaii, an islander, or have lived anywhere with fresh off the coast fish, BUT usually I can taste fish funk. In my Shoyu Limu Tuna bowl I had no funk, only delicious fresh poke and warm rice sprinkled with black sesame seeds and only $8ish!

Excited to come back and try more.

My 10 year old boys had fun.  A little pricey but it is clean, well lit and not too loud.  For the adults....the wifi blows, the food is not very good and expensive.  A small iced latte was just under $5.  Can't bring anything in either....(and Pepsi products..ick).\n\nAll attractions/games were in good working condition.

I have been coming to this place since the mid-80s and it is definitely consistent. At face value this is a local curry house, no pretensions of fine dining but good, reasonably priced food with attentive service. There is little better on a winter's night with the freezing wind howling up Bruntsfield Place, than to battle through the double doors into a warm and inviting aroma of indian spices.  Beware when ordering the naan: they only do these in \"feed the 5,000\" size!

I have to knock off a star bc of the wait time for the patio.  We have been here numerous times, and I know the patio doesn't take reservations. But a 1 & 1/2 hour wait at 5:30 is a little crazy.\nThat being said, the food is always amazing! I usually get some sort of steak, and hubby gets either the skate or some sort of braised short ribs.  Never had a bad waiter or bad food here. \nBottom line, if you want the patio (and the people watching is second to none), expect a wait. It would be better if they could text you when your table was ready, as the sensors only work a short distance in the casino. But the food is worth the wait

I have never seen a Cirque de Soleil Show before, nor any show in Vegas, for that matter. I really enjoyed it. The musicians were top-notch, the dancers were enegetic and exciting, the acrobats were breathtaking. We had a wonderful time. Of course, our tickets were free, so that makes it all that much better!

We placed an order for the delectable lobster and shrimp dip, but unfortunately, we were compelled to return it on two separate occasions due to an excessive amount of cheese, which rendered the dish unpleasantly rich and overpowering. The texture of the chips was compromised by the copious amount of cheese, causing them to break apart easily when submerged in the accompanying sauce. Consequently, the establishment graciously decided to remove the item from our bill. Subsequent to this, we opted to sample the parmesan chicken and baked potato, which proved to be a satisfying culinary experience, sufficient for two individuals to share.
Great find!  Visiting from DC and loved the unique take on menu!  Witty and original.  The food was excellent! Can't say enough about the pierogi sliders and the eggplant lasagna!!

This gastronomical establishment boasts an extensive culinary repertoire, featuring an array of delectable items on its vast bill of fare, including a breakfast menu that deviates from the customary offerings typically associated with such an eatery, encompassing an assortment of scrambled eggs, crispy bacon, and hash browns, et cetera, which, though perhaps not entirely genuine, is undoubtedly a unique attribute of this particular venue. Furthermore, the presence of piping hot pastrami and corned beef underscores the superior quality of the comestibles served here. The hospitable and accommodating nature of the staff serves as a significant factor in determining my intentions to revisit this delightful deli, rendering it a veritable haven for epicureans seeking a satisfying repast.

My husband and I went on date night and had a blast! Our instructor was Melissa and she was friendly and full of energy. However, Melissa was a little fast and slightly vague in her instructions, but gave us plenty of time to paint each step. A finished painting was hanging that we could refer back too. Drinks are average price, $5 for beer and $7 for wine. Last call drinks are half price! We ate before going so I did not have a chance to try any of the food, but there is a 20 minute dinner break half way through for everyone to eat. There were a lot of people munching on appetizers throughout the painting class. This is something I will absolutely do again, and highly recommend it for anyone looking for something fun and different.
If u come here on grave until 7am ask for Joy...great server....having saimin and Portuguese Sausage and scramble eggs....of course with rice... ono after a night out.
Very good food. Authentic. Spicy as indicated by name. We went there for dinner twice during our short visit to Vegas and we were happy both times.

It's about time Summerlin had a decent pub/bar/hang-out/tavern, whatever the hell you want to call it, it's good they have one. 
Super friendly staff, not overbearingly so, but attentive. Food was quite tasty, chicken sandwich is da bomb! The waitress said you can get it as a wrap (off the menu) , nice tip, thanks.
Few things:
1) For yelpers, if you check in you get a free shot of their house whisky. Bad thing is, it's horrible. Cinnamon / orange infused. Pretty much tasted like Triaminic cold and cough. Pass on it, trust me.
2) The bathroom sinks...I can't stand these things. Whoever thought a slightly tilted slab of tile would work as a sink...dude, you were waaaay wrong. Give me a basin and save my clothing from the splash back and the whopping 2 inches of space to place my hands under, please. 

Bottom line: Great place to hang, plenty of room to move, cool staff, great food. Just beware of the bathroom sinks....

Been here three times now and will keep coming back. One of the best buffet values for locals and with coupons a good value for visitors.
The prime rib is perfect every time, ask for a thicker cut and they are happy to give it to you. The crab legs are fresh every time I have been there and they have several types of shrimp. Something for every seafood lover.
The Mexican food could use a little work, the enchiladas have been hard but they have lots of Asian choices and the American part of the buffet has always been delicious.
And the deserts? Oh yeah! lots of choices with plenty of no sugar added ones for those who need it.
The servers are not only professional but personal.

This is a wonderful family owned restaurant with amazing service. Bagels are the best! Both the breakfast and lunch menus are extensive and the kitchen is very willing to make any dietary exceptions you have.

With moving to the other side of town, it was nice to find a new sushi spot near by. Service and rolls are great. Plus, they have a great happy hour that has options of 4-8 pieces. It gives you the option to try a lot of different rolls. All in all, it's a nice little spot and I've loved everything I've tried. Nice place as my last one was I Love Sushi.

Great wine and bruschetta, especially the apple one. Good live music when I went. They need a fire pit outside though! There is not much out there and they need to liven it up some. But great wine bar

They always take the time with my kids and are very good.  Sometimes they have a waiting list and often are booked up....so I recommend calling ahead to make an appointment.  But it is very worth it as the results speak for themselves.

"My sentiments regarding this pizza are ones of profound admiration, specifically pertaining to the judicious blend of mozzarella and provolone cheese, wherein the latter is incorporated in a manner that enhances, rather than overpowers, the former, thereby creating a culinary experience that is truly exceptional; additionally, the service we received was of an impressively high quality, such that it served to further elevate our dining experience; it is worth noting, however, that my previous experiences at this establishment have been somewhat inconsistent, with periods of disappointment interspersed among moments of satisfaction, but on this particular occasion, they demonstrated a commendable level of competence and dedication to their craft."

"An exceptional equestrian facility ideal for family outings, offering a seamless and efficient experience from initial reservation to conclusion, boasting a picturesque desert setting in North Scottsdale particularly breathtaking during the spring season, complemented by well-manicured grounds conducive to a leisurely horseback ride, further enhanced by a team of accommodating, polite, and knowledgeable staff members who guarantee a memorable visit, leaving a lasting impression that warrants future visits without hesitation."

I was utterly thrilled to have the chance to experience the exhilaration of a roller coaster ride within the confines of a casino/hotel, despite the fact that I am perhaps approaching an age where such activities may be deemed unsuitable and, furthermore, have been known to cause a considerable amount of discomfort; however, I firmly believe that one is only young once and should seize every opportunity to indulge in youthful pursuits. The queues to purchase tickets were somewhat inefficient, which I attribute to the sudden influx of patrons eager to partake in the attraction before its closure at midnight on weekends.

The ride itself was simultaneously terrifying and humorous, as I failed to carefully consider my attire and my companion and I couldn't help but burst into fits of laughter upon viewing our photographs. The cost of each picture was $15, with the option to purchase two for $22, which we opted for and split the cost. The employee assisting us gave me a look of utter incredulity when I requested that he charge two separate cards, leading me to wonder if he truly understood the concept of customer satisfaction and the importance of fostering a positive experience for patrons. Nonetheless, this minor inconvenience did not detract from the overall enjoyment of the ride.

Whiskey Dicks is in a bad location, but it isn't a bad pub at all!  The service is great, the beer is pretty good, and the food is pretty good too.  

We were greeting by a friendly short shorts wearing gal at the door, and were promptly seated.  I ordered a Ranger IPA, which is pretty good for a tap choice if you ask me.  They have a decent range of beers for an everyday bar.  I had the philly cheese with mesquite seasoned fries.  The fries were great!  The seasoning was awesome.  The philly wasn't the best, but it was good.  I thought the steak was a little dry, and there was too much bread on the thing.  The onions and peppers were nice and fresh though.  

Overall, with the beer selection and the friendly service, I decided to bump WD up a star.  Most pubs aren't carrying any decent beer, and yes there are a few better pubs for good beer, but there are actually drinkable craft beers here. They carry a few New Belgian beers, along with Sam Adams seasonal beers.  since I work so close, I definitely plan on returning!

Have eaten here many a time.  I used to get it delivered at my old job, and then recently was lucky enough to work only 1 block away.  Would visit once a week or so and get the Chicken Pita.  A great flavored grilled chicken, I ordered it with the whole wheat pita.  Topped with some cucumber sauce and hot garlic chili sauce makes it perfect.\n\nWould highly recommend it!  Reasonably priced at $8 for a whole pita.

"Having had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on multiple occasions, I must say that I have developed a profound fondness for it! The staff has consistently demonstrated exceptional friendliness and promptness, earning an A+ rating in my book. The ambiance, reminiscent of a Toby Keith's Jr., scores a respectable B+. The entertainment, in the form of live music, has been nothing short of spectacular, warranting an A+ grade. While the bar boasts an impressive selection, lacking only Norm, it still merits an A rating. Prices are average, but the food, with the exception of the steak, has been somewhat underwhelming, garnering a B score; however, the burgers and fries are highly recommended. In conclusion, taking into account the welcoming atmosphere, excellent staff, and top-notch entertainment, I award this establishment a solid A. I strongly advise paying a visit to this venue, as you are certain to appreciate the warmth and hospitality of the people and the surroundings. We eagerly anticipate our next visit, during which we undoubtedly will savor their delectable burgers."

"Upon my initial visit to this esteemed shooting range, I was accompanied by a seasoned marksman who possessed an arsenal of firearms at his disposal. As a novice shooter, this was only my second time engaging in such activities, and my first experience at a designated range. The staff provided us with the necessary projectiles and protective gear, and offered a succinct briefing before we proceeded to the enclosed shooting area. The facility's central location and welcoming atmosphere were certainly appealing, yet I couldn't help but feel inconvenienced by the throngs of sightseers that had converged upon the premises. Notwithstanding, I opted to postpone my certification endeavor, as I deemed it prudent to hone my marksmanship skills further. While I acknowledge the complimentary instruction offered, the exorbitant prices charged for ammunition and targets struck me as rather prohibitive, especially considering the preponderance of tourists. In light of this, I would recommend visiting during off-peak hours, such as Mondays around 9 a.m., to avoid the congestion that ensues later in the day. Despite my reservations, I do intend to return to both practice and undertake the certification examination, albeit with a keen eye for more economical alternatives for projectiles and targets."

"The gastronomical experience at this establishment is utterly remarkable. Drawing comparisons with other eateries under the same culinary umbrella, the fare presented here surpasses expectations, boasting an extensive array of delectable options that cater to diverse tastes. However, it is pertinent to note that the quality of service does not complement the exquisite cuisine, as it is often characterized by a sluggish pace, forgetfulness, and other shortcomings. Furthermore, the portion sizes are relatively diminutive, which may prove disappointing for patrons who crave more substantial helpings. Notwithstanding these drawbacks, we had the privilege of securing a table without delay on a Saturday evening, affording us the luxury of choosing between indoor or outdoor seating, thus suggesting that the wait time may be inconsistent."

"Vietnamese Sandwiches: A culinary delight that warrants a visit to this establishment, in my humble opinion. The piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance of their menu, these delectable sandwiches boast a freshly baked bread that delicately balances a satisfying crunch and warmth, courtesy of Hue Thai's diligent preparation. My gastronomical exploits have led me to conclude that this eatery reigns supreme in the realm of Vietnamese sandwiches within Las Vegas.  

Other menu items: Although they offer an array of Vietnamese, Chinese, and Thai cuisine, the authenticity of these dishes leaves much to be desired. However, their Vietnamese sandwiches and boba tea (which is passable) are the exceptions that prove the rule. Unfortunately, their pho falls short of my expectations. 

Price: A veritable steal! These scrumptious sandwiches can be had for the paltry sum of $3.50 apiece. However, be aware that a minimum purchase of $20 is required for the privilege of using a debit card, a caveat that may prove vexing for those who, like myself, eschew carrying cash. 

Ambiance: While dining at this establishment may not be the most aesthetically pleasing experience, owing to the curious combination of cleaning product and food odors and the rather jarring decorative scheme, it is by no means unpleasant. In fact, the design, which appears to be inspired by an underwater theme, adds a touch of whimsy to the proceedings. Notwithstanding these minor drawbacks, I would unhesitatingly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a satisfying and affordable meal. Rating: 4/5 stars."
The barbecue was good but not great. They do have a nice selection of barbecue sauces. The complimentary kettle chips were a nice touch. On the plus side, the food came lightning fast.

Fantastic!  The Farm burger was fabulous and the sweet potato fries with powder sugar were great. Huge fan of food.  Service on the hand was slow. They forgot our fries and we had to ask for them and did not get them until we were 3/4 done with our burgers.

I have been a loyal patron of this establishment for in excess of a decade, and despite my occasional forays into alternative venues, I invariably find myself returning to Nancy's salon, primarily due to the warm and welcoming ambiance, but also because of the exceptional quality of their nail care services and pedicures, which have consistently met, and indeed surpassed, my expectations.

This place is great! I received SO much stuff for my son when he was born (mostly barely worn hand-me downs from my husband's huge family and some of my close friends) that he couldn't possibly wear them all even if I changed his outfit 5 times a day! So I went on the hunt for a great consignment place I could utilize to get him "new" clothes as he grew. 
Luckily for me, there are quite a few places like this in my area (central phoenix). I checked out 2 others before I came to Smarty Pants (do NOT go to Urban Baby! Ugh!). 
The mother-daughter owner team at SP were very welcoming and friendly. They took almost all of the items I brought in and although I planned to just drop stuff off, I couldn't resist shopping for myself and ended up with three great tops for $15 total!! Incredible inventory, clean shop and friendly service... who wouldn't love it??

They informed me that they are expanding to the space right next to Bertha's (my favorite restaurant in town) to have a separate place for furniture and will be offering more adult clothing in the current space (I could have that backwards.... the new space is for clothes, perhaps?). 

So I will be heading back soon to spend my consignment money! Thank you Smarty Pants!

After seeing Paul put his review up...I had to join in! This venue is almost perfect in design and the acoustics are amazing. I love outdoor concerts and yet the amphitheater gives you a club feel while being outside.

That being said...like my review of the Fillmore...you will see that catching a buzz will require a credit card or a well hidden flask (leave your bongs at home). The whole Music Factory complex begs for a keg party straight out of high school to explode in the parking lot. Wait...what? Oh...that's right...we DO tailgate before shows. Ten dollars can get you a 12 pack of PBR and a sammy...or one 24 ounce beer inside...and that's without a tip. My tip? Lower your freakin drink prices!

Like others have said though...this place is great and they're attracting better and more obscure acts all the time. I'm just happy to have some reputable venues around.

This place had such high reviews on Yelp that we drove all the way from Scottsdale on our vacation to Tempe to visit this place. And it was worth it! From the front doorman asking me for my ID (knowing I'm well over 30) to saying my name right and telling us to have a great time, to the bartenders asking every few minutes if we were OK, to the delicious blue cheese burger, we were happy campers the entire time. I'm not a beer drinker, but my boyfriend tried all 3 beers and loved all of them. It's a fun, casual, sports bar environment and a great place for bar food.

I drove by and there was a blank storefront with no signage or notice. Turns out it moved across the street and is now near the other furniture stores (At Home, Creative Leather, Spencer's Appliance) at 2711 S. San Tan Village Pkwy, Gilbert. The new store is brighter and has floor-to-ceiling windows on 2 sides.

"As I previously mentioned in my initial posting regarding Princess Nails, the ambiance leaves much to be desired, bordering on squalor, and can aptly be described as a veritable hole in the wall. However, allow me to reiterate that Michelle, the individual responsible for administering the eyebrow waxing treatment, is truly exceptional. My second visit proved to be just as satisfying as the initial encounter. It is imperative that you request her services explicitly. While I refrain from bestowing a perfect five-star rating due to the establishment's conspicuous lack of cleanliness, I cannot help but wonder how they would fare without Michelle's expertise. It is essential to note that my assessment is founded solely on my experiences with eyebrow waxing and does not take into account any other services offered at this location, such as nail care, which I have never availed myself of and have no intention of doing so in the future."

It is a older hotel so you don't think of going there for the buffet right of the bat.  We somehow ended up here and the buffet was pretty good.  Not the largest selection but of what they offered everything was good quality (that's what really matters).  I was pleasantly surprised.  Would definitely go back.

After spending a few summers in Phoenix you learn to locate and love certain watering holes.  One of the best treats to cool off the perspiration of a long Phoenix afternoon is the date shake at Sphinx.  This place has a long history with Scottsdale and its shakes have been hydrating sweaty residents for several decades now.

We have been eagerly anticipating the inauguration of this novel eatery for an extended period of time, and our patience has finally been rewarded. Upon partaking in a culinary excursion to this establishment on the second evening of its operation, we were thoroughly delighted by the exceptional quality of the service, complementary chips and salsa, delectable fare, and refreshing beverages proffered. The meticulous renovation of the interior space has resulted in a visually stunning ambiance that enhances the overall dining experience. It is gratifying to have another superior dining option in the vicinity, which serves as a harmonious addition to the existing array of distinguished Mexican restaurants in the area.

We finally got a Jimmy John's and I had heard so much about it being great.  We tried two different sandwiches (the No 9 Italian Night Club on their great french roll and the No 12 Beach Club on  thick sliced 7 grain bread).  Great quality product, great bread, very competitive pricing.  It is a little noisy with the music and hard surfaces in this location thou.  They are a brand new location so that will probably change (hope) over time.

Funny thing is, we went to a burger place at Mandalay first. But they didn't come to our table for 5 minutes to even say hello. And 5 minutes is longer than you think when you just spent 90 minutes at the MJ One show and you're ready to eat off your hand with hunger. So we left. And came here. A bit different, to put it mildly. Service was impeccable, but not snooty. The Missus and I both got different tasting menus. Mine was the Alain Ducasse 4 course one sans wine. From the cold broccoli soup amuse to the amazing lobster curry to the foie gras topped filet to the Armagnac dessert, almost everything was very well presented and tasted amazing. First time with foie gras. Would definitely have been beyond the pale if served solo, but topping the perfectly cooked medium rare filet balanced it's richness. All I know is the junk was tasty. The only misstep was the mashed potatoes that accompanied  the filet. They were served in a bowl separate from the plate, and surprisingly...basic.  \n\nAtmosphere was romantic, view was stunning, of course, and definitely an experience to remember. Not cheap. But actually worth it.

Un super bon petit caf\u00e9, super bien situ\u00e9 pour un boost en plein milieu d'une bonne session de magasinage. Il est un peu difficile \u00e0 trouver, mais si vous prenez le passage entre le Centre Eaton et Place Ville-Marie, vous y serez. C'est plut\u00f4t un comptoir qu'un caf\u00e9 car il n'y a pas de place pour s'asseoir et siroter son latte tranquillement. Par contre, m\u00eame si votre commande ne prendra pas plus que 5-10 minutes, et donne l'impression que c'est de style \"fast food\" vu l'emplacement, vous aurez quand m\u00eame un service \u00e0 la client\u00e8le assez exceptionnel!

HUGE PORTIONS! 

Came here for lunch with my employers while I was attending a Seminar at the Hilton which is close-by. We came in and was seated promptly. Our waitress always had a smile and was quite the busy bee going from table to table. Impressive. 

I ordered a cheeseburger with fries. Markus and Miyoko ordered salads. When the salads came.. it really looked like 3 salads combined into one serving. Miyoko ordered the steak and mushroom salad that looked tasty.. Markus's salad was the same size but had an array of fruit on it. All of us were shocked of how big the portions were. I ordered my cheeseburger well done.. but it came back a bit burnt. I still ate it, but was a bit sad that it had been charred. 

All in all a good place to grab food. Especially since I heard the Riviera had crappy food joints to eat at. Would I eat here again? Only if I were in the general vicinity of the area. Its good to be back home in SF.

So after our hell of a boring time at PURE we walked our drunk asses over to Poetry. The sound of hip hop was like a breath of fresh air. Our first appearance was Thursday night around 1:30 am (or should I say Friday morning?) No cover (worked some magic) I think ladies were $20?? Anyways...we had sssooo much fun here....we danced all night....I had the best time here. Drinks came fast...everyone had a blast! If you like hip hop music this is the spot to be. \n\nWe actually came back for round two the next night and it was just as fun! I will mos def be stopping by every time I'm in Vegas....

"Gastronomical indulgences in the form of Fish and Chips, accompanied by a delectable quesadilla, were the culinary choices I opted for during the previous evening's dining excursion. Although the gustatory experience was undoubtedly pleasurable, I must confess that the aftermath has left me feeling somewhat lethargic and sluggish at present. Notwithstanding this, the eatery's ambiance was thoroughly enjoyable, boasting a spotless and well-maintained interior, complemented by the friendly and attentive service of our waitress. Furthermore, the establishment's decision to host a quiz or trivia night contributed to a convivial atmosphere, which rendered the overall mood quite mellow. As for the tap beers, they appeared to be a standard selection typically found in public houses, but I shall reserve judgment until my next visit, when I intend to partake in a nightcap and savor the full range of their beverages. Suffice it to say, my initial impression of the venue has been favorable enough to warrant a return visit, especially given its proximity to my domicile."

I indulged in the delectable flavors of the smoked salmon on a egg white omelet, savoring each bite while reveling in the hospitable atmosphere and appreciating the convenient parking facilities. Although my beverage was somewhat lacking in potency, I would unhesitatingly revisit this establishment, as the welcoming staff, impressive ambiance, and reasonable pricing comparable to that of downtown Scottsdale, all combined to create a truly enjoyable dining experience.

My assessment shall be confined to the culinary delight that I had the pleasure of ordering:

The White Pizza, a gastronomical masterpiece, exuded excellence in both taste and presentation. The subtle richness of the cheese was artfully balanced, thus avoiding the pitfall of overpowering the palate. A single slice proved to be sufficient for even the most discerning epicurean, unless, of course, one's appetite rivals that of a behemoth. It is worth noting that the pizza emerged from the kitchen in a timely manner, ensuring that the quality of the dish remained uncompromised. The generous dollops of ricotta only added to the overall appeal of the dish, thereby solidifying its status as a veritable gustatory triumph. While I do have a penchant for a slightly more decadent variation of the white pizza, the rendition presented before me still managed to elicit my approval. At a mere $5 per slice, this edible indulgence is an absolute steal, particularly when considering the late-night culinary options available in the city of Las Vegas.

The staff exhibited exceptional hospitality, and the gentleman behind the counter was particularly endearing. The promptness of the service only further enhanced the overall experience. In conclusion, I would highly recommend that you partake in this delectable experience for yourself, as it is truly a taste sensation unlike any other.
Such a great experience. I'm always hesitant on someone cutting my hair. Summer was great she did everything I wanted, was very professional. Will definitely be going back to them again.

This is my second visit to Victoria and was for a Yelp event so obviously the atmosphere was great, but you could tell from the attitude of the bar staff that this is a great place to visit when there isn't a nice organised event (Thanks Jody B)

The mulled cider is really something you should try with options of either Lingonberry or Pear - the former is my favourite and reminds me of visits to a certain Swedish furniture store where they serve meatballs. Victoria's is, of course, part of the group of Swedish themed bars around Edinburgh including Hemma, Sofi's and Joseph Pearce which is where the link becomes pertinent.

Will definitely use this bar in the future as a meeting place when I'm around Leith Walk.

"On the second day of operations, all staff members were acutely cognizant of the heightened sense of urgency that permeated the atmosphere, as they assiduously endeavored to refine their culinary skills and provide an exceptional dining experience for their patrons. In light of this, we opted to sample the Buddy's Salumi & Cheese Board, a delectable ensemble of olives, pickled vegetables, grilled Italian bread, genoa salami, spicy capicola, proscuitto di parma, grana padano, tuscan pecorino, and gorgonzola. Upon savoring the assortment, we were struck by the unparalleled quality of the capicola and proscuitto, which were undoubtedly the most flavorsome we have had the pleasure of indulging in. Furthermore, the gorgonzola boasted an unforgettable combination of a pungent bleu cheese essence and the velvety texture of brie, thereby rendering it a true gastronomic masterpiece. In addition, our curiosity was piqued by the notion of consuming a cheeseburger within an Italian eatery, and thus, we decided to relish the Pat Lafrieda Burger, which featured a brioche bun, tomato aioli, provolone cheese, and tuscan fries. To our delight, the burger proved to be remarkably scrumptious. Lastly, no culinary excursion would have been complete without partaking in the sublime pleasure of the establishment's signature tiramisu, which, much to our satisfaction, transcended our expectations and emerged as the most exquisite specimen we have had the privilege of sampling anywhere. For those seeking to enhance their dining experience, we recommend requesting a table situated along the outer perimeter windows, thereby affording breathtaking vistas of The Strip. Additionally, we suggest that you bring your camera, as the captivating entree cakes crafted by Buddy and his team are certain to evoke a desire to capture their splendor and serve as enduring mementos of your gastronomic adventure."

I have an ardent fondness for non-mainstream, artistic, and documentary films, thus, Camelview is one of my preferred cinemas due to its ability to showcase such films, which are scarce in the region. Positive aspects of the theater include an assortment of exceptional movies, friendly staff members, reasonably-sized beverages that avoid the overly large "bucket-o-cola" style found in other cinemas, delectable cinnamon almonds available for purchase, and a vintage ambiance. However, the theater does possess some drawbacks, including its aged appearance and lack of modernization, absence of stadium seating, and uncomfortable seats. It is worth mentioning that the cinema's clientele tends to consist of an older demographic, which can create a distinctive movie-going experience for those from differing age groups. Despite these factors, Camelview remains an enjoyable destination for me, albeit one that I wish had more alternatives for artistic films in the area.

Thanks to the exhaustive and meticulous evaluations proffered by Yelp reviewers, I was able to identify and select this moving company with confidence. As an individual who resides solo, I experienced considerable apprehension regarding the prospect of contracting the services of a moving company. However, upon initiating contact with the organization, my trepidation was promptly alleviated due to their judicious and considerate approach. Prior to the move, they furnished me with a photograph and comprehensive biography of the estimator who would be communicating with me, thereby engendering a sense of security and trust. Punctuality being a paramount concern, I was gratified to observe that the team arrived at the designated hour, ready to commence their labors with alacrity. Although a minor inconvenience arose in connection with the reassembly of my trundle bed, which remains unresolved at present, the overall execution of the move was flawless. In light of my thoroughly satisfactory experience, I would unhesitatingly recommend this moving company to any individual seeking such services.

I don't have a whole lot of experience with liquor stores, but have always been pleased here.  The staff are always nice, helpful, and non-intrusive.\n\nI once went with my boyfriend, who expressed a desire for a certain beer that they didn't have.  The dude behind the counter immediately said that they would order it.  Lo and behold, the next time we went, there it was.  We proceeded to buy lots of it.  Everything after that is kind of a blur.

"The performance was satisfactory, but it failed to meet the lofty expectations generated by their ABCD competition. Nonetheless, I took into account the fact that they were executing two consecutive shows, each lasting an hour and a half, which rationalized the JBWKZ's decision to refrain from exerting themselves excessively. Consequently, the display was not utterly awe-inspiring, but they did incorporate certain captivating elements, such as state-of-the-art technology, to create an amusing experience. They also exhibited an admirable versatility by exploring diverse musical styles, ranging from those reminiscent of the 1940s, to Disney-inspired pieces, hip hop, punk, and even a few disco tracks, which evoked mirthful sentiments."

Good bar for the location and size. This would be a good place to get started for the night. I ended up standing by the bar and getting carded when I asked for water. Blech. Drinks were yummy and there was a little room to dance. \n\nThe stage above the bar was AWESOME. It was especially nice that there was a hot chick on mic. Fun stuff when you've been drinking.
I loved the ice coffee and everything I've ordered here has been fantastic!\nIs my go to breakfast joint while in this area.

I was surprised to see that DSW is now carrying a bunch of running shoes!  Before it used to be just casual and formal shoes (for men) but I went here the other day and was pleasantly surprised.   Now it's not going to be a specialized as say a Run for your Life or TrySports store, but it was nice to find a store that carried Mizunos or Asics.\n\nNormally I just stick to the right hand side (2 aisles) where the men's shoes are at and the back clearance section.  My sister often goes here... sometimes for hours on end and I can see why since their selection is vastly greater on the women's side.

Instead of suffering an interminable delay adjacent, I opted to sample Waffallonia's delectable offerings for the first time. Upon perusing their menu, I settled upon a waffle adorned with Nutella, bananas, and strawberries, albeit initially, the serving size appeared somewhat diminutive relative to my voracious appetite. Nonetheless, I quickly realized that my concerns were unwarranted, as each bite yielded an unforeseen profusion of flavors that satiated my hunger and left me utterly content. The waffle itself was replete with sugary morsels that evoked memories of indulgent funnel cakes, while the freshness of the fruit infused each mouthful with a vitality that was further enhanced by the harmonious blend of ingredients. My gratification was further amplified by the cozy ambiance of the establishment, whose limited seating capacity only served to enhance the intimacy of the dining experience. Ultimately, my decision to patronize Waffallonia proved not only worthwhile but indeed fortuitous, as their exceptional waffles have secured a permanent place in my culinary affections.

"Exceedingly gratifying culinary escapade!!! Although I had yet to indulge in the gastronomical delights offered by the Mesa branch of this esteemed eatery, I opted to partake in a delectable bowl of pasta, which not only satiated my hunger but also left me feeling profoundly appreciative of the exceptional service provided by my affable and attentive server, Ashley. In the event that you decide to grace this establishment with your presence, I implore you to request Ashley's assistance, as her vivacity, familiarity with the regular clientele, and unwavering dedication to providing an optimal dining experience are certain to engender an atmosphere of conviviality and merriment. Unquestionably, this visit constituted the most enjoyable encounter I have had the pleasure of experiencing at Oregano's, and I eagerly anticipate my next opportunity to savor the delectable Big Rig and Ashley's warm hospitality."

I stopped in here with the owner's girlfriend after she cut my hair. She kindly treated me to anything I wanted to eat and drink. wooo hoo! I ordered a Grey Goose and cranberry and a Las Vegas roll (my all time favorite sushi- even if it is fried). Both were delicious. Thank you!!

Last week, on the way from the Airport to the Convention Center, me and my buddies decided it was time for some breakfast.   Fortunately, we came across this IHOP.   The place was pretty empty, I believe there were only two other parties there besides us.   The service was fast and friendly.   Our hostess / waitress (Shee was her name) was awesome.   The food was average for an IHOP.   You know what you will get.   As a bonus, this IHOP is close to the Pinball Hall of Fame.   \nThis is a good place for breakfast.   \nWill I be back?   Yeah, maybe.

This review is only for the Chippery, not the daiquiris. (Though I bet they are delicious!) 

I was wandering around the Forum Shops and I wanted just a little snack before heading home. My friends were getting daiquiris and I saw they have food in the back so I shoved my way through all those wanting frozen drinks and went back. I was pleasantly surprised at the chip selection. They had 6-8 flavored of homemade chips for really reasonable prices, $3 or $5 per bag depending on size. 

The only reason that it gets less than 5 stars is that the service wasn't great. Not cheery people this afternoon at Caesars! It is definitely a hidden gem for a cheap little snack.

"It's a labyrinthine array of playthings that one wouldn't typically discover at most retail establishments specializing in general merchandise. 

I must say, I rather appreciate the organizational scheme they've implemented here. It facilitates effortless navigation to the specific section one desires to peruse, with each item meticulously arranged within its designated category - Toddler toys, board games, plush toys, educational playthings, dolls, sports-related items, action figures, vehicles, et cetera. 

My apologies for the jest regarding the'maze' analogy; however, it does pose a challenge to maneuver through the store without getting lost, albeit in a delightful manner. Upon entering, customers are directed through a serpentine path flanked by shelves brimming with an assortment of toys, ultimately leading to the central aisle. 

My experience at the checkout counter was quite satisfactory, thanks to the attentive cashier who even took the initiative to discreetly scan an item my nieces had set their sights on, doubling the efficiency of the process while maintaining a cheerful demeanor. 

While prices may vary, the toys sold here generally tend to be more expensive than those found at department stores, but the diverse selection and unique shopping experience offered here justify the slightly higher cost."

"The diminutive dimensions of the eatery do not detract from its ambiance, which exudes a convivial and welcoming aura, while the judicious deployment of embellishments and accoutrements contributes to an overall sense of refinement and sophistication; the attentive and proficient service further enhances the culinary experience. The Pad See Ew, a stir-fried rice noodle dish imbued with a rich, complex flavor profile replete with a variety of spices, is somewhat let down by a modest serving size, which, though perhaps understandable given its placement on the lunch menu, leaves a tad bit to be desired. In contrast, the Pad Thai, a dish consisting of stir-fried rice noodles, chicken, and a flavorsome sauce, boasts an impressive quantity that complements its commendable quality, with each component displaying a satisfying texture and taste; indeed, the dish elicits unreserved praise and ensures that future visits to this establishment will be forthcoming."

This culinary establishment is exceptionally delectable. The expedient drive-thru service remains available, enabling patrons to relish the convenience; the employee who attended to my order demonstrated remarkable alacrity and congeniality, constituting an impressive aspect of the experience.

The poultry appendages, specifically the wings, underwent preparation with utmost precision, resulting in a flawless execution. However, the supplementary items presented a minor drawback. We opted for French fries and potato salad, the former satisfying my companion's taste buds while the latter, despite its palatable quality, featured an unexpectedly diminutive serving size, barely sufficient to justify the cost of $1.89, thereby warranting a four-star rating.

Apart from this minor shortcoming, the eatery earns high praise, elevating it to a formidable status among competitors. Patrons are advised to bypass the supplementary dishes and focus on the exceptional chicken wings, allowing them to combine various flavors to their liking without incurring disappointment.

This bar is now one of my favorite places in Las Vegas. 2 shots & a beer for $9?? Yes please! The crowd was so diverse and the karaoke was fabulous! We went there on a Saturday night and it was crowded, smokey and fun. If you can't handle smoke, then this is not the place for you! The bartenders have a stiff pour and the rest of the staff is very friendly. Please be advised that true to Dive Bar standards, there is only one toilet in the bathroom, so you WILL be waiting to take a pee, so don't break the seal ladies!

"Leith Links, situated in the northern precincts of Edinburgh, serves as a verdant oasis, offering a serene ambiance and myriad recreational opportunities for residents and visitors alike. This expansive green space, replete with winding pathways, play areas for children, and designated zones for canine companions, provides an idyllic setting for leisurely strolls, invigorating runs, or simply savoring the natural beauty of the surroundings. Although comparable to the Meadows in terms of its appeal as a popular gathering spot, Leith Links enjoys a more tranquil atmosphere, largely due to the absence of throngs of students converging upon the area for picnics. However, it's worth noting that the northeastern sector of the park may occasionally be subject to unpleasant olfactory sensations, courtesy of the proximate sewage facilities. \n\nDespite its peaceful ambiance, Leith Links hosts a diverse array of activities and events throughout the year. Within its borders, one can find allotments and a Children's Orchard, which serve as hubs of community engagement and sustainability. Additionally, the park plays host to various cultural celebrations, including the Leith Festival in June and the Edinburgh Mela in August, showcasing the rich tapestry of local and international talent. Furthermore, Leith Links lays claim to a unique distinction: it was here that the rules of golf were first codified, earning it the title of the true birthplace of golf, a fact that challenges the long-held notion that St Andrews holds this honor."

It's a everywhere and it's nothing unique but it's mostly fresh and they have mostly healthy options for mostly reasonable prices.

The half/half combos available for all their soups, salads, and sandwiches make this place a constant lunchtime stop for me.  The Fontana grilled cheese.  The tortellini  Alfredo pasta.  The Cesar.  All classics and all done fairly well here.

The negative: the sweeping.  Nearly every time I've been here someone has come by my table and started sweeping the carpet with a brush broom... Over and over and over.  Besides the dust that I'm sure it's putting into the air (and my food) it also makes a whole lot of noise and takes away from the meal.

Certainly not a completely unique adventure.  But fairly solid food for a quick eat place.

"Culinary excellence and immaculate ambiance converge at this esteemed eatery. The chef emerges from the kitchen to engage with patrons and ensure a satisfactory dining experience. Although I do not subscribe to a plant-based diet, the vegan options tantalized my taste buds. In particular, the 'gardein beef', 'gardein fish', and 'gardein chicken' dishes showcased exceptional flavor and creativity. Additionally, the innovative 'Sweet Sour Scallops' (king oyster mushrooms sliced, breaded, and fried) offered a vegan twist on the classic sweet and sour pork dish, further solidifying the restaurant's commitment to gastronomic ingenuity. My plans to revisit this culinary gem are already underway, and I highly recommend that others follow suit."

Soi loved this place.

So I went to Purple Zebra and got a giant frozen drink that Vegas is known for. However my mom was hungry. After a nice host outside said it was cool to bring in my extra alcohol we were seated. 

I have to say the margarita, for being at a Mexican restaurant, was a major fail. It was just bad. Even though the waiter was really nice about taking it back and replacing it with a different margarita. The second margarita was bad too. So just avoid margaritas.

But everything else was amazing.

You know how you can eat something and taste love? Well the carnitas tacos I had tasted like love. Just ooey gooey flavorful love. And the guacamole with pomegranate seeds.. #idied So. Freaking. Good. I also had rice. Green rice. That kinda looked like throw up. But if you close your eyes and open your mouth you'll be taken on a journey. A journey into epic rice land full of love and yumminess.

Just yeah... Go there.
I quite enjoyed the dinner I had here and would definitely return. Friendly service, excellent food... Seems on a par quality wise with Bankok Balcony in Squirrel Hill. Fairly small inside.

"Culinary excellence abounds at this esteemed establishment, where the fare is scrumptious and of superior quality, albeit the prices charged for the servings may be slightly elevated. However, the satisfaction derived from partaking in such gastronomic delights far outweighs any pecuniary considerations, as the sensation of consuming wholesome and delectable sustenance permeates one's being, engendering a profound sense of well-being and contentment."

This is a restaurant inside of the Fiesta Resort Conference Center. It deserves it's own entry here on yelp. Now we didn't get to have the complete restaurant experience here due to it being late, and our only reason for being here is a flight missed connection. \nI have to give 2 thumbs up for the service in the lounge area with a smiling face by Jenn the waitress. She had to work late with the rush of hungry travelers, but she didn't seem to mind. \nI had a soup and salad. On the menu it said \"Chef's Famous Chicken Tortilla Soup.\" I had to try it and wow...it's the best I've ever had anywhere. So, here in our situation tired, hungry, and stuck...I discovered the best Tortilla soup ever. I wish I had the recipe. If anyone ever gets graced with it, please let me know. Delicious!

"For those who have yet to experience the culinary delights of Wildflower, allow us to enlighten you on the charming ambiance and delectable fare that awaits your arrival. Boasting an expansive, well-lit interior, this cozy eatery offers an array of mouthwatering options sure to satiate even the most discerning palates. From their signature soups, sandwiches, salads, and freshly baked pastries, each dish is meticulously crafted using only the finest ingredients, ensuring a truly satisfying repast. For the uninitiated, we highly recommend indulging in their flavorful spinach salad, sans bacon, or the egg, tomato, and feta cheese garnished breakfast sandwich, skillfully presented on a crispy ciabatta bun. Furthermore, the prices at Wildflower are eminently reasonable, making it an ideal destination for a leisurely meal or a quick bite, without breaking the bank."

I give this place a 4 because while they have a great (and tasty) selection of soups, sandwiches and wraps, they miss the mark on  the smoothies.  They put orange juice in almost everyone, so while I expect a raspberry flavored \"Raspberry Rage\" it usually takes like orange juice.  I have tried about 5-6 different flavors and most of them just taste like orange juice or whatever juice they use as their base.  I still get them, but Im always dissappointed.  \n\nBtw, IMO, the best smoothie is the Blue at Franktuary

"An exceptional establishment, distinguished by its fastidious attention to cleanliness and an impressive level of customer service; the culinary offerings, while not without their merits, were somewhat inconsistent in terms of flavor profile, specifically, the Devil's Egg, which lacked any discernible zest, was a disappointment, while the Short Ribs, though tender, were over-salted to an extent that made them unpalatable, save for a few bites; however, upon requesting an additional dash of spice, the Andouille Sausage, Shrimp, and Grits combination proved satisfying, albeit the latter component, the grits, seemed incongruous with the other elements of the dish, but ultimately, the meal concluded on a positive note with the delectable Donut appetizer."

$40 was steep for our lunch as we awaited our suite to be ready. Killed some time here and was rather surprised by how good the chopped salad was!!!!! So, so good, with uber fresh ingredients, like celery, fresh peas, lettuce, bright and flavorful!!! There was chicken, and some fresh herbs, and at least 4 other ingredients. loved the light dressing as well. Fresh taco-like shell that has the texture of Chinese shrimp chips, with sesame seeds embedded in it. Salad was about $16

Disappointing was a $4 cup of nasty, non crispy, flabby fries that accompanied a French size grilled Mahi Mahi sandwich in chipotle sauce. Good, but def not worth $17.

Hey, it's Vegas, y'know?

Get that salad. AMAZING AMAZING
Set along the side of the Wynn pool.
The pizza is good, but the pasta is outstanding. Nice quaint family outing place, or a great place to take a date for a private dinner. They, also, offer some good salads.

"I thoroughly relish this establishment, as it exudes an understated yet refined ambiance that strikes the perfect balance between relaxation and sophistication. The beverages, while somewhat pricey, are skillfully crafted with generous pours, ensuring a potent and satisfying drinking experience. The culinary offerings are equally impressive, with each dish showcasing meticulous preparation and attention to detail, leaving me utterly delighted with each successive visit. Moreover, the atmosphere fosters an ideal setting for leisurely sipping on expertly mixed cocktails while engaging in lively discourse with companions. The clientele, primarily comprising adults aged 26 and older, contributes to an atmosphere of mature elegance. Consistently, my experiences at this venue have been overwhelmingly pleasant."

We executed a reservation via OpenTable for breakfast, which proved to be a judicious decision, as it precluded us from having to endure a thirty-minute wait in line. Upon entering the establishment, we observed numerous unoccupied tables, which rendered the prolonged queue somewhat perplexing. As we arrived at 10:30, we had the opportunity to sample both breakfast and lunch offerings.

My mother was particularly eager to indulge in their all-you-can-eat macarons, but unfortunately, they failed to meet her expectations, as they lacked the requisite texture of melting in one's mouth. However, several of their other dessert items, such as the creme brulee and fruit tart, were quite delectable. Their crepe offering, on the other hand, was disappointing - the batter was insipid, and the berries were too tart. Moreover, the candied nuts they utilized possessed an unpleasant refrigerated flavor.

In contrast, all the meat dishes I sampled were quite satisfying. The prime rib was cooked to perfection, and the pork apple dish was scrumptious - vastly superior to the parched, chewy offerings at The Bacchanal. Additionally, their hot cherries were palatable. It's amusing that they even offer sushi.

The service was adequate, given the nature of a buffet. However, our server visited our table so infrequently that we were compelled to place our finished dishes on a nearby table.

Ultimately, despite some inconsistencies, I found the food enjoyable, and I would likely return. An abundance of delectable desserts and meats is always an attractive feature for me.

I went out to Outback for a light snack. I was seated promptly without any delays. My server was very attentive and helpful with the menu. I ordered the side salad along with the soup for the day. The salad was fresh and crisp and I promise they have the best garlic croutons. The soup was better than I expected it was a creamy onion and cheese soup. And of course they brought out their famous bread and butter!

Great place for a quick, healthy bite, featuring flatbreads, wraps, panninis, salads, soups...even quesadillas!  No matter what you choose, you know exactly how many calories are in each (the calorie count is next to each menu item). 

I devoured the chipotle chicken wrap (380 calories). The veggies were plentiful and fresh, and the flatbread was the perfect thickness--soft but not flimsy. The chipotle sauce was flavorful, with just the right amount of heat.  My only complaint is the smaller portion of chicken--more is always better.  Try the peppadew hot sauce on your meal!  Wayyyyy better than Tabasco. 

It would be PERFECT if there was one located closer to Scottsdale...So many tasty options, all at very reasonable prices--$5 got me the wrap, a drink and my choice of chips, a cookie or a brownie.  Beat that, Subway!

They have an amazingly primo location, right next to ASU and all those local businesses.  They actually have a good amount of seating and easily accessible parking!  This alone practically makes the place 4 star worthy.  What nails it is the staff.  Everyone has been professional, friendly and super helpful.  I've seen folks who forgot to take all their cream cheeses, and they'll remind them they are entitled to them in the deal.  So many places would just let you leave.  

Notice I haven't mentioned their food yet?  Well, there is a reason. It is 100% ok.  I've never gotten anything bad - ever.  But nothing has been great either.  Average menu options, with some nice choices.  Bagels are ok, but nothing to write home about.  One of my favorite things is that for a sandwich you can upgrade your bagel to a wrap, artisan bread or a "softwich" which is like a bagel but softer and square.  

It's never going to be a bad choice, and the super service will have you leaving with a smile on your face.

A superior drinking establishment that caters to local patrons, as evidenced by the presence of bartenders from neighboring establishments who frequent the premises for recreational purposes, such as gambling and socializing. The culinary offerings are of high quality, the gaming options are diverse and well-maintained, and the bartenders demonstrate proficiency in their roles. Personal financial successes have been experienced on multiple occasions, specifically, a total of $600 in winnings from Keno and video poker during two separate visits. An uncommon occurrence, wherein the author remains in the black, monetarily speaking, after visiting this particular watering hole. The interior layout features a sizable bar area with approximately a dozen seats devoid of gaming machines, allowing patrons to partake in beverages without engaging in wagering activities, accompanied by several booths positioned along one side and a few elevated tables situated on the opposite end.

"Although I have yet to indulge in a culinary experience at this establishment, I would unhesitatingly confer a rating of five stars, primarily due to the panoramic vista that it offers. My father and I visited the Duquesne Incline initially, and subsequently, we had a brief interval prior to his departure, which enabled us to halt momentarily at the adjacent Grandview Saloon and partake in a refreshing alcoholic beverage while basking in the ambiance. 

The outdoor seating area, also known as the patio, presented a spectacular scene, boasting an unobstructed view of the confluence of rivers, in addition to offering a unique vantage point from which to observe the incline in operation. Furthermore, the assortment of beverages available was quite satisfactory, albeit we opted for a more conventional selection, specifically Yuengling. Nonetheless, the prices were reasonable considering the prime location. Our server exhibited promptness and cordiality in their interactions with us.
