While there may exist more intriguing gastronomical options within the city center, I would unquestionably return to this venue for the sake of the view, particularly when entertaining guests."
I love this place, great food and atmosphere, but on my last visit wasn't impress with new addition to menu

This place is so mix fun. The food is great and the people here are a blast. The only negative is they don't have deserts. This place screams s'mores and twinkee's but all they have is fruit. Regardless... Amaze balls!

Very impress of this new restaurant inside SLS Las Vegas; Contemporary and quite chic Tapas style.  Decor is tasty and elegantly put together; Service was pretty good as well. The dishes are perfectly proportioned and delicious...  Watermelon & Feta Avocado, Spiced Nuts, Cucumber salad is a must; don't forget their assorted Hummus and their oyster too. Their pita bread was freshly baked and it was perfect.\n\nCant wait to go back; someday.  Definitely will recommend to anyone planning to visit Vegas.  Glad that we got to try this during our visit.

Ryan J brought me out here and, yes, I brought my A game--went ahead and ordered the Bear: peanut butter, cracker jacks, bacon, gouda and BBQ sauce. It was state-fair-what-did-I-Just-Do? awesome. So good. 

The carneys selling overpriced knitting nearby were odd--but we liked the lamps the guys recreating Mad Men were pimping out there.

I don't know anything about these Short Leash Dogs people--but they clearly have something dialed in. The Bear dog was part of some contest put on by the Arizona Diamondbacks. They won, so now it's become a big deal for them.

Ryan J got a different dog. And as he reviewed nearly two years ago: you gotta "unleash your hot dog inhibitions" to get into this place.

Who has hot dog inhibitions? Dumb people, that's who.

Been here twice.  $27 for dinner all you can eat.  Sushi is good - not fantastic, but not bad - comparable to almost anywhere else.  What is fun - the fact you can order and order and order - since you can get half roll (maki) you can really eat a lot of sushi and try everything.  Pay attention to the black board to the right of the sushi bar - with specials.  Salmon Belly was available one night - super fantastic.  Super White Tuna - fantastic. Salmon and Hamachi really good.  Scallop - good. Conch, Halibut and Sweet Shrimp - were just OK.  Lots of desserts included. Sea Weed Salad, things other than sushi are included but you order with your waiter and not the sushi chefs.  Sit at the sushi counter - fun and they just wait on you attentively - asking you what you like and giving you whatever you want.   Spicy Tuna crackers everyone raves about - didn't seem that special. Everyone raves about the Pork Belly - was OK.  But hey - its included so try it.  Service is good.  Sitting at the Sushi Bar - much better because you have the sushi guy right there asking you what you want all the time. Fun to take a friend and just go thru all the sushi you can possibly go thru.

"This establishment evokes immense affection within me due to its hospitable personnel, reasonable pricing, and prevalence of regular patrons, which creates a welcoming ambiance. Their diverse array of delectable pastries and cakes, including the sublime Red Velvet Cake, has never been subjected to the unfortunate process of freezing. Moreover, their recent introduction of DONUTS has further augmented my enthusiasm for this venue."

"My spouse and I have had the pleasure of lodging at Harrah's on multiple occasions. During our most recent visit, we opted to bring our offspring and reserved a 'classic' accommodation featuring two queen-sized beds. Interestingly, this particular room type proved to be more tranquil and spacious compared to their 'high roller' or 'premium' options, which we found somewhat perplexing. Although the room lacked a dedicated workspace, it did feature a small table accompanied by a pair of chairs. While the decor was not entirely up-to-date, it was by no means unpleasant. In fact, we would not hesitate to select this room again in the future if presented with the opportunity. However, we did encounter a minor drawback in the form of a persistently leaking bathtub, which, although not particularly bothersome, detracted from our overall satisfaction and thus warranted a rating of less than five stars."

"Ultimately, an ecstatic hour that culminated in my euphoria. If you seek delectable cuisine and potables within a constrained financial plan, the daily 5-7 happy hour may be a judicious selection for you. $5 specialty beverages, including a pomitini meticulously crafted at your table, are available. This particular cocktail was indeed impressive and, some might say, 'girly.' Additionally, $5 appetizers encompassing a superbly seared Ahi accompanied by a Jicama and carrot salad. The Ahi boasted adequate seasoning and reasonable quality. Other $5 options are accessible as well. For instance, a colossal $6 burger, inducing two onion rings and a challa roll as a bun. Furthermore, a $12 Ahi burger, reminiscent of a croquet style, accompanied by two onion rings or a portobello burger is also available. This happy hour can be savored in either the bar area or the more relaxed patio, which features heaters for the cooler evenings. With such affordable prices, we indulged in an excessive amount of food, leaving us feeling exceptionally satiated. I highly recommend adding a side of the sautÃ©ed mushrooms from the menu, as they significantly enhance any meal."

Having La Cerise just down the road from work is both a blessing and a curse... a curse in the sense that I want to lunch from here far too often than is good for the budget!

The service is always friendly, the food is always fantastic, the coffee is pretty good and they make their own ice cream on site.. what's not to like??!!

I think their prices are quite reasonable as well for the quality of food you get. All their sandwich options you can have in your choice of panini, croissant, wrap or bun.  There's usually a soup of the day, pasta of the day (often lasagne or mac & cheese) as well as a vege option of the day.

If you're in the area, don't hesitate to pop in for a bite!

Who knew it covered 122 acres?! Huge park with lots to do for any outdoor activity. There's a lake as well and some drainage system or something, but I like to think it's a submarine top. 

Great looking basketball courts! They have tennis courts across Park Road. The children's play area looks good too. I'm sure they have some great softball games on their 4 fields. I was seriously impressed with all the different areas (you can tell from the road that all of this exists!)!!

The one thing that I think others have mentioned, is the upkeep. Perhaps due to funding, it could have more maintenance. 

Also, there is a recycling drop off in one of the corners off of the softball fields. Cool.

Yelp has this location in Ballyntyne, but it's in the South Park area on Park Road, just south of Tyvola/Fairview.

My first venture in here, I wasn't sure what to think.  It felt difficult to get attention for service.  But then it warmed up.  The staff turned out to be very friendly and helpful.  The whisky list is monstrous and the food is pretty good.  I ended up coming back a few times during my visit and standing around the bar and listening to music was a most enjoyable way to kill a few hours (and brain cells).  \n\nWhen someone says \"Whiski\", there's Whiski Bar and Restaurant and then their sister establishment, Whiski rooms.  While related, don't confuse the two.

"Corey is undoubtedly the quintessential embodiment of masculinity and virility, as his unwavering dedication to providing an exceptional dining experience at Majerle's Sports Grill in Scottsdale, Arizona, has earned him widespread acclaim and admiration from patrons such as myself and my companions. Our initial foray into this culinary establishment was predicated upon our collective desire to satiate our hunger and partake in the captivating ambiance that permeates the venue, replete with an array of state-of-the-art audiovisual equipment that rivals the most opulent sports bars. The delectable cuisine, attentive service, and particularly the affable and charismatic manager, Corey, combined to create an unparalleled nocturnal experience that fostered an atmosphere of unbridled revelry and jubilation, commemorating Stephanie G's momentous 29th birthday in style, reminiscent of the iconic 'Girls Gone Wild' franchise. My anticipation for a future visit to this esteemed eatery is palpable, as I eagerly look forward to relishing the company of the friendly staff, savoring the mouthwatering fare, and indulging in the euphoric delight of dancing the night away, all while being captivated by the visual splendor of the finest hip hop and R&B music videos, displayed on an array of cutting-edge televisions that blanket the interior of this pulsating hotspot."

"I have merely been present at this establishment on occasions when my employer has hosted business dinners.  If I were financially responsible for settling the bill, I would likely opt for an alternative eatery, as I believe the cost surpasses the caliber of the cuisine.  Nonetheless, it is essential to acknowledge that Las Vegas is renowned for its exorbitant prices, and thus, it is unsurprising that such a phenomenon occurs within its borders.  The entryway and foyer of the restaurant are rather captivating, with the wine tower serving as a striking focal point in the primary dining area.  The hospitality has been meticulous and considerate, although perhaps a tad sluggish in tempo.  We encountered no difficulties in attracting the attention of our server during my visits.  It is conceivable that certain individuals might misinterpret a leisurely pace as poor service; nevertheless, I have discovered that the staff at this establishment is quite responsive and diligent in their efforts to ensure that patrons are content with their dining experience.  During each visit, my server demonstrated remarkable pliability in accommodating requests, including modifying orders from a fixed-price menu.  In summary, my experiences at this restaurant have been generally favorable."

I'm not a whisky drinker and in fact, even the smell of it makes me feel sick. I worked for a catering company when I was at school and I remember having to walk around with trays of various different whiskies for people to take. Every single person asked me which was which and even though I should have arranged them in a manner that made it easy to remember - I didn't. So ended up just making whiskies up... I wasn't fooling anyone. After my whisky experience I still really am none the wiser about any of them but I've bought a few bottles in my time for retirement presents and such.\n\nThis store is jam packed and looks very traditional, with all kind of whiskies, they also have other spirits too including a good selection of gins (my favourite), I guess whisky is their speciality though and I'm sure whatever whisky you're looking for you'll find it in here. Great for a souvenir from Scotland, a gift for a whisky drinker or great if you just fancy treating yourself to  fancy new bottle of your favourite whisky.

"The morning repast fare at this establishment is of exceptional quality! The scrambled eggs were thoroughly cooked, exhibiting a satisfying texture that was both fluffy and light. The bacon was delightfully crisp, possessing an enticing aroma that complemented its flavorful taste. The hash browns were cooked to perfection, boasting a satisfying crunch on their exterior while retaining a fluffy interior. Both varieties of sausage proved to be delectable, with each bite delivering a savory experience that left me eager for more. In addition, I partook in a bowl of wonton soup, whose flavorsome broth and plump dumplings pleased my palate immensely. Although the presence of bean sprouts was somewhat superfluous, the overall quality of the soup remained undiminished. Furthermore, the eatery offered an assortment of other delectable options, including pho, miso soup, shrimp noodle soup, and an array of sandwiches that elicited my approval with their satisfying taste and generous portion size. While I did not sample any of the sushi, Asian cuisine, BBQ, or salads, their visual appeal suggested that they too were of high culinary standards. Lastly, I highly recommend indulging in the chocolate-covered strawberries and cannolis for dessert, as their rich flavors and satisfying sweetness will surely satiate your sugary cravings."

I really enjoy going to this place!!  It looks like a little hole in the wall but the food is great!  As well as the service!  It's close to my boyfriends work and that's how I found out about it!  Everyone he works with raves about their salsa!  And it is de-lish!  Every day they have lunch specials and it's very affordable.  They also have outside seating which is nice.

sometime i'm in the mood for some hard packed ice cream. not this frozen yogurt or frozen custard stuff. just good old fashioned ice cream. this place has very good quality ice cream. chocolate dipped waffle cone was a decent enough to hold my delicious ice cream. they have a bunch off different flavors so i order whatever i feel like.

I introduced this joint to my five companions on my most recent trip to Sin City and they immediately made it their dining choice every night (i should say morning..) for the remainder of the trip.\n\nYou can't go wrong coming to this place, unless you try to eat at around 7pm. In that case, expect a 75min wait for the best value restaurant in the county.

Went back for a second time to get the Irish coffee on a cold late afternoon.  The place was empty and there for the service was great.   The bartender was engaging and extremely knowledgeable about whiskey and even gave us some pointers about how to have a better experience and enjoy the whiskey properly.   The place itself is small  but let's not forget that it is inside a sea container but the patio during the afternoon is delightful and make a great perch to watch the playground.   The Boozery is the ONLY BAR IN LAS VEGAS that serves products from our very own Las Vegas Distillery!!!      So go enjoy this unique bar in the very unique setting of container park....

"I have an unwavering fondness for sandwiches, and Jersey Mike's unquestionably excels in the art of crafting delectable specimens. Situated in close proximity to Firefly, this establishment boasts an impressive array of scrumptious sandwiches, which are meticulously prepared using only the freshest ingredients and presented before your very eyes, much like Port of Subs. Although they do not offer baked subs, their grill-toasted philly cheesesteaks more than compensate for this minor shortcoming. Upon entering the premises, I opted for the Club Supreme, or whatever nomenclature it may have been assigned. Suffice it to say, the end result was nothing short of spectacular; the copious amounts of meat lavished upon the sandwich were complemented by flawless toppings and a crispiness to the bacon that bordered on the sublime. Furthermore, the hospitality displayed by the staff was truly commendable. My companions and I were accorded the utmost courtesy and attention throughout our visit. Notwithstanding the aforementioned excellence, a word of caution regarding the Chicken Parm hot sandwich is warranted. Despite its tantalizing description, it materialized as a sizzling chaos, best described as a culinary free-for-all. In conclusion, although Jersey Mike's deserves accolades for their magnanimous UNLV discount, prospective patrons would be well-advised to avoid the noontime throngs, as the ensuing congestion can prove overwhelming."

As the name suggests, this little-known Greek restaurant in Tollcross prides itself on serving up authentic, tasty, homemade Greek food - and plenty of it.

Run by a Scottish couple who have just returned from living in Kefalonia, this restaurant is definitely worth a visit.

My partner and I went on a whim one evening and nearly all the tables were booked, which is always a reassuring sign. Instead of attempting to choose from the extensive a la carte menu, we opted for a selection of mezzes from the starter menu instead: home-made humus, taramasalata, tzatziki, huge juicy olives and a portion of deliciously crispy whitebait. 

With an unlimited supply of crusty bread and a great value house wine, it was a gorgeous meal.

Myriad of slice options during the week here, with fewer on the weekends but still good.  Pizza is a general NY style, nothing spectacular or memorable, but still solidly good.  Crust at the end is deliciously chewy inside with crispness on the outside.  Sicilian crust isn't as good here, in my opinion.  Prices good for lunch specials, but ordering a few pizzas with various toppings can get quite expensive.

My husband and I visit Viva Mercado's often.  The wait staff is attentive and very friendly.  Our drinks are never empty! The complimentary soup they serve is very good! And I also love the chips and salsa/bean dip.  The chips are always fresh and crispy.  I love their chimichanga's and my husband is partial to the fajitas that come to the table still sizzling.  If you haven't tried this place yet, you're missing out!

Wow, what a great Mexican place! The most amazing collection of sauces I've ever seen. Their homemade sauce was enough though, the food is very tasty, and the price is certainly right. Fish tacos FTW!
Just had dinner last night here.  The Pinot Grigio just ok BUT THE FOOD was really good.  I would receomend this resturant to anyone.
Great steak fajitas!!! I was super hungry after a night of cocktails & craps..I like the liveband and the decor, we'll def be back next time.

I loooooveeeee the Prime Rib here is very tender and tasty. 

I made reservations through OpenTable to avoid waiting in line since I could get very impatient standing in a long line. So yes, my friend and I have avoided the long line and we went through the "VIP" door where we checked in, paid, and got seated right away. 

Our server came up to our table right away to take our drink order and we've proceeded to getting our food. The moment I saw Prime Rib... I've patiently waited for the people in front of me to get their cut and make up their minds about which sauce to put. Next, I went to their seafood area and there was a horde of people taking all the crab legs which I find very annoying... because hello people you're not the only ones at the buffet to take all of those crab legs. I left but I had an intention to go back for my second round of plate. 

I saw the dessert selections and I love their french macaroons the most... the same person taking all the crab legs was behind me so I took all the chocolate french macaroons.. I mean seriously there was only 5 left lol payback I guess?

In the end... I got my crab legs and left a happy camper. Our server was very quick and attentive filling up our waters and other drinks. NOMNOMS

I think i have yelped their other location on Mill.

This one is exponentially better because there are no crazies or drunk college students here. YAY!

I normally get pretty standard flavors here. Nothing fancy. I got the naranja and my wife the coconut (don't know the name of that one). They were good as we knew they would be and expected them to be.

They have stickers all over their wall that you can slap one up there. mine is the upside down one on the speaker.

This place kind of just fell into my lap while walking around our office building. This place has REALLY good food if you are into heavy, flavorful meals. My favorite to get here is the Jambalaya. SO GOOD. This location is a very small location, but worth standing in line for if you wanted to try it. It's constantly packed, so make sure you are okay with waiting for a spot.

The pho here is not the best that I've had, but it's most likely one of the best pho restaurants on Spring Mountain. I was born and raised in San Jose which is home to the largest Vietnamese population in the country so I have a good idea on what good pho is. The single most important factor is the broth which gives it the flavor, and I'm happy to say that Kinh Do has a great pho broth.\n\nI don't care for beef too much, so I order chicken pho like I normally do and it has been great every time. The bean sprouts + basil leaves are fresh and those go well with the meal. Like I mentioned already, the broth here is awesome. The service could be better though...sometimes I have to flag down a waiter to get my water refilled.

I have been to St Francis several times and really love it but I had one dish that simply blew me away. The forbidden rice bowl-wow-flavors just explode in your mouth.
I had chicken added for protein-the dish came to the table so fresh-with perfectly cooked veggies in season, the rice was beyond tasty and the shredded chicken the perfect compliment. The real star is the sauce-delicate,aromatic, light.
I ate most of it for lunch then took home the leftover and and had a light dinner.
I never eat the same thing twice in a day but this is the type f dish I could eat weekly.
Thinking about going back soon...

So this place re-opens under new management as the all-new Wet'n'Wild water park in a week or two.  Sounds awesome if you look at their website and interactive map and a preview of all the thrill rides.  The landscaping looks to be much better too.  It's about time the hottest, fastest-growing and fifth largest city in the nation had an A-List theme park when SoCal has about ten alone!  When I see the Travel Chanel's "Top Ten U.S. Water Parks" they blow all of ours away.  I hope they re-engineer the wave pool with rolling waves, so that you can ride them like at Big Surf, instead of the intermittent "undulation" it had here before and at Golfland Sunsplash in Mesa.

Although it wasn't opened its first year by June, it will run all the way until the end of October and season passes are discounted at $59.99 before opening day.  They can be purchased at their website address: http://phoenix.mywetnwild.com/

For the latest info regarding their grand opening and a chance to win free season passes you can also follow them through Twitter at http://twitter.com/wetnwildphx and become a friend on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/pages/Phoenix-AZ/Wet-n-Wild-Waterpark/84174876135.

"Fanciful culinary indulgences are my penchant, ergo, I opted to partake in an epicurean escapade at a posh eatery on a Friday evening, craving their delectable victuals and beverages. We reserved a table and chose to sample their elaborate tasting menu, inclusive of the prized foie gras, as an additional delight. Furthermore, we elected to complement our gastronomical experience with a bottle of superior quality wine, thus elevating the cost of our repast to a considerable extent. Upon entry, a cloakroom was provided for our outerwear, which proved to be a considerate gesture. Alas, the gratuity-inclusive valet parking fee amounted to $13, which seemed somewhat incongruous with the establishment's luxurious ambiance. The comestibles presented themselves as scrumptious and visually stunning, yet they failed to surpass the lofty standards I have come to expect from such an upscale dining establishment. Our servers exhibited varying levels of proficiency; one member of the waitstaff demonstrated exceptional descriptive abilities and addresssed our queries with alacrity, while others appeared slightly less articulate in their communication, much to my chagrin, considering the importance I attach to comprehending the ingredients and preparation methods employed in the creation of my meals. Lastly, the prices for the menu items were as follows: $92 for the menu degustation, with an additional $12 per person for the foie gras degustation, and $80 for a bottle of Baron Louis red wine."
Always a great meal. The food is out of this world. One of my fave places in the East End.

"An excellent eatery offering reasonable prices and an impressive array of delectable dishes, all prepared with the freshest ingredients. Its proximity to my domicile makes it a frequent destination for me; in fact, I've had the pleasure of sampling a considerable portion of their extensive menu, with the standouts being the tender and flavorful rare beef and brisket soup, as well as their mouthwatering mixed dumplings and imperial rolls - truly a culinary delight."

This culinary establishment serves fare that is of considerable quality, garnering my approval to the extent of four stars. Although my experiences with superior Chinese cuisine in other municipalities have been numerous, the offerings presented by this eatery are, relative to the local gastronomic landscape, quite satisfactory. The fried rice, while not as crispy as I would have preferred, still boasts an adequate level of flavor. The Mongolian beef, although lacking the desired crispiness, showcases a commendable richness of taste. The Lo Mein, a dish comprising noodles, exhibits a pleasing texture and savory characteristics. However, the fried spring rolls accompanying the lunch specials fall somewhat short of my expectations. Despite these minor shortcomings, I genuinely appreciate the culinary offerings of this venue. Given the locality's limited options for quality Chinese cuisine, this restaurant emerges as a notable exception. Additionally, the prices charged for the meals are eminently reasonable, rendering it a recommendation-worthy destination for those seeking a satisfying dining experience within the realm of Chinese gastronomy.

BBQ chicken pizza was my dinner of choice, and I must say, it lived up to my expectations in terms of flavor and quality. However, upon perusing the menu, I couldn't help but notice that the prices for additional toppings were somewhat exorbitant, which led me to question the value proposition offered by this establishment. Notwithstanding, I opted to indulge in their culinary offerings, albeit with a few reservations regarding the pricing strategy employed. In conclusion, while there was room for improvement in certain aspects, the dining experience was generally satisfying.

This is definitely a unique vegas spot, something everyone should try at least once. Took my brother and my girlfriend here on our last vegas trip and was able to handle about 2 hours inside the cold. Girls- dress warm, not cute. You will freeze if you come in a black dress. Guys- drink some beforehand. The drinks are good and strong, but you don't feel them as much because you're freezing your ass off. Fun place with a great staff

Levant just opened in the uptown Mint Museum building. In the side of the building, actually, directly across from the Knight Theater's massive outdoor screen. It's owned by the same folks that own and run Kabob Grill. I've only been once, and it was for take-out, but it was delicious. Everyone was really eager to help. My wrap was hot and fresh. And when I brought it back to the office, it smelled so good that people from all over the office came by to see check things out. 

I ordered the Kafta wrap. The hummus tasted really fresh, and the beef was tender and flavorful. The fries were nice, too. Crispy on the outside and seasoned just right. 

I'll definitely try it again, next time for eat-in. This end of downtown Charlotte has really become energized with all sorts of new places to eat. I wish them plenty of success.

We tried this place after remembering that this new sandwich shop had opened.  We are glad that a Vietnamese sandwich shop is now closer to home.  The other reviews said they had a long wait so I was expecting it,  but there was no wait at all.  Maybe 2 minutes at the most.  That was a pleasant surprise.  We were the only ones there also. 

I had the sliced pork sandwich. #7.  I liked the way the meat was seasoned.  The veggies tasted fresh.

Wife had the Mekong special.  #11. We tried each other's sandwich. She liked hers better and I like mine better.  The difference between us is I like to taste the meat in the sandwich I eat.  She is happy with tasting veggies. 

I would definitely come here again and recommend it.

A phenomenal Starbucks situated within an exceptional community, characterized by an amiable staff, a melodious ambiance, and an invigorating atmosphere, but slightly marred by the inconvenience of securing a parking spot.

"We were thoroughly delighted with our stay at this quaint hotel, primarily due to its prime location directly opposite the iconic Hard Rock Cafe. The accommodations were tastefully appointed, and the hospitality demonstrated by the staff was truly exceptional. While the pool area was a pleasant respite from the bustling streets of Orlando, we did encounter a minor inconvenience in the form of an absence of a pack n play, which, granted, may not be a standard amenity for establishments catering to a more adult clientele. However, we were able to procure one for the duration of our stay, albeit at an additional expense. Additionally, we appreciated the welcoming ambiance extended to our canine companion, and the culinary offerings served by the attentive waitstaff were undoubtedly a highlight of our dining experiences in the city."

What an eclectic menu for a diner!  The ambiance is just what you would expect from a classic 60's diner.  I had a ruben and some fries and it was really good!  Most places use processed corned beef.  Theirs was real sliced beef...very tender and very flavorful.  Probably the best ruben I have ever had.  I had to try the pie too since they tease you with a great display right when you walk in.  The French silk was really rich and chocolaty.  Definately worth the stop if you are in the area or passing through.

These can't be sandwiches!! It's preposterous how delicious they are. And when you're in need of something to munch on at 4am, Earl's got your back. For my three day stay in Vegas, I've eaten here three times (all these times, sober). I tried the club sandwich, the carribean jerk, and the tomato soup. I can't deny bacon in anything, so the club sandwich was definitely a win. The carribean jerk sandwich had an amazing spread to it, packed a powerful kick with some tender loving. I've named the carribean jerk sandwich my favorite of all time. The tomato soup is topped with freshly baked croutons and is the right amount of creamy. I'd say the soup itself is filling for a light lunch. \n\nCheap, fresh, delicious.

Yummy! So this is what 'real corn beef hash' should look like and taste? I've only been here for breakfast, now I have to try their lunch & dinner. If you go there for breakfast, get their early or expect to wait. It's a small and popular place.

Took my buddy here the other day to nurse a hangover. Great food. Reasonably priced. Definitely did the job for us. They are open til 2pm serving breakfast. Friendly staff. They brought us pitchers of our drinks so we didn't have to chase a waitress down everytime we wanted a refill. I like that.

"Despite having never stayed in the rooms, I have had the pleasure of dining at the Grand Cafe on multiple occasions, and I must say that the quality of the culinary offerings is exceptional, particularly given the reasonable prices and generous portion sizes. Although I am not typically a fan of buffets, I have indulged in the spread at this establishment on several instances, and I have yet to encounter any issues with the variety or freshness of the dishes. It is worth mentioning that as a holder of a Players Card, I have been able to take advantage of advantageous deals, which has further enhanced my overall experience. Unfortunately, like many other gaming establishments in Las Vegas, the atmosphere within the casino can be somewhat hazy due to the ubiquity of cigarette smoke, which seems to permeate every corner of the facility; however, this is a minor drawback considering the otherwise excellent amenities and services offered. Speaking of services, I have noticed that locating assistance can sometimes be a challenge, likely due to the lingering effects of recent budget cuts; nevertheless, a helpful hint for fellow patrons would be to seek out the individuals clad in suits and sporting badges, as they tend to be especially helpful and knowledgeable. Lastly, it is worth mentioning that Station Casinos appear to hold a special affinity for local clientele, which is certainly appreciated."

"Our sextet collectively partook of an assortment of delectable victuals, specifically, duck fat fries, meatballs, pork belly, mussels, pappardelle, lamb carpaccio, dates, octopus, beets, porchetta, guinea fowl. Additionally, we indulged in a variety of sweet treats, including cheesecake, custard bread pudding, and port tawny for dessert. The consensus among our group was that the duck fat fries, pork belly, and dates were the most exceptional offerings, with the latter two dishes being particularly noteworthy. However, the remaining items were generally well-received, with the sole exception of the lamb, which unfortunately lacked both texture and flavor and was also excessively expensive. Our server provided commendable assistance throughout the meal, suggesting a wine pairing that greatly complemented the cuisine. The total cost for our repast, inclusive of numerous libations and dessert, approximated $300.00, which we considered reasonable given the quality of the culinary experience. We would unquestionably return to this establishment in the future."

Two Reviews in One!

The Mill is REAL Cool!  Should get 5 yelp stars for being Cool!  Still it could be better and hopefully will eventually actualize its potential!

Here are my favorite parts of the Mill :

Big Ben British Pub
Zucca Pizza
Savory Spice the Spice Shop!
Has Had a GREAT Gallery Space (thanks to Mr. Elder)


Market? My Favorite places at the Mill are NOT the Market, though the Market is still worth a visit, it will not take long to see it...  Market has Potential, Great looking Spot!  Though I have not been on the Weekend, During the Week lots of Vendors are not "maning" their booths and

These were my Favorites (in Order): :

1).  Pickleville 

2).  Cloister Honey

3).  Simply Local had:  Uncle Scott Root Beer!
                                         Chocolate Bars from:  "French Broad"(Asheville), Black Mountain Chocolate (Black Mountain,NC) and Escazu (Raleigh)!

                                          Muscadine Juices... the one I bought was about 2.75 stars, better than a few, though no where near the best!  Not enough flavor!

"An exceptional ambiance, courtesy of the establishment's French maÃ®tre d', permeates the dining area, thereby creating a hospitable environment that, in conjunction with the restaurant's fixed menu offering excellent value, fosters a sense of loyalty among its clientele, resulting in a high frequency of return visits; however, it is advisable to secure reservations in advance, as the venue tends to be quite popular and therefore often reaches capacity."
My wife and I had breakfast here while staying at the Wigwam. The coffee was great. We both ordered omelets which were good sized and packed with ingredients. Very tasty and a good atmosphere.

"This establishment serves as an optimal destination for individuals who derive pleasure from observing artistic creations, while also providing an adequate learning environment for students like myself, who are required to familiarize themselves with the subject matter as part of their academic curriculum. \n\nThe gallery in question stood out as particularly captivating due to its electrifying exhibition, despite my lack of comprehension regarding the underlying conceptual framework. Nonetheless, I thoroughly enjoyed my visit and managed to capture some remarkable photographs, thereby rendering the excursion well worth the time and effort invested."

"We partook in a delectable morning meal at this esteemed establishment today, and I must say that the culinary offerings were of exceptional quality, as per usual. Our hospitable server, Brady, provided attentive and unobtrusive service, ensuring that our dining experience was optimized without interrupting our conversational endeavors. Kudos to Brady for his commendable performance!"

I've only eaten here once so far but I like it.  I had the Thai Peanut sandwich and the tomato basil soup.  I thought the sandwich was very good and unlike the other review regarding the tomato basil soup, I really enjoyed it.  The food is good and I enjoy the colorful appearance from the outside.  In fact, that's what drew me to the place.  I'm usually on my way to Paradise Bakery or Firehouse Subs when I'm in this parking lot but the flashy and colorful lights drew us in and we liked what we found inside.

Ambiance: Excellent
Room: Excellent
Service/Concierge: Excellent
Parking: Reasonable
Location: Excellent
One can get a good price for this place if planning properly. The location is good but could be better its a short  walk to the main shopping area and restaurants area. There is plenty of parking and the service is great as always with the Delta Chain of hotels. You can park on the street if you want but I would be wary considering what I have seen in Montreal Downtown. We were upgraded to the Signature Club room which allows you access to the Signature Lounge.Continental breakfast and complimentary hors d'oeuvre are served in the Lounge. Great for someone like me who wants a quick coffee fix. Being a Delta Hotel fan I would recommend it any day. This hotel can get busy and sometimes you have a rowdy crowd so I would recommend a higher floor if you can manage it.

This place is great if you have a big appetite and love meat. There's whole salad bar with artichokes, caprese salad, calamari salad, etc, which is a tasty accompaniment to the meal. I got the seafood plate with shrimp, scallops, grilled salmon, and "tempura" cod. The salmon was a little dry and the cod too oily, but the shrimp and bacon wrapped scallops were good. I wouldn't recommend the seafood plate.

My boyfriend got the all you can eat meat instead. This was clearly the better choice. There was an assortment of lamb, sirloin, chicken etc. My favorite was the lamb with balsamic reduction, very tender and flavorful. My boyfriend loved the spicy chicken. Succulent, delicious meat.

We saved by using the Tix4tonite ($24).

Gorgeous hotel and the room are HUGE.  We came xmas eve/xmas day on a special.  My partner got a letter with a great offer. 299.00 for 2 nights, 2 tickets to Le Reve( premium seating), and 2 buffets( breakfast or lunch).  When I booked, I asked if the special was available during xmas and was told Yes.  I was happy to see a 96.00 food credit because we were charged 50.00 for xmas eve dinner.  

I don't agree with the resort fee since we didn't partake in anything else except for the internet.  I would have just rather paid the internet fee.  

I had a small issue with not having our room cleaned, but everything else was good..   My partner was thrilled that her name showed up on the tv screen. We did have an issue with the a/c.  we turned it to 65, but it barely cooled the bedroom party of the suite.  We both slept nakey, because we were so hot.

"Prodigious cake segments. Diversified array of macaroons. However, I perceived the almond croissant to be excessively saccharine. Despite my profound affection for confectionaries, I found it arduous to consume the minuscule portion due to its cloying sweetness. In contrast, the almond croissant obtained from La Belle Terre exhibited a markedly superior quality."

Was here for breakfast the other day. Food was good and the service was excellent and quick!

Food: 4
Service: 5

Overall: 4.5 rounds down

This was a great discovery in the South Side. It is not your typical South Side bar (which is a very good thing in my mind), and it has surprisingly good food! I think it is smoke free too, which makes it all the more appealing. I highly recommend stopping by for some sliders the next time you are in the area!

"My culinary inclinations unwaveringly incline me towards commending Wolfman's pizza, despite its dubious connection to California cuisine, as it elicits a sense of familiarity akin to that of California Pizza Kitchen. My gastronomical exploits have led me to develop an ardent fondness for the White Wolf pizza, which boasts an assemblage of chicken, spinach, and finely chopped herbs atop a crust that deftly balances thickness and thinness. Furthermore, I find the crust to be remarkably versatile, catering to diverse pizza enthusiasts who may harbor preferences for varying styles, such as New York or Chicago. Although the appetizers fail to leave a lasting impression, they satiate the hunger of patrons awaiting their pizzas admirably. The individual-sized salads prove sufficient for two individuals to share, while the larger portions could easily accommodate three or more diners. When dining with a companion, consider requesting the smaller size and an additional plate, accompanied by the dressing on the side, as the servers tend to be generous with their distribution of the condiment. The staff exudes friendliness and hospitality, yet the pace of service can fluctuate inexplicably, even during periods of low patronage. Notwithstanding this inconsistency, the establishment offers an impressive selection of beers and periodic special deals, which they advertise on their website."

This place has a great patio PLUS a great selection of microbrews.  I loved the setup of this place- great front and back patio-dog friendly too.  The back patio setup is awesome.  Great view of Camelback Mountain and the bicycle wall with the tires that are fans is super cool!  We came on Father's Day and for their BBQ Sunday special and we were not disappointed.  The special was great, huge portions.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.  Our waitress gave great recommendations and did not steer us wrong. Can't wait to go back!

Great venue for a wedding - I attended a couple of weddings here and the chapel is very quaint.  If you like historic little places with lots of character and don't want to get married in an actual church, this is a great option. It is also centrally located between midtown & uptown districts, which is nice if you have people coming from out of town or simply from different sides of town. There is a beautiful garden outdoors with lots of trees and a sweet little gazebo which is perfect for those wedding photos.

This show is different from every other Cirque du Soleil show I've ever seen.  Be prepared - this is an adult show with nudity and very adult themes.  There were a few uncomfortable moments with the performances, but on the whole, it's still a very visually stunning show.  As always, the costumes are incredible.  The music is perfect.  The acts are all very inventive and the performers are amazing.  \nSimple words of warning - Don't bring your parents or grandparents.

Great little (and only) Cambodian restaurant in phoenix. Great variety of food and friendly service. Very clean and inviting interior full of Cambodian decor, there are even some Cambodian books on each of the tables to look at while you dine.

If you like Thai and Vietnamese food this place is basically a fusion of the two. I tried the Loat Cha noodles and they were excellent, with beef and eggs . Only downside was the small portion, would have expected a bit more for the price. For desert I tried the corn. Although to most people corn would be part of the main course this treat was essentially a roasted corn on the cob smothered in a sugary, and fish sauce type glaze. It was excellent and a great alternative to a typical desert item.


Place was a bit hard to find the restaurant name was on the side of a building and not facing the street, and the entrance to park is off to the side of a mechanic shop which is not very apparent.

We availed ourselves of a Groupon for my spouse and myself, which enabled us to indulge in a therapeutic massage and detoxification treatment, and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience, with the exception of a minor issue regarding communication pertaining to the intensity of the massage; however, the staff was accommodating and responsive to our needs, ensuring that we felt pampered and rejuvenated upon departure. The comprehensive massage encompassed our head, neck, shoulder, arm, foot, and leg regions, culminating in an overall satisfaction with the service rendered.

My roommate and I decided to momentarily abandon our stringent dietary restrictions today, indulging in an unapologetic craving for Thai cuisine, and we were utterly delighted that we did so, as the culinary experience was nothing short of exceptional. The eatery we patronized was remarkably tranquil this evening, a characteristic commonly attributed to many downtown establishments on Monday nights, thereby allowing us to receive prompt and attentive service. I opted for the delectable swimming rama, a dish comprising beef immersed in a rich peanut sauce, served atop a bed of expertly steamed vegetables; the flavors were undoubtedly tantalizing, and I would unquestionably order it again in the future. My roommate, on the other hand, selected the fiery pad pik sod, a dish boasting a medley of colorful vegetables and jalapeÃ±os, complemented by succulent chicken; although the spiciness was somewhat intense, the sheer depth of flavor was truly remarkable. Both of us relished every bite, leaving not a single morsel uneaten, and joining the esteemed ranks of the clean plate club. Our fellow diners opted for the mouthwatering yellow chicken curry and tom yum soup, their visual appeal being nothing short of stunning. The ambiance of the restaurant was open and pristine, albeit slightly lacking in character. Prices were eminently reasonable, ranging from $10 to $15 for the majority of dishes. While my entrÃ©e undoubtedly satiated my hunger, the allure of the other dishes was impossible to ignore, compelling me to consider exploring alternative options during my subsequent visit; however, for now, I must regretfully return to my rigid dietary regimen.

This place is the bomb!  Food portions are huge and the quality is consistent... Recommend the mixed plate or Katsu/Teri beef combo with Mac salad!  I wonder sometimes if the owner is a local or just bought the franchise... But so far food is good representation of what you get in Hawaii.

I have had their Brisket on several occasions, pretty good stuff, I am a BBQ fanatic, if I like it, you may love it, I have tried BBQ from some of the best cooks in the world... that being said, this stuff is pretty damn good... try it for yourself

"Optimize your culinary experience by indulging in a delectable croissant accompanied by an expertly brewed coffee, all while luxuriating in the welcoming ambiance of this charming establishment. With its extensive selection of mouthwatering pastries and baked goods, this cozy cafÃ© has the potential to supplant our beloved Ellefsen as the go-to destination for satisfying our morning cravings. Conveniently located in Ahuntsic, this eatery enjoys a steady stream of customers during the week, but it's during the weekends that the crowds truly flock to savor their renowned brunch offerings, freshly baked bread, and assorted sweet treats."

"This serves as an augmented rendition of the previous assessment, wherein the latter review's effusive praise is now supplanted by an even more emphatic expression of gratitude towards the exceptional customer service proffered by the drive-thru staff, specifically that of Guillermo, whose remarkable efficiency in expediting my repast was so conspicuous as to warrant unstinting commendation, thereby setting a new standard against which all future dining experiences shall be measured; this laudatory account was recorded on November 15th, 2013, at 6:42 p.m., and it stands as a testament to Del Taco's steadfast commitment to excellence in the realm of fast food service."
The Kona coffee is a personal favorite for my coffee for my hubby.  We love the banana crepes and Monte Cristo.  I also love the Chicken strip salad!

Whenever we go to a Coyotes game or a concert @ Jobing.com Arena, we stop by this location to grab some grub and pre-game Brewskies.  If you plan to come here pre-game, be prepared for a long wait.  We average 30-45 min every time we come here before a game.

What can I say about Yard House that hasn't already been said?  I love their Beer selection and food.

My favorite dish is of course the Sliders ($10.85).  When they have it, I get the Green Flash IPA ($7) to wash it down.

Overall, it's a great place to be just before a Coyotes game.

Return Factor - 90%

"Would have garnered a perfect five-star rating if the waiting period and service quality had been more satisfactory, thereby aligning with the exceptional culinary standards set by the restaurant's creative farm-to-table fare, particularly in regards to the mouthwatering fried sage fried chicken and the delectable chicken and waffles dish, which undoubtedly showcased the establishment's commitment to innovative gastronomy."

I make it a point to frequent this canine recreational facility with my trusty canine companion on a regular basis, specifically utilizing the expansive area designated for larger breeds. Notwithstanding the bedlam that often ensues at such dog-friendly locales, this particular park exudes an atmosphere of relative tranquility, a testament to the diligence and accountability of the proprietors in maintaining a safe and hygienic environment for their furry friends. Moreover, the amenities provided here are not only plentiful but also ideally suited to accommodate the needs of the more imposing canine denizens.

There are lots of great restaurants near Phoenix area, as a Chinese student, I would like to say the Szechwan palace can represent the authentic Chinese food.  I ordered Mopo Tofu, Chongqing Hotpot and Boiled beef and fish today. All dishes are really spicy and I really love it.

After an entire day of meandering throughout the historic city of Edinburgh, Wings provided the ideal culinary delight to satiate my unwavering yearning for authentic American-style chicken wings, thereby offering a gratifying dining experience enhanced by a convivial ambiance and complemented by a cinematic marathon event taking place in the lower level of the establishment; furthermore, the attentive and efficient service proffered by the staff was augmented by the savory flavors of a Magner's, accompanied by an impromptu dance performance ignited by the fiery, blue cheese-infused sauce, thus ensuring my eager return at the earliest convenience.

The people working at this store are awesome- they remembered me the both times I went in.  I will drive to this Autozone over the others because they are so friendly.  There was a line both times, but with the summer heat in AZ, a lot of people needed new batteries.  Bottom line- great Autozone!

Now that I have had the opportunity to slumber on the floor of this terminal, I feel an intrinsic bond with my surroundings.

The advantages of this establishment are as follows:

1. Complimentary wireless internet! I am currently utilizing it to convey my thoughts.
2. The atmosphere is now devoid of smoke, a welcome alteration.

However, there are some drawbacks to consider:

1. By design, airports are intended to be uncomfortable, a deliberate attempt to encourage travelers to expedite their departure.
2. I am perplexed by the ubiquity of the Wheel of Fortune slot machine, which seems to pursue me relentlessly. Why does it persist in its pursuit?

After a duration of 12 hours, I find myself yearning for a potted plant, any potted plant that might provide a modicum of solace. In the future, enlightened airports will feature botanical gardens, alleviating the stress associated with air travel and creating a more hospitable environment for those who find themselves waylaid. Until then, I shall continue to appreciate the benefits of smoke-free airports, despite the occasional inconvenience caused by the callous treatment of luggage by airlines.

If it weren't for Yelptern Izzy D and a Monroe-ish Street meeting we had scheduled, I probably would have never come across this place. Glad I did though... glad I did. 

I have yet to chow down so I can't speak to their eats... I'll surely nab some nosh and let you know. What I CAN tell you is that the interior is awesome. Super chill, super quirky, but super quaint, so not the place to meet 10 of your besties for coffee. There are two sides, I like the side you enter on because I think it's a bit more active and I dig the furniture sitch. Staff is so welcoming, informative, and isn't quick to rush you out if you're working for a while. Java is solid. 

Bonus points for having live music every night 5-6. This is what their sign says, this is what their staff says, though I haven't been for tunes yet. 

Food and tunes anyone? Let's go!

"Recently, a comprehensive renovation has been conducted, resulting in an efficiently designed floor plan that seamlessly facilitates user navigation and optimizes spatial functionality, thereby creating a highly effective and well-flowing layout. Furthermore, a designated area for well-behaved children and those who may require additional attention has been strategically positioned on the opposite side of the building, effectively separating it from the primary library space and minimizing potential disruptions. This thoughtful design element can be attributed to the genius of the architects and planners responsible for the project."

"I possess a predilection for Firebirds, an establishment that ostensibly embodies the quintessence of culinary excellence and atmospheric ambiance. Perching atop my expectations, the eatery's delectable fare and hospitable staff never fail to impress, with the exception of a singular grievance pertaining to the manner in which my victuals are conveyed to my person. Specifically, I implore the servers to refrain from digitally violating my repast with their thumbs, instead opting for the utilization of a tray, thus ensuring an untarnished dining experience. Furthermore, I must commend the proprietors on their judicious selection of a new venue, which boasts an aesthetic grandeur that rivals the gastronomical splendor of the edibles served within."

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are truly singular and tantalizing, representing a creative synthesis of Mexican and Chinese gastronomic traditions. It is imperative to sample the fare in order to fully appreciate its delectability, as the combination of flavors and ingredients results in a truly unparalleled epicurean experience. Furthermore, the ambiance is relaxed and conducive to enjoying a leisurely repast, allowing patrons to savor their meals in a tranquil setting while perhaps even partaking in a glass of vinous beverage, thereby enhancing the overall enjoyment of the dining experience."

Not as good as Persian Room, yet they have really good meat and great service.

Hookah is well packed, hookah guys are nice and change out charcoal and maintain regularly. Lots of options.

They also have live music sometimes. Drinks are pretty good too.

Call it in a head of time. There's always a line and its not fast service by any means. Inside is kind of cramped and outside seating is very limited. Customer service is not where they excel, but I've gotten over it. Getting in and out of the parking lot is always entertaining but well worth all the hassle. \n\nThey have a lot of different pasta salads in their deli case that you can get by the pound, perfect to go along with your sandwich and so far all that I've tried have been delicious.

Pasand is under new ownership and the changes already seem good. I went there today expecting the same old stuff. What I got was some truely excellent tasting food. The food was leaps and bounds above the previous food. The spices were much more distinct and flavorful and especially fresh. In talking with the owners they were going to rennovate the run downinside and add some more buffet places. Overall I approve of what has been down to the place especially the food.

I stopped in today for lunch. The staff were nice, service was fast. The food would be what I'd consider a restaurant style bbq. The ribs tasted like they were smoked and dry rubbed, pretty good even though im more a fan of a more vinegary and fatty rib. The cornbread was ok. The hot sauce was a little over powering, not from heat..it just didn't leave any room for the flavor of the meat. Overall good experience but the place was empty...so if you want a bbq place in the South Side..you should probably stop in so they keep their lunch hours.

I dined here on Monday 04/29. I ordered the Korean steak tacos, they were ok but nothing special. The vanilla bean cheesecake however was good. The waitress young lady long blond hair, was very good and attentive.

Freed's Bakery made ordering a custom cake a breeze! It was a week before my friends and I would be going to vegas to celebrate a birthday. They made a delicious red velvet cake and delivered it to the restaurant w/ no hiccups!

We ordered a red velvet cake w/ irish bailey filling and butter cream frosting. The cake was so moist, the girls and I devoured it.

thanks for everything!

Best Wishes is another of those alternative, independent gift shops which are very popular in Edinburgh. It sells all sorts, including artsy cards, funky wrapping paper, jewellery, trinkets, make up, and toys which are all excellent stocking filler gifts or something small to give as a birthday present. The gifts are not the cheapest around but they are good quality and the cards are very original, think Clinton's but actually good. \n\nThe store is well laid out, making it easy to find what you are looking for which for me is a huge help, seeing as I often get lost in these type of shops, and end up buried under hundreds of little accessories or being attacked by care bears. The owner was exceptionally helpful as well, offering to wrap everything, and was a cheerful person to have a chat to.

"My ardent desire is to confer a perfect quintet of stellar ratings upon this culinary establishment, as it has consistently demonstrated a laudable proficiency in providing delectable fare at reasonable tariffs, while fostering a welcoming ambiance that facilitates a convivial rapport between patrons and staff. However, I find myself reluctant to bestow the full complement of five stars, due to a singular yet salient shortcoming that unfortunately compromises my dining experience. Specifically, the presence of employees partaking in noxious nicotine fumes outside the premises, subsequent to preparing my plant-based victuals, engenders an unsettling sense of dissonance that sadly precludes me from extending the highest rating. Such a state of affairs strikes me as analogous to a comedic sketch on Saturday Night Live, wherein the incongruity of smoking and cooking in a vegan eatery would serve as the central theme."

Relatively new nail salon in Villeray. Big location, very clean and comfortable. Nice collection of colors to choose from (OPI, Essie, Shellac). They offer 15%  student and elder discount on Mondays and Tuesday. Prices are very competive even without the discount.

I adore this place! It is always packed and the service is wonderful. This is my 3rd visit in 2 months; the portions are huge, the options are endless and the waitstaff is knowledgeable. My only advice is not to order any of the steak menu items. The sirloin was fatty and just bad (one star subtraction). Everything else I have had from sushi to chicken to shrimp has been off the charts delicious and fresh. Grab a few friends, get the sushi boat and prepared to be blown away. A hidden gem that is in our regular rotation. CHECK IT OUT!!!

This place was surprisingly way better than I thought. Came at 10:40 ish. Paid for breakfast, but got breakfast and lunch. Came in during the transition. Their beef sausage ( different from the breakfast sausage) was very tasty. Also really like their flank steak. The Mexican rice was also very good. You seriously cannot beat the price

"The morning repast menu boasts an exceptional array of delectable options, catering to the diverse tastes of its patrons. Our party of nine was accommodated with celerity, and the hospitality we received was of the highest quality. This eatery unquestionably warrants a revisit, whether for a casual brunch encounter or a momentous celebration."

Second time I stayed at the Aria was for NYE this year. The table minimums have gone up quite a bit. On the plus side, it keeps the crowds out. But on the down side, I don't want to play $5 chips at Roulette at noon. Despite it being a holiday weekend, I could still find tables at MGM going down to $10, even at night.

The hotel is nice, but again, my room at MGM Grand is nicer. The Aria room had a bunch of issues. The minibar fridge was broken all weekend so all drinks were hot. We left our room for 7 hours during the day and returned to a dirty room - room service hadn't been picked up and it hadn't been serviced at all. They send someone to clean up finally, but they never refilled the water bottles. Later that night, we call and say, hey we need those waters. They say, that's a separate dept. that fills the minibar and they also didn't do their job. And as a result, to get a bottle of water, we had to pay $30 at room service instead of $10 in the minibar. It was annoying.

The beds are very comfortable. The casino itself is nice and attracts a nice crowd.

But I still prefer MGM Grand. I never encounter weird problems like those described above and my room is actually nicer at MGM Grand.

Ok im not going to say that i dont love coming here. The service is great, the ambience phenomenal, the manager is actually italian, etc. I love coming here for dinners or just a bite at the bar, but like with the rest of cuisine in Charlotte, its just not awesome. I believe its because the water in CLT sucks. \n\nGrilled octopus is the best thing on the menu. Hands down

"Excellent culinary experience. We thoroughly enjoyed the delectable fare, specifically the regal Hawaiian pizza, accompanied by an equally impressive cheese bread, not to mention the mouthwatering roasted chicken complemented by a pesto sauce. Although the ambiance was slightly marred by the overpowering aroma of the firewood, our satisfaction with the gastronomical offerings remained unwavering. In conclusion, we would highly recommend this establishment, with the minor caveat regarding the ventilation system."

Buffalo wings are on of my main food groups. One of the reasons I miss living in Arizona, that's right not somewhere in the N East that get's cold, but AZ. Wing are perfect each time, right amount of spice, heat and sauce. Being spoiled by NNY has ruined me for life. I can't seem to find a close second to this, and man have I tried. Love the other food btw, and the service has always been good everytime I go. NNY is my excuse to visit my relatives in AZ.

I don't get haircuts often. That being said I enjoyed miniBar Ber Shop. Its a little more modern than my tastes, but after a few beers I couldn't care less. And yes, beers at the barber....INGENIOUS! 

Boris gave me a trim and shaved off my beard. We gabbed about raising kids, and going on vacation, and how generally awful we both think New York can be. After I was done I had a couple more beers. Hey its almost noon and I'm on vacation.

PS the girl at the front desk is c-u-t-e.

"Upon my most recent visit to Las Vegas, I opted to return to this establishment due to its exceptional quality. Although I do not customarily consume burgers, my assessment of the restaurant is centered primarily around their milkshakes. Having sampled the Mother Fluffer on two separate occasions, I can confidently attest to its extraordinary taste. My spouse, who accompanied me on both visits, thoroughly enjoyed the Lunch Box Milkshake as well. While the Caesar salad I ordered was satisfactory, it did not quite live up to my lofty expectations. In contrast, my husband's Classic Burger garnered a positive review, albeit with a few reservations. Notwithstanding, the milkshakes and fries at this venue are undeniably delectable, making them an excellent choice for any patron seeking a satisfying dining experience."

It is an exceptional cinema. Why, you might ask? Well, let me elucidate. Firstly, the premises are immaculately maintained, creating a welcoming ambiance for movie enthusiasts. Secondly, the staff exudes warmth and friendliness, with a particular employee, formerly of Taco Bell fame, now gracing the establishment with his presence. Thirdly, the temperature within the theater is pleasantly cool, ensuring a comfortable viewing experience for patrons. Fourthly, the screens are impressively large, further enhancing the cinematic enjoyment. Fifthly, the chairs are not only expansive but also luxuriously soft, providing optimal comfort for an extended period. Sixthly, the stadium seating design grants an unobstructed view from any seat, elevating the movie-going experience. Seventhly, the theater's relatively low attendance can be seen as both a positive and negative aspect, depending on one's perspective. Lastly, with 24 screens available, it is highly likely that the desired film will be showing at the preferred time, eliminating the need for prolonged waiting periods. Additionally, parking validation is offered in the adjacent AZ Center garage, rendering the overall experience even more convenient. Therefore, my preference for this cinema is unequivocal.

Coffee addict.  4 years and still going strong.
I love coffee I have no idea what got me started on coffee. 
I have to give this place kuddos though because their coffee is excelente.

I just had a regular cup of Joe and the chocolated coated coffee bean for free. My friend had a Rockstar with fruitpunch in it. It was really good, the rockstar seemed a little pointless being that they already sell fruit punch Rockstars at your local stores.

On the plus side they have double drive through. Prices seem way cheaper than Starbucks. Most importanly the staff is super duper diddly friendly :)

Here comes debbie downer, the only reason why I can't give 5 stars is because their menu is so overwhelming. I didn't know what to get. There are way to many options maybe they can minimize or make the font on the menu larger. 

I can highly  recommend  you give it a try. If you love coffee and other fun drinks.

When we arrived at the Senor Taco in Fountain Hills, situated within a dilapidated strip mall behind a Circle K, the initial aspect that caught my attention was the plethora of trucks populating the parking lot, which, albeit limited in size, was brimming with large trucks adorned with an array of construction-related tools and equipment. This sight instilled within me a sense of optimism, leading me to surmise that the establishment was likely to serve quality cuisine.

Upon entering the restaurant, we were greeted by a recently renovated interior, characterized by spotless formica booths and shiny tile floors, although the ambiance remained relatively unremarkable. Customers are required to place their orders at the cashier or utilize the drive-thru window, following which their meals are prepared and ready for collection within a mere five minutes. The prices, in my opinion, are one of the primary draws of this eatery, as they are eminently reasonable and affordable for the majority of patrons.

We opted to sample the fish taco plate, which consisted of two generously proportioned tacos enveloped in fresh corn tortillas, complemented by an abundance of crisp cabbage and rich, creamy crema. Although the rice and beans accompanying the dish were undeniably delectable, they were regrettably not served at a sufficiently high temperature, thereby precluding them from attaining a perfect rating. Notwithstanding this minor shortcoming, my spouse and I were able to share a single platter for the modest sum of $6.99, a price point that strikes me as remarkably reasonable.

Furthermore, the diverse array of authentic Mexican flavors available at this establishment is certain to appeal to aficionados of the cuisine. The prices, while not exorbitant, are sufficient to ensure that the restaurant remains profitable, and the clientele appears to comprise primarily individuals who genuinely appreciate and understand the nuances of Mexican cooking.

A self-serve salsa bar, replete with an assortment of customary salsas, as well as my personal favorite, pickled carrots and fresh radishes, further enhances the dining experience. While the ambiance may not be particularly refined, the eatery's focus on providing rapid, economical, and delectable sustenance renders it an excellent choice for those seeking a satisfying meal without breaking the bank.

Wood paneling, a great (though expensive wine list), and a Goodfellas feel to this hidden gem that has been in business for 35 years.

An above average selection of pasta standards including squid ink fettuccine, and pesto made with basil so fresh it took on a different flavor.  The beer selection is poor, however the above average wine list made up for it.

Many varieties of scalopini, soups and fresh seafood, makes this more than just a pasta joint.

Service is friendly and professional.  I will be back.

Came here for the steak and eggs!! It says 3.99, but it actually comes out to 4.49. But that's ok. The customer service is kinda bad, It seems they're always frustrated.  

Anyways, the steak was full of nerves and fat but had good flavor. When they ask you if you want toast or biscuit in gravy, get the toast!! The biscuit in gravy is always cold and the gravy tastes like its out of a can. 

I suppose I would recommend this place, I get a lot of food for a little money, and that's good for a student on a budget!

This production deviates from the conventional format of traditional performances, distinguishing itself from its contemporaries and offering a unique experience for viewers. The term "different" encompasses a wide range of interpretations, contingent upon individual preferences, emotions, interests, and the extent of unconventionality. I must confess that my personal enjoyment of the musical component of this show was considerable, and I found myself yearning for further musical performances, as the band's artistry and the blue men's eccentricity, complemented by the captivating light effects, culminated in an exhilarating spectacle. However, certain comedic skits seemed to prolong themselves excessively, in my opinion. Perhaps, I failed to comprehend the underlying message, as I felt that merely standing and consuming cereals did not constitute sufficient entertainment. Nonetheless, I strongly advise against revealing excessive details and instead recommend that you experience it firsthand, as I unequivocally endorse this production.

What more can be rewarding after a 5 hour hike at Red Rock, I'll tell you what....a good ass breakfast!  My first time here and by the looks of the food on the table and how crowded it was being a wednesday afternoon, I knew it was gonna be good.

My friend was on her whack diet (she ain't even fat), so she just ordered tuna salad and biscuit with gravy.  I ordered the mexican omelette and red velvet pancakes, which I never there was such a thing.  The mexican omelette had marinated carnitas, sliced jalapenos, pico gallo, pepper jack cheese and topped off with sour cream.  It was pretty good but the red velvet pancake was the main dish I enjoyed the most.  I have never been a big fan of anything red velvet and this is the first.  She gave me a bite of her biscuit and gravy but I thought she was done with it and I killed it.  Haha she was like really, I look down for one second and you eat it all without sharing, ooops.

Very affordable too with friendly servers who attend to you right away and checks up occasionally, despite the place being busy.  I will definitely be coming here for breakfast again. My ex and her tuna salad, what a waste of visit to baby cakes for her.

I stopped by here on a whim, thinking they had wifi because it is a coffee/tea/smoothie spot and I learned that they didn't have wifi
No biggie 
The girl that helped me was nice and gave me the run down on the menu and the Flavors that she liked
I went with a strawberry piña colada smoothie and it was really, really good 
It was pretty cheap too, which made it even better 
I sat at the table out front and enjoyed the smoothie
The foam on top made my day
I will have to stop by and try one of their coffees

I stayed here when it first opened many years ago. At the time Ceasars and The Mirage were the big dogs and the whole pirate ship show out front was a big deal. I was upgraded for free to a top floor room with a sick view and can't help but think TI helped cement my life long love of Las Vegas.

Fast Foward 15 or so years. I don't think I have done more than walk through the place a few times since. But when I returned for noodle soup (read Pho at the Coffee Shop review) I saw a $5 craps table on my way out. I stopped to play a while with the  light morning crowd.

The dealers were friendly and fun and everyone was having a good time playing the game. I think that is all you can ask for in a casino. I also like the feature bet. While  I'm sure it's a sucker bet the 176 to 1 odds can make one happy sucker. I will return to play craps here and eat soup. Good Luck.

No matter what hour of the day, day of the week, or time of the year - the Grapevine is a must visit kind of place for locals and tourists alike!  

The patio upstairs is fantastic for hanging out with your family or friends, grabbing a bite to eat, and relaxing and enjoying the sunshine.  The bar upstairs has TVs, so you'll be able to catch whatever game you are trying to see. 

For happy hour and on into the night, you can stay and rock out to the karaoke. The people here aren't messing around!   You'll get a little bit of everything from Elvis to Dixie Chicks to Sir Mix a Lot.   Where could you find that kind of entertainment all in one place?!

Every time that I have been to Montreal in the last six years, I have gone to Schwartz's.  More because of my husband's affliction for it: If we're in the city, he needs to go and get his fix. After all this time, I don't blame him.

Everyone has their own way of ordering - and I don't judge (unless that way is 'lean'; that I don't understand.) You might want a cherry coke with your sandwich. You might eat your sandwich with a knife and a fork. And that's fine. (My order? A sandwich, fries to share, a pickle, cherry coke. The A1 steak sauce needs to be nearby, too.)

I don't know if I would call this place 'the best restaurant in Canada' or 'the Katz's of Montreal', but it is terribly good smoked meat, in a style very different from New York delis (bagels and smoked meat - it's what sets New Yorkers and Montrealers apart). It's mouthwateringly delicious, served in a setting that requires that you get close to your neighbour (and I've had some great conversations as a result).

The line appears daunting, but the guy manning the door knows what he's doing. Trust him. Trust the staff inside. Trust the smoker in the kitchen that has been churning out incredible sandwiches for the past 82 years.

I just hope that Celine Dion doesn't mess it up when the sale is finalized.

I really like that the free weights are separated from the treadmill area. pool is nice trainers are great too. I usually go after work and its never too crowded. they also have some great spin classes.

"My affection for their Chai frost, augmented by the indulgent addition of whipped cream, is unwavering...

Moreover, this establishment boasts an inviting ambiance, characterized by subdued illumination and a warm, welcoming atmosphere, rendering it an ideal setting for a leisurely coffee break.

For those seeking an even more comfortable experience, I suggest bringing a pillow and blanket, thereby enhancing the coziness factor exponentially...:

The staff is proficient in their duties, ensuring a prompt and seamless service, which is particularly advantageous during the sweltering summer months when the judicious employment of misters maintains a refreshingly cool environment within the premises."

@ Skip B.  I read the inspection report from 1/24/11 and didn't see anything too serious on there.   There were 5 critical items mentioned.  One was for no date on portioned salad dressings.  I assume \"portioned\" refers to when you pour dressing from the main container into a secondary container for daily use.  The second was for putting fish and fries at convenient locations during lunch rush.  The third was something about the ice drain line, fourth  was some air gap issue with the drive through window, and the last was for a bag of ice melt being stored on the same shelf as food.  When I see a score of 31 I expect there to be spoiled food, dirty/sick employees, rodent infestations and the like.  These are hardly reasons for me to stop enjoying my guilty cheap burger and fry pleasure.  \n\nWith the previous rant review addressed this place is the best alternative to fast food burger chains.  I have had their burgers, chicken fries, fried okra (!), and fish.  Their fish is surprisingly yummy and burgers should be ordered doubled and split with a friend.   My biggest complaint is that they don't have root beer or ginger ale.  As a result I never order a drink.

"I recently halted my vehicular transportation device at this establishment purveying sustenance and other domestic necessities, albeit on an impromptu basis, owing to the dearth of edible spreads and sanitary tissue within my domicile; however, the cordiality of the staff remained undiminished, as they presented an array of vibrant, succulent fruits and vegetables, which served as a visual precursor to the complimentary culinary samples that awaited my taste buds. Furthermore, my sojourn at this market did not disappoint, as I acquired an excessive quantity of fermented beverages, thereby solidifying Trader Joe's status as a veritable haven for epicureans such as myself."

"I have had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by this esteemed establishment on multiple occasions, and I must say that the ambiance has consistently struck a chord with my sensibilities. The servers have been exceptionally hospitable, displaying an unwavering commitment to ensuring a seamless dining experience for their patrons. Although I have witnessed the restaurant bustling with activity during peak hours, the staff has consistently demonstrated an impressive proficiency in managing the influx of customers without compromising the quality of service. While I remain hesitant to bestow a perfect five-star rating, I do anticipate returning to savor the delectable offerings of this eatery in the future."

"I am an ardent devotee of this establishment. My affection for the Sahara venue was immense, but alas, it was regrettably closed on Thanksgiving, much to my dismay (we discovered this fact the hard way...). In light of this, I opted to visit this location instead, and upon arrival, I was informed that there would be a prolonged waiting period of one to three hours, with no assurance of seating.
