Following several persistent inquiries directed towards the hostess, I was advised that if I continued to entreat her, there was a possibility that we might be accommodated earlier than anticipated. As fate would have it, mere moments after my third attempt at prodding her, a booth became available, and we were promptly ushered in. My elation was palpable. It dawned on me that making a reservation well in advance, particularly during peak holiday seasons, would be a judicious decision for future visits.

Opting not to partake in the customary Thanksgiving feast, as it seemed to be merely a hasty assembly of dishes, I decided to sample the New York Steak, Ribeye, and Pork Tenderloin instead. To my delight, each selection proved to be delectable and impressively tender. Although the sweet potato mashed-up-stuff lacked a discernible sweet potato flavor, it remained passable. The fried green tomatoes appetizer, on the other hand, was utterly scrumptious! However, the unremarkable chicken accompaniment struck me as somewhat incongruous, yet unexpectedly complemented the rich textures and flavors of the fried and balsamic dressing components.

The breathtaking perspective from this site, overlooking the pool at night, eclipsed that of the Sahara and left me thoroughly captivated. Incidentally, we retained approximately three-quarters of our meal for later consumption, much to my satisfaction."

Pretty fun place to check out while on the strip.  My daughter wanted to go here to meet the polar bear mascot and he didn't disappoint.  The costume is top notch and better than your standard character.  The top portion is like a puppet and is very animated.  They allow you to take your own photos, however, the background is just a green screen.  If you go upstairs, you can purchase the photos they take with an artic background added.  We bought the package which had two 5x7 photos and a sheet of four smaller sized photos for $35.    Employees are all really nice and of course the store had a great variety of Coke themed merchandise.  One of the nice \"free\" attractions  Vegas has to offer.

Yeah, yeah, I know, it's a chain.  But it was there for us when we needed it.  My mother wasn't eating well on her own and my middle daughter lived in Mesa, not too far, so she would stop by Boston Market and pick up a couple of dinners on the way to visit her and they would have a nice visit and meal together.  Since Mother always liked what my daughter brought and ate well, at least we knew she was getting good nutrition from it and some leftovers for the next day.  \n\nWhen I was in town I would stop by there too  I always liked their sides and would sometimes just get a vegetarian plate of just the sides.  I liked their roast sirloin or whatever they call it too, for the price.  And their desserts were pretty good.  I liked that they had dishes that you don't find in most fast food places.  I never had a problem with anything I ate from there and they were pretty consistent in their quality so I give it four stars on a sliding scale compared to other fast food establishments.  I'd go back anytime I'm in the mood for good old American comfort food.

I am usually not a fan of restaurants with gift shops inside of them, but I must admit I am a fan of Saddle Ranch. This is perhaps one of the best people watching locations on the west side simply for the fact that they have a mechanical bull. For some reason this device attracts women with skimpy shirts and fake boobs like bees to honey. While sipping on my ginormous long island ice tea, I could not help but utterly enjoy watching people get tossed from the bull, in many instances it was pure comedy. I have yet to eat here but my parents have on two occasions and have had wonderful experiences. The first time they went there they had to wait for a table and the manager walked them over to the bar and bought them a drink. The manager obviously understood that a free bloody mary was the way to my mother's heart and a sure fire way to win repeat business.

We love this place! We come at least once a month.  You can never go wrong with \"bottomless fries\"  as an appetizer and distractor for the kids.  The burger selection is good and service is always prompt and friendly.  I recommend signing up for there frequent diner card to earn free burgers for purchases and a birthday burger as well.

About as large as a small Wal-Mart, this is truly a warehouse of shoes. And surprisingly, not all women's shoes. There is a large section of shoes for men too!

I stuck to my side of the shop and saw that the shoes were organized by style - boots, laceups, slip-ons and such were all neatly put together with one on display and a stack of others underneath with a variety of sizes. I have average size feet, so it's rare that there is any problem finding shoes in my size that fit.

After I had narrowed down my selection to just two and was walking around to test comfort, I spotted their "clearance" racks in the back had a pair of the style I wanted in my size! So instead of buying a full-price (marked down?) pair at $62, I got a "last pair in store" with a 20% discount that was a name brand (Timberlake!) for $52. Boom!

When you shop at Off Broadway, you also get an encore rewards coupon for 10% of your spending that you can use on your next visit. I can't imagine that I'll be back for shoes again and remember this coupon, but hey, you never know!

In my subjective experience, there exists a profound schism within the city of Pittsburgh, analogous to the historical conflict between the Montagues and Capulets. This dichotomy is manifest in the culinary preferences of the city's inhabitants, with individuals either aligning themselves with Pamela's or Deluca's, the two establishments representing the antitheses of the breakfast food spectrum. As an ardent adherent of the latter, I would eagerly engage in a spirited dispute with proponents of Pamela's, provided that I have been adequately fortified by a colossal breakfast burrito, proportionate in size to my cranial dimensions, and numerous cups of coffee. 
 Deluca's, while possessing certain idiosyncrasies, continues to captivate my attention. These peculiarities include an interminable wait for seating (attributable to the universal desire to partake in the restaurant's offerings), an ambiance reminiscent of a vintage diner, replete with an eccentric mural and surfaces susceptible to stickiness, and a service staff that, while proficient, does not indulge in excessive coddling of their clientele, given the restaurant's bustling nature and modest gratuities. Personally, I find these characteristics appealing and actively seek them out in a dining establishment. My fondness for Deluca's extends to visiting the restaurant in a state of mild inebriation, whereupon I relish devouring a gargantuan burrito and copious amounts of orange juice and coffee, the latter replenished at irregular intervals by an accommodating server. 
 Notwithstanding my unwavering loyalty to Deluca's, I must confess that a certain diner, situated beneath the 16th street bridge, whose name escapes me at present, serves exceptional biscuits and gravy, thereby earning my esteemed recognition as my preferred dining venue.

"Consider ordering a mere half of the portion size you genuinely desire, as a single scoop is equivalent to approximately two; however, be prepared to navigate through a smoke-filled casino to reach the secluded location on the second floor. Despite the somewhat lengthy journey, the prices are reasonable, and the distinctive flavors available are certainly worth sampling. A young child received a towering shaved ice treat, nearly six inches taller than the container it was served in, prompting my companion, a self-proclaimed ice cream aficionado, to remark that while the quality was satisfactory, it fell short of her beloved Baskin Robbins standard. Personally, I opted for the banana Caramel chocolate chip variety, which, although enjoyable, did not elicit excessive enthusiasm from me, as I am not particularly fond of ice cream."

Clearly the magic words here are Capastrami and Bobbie. Go in knowing those two words and I promise you you'll leave one happy sandwich-eating mofo. 

For me the Bobbie beats the Capastrami hands down. (The damn amazingness that is the pastrami from Brix in Sunset Beach has ruined all other pastrami for me.)  

The taste of Thanksgiving all smushed together on the tastiest, softest bread ever though, truly makes the Bobbie something to write home about... or at least will make you want to find your nearest Capriottis location and get there ASAP!

Awesome checkouts so they are In a bad neighbourhood who cares??? Take your High class behinds back to the high class ville this is the west side. Come in, friendly associates (see Stephanie) and leave easy, fast, clean and friendly..all I expect from a local Walmart

Self-serve frozen yogurt seems to be this new crave that is all over the valley. Some places do it extremely well, and others are just plain mediocre, and soemtimes bad.

Lots of unique flavors here, however, my fiancee was a little upset that there was no red velvet. I just discovered moshi, and it is quite possibly the most amazing thing ever. Moshi is kind of like marshmallows, but as someone who only eats kosher I try to avoid eating marshmallows from outside. Moshi is an excellent substitute, and it really goes well with ANY yogurt flavor.

The one thing I have to comment on is the strawberries here which were very, very ripe. Most other places seem to just throw any kind of strawberries into their yogurt line, but Yogurtology happened to have some really good calories.

Its a super clean store, and the decorations are definitely very unique. The only thing that keeps me from giving Yogurtology a 5-star is the price, at 45 cents an ounce its slightly more than the Yogurtland I'm used to near ASU campus.

This place is amazing on the weekend although it is busy. The weekday barely anyone is there but the service is kind of weak which you would think it wouldnt be since the employees have nothing else to do. The food is good but everytime we ask for our eggs for be fried or over easy they cone out really runny and sunny side up. Overall you are paying mostly for the environment and the freshness of some of the food. :) I enjoyed the place and I will return agian. :3

"Culinary excellence, panoramic vistas, and exceptional hospitality converge to create an unparalleled dining experience, where the prix fixe menu offers a delightful array of gastronomic delights, while the Ã  la carte options provide an equally satisfying alternative for a memorable evening out."

"The service my spouse and I received during our in-person visit was exceptional! Upon arrival, the staff promptly relieved us of our luggage, eliminating the need for manual handling. We were informed that our bags would be securely stored until check-in time, which was conveniently scheduled for either 2 or 3 pm. Additionally, we were advised that we could contact the front desk at check-in time to obtain our room number, thereby avoiding an unnecessary wait in line. However, despite these impressive efforts, we were disappointed to encounter a rude staff member when calling to obtain our room number. The individual in question curtly replied, 'the main tower,' without providing adequate directions, leading us to spend 45 minutes fruitlessly searching for our accommodations. Eventually, we discovered that we were actually situated in the grand tower. It is worth mentioning that the sheer magnitude of the hotel, combined with the occasional absence of visible signage, contributed to the confusion. Nonetheless, our suite was truly remarkable, thanks to the meticulous attention to detail displayed by the housekeeping staff. Their dedication to maintaining a spotless environment was genuinely impressive. My spouse and I are eagerly anticipating our upcoming stays at other MGM Hotels, specifically THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay next month and Bellagio in December. We look forward to comparing their quality of service to determine which establishment best suits our preferences."

"Desirous of indulging in a locally-based culinary establishment, I opted to sample the fare at this unpretentious venue, boasting an accommodating team. As a caveat, for those who are temperature-sensitive regarding their gastronomical intake, I must advise that the piquant flavors presented by the chef may prove formidable; however, for aficionados of spicy delights, the posole (a traditional Mexican soup) is an absolute must-try item, accompanied by the delectable homemade tortillas that diverge slightly from the customary preparation methods associated with this dish in my previous experiences within the realm of Chicago-style Mexican cuisine. Despite these minor deviations, my overall satisfaction with the meal was quite high, and I look forward to future visits."

All I have to say is... Grilled cheese and creamy tomato soup!!!! And excellent beer selection. I'm a fan of the Rogue Hazelnut (goes just right with the grilled cheese and soup).\n\nDimmed, relaxing lighting and awesome service!
Food is delicious. I had the Vegenini, it is like a vegetarian pizza. I loved it. The potato fries are also delicious. Customer service is always friendly.

Nice. Oh so very nice. Not as nice as the Aria or Vdara, but damn close. The only thing though about the Cosmopolitan is that it felt very cluttered and congested. It was hard to navigate through the casino and multiple floors of well, everything. We couldn't even find the sushi bar that we wanted to eat at and we couldn't locate any employees to ask for directions. \n\nStill a nice hotel though. I can't imagine what it would be like to stay here. One of the few hotels in Vegas that actually have a balcony and a minibar. Pretty sweet.

The food would be 3 stars but the service made it 4 stars.   Our cute waitress Tashja made the meal.  Super friendly and personable, but best of all she knew the menu and made great suggestions.  

The North Boulevard drink was Yummmm...pretty dangerous because you couldn't taste the alcohol but could tell more than one would get you pretty messed up.  Like happy lemonade.  Fried Pickles were great, super crunchy.  

I had the Ahi Tuna burger...yes, I went to a burger joint for tuna.  It was very good.  

Hubby had Turkey burger which he thought tasted a little weird.  Just eh.

Sandwiches are definitely not very big as others have said.

Bouchon Bistro, in the Venetian, is Thomas Keller's Las Vegas presence. Judging from the google results and "Bouchon Las Vegas dress code" being a popular suggested search, there's some confusion about this bistro. It's relatively casual, but chic. It's decorated like an old French bistro, and the menu reflects its casual but traditional nature.

His plate: Steak Frites - pan-seared prime flat iron served with maître d'hôtel butter and frites

Her plate: Sourdough Waffles - sourdough waffles with bananas, toasted walnuts, maple syrup, & Tahitian vanilla bean butter; cappuccino; mimosa

To share:  Beignets with chocolate and fruit dipping sauces; side of bacon

The bread for the table was beautiful and fresh, nice mini leaves of thoroughly authentic and crusty French bread. Our beignets came out hot and fresh, very dense and covered in cinnamon sugar. The dipping sauces were chocolate (that may have had a hint of hazelnut) and strawberry/raspberry.

D's steak was good, though he was disappointed that the fries weren't house-made or more special. My waffles were fantastic - and the combination of the vanilla bean butter and the walnuts were really delicious. The syrup was not really needed at all, but I did appreciate that it was served warm.

Last week, I opted to treat my significant other to a culinary excursion at this establishment in honor of his birthday, seeking to indulge in an intimate ambiance and delectable fare. Upon entering, we were greeted by an accommodating hostess who showed us to our table promptly. Our server, a friendly and attentive individual, presented us with menus and offered recommendations while ensuring that our dining experience was satisfactory throughout the evening by checking in on us regularly. In terms of the cuisine, I opted for the Spaghetti Bolognese, which, unfortunately, lacked a certain je ne sais quoi in terms of flavor. However, my companion's selection, the FRUTTI DI MARE, proved to be an unmitigated success, boasting an array of fresh seafood that was expertly prepared and presented. So much so, that I found myself pilfering succulent shrimp from his plate on multiple occasions, much to his amusement. Lastly, we shared a scrumptious gelato, augmented by a shot of espresso, which served as the perfect finale to our meal. All things considered, we thoroughly enjoyed the culinary offerings and exceptional service afforded to us during our visit.

Solid Vietnamese food in Las Vegas.
Found this place on Yelp before heading back home and decided to give it a try.  Their dishes are decent and price is right.  The service was very friendly as well.  It's a good place to get some authentic Vietnamese food.
Will come around again.

Pro:
1.  Solid food
2.  Great price
3.  Great service

Con:
Nothing outstanding to mention.

This is the best Arby's around! The wait is a little long sometimes, but the always get your order right and your food is always fresh. They often send coupons out in the mail and in the Centennial View, also they usually have other rotating deals in house. Nothing really to complain about there, they make sure the food on your tray if in your bag really is Good Mood Food! ;-)

Just a quick review of Macaroni Grill. 

I've been to this location several times and I've never been disappointed. The service is always pleasant and fast and the food is pretty darn good for a chain. 

I've tried some of their pasta dishes and had the grilled pork chops once and they were quite good. I ordered them on a whim and was pleasantly surprised with them. And they make a great Insalata Blu which is bibb lettuce, walnuts, red onions, grated bleu cheese all tossed in a balsamic vinaigrette. 

The bread they serve with the olive oil and cracked black pepper is always pleasing. And they have a great blackberry mint iced tea. Yum. 

The music they play is a great mix of Italian opera and the Italian crooners of the 50's such as Frank Sinatra. And hopefully there will be a birthday or two while you're there. They usually have a singer who does a great job of "Happy Birthday" in Italian. (What does this person do besides sing? Is that all they do? Anyone know?) 

Oh, and if you use the restroom they play lessons in Italian while you are....um...doing your business. Pretty cool.( I just hope that if I ever need to use Italian in an emergency I don't have to duck into a bathroom to remember it.) 

If you're in the mood for some good Italian food with good portions and friendly attentive service, Macaroni Grill can't be beat in my book.

This place was good and found this on the internet.  Anyways I wished I had the sushi, but I was sick so I went with the noodles which was good. It was nice and hot and filled my belly. I loved the salad as well.  I wished I had the other dishes, but it is okay though.  I would come back here again.

This establishment was exceptional during its tenure as Oasis and remains relatively impressive, securing a position among my preferred venues along the strip. Prior to its renovations, it was considered the most economical option, though its prices have since aligned with those of neighboring establishments. I am uncertain about the specific experience that led an individual to question its cleanliness. 

I appreciate the thoughtful design and emphasis on creating tranquil spaces, which sets it apart from Mirage and Canyon Ranch. The latter two prioritize gym facilities and fail to provide sufficient areas for patrons to unwind. The ambient lighting throughout the facility contributes to a sense of serenity, while the availability of water and refreshing cucumber eye treatments in multiple locations is truly remarkable. 

For individuals who, like myself, intend to spend several hours lounging within the spa, Nurture presents a viable option. However, I must note that the strip's overall attention to spa amenities remains inadequate, thereby precluding me from assigning it a perfect rating of five. To enhance their offerings, I suggest that management consider visiting Asian casinos, which boast superior spa facilities, and incorporate their features upon returning. 

It is worth mentioning that the spa is situated at a considerable distance from both the parking area and main entrance, necessitating a sizable allocation of time for appointments, particularly for guests not residing at the Luxor. Plan accordingly to ensure punctuality.

I love this place but always seem to forget about it. The rockin shrimp is an absolute must! The slider app actually makes a nice meal for the ladies. I love the salmon and my husband loves the chimichurri  skirt steak. Their happy hour is one of the best around!

We have had drinks and good here twice since our stay in Vegas and it didn't let us down either time. The first time we shared the chicken and steak nachos which was huge and delicious and we couldn't even finish the plate together!! The second time we had the tortilla chips and salsa and mild chicken wings, both so good and not over filling which is great when accompanied by beer. Not expensive and good size servings.\n\nBe sure to get the tickets from the girl out the front though for the buy one get one free drinks as it works out cheaper than happy hour. We had great service both time and very friendly staff.

Subway, an establishment renowned for providing copious amounts of nourishment at an affordable price point, specifically $5, boasts an impressive reputation for both cleanliness and expediency, particularly within affluent neighborhoods. However, it is advisable to exercise caution when visiting during peak hours, as the influx of patrons can result in prolonged wait times. While it is plausible that superior subs may exist, they are unlikely to match the value offered by Subway at this price range.

I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to this establishment, as the ambiance was pleasant, the servers were cordial, the embellishments were quaint, and the musical selection, although somewhat excessive in volume, was tasteful. Furthermore, the expedient delivery of crisps and salsa was greatly appreciated by myself, as well as others who share my predilection for prompt service. The venue offered both indoor and outdoor seating areas, with the option of two separate patios.  
The potato chips were cooked to perfection, neither overcooked nor too thick, and the homemade salsa boasted a subtle smoky essence without an overpowering degree of piquancy, thus catering to the preferences of those who are sensitive to spicy flavors. In addition, I sampled a refreshing cucumber mint agua fresca, characterized by its light and revitalizing quality. Moreover, I opted for the nachos, augmented with a modest portion of corn. The server's description of the dish as "a meal" proved accurate, as I felt thoroughly satiated and had ample leftovers.  
My intentions to revisit this eatery are fueled by a desire to experience their diverse agua fresca flavors and vegetarian tacos.

This days inn is very nice.  Google mislead us and it was a little farther than we thought it was from the highway, but we found it eventually.  Note that the advertised parking amenities are for you to pay $12 per night to park in a sketchy lot across the street - not cool.  But the rooms are very nice and clean, and the staff were very friendly even though we did not speak french.
Cheap prices and a great place to get fresh veggies. Place does get busy on the 1st and 2nd of the month given how cheap the place is so try to avoid those two days.

Good but expensive.  But I guess all hotel cafes/restaurants are expensive.  Can get crowded and with long lines.\n\nOpens at 6am, which was perfect for LV because we didn't get back from the late night club til 545 am, so before heading back up to our room, we waited 15 minutes for the cafe to open and had breakfast!  ONLY IN VEGAS! LOL

"For a culinary establishment situated within an airport, the quality of the fare served is, in fact, superior to the norm, thereby warranting a rating of four stars; however, it must be noted that the gastronomical experience offered by this particular eatery would, in all likelihood, be relegated to a rating of three stars were it not for the unique circumstance of its location within an airport, and thus, the assessment of its overall merit must be considered in relation to the specific context in which it operates."

Well, i like the idea of Motel One. Always in the center of the city, somehow modern design, good beds. No fancy unnecessary stuff. All of this is true for this motel one in Edinburgh. Perfectly located even if it's hard to discover. 
Breakfast is ok, but not more. 
Service is friendly. 
No twin rooms available..

"I recently had the pleasure of visiting Panini Cafe for the first time, and I must say, it was a truly delightful experience. As a kosher and vegetarian-friendly establishment, they offered a diverse array of culinary delights that catered to my specific dietary preferences. The menu boasted an impressive selection of pescatarian options, featuring fish such as salmon, tuna, tilapia, and several others. My companion and I began our meal with a delectable appetizer of hummus, accompanied by warm, fresh pita bread and a medley of sauteed onions, pine nuts, and olive oil. The flavors were sublime, and we devoured every last bite. For my main course, I opted for the Ravioli Athens, a heavenly creation tossed with garlic and basil and topped with feta cheese and kalamata olives. Although the price tag of $16.99 was slightly higher than I had anticipated, the dish's enticing description proved too tempting to resist. I am thrilled to report that my expectations were not only met but exceeded, as the flavors were nothing short of extraordinary. Moreover, I was grateful for the kosher certification, which afforded me the opportunity to indulge in the dish without any concerns. In addition, I exercised portion control and saved half of the ravioli for a subsequent meal, savoring the leftovers just as much as the initial serving. My companion's roasted Creamy Eggplant, accompanied by a house salad, also received high praise. The service we received was top-notch, leaving us feeling satisfied and well taken care of. Without a doubt, I look forward to revisiting Panini Cafe and exploring more of their mouthwatering offerings."

"An exceptional destination, this locale boasts an impressive culinary establishment and multiple drinking establishments of considerable quality!! My olfactory senses are pleasantly satiated by the pervasive presence of a fragrance reminiscent of coconut and suntan lotion, which permeates the atmosphere in a manner that obviates the need for noxious cigarette fumes; the personnel affiliated with this enterprise exhibit a commendable level of cordiality and usefulness."

At here last night after a rough day.  It helped.  Ordered the duck breast and duck/pork meatballs and loved it.  The chocolate souffl\u00e9 was good as well.  The staff were friendly and service was great.

I had only been to the poolside before, but went to the club for the first time! The bouncers were actually friendly, making sure there was enough space to walk around. The sound system here is amazing! Fun to see some great DJs! \n\nTwo floors to the nightclub - the one upstairs is a lot larger!

Five guys is a great alternative to fast food burgers without getting mixed up in the world of \"gourmet\" burgers. Their burgers are very tasty and are available with a huge list of free toppings unlike most places at this level. Get some free peanuts while you're waiting for your order? Yes please. Although I enjoy the burgers, I think the fires are worth equal mention. They come in regular and cajun variety and I've never seen anyone who actually needed to order a large. The regular is plenty, even to share. The menu is pretty basic but they do have a hot dog and a grilled cheese option for those who aren't into burgers. I will say that for me it is kind of a toss up between Five Guys and In N Out, but I seem to find myself here more often.

This establishment represents an economical dining option, which we frequent due to their delectable cuisine and generously portioned margaritas, with the exception of the diminutive size. The culinary offerings are quite satisfactory, particularly the La Mejor, which I highly recommend. My spouse consistently orders the Pollo con Crema, and we customarily request takeout containers to enjoy the remaining fare the following day. Although the service can be somewhat unpredictable, the staff generally exhibits attentiveness and expedites the delivery of food in a timely manner. Unfortunately, the dining area appears somewhat dilapidated and could benefit from aesthetic renovations, as the booths and tables evidence signs of wear and tear.

After culminating my workday, I decided to halt at this establishment in pursuit of a potent margarita and a delectable hors d'oeuvre. The ambiance evoked a sense of familiarity, reminiscent of the erstwhile Super-Mex that had previously occupied the space. Upon partaking in the beverages and savory delights, I found them to be of considerable quality, and the bartender exhibited a congenial demeanor.

Arrived at around 10 am on a Friday with my best friend. We didn't schedule an appointment and were luckily enough able to be sit right down for a pedicures. 

I would suggest making an appointment because after being there 10-15 minutes it became packed. 

We were asked which pedicures we preferred and I believe it was called the Luxury one ($45 one) It was amazing! I have had a lot of pedicures but have to say nothing like this one. 

The Luxury spa was the royal treatment that is for sure. From a mask type cream for your legs, salt scrub, sugar scrub, hot wax for your feet (never had I had that done before) and just all around special treatment. 

My best friend was helped by Henry and I was helped by an elderly woman. They were both very nice and friendly and for the most part understood us and spoke relatively good English. 

I was highly impressed at least by receiving a pedicure so we have agreed this will be our monthly spot for our girls day pedicures.

Wow, what a cool place! I went for the first time last night and had the farmer sandwich, it was fabulous. Service was great. Love the atmosphere and vibe here. The patio is especially nice when the weather is right. The menu is just salads, sandwiches and pizzas but if that's what you're looking for, give it a try.  I highly recommend Liberty Market.

"Upon entering the establishment with the intention of procuring beverages for the impending journey back to Los Angeles, my expectations were surpassed by the quality of the drinks served. It is my belief that this particular venue boasts one of the superior tasting boba places I have had the pleasure of experiencing during my time in Las Vegas. The proprietors have adopted an innovative approach to the presentation of their beverages, utilizing uniquely shaped containers that unfortunately do not conform to standard cup holders, much like those found at Half & Half back in my place of residence. The tea exhibited a satisfying flavor profile, while the boba, though somewhat lacking in sweetness relative to my preferences, maintained a pleasing texture. The ambiance of the establishment and the demeanor of its staff contributed positively to the overall experience, rendering it a suitable option for those seeking a refreshing beverage in the Las Vegas area."

My parent's love this place and now, so do I.  It is New York Style pizza (thinner crust and longer slices) very much like we got back home in NY.  Dont let their prices deceive you as it is pretty good!

During my recent weekend sojourn at this esteemed lodging establishment, I had the pleasure of indulging in a series of hedonistic escapades that left me feeling both exhilarated and financially drained. My adventures began with a solitary excursion to the city of Las Vegas, where I managed to inexplicably find myself on the famed Strip, outside the illustrious Wynn resort, following an evening of unbridled revelry. Upon my return to the hotel, my companion and I established a daily ritual consisting of ordering luncheon via room service at 3 p.m. (our wake-up time), followed by successive glasses of champagne, and culminating in the depletion of the minibar's contents, only to have it restocked and subsequently plundered once more. Our nocturnal exploits commenced around 10 p.m., as we ventured forth to partake in the opulent ambiance of XS, and concluded at 4 a.m., when we transitioned to engaging in vigorous gaming activities. Unfortunately, our financial euphoria was short-lived, as the staggering sum of $700 for our hotel room fee, combined with an additional $800 for room service, abruptly reduced us from carefree, globe-trotting celebrities to anxious, penny-pinching adolescents who had inadvertently appropriated the family automobile. In light of our experiences, I would recommend that any individuals opting to pursue a similar course of action should consider indulging in the mouthwatering burger sliders (crafted from the finest ground beef) accompanied by perfectly cooked onion strings. Additionally, each bottle of champagne we sampled was truly delectable, and prudent travelers may discover that the champagne and sparkling wine offerings are indistinguishable, thereby providing an opportunity for fiscal savings. Furthermore, the hotel offers a "happy hour" for room service, featuring Corona beverages at a reasonable $5 apiece, alongside select culinary delights available for a mere $10 per plate, which, in comparison to the standard prices, is indeed a palatable option.
Great service, but almost always packed! Definitely should make appointment if you're not willing to wait 20 minutes. Also a little on the expensive side for gel manicure.

"As an ardent devotee of the Cracker Barrel franchise, I was eager to partake in a culinary experience at this particular establishment, and my expectations were not disappointed. The ambiance of the restaurant was quaint and endearing, reminiscent of the rustic charm that has become synonymous with the Cracker Barrel brand. Furthermore, the fare served was expertly prepared and presented, showcasing the hallmark of quality that distinguishes homestyle cooking. Additionally, the staff exhibited a warm and welcoming demeanor, contributing to an atmosphere that was both convivial and comfortable. Lastly, the prices for the meals were eminently reasonable, making it an accessible dining option for those seeking a satisfying repast without breaking the bank."

"The gastronomical offerings at this establishment surpass the quality of the beverages, specifically the coffee. The culinary creations, including sandwiches and salads, are meticulously prepared and presented. The welcoming atmosphere fosters an environment where patrons can freely express themselves, engaging in conversation, enjoying a meal, or utilizing the Wi-Fi for web browsing or literary pursuits, all while basking in the natural light that streams through the expansive windows. The site's accessibility is also notable, with ample parking options adjacent to the venue. However, my sole grievance lies in the fact that the coffee, albeit a fundamental component of any reputable coffeehouse, falls short of expectations. Notwithstanding this anomaly, I choose to overlook it due to the numerous attributes that render this locale an appealing destination."

flew into and out of McCarran last week. no hassles or problems whatsoever.

shuttle service to our hotel was handled quickly (TI doesn't have its own, but there are small buses that will do it for a small fee).

well, aside a slight security issue when a corkscrew/bottle-opener/knife inexplicably turned up in my friend's luggage, but that's a story for another time. we're still trying to piece together the previous night...

"I habitually opt for the convenience of the drive-thru, and my experience has led me to anticipate a brief waiting period of approximately 5-10 minutes prior to receiving my burger combo and proceeding on my way. The culinary offerings have consistently met my expectations and justified the temporary delay."

"My companion and I indulged in a visit to this establishment's hookah lounge during their happy hour, and we were thoroughly impressed with the pricing strategy employed. The cost of both beverages and culinary offerings was precisely 50% of the standard price, which we deemed to be eminently reasonable. Specifically, we would recommend the Pear-sian Drop martini, priced at an affordable $4, as well as the Pesto Pita Pizza, available for $3.50, and the Athens Fries, offered at a slightly higher price point of $4. Upon entering the premises, we were warmly received by the staff, who presented us with an array of hookah flavors for our perusal. We appreciated the straightforward and ingenious nature of this approach, particularly given the unpredictability of flavor options at similar establishments. For a mere $7.50, one could partake in the enjoyment of a hookah; however, we elected to indulge in the superior 'frozen' hookah experience, featuring a gel reminiscent of those utilized in beer-cooling devices, for a modest additional fee of $10. The ambiance of the lounge was characterized by an opulent and exotic essence, further enhanced by the selection of classic rock melodies that filled the air. Unfortunately, our hookah-smoking experience was marred by the fact that the coal refills were not provided during happy hour, which we felt was a significant oversight. Despite this shortcoming, we found the taste and quality of the hookah smoke to be satisfactory. However, we would suggest that Paymon reassess his coal service policies to ensure a more complete and satisfying experience for patrons."

I had the privilege of experiencing Eagle Mountain Golf Club for the first time last week, and I must say that I was thoroughly impressed. In fact, it has quickly become one of my favorite golf courses in Arizona, and for good reason. Firstly, the course is meticulously maintained, with lush fairways and greens that are both challenging and rewarding. The design of the course is also noteworthy, offering a diverse range of distances from the various tees, allowing for a enjoyable and inclusive experience for golfers of varying skill levels. Furthermore, the rolling hills and changes in elevation throughout the course create a unique and engaging experience for players. Additionally, the greens are cleverly designed, featuring subtle slopes and undulations that require careful consideration and precision when putting. The breathtaking views of Phoenix from the course only add to its charm. Lastly, the affordability of the course is an added bonus, with reasonably priced drinks such as $2 16oz PBRs available on the day we played. Needless to say, I'm eagerly looking forward to my next visit. Return factor - 95%.
This location had great accessories and I did get a few great blazers. The staff just wasn't the friendliest. However they weren't rude. Just kinda blah lol

Never been to Philadelphia nor have I ever been to a whole lot of places that sells cheesesteak sandwiches. But this place reminds me of a place in Tucson called Frankies South Philadelphia Cheesesteak.  

From my understanding this place used to be located on 5th Ave which they've relocated to Craftsman Ct in Old Town Scottsdale. The new location has three times the space than the original one. Still open 24 hours a day, it's probably the only place you can get a Philly cheesesteak at 3 am.

The GF had bought a Groupon to this place awhile back and finally decided to take me here (feel so lucky). I ordered a regular 9 inch Cheese-steak with whiz cheese and a side of fresh cut fries (oh if you check in here, you'll get a free basket of fries with your order). Within 5 minutes or so our order arrived - and just as fast as the food came out it was gone!  The bread was nice and soft and the steak was full of favor! 

This place is awesome! The only thing that bugged me was trying to find a parking space. Holly hell I think we were driving around for hours! Ok Ok maybe not hours but it sure seems like it (hungry status). 

Love this place and will hopefully be back soon. 
KCYE

Not only are the drinks delicious, but the service is out of the world! They are extremely friendly and love to chat. As for the drinks, they don't have as large of a menu as Starbucks, but they a lot more fun flavors for people who don't just want coffee. Also, a lot of them taste better than those at Starbucks.

I had the buta-burger as it was all the flavors that i love...the burger was surprising good! i didnt expect it to be as bomb as it was....i was like 2nd in line and they were crazy fast too, which is always appreciated...my only gripe is that its kinda expensive..other than that, awesome!

Thankfully this place re-opened.  What's there to say...you can get a nice NY style pizza hot and fresh here for far less than the poor excuse for a pizza parlor across the street.  When I say hot, I mean HOT...holy mackerel does that pie come out smoking hot.  Good quality and good service to be found here into the late evening.  Great spot to grab a quick slice when on E. Fremont.  Uncle Joe's a cool guy too...just don't get on his bad side or he'll toss you out on the street like yesterday's trash as was witnessed when two assholes decided to go toe to toe in the restaurant.  Good times!

I moved to Bloomfield in April and being Italian and loving Italian food I thought that Little Italy would be a good fit, I was wrong... Until tonight.  I have found that every Italian restaurant I've tried has left much to be desired; from Del's atrocious food to the over hyped Pleasure Bar, I had not found an Italian joint I liked.

Lombardozzi, I have not clue why I had not tried you until tonight.  I had tried their meatballs during Little Italy Days and really enjoyed them, but always forgot to head down the block to try a whole meal.

We started with calamari and it was fried t to perfection, and no rubbery feel, which is a positive, because 99% of places outside the east coast can't to calamari to save their lives.

I had the gnocchi with red sauce (only sauce option which kind of irks me, because gnocchi is great with a pesto) with meatballs.  The gnocchi is homemade and to die for, and the sauce is pretty good too (I'm a sauce snob, nobody beats my mothers or grandmothers) and the meatballs were as good as I remembered.

Great food experience, but the service was at best bad.  The waitress took over five minutes to get our drink order, and just kind of seemed annoyed at the whole working thing.

I will be back, because there is no Italian food in Bloomfield that even comes close to Lombardozzi.
Fresh shrimp, crab legs to enjoy. Prime Ribs & Leg of lamb on carving table. Many different other dishes. A lot of desserts, including crepes made to order. Weekday price is more worth it.

Great steak sandwich and the fries have a great taste without any sauce. My wife had Mamas burger, the bun and mushrooms were great tasting, but the meat lacks flavor. We will give this place another try.

If you desire to indulge in a seated culinary experience, be prepared to partake in a queuing process external to the edifice, and potentially share a table with unfamiliar individuals. In alternative settings, such circumstances might elicit annoyance or surprise; however, on this particular day, my enthusiasm rendered me receptive to these idiosyncrasies, which ultimately enhanced the ambiance and charm of the establishment.  

The smoked turkey sandwich boasted succulent tenderness, augmented by the tangy application of mustard upon a crustaceous bun, thereby transcending mere sustenance and ascending to a celestial realm of gastronomical delight. Fries exhibited a satisfying crunchiness on their exterior, while maintaining a fluffy texture within, achieving an exemplary balance of contrasting sensations. Furthermore, the colossal dill pickle rivaled its smaller counterparts in both flavor and quality, while the scantily dressed cole slaw proved refreshing and delectable, constituting a notable highlight among its peers.  

Our server, a paragon of excellence, demonstrated remarkable proficiency, effusive friendliness, and rapid efficiency, effortlessly accommodating a high volume of patrons with aplomb. Such exceptional service, combined with the affordability, expediency, and captivating atmosphere, solidified my conviction that this dining establishment merits a visit, boasting the most favorable evaluations and loftiest ratings.

I thought this place was awesome! I had the buffalo cheesesteak sandwihch with a side of jicama fries (not cooked...raw) which was a very welcome and wholesome change for the norm. 

The atmosphere is modern. Seating is pretty ample and comfortable for all sizes. Most of the patrons have on workout clothing as the LV Athletic Club is in the same shopping center. Parking seems a little cramped but there's always a good amount of parking spaces available. 

They also have cafe seating with very nice furniture. I was impressed and will definitely be returning.

If it wasn't for Lotus of Siam - they would have 5 stars.

For appetizers - must have is the beef thai jerky and of course their tom kha soup.

Entrees - Prik King and Panang are incredible.  As I get older I can't handle spice as much as I used to so I always order mild and get the spices on the side.  You have to ask for the spices as they don't always give it to you but it's worth the asking as this way I can add a little more as I go for an extra kick.

"Whenever I enter this establishment, I experience a profound sense of nostalgia, reminiscent of the classic cinematic productions of yesteryear, replete with monochromatic hues and elegantly attired protagonists. My sartorial choices, including a vibrant red lipstick and an ensemble evocative of a bygone era, serve to enhance this sentiment. Furthermore, I find myself compelled to execute a rhythmic finger-clicking gesture as I descend the stairs, further reinforcing the ambiance of a scene straight out of a film noir. The musical offerings at this venue are somewhat variable in quality, depending on whether the house band is performing or not. On the one hand, the resident pianist possesses considerable skill and can deliver an impressive musical experience. However, when guest performers take the stage, the results can be somewhat unpredictable, ranging from exceptional displays of artistry to lackluster performances that fall short of expectations. Despite these inconsistencies, I remain an ardent admirer of this establishment."

Located directly opposite H&M, proceed towards Caesar's Palace and then turn left at the fork in the path. Ordered waffle fries that had been generously dusted with a combination of rich cocoa powder and fiery chili powder, accompanied by a steaming hot chocolate chai beverage to consume on the move. Observed meticulously as the skilled barista adhered to a seemingly well-established recipe, carefully crafting my beverage step by step from behind one of the cabinet doors. Briefly sampled a few fries prior to venturing back into the shopping center, ensuring they remained crispy and untouched by the moisture within the takeout container. For a moderate price point of $7, approximately ten to twelve ample-sized waffle fries were provided. Unfortunately, the promised cocoa flavor was barely discernible, with merely a subtle hint of chili present. Despite not being an ardent enthusiast of piquant cuisine, these particular fries were found lacking in both flavor and texture. In contrast, the beverage proved satisfying, offering a robust chai essence and served at an ideal temperature, yet lacking the desired level of frothiness.

Had to kill some time waiting for a place to open.  Stopped in at apache and got a enchilada plate, red, cheese, actually white cheese that was melted.  I was shocked to be honest.  The sauce did seem to be tomato based which I'm not a huge fan of but it tasted pretty good.  Also at 6 bucks for that plate cheaper than most.

Really great deal.  Coffee was a little weak but dad's 3.95 two eggs with hash browns was such a great deal.  My Korean omelette (kalbi, onion and cheese) was flavorful but will probably not try that combo again.  Fun, chatty owner and chef.  Brightly colored walls and decor.  Good morning start.

Jersey Mike's, being an eatery unfamiliar to my geographic location, warrants a visit whenever I find myself in close proximity to Phoenix, as it boasts an exceptional level of quality that cannot be replicated by similar establishments such as Subway or Quiznos, thus making it a coveted destination for my culinary pursuits.

Food was worth the money- larger sizes. Menu is wayyyy to large and could be downsized or split in an AM PM vs having 10 pages of food chooses. The interior was well thought out w wide range of art. We had 4 different burgers all were great. Love the different French fry options
Friendly, accommodating, and the pizza and wings are always good.  It is one of my go to places for a casual dinner out.

Friend said he seen Guy from the food network do a show here, so we decided to come and check it out. Got here at 6:30am on the dot and ordered the Enchiladas,  the plate was very good and had good taste to it. \n\nWas expecting a bit more but wasnt bad.

I miss this place.  I used to work right across the street from McAlp's and would go there at least twice a week.  The atmosphere is great, food is good, and deserts are tasty.  Its nice to see that some places in the Phoenix area don't feel the need to constantly renovate and are not afraid to keep their days gone by look, feel and approach to business.  Writing this is making me hungry for their food again.  I need to find an appointment to schedule downtown so I can lunch there next week.

Was in Scottsdale for Spring Training and looking to get a great steak.  Everyone I asked kept telling me to go to Mastro's Ocean Club.  now I know why.  From the minute you walk in, you are surrounded by excitement.  The bar area was packed, but not so bad that you could not get a drink.   The meals were fantastic and the steak was prob one of the 3 best I have ever enjoyed.  Highly recommend inf you are in Scottsdale.   Not cheap, but worth it.

"Initially, the wine catalogue appears utterly preposterous, yet it's an integral component of their distinctive modus operandi. I'm referring to the absurdity of the wine list, which surpasses the dimensions of a telephone directory in magnitude, and its organization, which prioritizes price over varietal and regional categorization. This extensive list caters to the needs of two establishments, Cowboy Ciao and Kazimierz, the former of which boasts an impressive track record, primarily attributed to its prime location, captivating ambiance, and delectable culinary offerings. In the company of my companion and father, along with his recent spouse, I opted for a particularly esteemed wine from K Vintners, priced at $200, which yielded a memorable experience that lingers in my mind, augmented by my proficiency in wine recognition."

I was driving home from Tempe tonight when I saw this place so I decided to stop in and get a bite to eat. The first thing I noticed was that the place was super clean, friendly staff, but most of all, awesome food. I had a ribeye steak sandwich, which by the way was only 7 dollars and some change, fries, and onion rings. I can find a good steak sandwich almost anywhere in the valley, but this one was one if the best I've had. I was a huge fan if onion rings, but these changed my mind. \nAnyway, I give these guys 4 stars, can't give 5 yet until I have a chance to try the burger.

Wow, this place is awesome!  I'd heard about it a couple of months ago and my wife and I finally went last Saturday.  And then the next day.  That's how much we loved it.  It's a quaint, cozy place to get some coffee and relax.  Their cinnamon roll was great, especially the frosting!  The waffle sandwich with the Bechamel might be one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've had.  The second day we went we took my wife's cousin Johnny and he loved the sandwich as well.  We are making a resolution to go to Bread and Butter every Saturday, or at least every other.  I definitely recommend it for a nice breakfast and I'm excited to try the lunch sandwiches.

"Everything was remarkable at this esteemed dining establishment, with the notable exception of the primary protein component of my entree, which unfortunately did not meet my expectations in terms of doneness. Specifically, the 10 oz filet mignon that I had ordered, prepared medium rare with an accompaniment of truffle butter, was regrettably overcooked to a degree that could be described as falling between medium and medium well. As this venue purports to specialize in the culinary preparation of steaks, I felt compelled to deduct points from my overall assessment due to the unfortunate discrepancy in cooking time. 

Notwithstanding the aforementioned issue, I must admit that the garden salad and the assortment of vegetables that we shared, including broccolini, spiced maple carrots, and a delectable lobster mac and cheese, were indeed quite delicious. 

Furthermore, the quality of service provided by the staff was commendable, and the ambiance and musical accompaniment contributed significantly to the overall pleasantness of the dining experience. However, I cannot help but express my disappointment regarding the fact that, despite the premium price point associated with their steak offerings, the kitchen was unable to execute my specific request for doneness. It is my sincere hope that future patrons will not encounter similar difficulties in this regard."

Went here on Labor Day weekend,  Saturday night. It wasn't too crowded.  We got a nice spot in the back on some nice couches. The waiter was very friendly and informative.  We tried some wine and dessert.  It's a little pricey, but we will be back.  Overall a really good experience.

Went in and tried the pork rib and fatty brisket and it was pretty good. I generally don't care for pork ribs but it literally fell off the bone and was very moist and juicy. The brisket has just enough fat and was very flavorful. 

They had 3 different kinds of bbq sauces sweet, smokey and a white thunder. The sweet is a typical bbq sauce, smokey was my favorite and white thunder was pretty much just heat. 

Prices are pretty much standard to other bbq places starting around $8. Since this is closer to my job I'd definitely go back.

Very urban chic! Their chai tea latte is one of the best I've had in Vegas. Their breakfast items are over-priced, especially since their bagels are supermaket Sara Lee brand; however, they have a honey-butter they serve with them that absolutely makes up for it.

Between 4 and 5 stars, this culinary establishment boasts an impressive array of delectable dishes that cater to diverse tastes, with a particular emphasis on fiery sensations that will tantalize one's palate. The ambiance is intimate and cozy, with a welcoming atmosphere that fosters a sense of comfort and relaxation, further enhanced by the hospitable proprietor who personally ensures a satisfying experience for patrons, offering expert guidance for those unfamiliar with Thai cuisine. Enjoy a glass of wine at a discounted price every Thursday, complementing the assortment of flavorsome appetizers that are ideal for sharing, while basking in the warm and inviting ambiance that creates an idyllic setting for a romantic evening out or a convivial gathering with friends. Despite its unassuming location within a strip mall, this eatery exudes an air of sophistication and refinement that belies its unpretentious exterior, making it an excellent choice for a special occasion or a casual meeting.

It smells nice.

It's inexpensive.

It makes a sly dig at the recipient's personal hygiene.

And this is yet another place where you can pick up gifts for any menopausal women who make it onto your Xmas gift-buying list.

I think this is one of the best brunch buffets in town.  They have the make your own omelet station and great eggs and a fantastic dessert selection.  Also, the champagne for the mimosas was good too.  This place was so good, my petite little roommate ate here for 3 hours.  (Suffice it to say, she was in a food coma for a good part of the day.)  That's some good eating...

We perused the midday repast menu, and our gastronomical expectations were thoroughly satiated by the delectable offerings presented thereupon. It is with utmost certainty that we shall revisit this culinary establishment on our subsequent visit to Las Vegas.

great selection! 

got here just before 3 on a monday. there were only 4ppl before us but for some reason it took about 10 minutes to be seated. do not try pushing your luck after that! the line grows terribly fast the closer you get to dinner and the smart diners arent going to leave in time for you to be seated, they want to see the dinner selection too! 

i was a little disappointed with a few things: eggs benedict was IMPOSSIBLE to cut with the knife i was given and when i tried to bite thru it, it was rubbery...i LOVE meat but there was only 2 choices of meat at the carving station (top sirloin and a flank steak?)...the desserts were super cute but some were a bit off and none of them made me want to get seconds. oh and i NEEDED to ask for milk because some desserts were too creamy or too sugary (which is weird because ive NEVER in my life have thought something is too sugary)...finally i think we left about 30 minutes after "dinner" started but didnt see a difference in what was being served. dishes were refilled but that was about it. 

yes the food was good, but i guess i came here expecting to try dishes that i dont see all the time and that taste phenomenal. minus a star for not serving anything that i wanted second helpings of.

Great atmosphere & wonderful service. My only complaint was when ordering a cocktail I expect there to be a little kick. I had 2 drinks & got not even a buzz. The popcorn is good, albacore tuna was phenomenal, prime rib was fun with the presentation. Overall a fun place that I would love to take out of town guests & visit again to try more of the plates.
Enjoying an amazing birthday dinner with family and friends... With a sushi feast to make the gods green with jealousy!

They do take out and delivery! The pizza is tastier than most delivery places. The 10\" is a good size for an individual pizza. The staff was a lot of fun to chat with and answered any questions we had. We will definitely be getting food from them again.

EM Cafe, a culinary haven, launched two years prior and garnered immense popularity, principally owing to its unpretentious and airy ambiance. Boasting towering ceilings, pristine white walls that serve as an artistic canvas for local talents, and a spacious table in the center, ideal for communal feasting or sizable gatherings, the eatery exudes an inviting charm. While the fare may be deemed unremarkable, it has recently experienced a slight decline in quality, specifically regarding the potatoes, which have elicited criticism. Nonetheless, the likes of sandwiches, omelets, and French toast continue to impress, with generous portions that, though not excessively vast, satisfy the appetite. This cozy establishment has become a mainstay in the Mile End neighborhood, defying the notorious reputation of Parc Avenue, where many businesses struggle to survive beyond the initial six months.
I'm on the fence on whether I like Aria or Cosmo better, but I know for sure that I like playing poker in Aria, so it is all the more convenient to stay there.

Great food!  Had the carne asada plato special which was really tasty! Friend had Killer Burrito off menu which he loved. Service was so so. The man at the register was fantastic. Drinks not refilled and no one came back to check on us. All forgivable.  We'll be back for sure.

I went to this coffee shop simply bc its name caught my eyes. It's located in the Noda area (which parking can be such a chaos), but it has its own private parking lot  that's a huge plus. Also free wifi too!!!!

The shop has a very cozy fell to it, and has about 10 small tables inside and outside. It also has its own roasting machine, I guess that's a big plus for HUGE coffee fan. Personally I like my coffee sweet and strong like cuban coffee. However, I made the mistake of ordering a Hazelnut cold brew. I mean don't get me wrong I still like it, but I prefer some sugar to it.

I came here to do a little research, since we haven't install internet at our place yet. After sitting there 3 hours, I decided to order a Chai iced latte and lemon poppy muffin. The latte is pretty good, but didn't stand out to me as a MUST have in my drink list.

I will definitely go back for the extremely friendly staff, and to try the cuban coffee in a colder weather.

I really enjoyed myself. Though I hadn't heard any good feedback from many of my friends. She looked better (presentable) than I expected.  The bottle service really made for a great experience. 1 bottle of ciroc for 4 girls. We drank it all and had a blast.  The cushioned bench style seat was comfortable. The view from bottle service section is excellent. It's fun to have some drinks, get up off your seat and dance with your friends.  The stage props and dancers really help this show.  I would watch it again.

Very loud and boisterous and bustling, and thankfully we had a reservation, but spent a great evening here!  The service was fantastic, the food and drinks came out in a timely manner, and there doesn't really seem to be a bad seat in the house.  I went simple and had the cheeseburger and I'm still dreaming about the next time I can go back and have another, it was fantastic.  And then I doubled down and had the brownie and thought I'd died and gone to heaven.  And the wine list was pretty big with some interesting options.  I would go back in a second, just really decent American cuisine well-prepared and served with style.

"This culinary establishment offers an exceptional dining experience at an affordable price point, featuring delectable Persian and Middle Eastern cuisine in a casual, fast-food setting. For a mere $8-$9, patrons can indulge in a satisfying meal accompanied by a beverage of their choice. The fare is prepared fresh daily, bursting with flavor and presented in generous portions. The Kubideh combo, comprising two skewers of one's choice between ground chicken or ground lamb, is a particularly popular option among regulars, providing ample sustenance for a remarkably reasonable tariff."

A rather unobtrusive coffee establishment situated directly beneath the esteemed Elizabeth Arden's Red Door Spa, offering a limited selection of baked goods, yet I opted for a refreshing iced coffee beverage priced at three dollars. Although the consistency proved somewhat diluted to my liking, its revitalizing properties were most welcome during a sweltering afternoon. Lamentably, no sugar water was apparent to enhance its flavor profile, a factor that might have elevated the overall experience.

"Culinary offerings are satisfactory, yet the hospitality experience is truly impressive. I frequent this establishment primarily to observe televised sports events and indulge in adult beverages. The numerous televisions positioned throughout the venue, coupled with the expansive outdoor screen, create an exceptional viewing environment that enhances the overall entertainment value."

Saturday morning and still on the road for another week. It's laundry time. Easy access and Very clean. The nice attendant told me that they also do fluff  and fold for $1.50 a pound. Plenty of machines, wifi, change machine, soap products, TV's, A/C, ceiling fans, carts, folding tables, seating etc. Oh, and if you're a trucker, this place is on the corner and plenty of bobtail parking on the street. I'll be back!

Love, love,  love the Cajun barbecue shrimp! Be sure to order extra bread so you can soak up all of the yumminess! Great service, great drinks, especially if you are here before all the crowds. And yes, you must like country music...it IS a country bar with awesome music and some amazing live bands wed-sun. Did I mention the amazing shrimp! :)

"Although I did not opt to lodge at this establishment during my recent visit, I did partake in the gaming facilities available on the premises. I must say that I had an enjoyable experience, culminating in a financial gain of a couple hundred dollars, which left me feeling content and satisfied. However, I must admit that the procurement of beverages did prove to be somewhat protracted, but I refrained from harboring any animosity towards the staff due to the delay. Furthermore, I have it on good authority that the roller coaster located within the confines of this hotel is truly remarkable, and although I did not have the opportunity to indulge in its thrills during my most recent visit, I have fond memories of my previous experiences with it. In fact, I am eagerly looking forward to my next visit, during which I intend to sample the accommodations offered by this esteemed hostelry."

Great concept! I loved the individual portions just for the novelty of it. It might be useful to go with a buddy and pick out things to share.

Highlights included the pesto mashed potatoes, prime rib, fried chicken, mushroom risotto, and truffled scalloped potatoes.

Lowlights: ramen (too salty), sushi (I didn't try any, but apparently it was the worst sushi ever), and some of the desserts were disappointing (rock hard red velvet cookies).

Cool idea with the mac and cheese bar, but one bowl can be shared with the table, as it's very rich and creamy, and the portions are pretty big. And you wanna save room for those king crab legs, right?

Maybe this place doesn't have the variety like other buffets, but they offer items that are different or use different ingredients, which makes it more interesting.

Overall really good barbecue.  I LOVE their chipotle cheese stuffed sausage!  The cheese is just amazing.  I had it on their burger once and it was good, as well.  The hushpuppies are really good here, too.  The centers of them are moist, which reminds me sort of a conch fritter.  Pulled pork, mac and cheese, and baked beans are real good.  Good variety of sauces...I prefer their signature sauce, which is a cross between a vinegar and tomato based sauce in my opinion.\n\nI had their brisket once and it was not my favorite.  I tried the ribs once and they had a lot of fat and were tough.  I hope those instances were just a fluke b/c everything else has been great.  I love to support local businesses and the workers always are nice and accommodating.  Great place!

My husband and I tried Presto for the first time today and we really liked it! We had the ahi tuna sliders (delicious) and the Greek pide (also very good). I had never had pide before and really enjoyed the non-greasiness of the crust. I like pizza but I always end up using a million napkins to soak up the excess grease so the pide was such a great alternative for me. The service was good (I read a lot of complaints so I was a little worried it would take forever). My only complaint was that they pre-make all the salads and keep them in a cooler.  I initially wanted to order the ahi salad but I came to pick up the food around 3pm and I just didn't think the salad would be as crisp since it was sitting all day as if they made it fresh to order. I didn't try it though so I can't judge. All in all it was a nice lunch and I'm glad we have a healthy restaurant so close to home!

I can only give this hotel 4 stars because I didn't stay here and didn't get the full Cosmopolitan experience. I can imagine that it's worth all 5 stars, but I can't know for sure just yet. I did however visit the casino a few times during the day and night. It's gorgeous inside with strands of crystals hanging from the ceiling like you are actually inside a chandelier. OMG I loved it, sooo pretty. The clubs and shops inside were top notch and most probably out of my price range, but awesome none the less. I went to the Sports Book and got to watch my team kick butt for a little while on their screen of TV's. I had bet at my casino, but The Cosmopolitan's odds were better. This place is pretty much one of the nicest hotels on the Strip right now. I walked through almost every single hotel, and this one really stood out!

I was in North Phoenix for a friend's birthday.  This place was choose by one of our mutual friends.  This place is very authentic!!!  The help speaks Cantonese! (and English) and were very helpful in their recommendations.  I would go back if I lived up there.

On Las Vegas Boulevard without being caught up in the chaos of the strip. My friends and I stopped by this bar to grab a drink and a quick bite before we headed to a movie at the South Point. Knowing that the casino would be packed, we came here.

At first, I was  hesitant to come because my first experience was disappointing. This second time, it was better. We entered around 10pm and sat ourselves at one of the side booths. The wait staff were slow to acknowledge our presence, but after we made it clear we were there, they were more attentive. 

The menu is extensive and that can backfire. Like I said, my first experience had me never wanting to come back. I didn't care for their chili. I was impressed with the extensive salad choices. On Thursday, they have a  BBQ chicken served over cold soba noodles with tons of veggies tossed in. The marinade for the chicken remind me of the Chinese style BBQ except it was more salty than sweet. The half portion was 8.95 and was enough to tide me over. I was trying to be healthy, but could not help stealing my friends fries. They were thick cut and fried to a golden brown. Absolutely perfect.

A bonus, they were playing so much 90's alternative. Nothing like some Smashing Pumpkins and Bush to remind me of my childhood.

What I love about this location over the two that I am used to in Milwaukee is the basement used vinyl section. The two in Milwaukee run their vinyl on the floor, completely packed. I always have to sit on the floor, pull some out, and move like 20 at a time.\n\nThis location has 75% of the stuff in bins that I can stand and pick through...and the best part is that there is no one in the basement, so you don't feel weird if you want to sit there for two hours literally looking through every album. I don't feel welcome to do that at the one on 76th st in Milwaukee.

You'll find this grub inside a seedy yet surprisingly clean bar called moon doggies.  I told Chris, the Naked City Pizza Owner, I 'd be scared to patronize this joint at night. He is assured me it's cool...mostly industry folk.

Took hubs and dad in for lunch.  Strangely enough, we didn't have any pizza.  I know this guy is from Buffalo so we decided to try his buffalo wings.  We also tried the steak frites sub (a special written on the board).  Dad had a chili cheese hot dog with everything and fries.

The wings were good.  We ordered them "hot"  The were great!  Cooked just as I like them.

Dad loved his hot dog.  It had chili, cheese, pickles, onions, jalapenos and so on.  He didn't love his fries.

The steak frites sub was a monstrous roll coated with cheese and stuffed with garlicky beef, creamy horseradish, and skinny fries.  It was served with a side of peppery gravy to drizzle over the top.  The sandwich was excellent.  Lots of meat.  Perfectly seasoned.  Yum-o!

Our lunch for three was $25 and we brought some home.

I"ll definitely go back soon to try the pizza!!

Dropped by for lunch on an early Saturday afternoon. Only one other table of guests there, but considering how new they are, that wasn't surprising. The server we had was obviously new to the job, but she did well.

Ordered the Ma Po Tofu and the Baked Pork and Rice with Portuguese sauce. Both dishes tasted good.

This restaurant is a good place to try some Hong Kong "western" style dishes. They are a very good east side of town alternative to the wealth of Chinese restaurants on Spring Mountain Rd.

"While I do not frequent Dish for the purpose of indulging in an epicurean adventure, I must confess that I derive immense pleasure from the relaxed ambiance that permeates the establishment, particularly when seeking sustenance following a late night of revelry or as a salve for a lingering hangover. My preference is to place an order for a half grilled cheese sandwich, accompanied by a steaming cup of tomato bisque. I must say that I am quite enamored with the practice of serving a deviled egg as a complementary side dish, a thoughtful gesture that elevates the dining experience to a new level of sophistication. My unwavering fondness, however, lies with the black bean and rice burrito, a delectable entree that never fails to satiate my hunger. Furthermore, the musical selections played on the jukebox contribute to the overall convivial atmosphere, transforming Dish into a veritable haven for those seeking refuge from the mundane rigors of daily life."

I recently had the pleasure of visiting this quaint eatery twice within a 24-hour period during my excursion to Las Vegas. Their prices are extremely reasonable, and the culinary offerings are unexpectedly delectable. Upon sampling their garlic chicken wings, my spouse expressed satisfaction, whereas I found them to be slightly lacking in flavor, although the crispy garlic was quite palatable. I thoroughly enjoyed their salted fish and chicken fried rice, with a generous serving size that did not scrimp on the salted fish, a notable aspect that impressed me. Additionally, I purchased their jook for my father, who was indisposed, and he relished the salted pork accompanied by a thousand-year-old egg porridge; the flavors were adequately balanced, neither excessively salty nor overly watery. During our subsequent visit, my father opted for their curry beef, the quality of which I presumed to be satisfactory, given that he consumed the entire dish. We also indulged in their beef chow fun, which boasted an abundance of flavor derived from the intense heat of the stove. While there were other menu items we sampled, my overall impression of this modest yet charming restaurant, situated outside the Las Vegas Strip, is one of contentment. Furthermore, its location away from the strip ensures that dining here will not significantly impact your financial resources.

"Devoid of any frivolous or unnecessary expenses, the cost of services rendered by Dan, an individual in whom I have unwavering trust and with whom I have had the pleasure of acquaintance since his tenure at Chapman, was found to be eminently reasonable and altogether commensurate with the exceptional quality of workmanship and dedication evidenced in the maintenance and repair of my Audi vehicle, thereby precluding any potential grievances or dissatisfaction on my part."

Last night, in the company of some acquaintances, I visited this establishment and partook of their culinary offerings. The hospitality we received was quite impressive, as our server exhibited remarkable attentiveness, repeatedly refilling our beverages and even dividing the tab for us after we neglected to request it. My individual pizza, adorned with artichokes and sliced tomatoes, was truly exceptional, warranting the slightly elevated price due to the superior quality of its constituents. The other patrons at our table also expressed satisfaction with their meals, and by the conclusion of the evening, there remained no pizza uneaten. While I would advocate for a broader array of options, the overall experience was certainly worthy of repetition.

The food offerings are above and beyond normal pub fair, more interesting than the typical burgers and fries and also deliciously made. I especially enjoyed the tomato soup made with goat cheese, the goat cheese fritters, and the butternut squash croquettes. They have many local quality beers on draft and the atmosphere is a cozy dark would expect and enjoy from a pub.

"I thoroughly enjoy the fact that this establishment consistently maintains a high level of patronage, yet still manages to provide exceptional service and culinary offerings. Upon each visit, I have been impressed by the proficiency and attentiveness of the staff, who have demonstrated an unwavering commitment to ensuring a satisfying dining experience. Furthermore, the menu boasts an array of delectable pasta dishes, which I have had the pleasure of sampling on multiple occasions. Notably, their flank steak salad has proven to be a flavorful and nutritious option when I am in the rare mood for a healthier selection. Additionally, their Italian sodas are a refreshing delight, with the Hurricane variety being my personal favorite. In conclusion, this venue has become my preferred destination for Italian cuisine and is unequivocally worthy of a visit."

Superb cafe right next to Concordia campus that's perfect for a quick lunch, a study area (especially downstairs), a quick delicious drink or a relaxing weekend with poetry readings on Saturday & Sunday. Basically, they have it all! The half panini + soup combo is under $10 which is a steal for a student like myself. The lavender, rosemary lemonade is deliciously tart and full of flavour, which is wonderful because many a-times lemonade is extremely watered down. Yes this may just be another \"artsy\" cafe that litters montreal, but the atmosphere and table arrangements create a comfortable stay, no matter what you're there for! Also, i read a past review that there used to be shisha and i'd love to see that return! It would be awesome!

Second time here, food came out very fast on a Saturday afternoon lunch time, pretty dang tasty overall, had a Pa-nang curry, pineapple fried rice, Mongolian beef, chicken pad Thai. We ordered everything spicy, yet still wanted more heat! If you like your Thai dishes spicy, order it at an 11 (out of 10). Maybe you'll get lucky and get that heat we missed out on.

"The culinary offerings were indeed delectable, however, the hospitality experience fell short of our expectations. Following a leisurely afternoon indulging in the therapeutic amenities of Qua Spa, we opted to partake in a late luncheon at this establishment. The pizza, boasting an abundance of toppings and a satisfying crunch, lived up to its reputation; regrettably, the same could not be said for the level of attentiveness displayed by our server, whose lackadaisical approach to refilling water glasses and monitoring our dining experience left much to be desired."

I was told this was the best buffet in Vegas and I don't see how anywhere else can compete.
