Upon being seated, we were promptly attended to by a staff member who inquired about our beverage preferences. I am eager to return and sample additional items from their extensive menu."

Took \"the Fam\"  and grandkids( Yes, Jeannie has grandkids) to Joe's for breakfast.  Not only did we leave without a huge dent in my wallet, we all left pleasantly stuffed!  If you like bacon, order like 5 sides of it.  You won't want to share this pig perfection! Thumbs up were given by all....French toast, breakfast burrito, pancakes, and cinnamon buns were all gobbled down.  My son and I ordered the biscuits and gravy.  We both devoured them like Evil Skeksis! The biscuits are super soft and they have the gravy just right. I would go there and just eat that each time...for 2.99!!!!  It was more than enough food too.\n\nCheck it out!

Great pho, the broth is so delicious and a great big portion.  Try the rolls too, they do it right!

Been here on a couple of occassions since it's a far drive, but a great place to stop by for some great food.

Tried a few different items when dining with a group recently. Enough for everyone to share and even took some leftovers.

Even though they were close to closing time, they allowed us and some other folks in.  Great people.

"For individuals seeking to savor sushi at their own leisurely pace, without the necessity of communicating their preferences to the sushi chef, this establishment provides an optimal dining experience. The quality of the cuisine oscillates between good and excellent, a remarkable feat considering the nature of the restaurant as a conveyor belt styled sushi place. Furthermore, the prices are quite reasonable, making it an accessible destination for sushi enthusiasts. 

To ensure the freshness and crispness of the dishes, the staff diligently cycles through the menu offerings, replacing them with new selections in a timely manner. This attention to detail is particularly crucial for sushi connoisseurs, who understandably detest tepid or lukewarm sushi. 

While the variety of options may be considered average, with a greater emphasis on rolled sushi as opposed to nigiri styled sushi, the menu cater to diverse tastes and preferences. 

It is hoped that the staff will consider providing ginger (gari) and wasabi, essential condiments for sushi, to all patrons. Lastly, this restaurant is not suitable for high-powered meetings, but can accommodate group gatherings, family style dining, in a relaxed atmosphere."

we went here for dinner and drinks, and it was awesome. the giant soft pretzels are amazing, buttery, and delicious and are served with a roasted pepper cheese sauce. they are awesome, but get them to share, the butteryness is rich! the prices are reasonable, and the patio is nice to sit out on! even better than the food, service, and prices is the music!! they play an awesome selection of music!!

I love whole foods ! The groceries are soooo fresh and decently priced but the only drawback is the employees... \nThey're kinda rude and don't have much of a personality... The cashiers don't hold much of a conversation, they seem so miserable working here! \nEven though the employees are lame, it won't keep me from giving whole foods my business that's why I am giving four stars!!

Go to brunch place in Montreal.  Don't know if it's worth the wait though.  Go during the week if you can when it's less busy.  We did and we ended up running into Georges St. Pierre!!  Eggs Benedict and GSP, what more can you ask for.

The green is a blissful centerpiece of Charlotte, our very miniature version of Central Park.  There are unique sculptures that are scattered about the park and fun road signs pointing to random yet creative destinations.  The park is a fun place to take your kids after some ice-cream to run some sugar out of their systems or to walk hand in hand with your significant other while the sun is beating down.  I tossed a penny into fountain with the man-sized fish around each corner.  Often times, The Green is reserved for weddings and receptions, but I would chose a less busy destination.  I just enjoy wandering down the paths to catch some relaxation.

I was badly craving asian food and decided to give PF Chang's a try.  Being a lone diner since I was in town for business, I was worried that they were going to ignore me or sit me in a crappy area to hide me.  However, the service was great.  I was glad to see my food come quickly and taste good.  \n\nI had the lettuce wraps, crab rangoon, and a cup of their hot and sour soup.  All three were excellent.  I would definitely recommend this place to business travelers who might be staying in the area.  (There are a lot of hotels near by)

"I felt compelled to express my sincere gratitude for the exceptional quality of the wireless internet connection in my accommodations, which afforded me the luxury of seamless and uninterrupted online access; truly, the diligent efforts of your IT department or affiliated personnel are deserving of high praise and recognition."

This shop, located in the Bellagio, is smaller then its counterpart located in Aria's.
The chocolate fountain is amazing to look at and take pictures of.

The line is confusing and there are people everyone in this very small shop with very limited seating inside.

I was so excited to be ordering individual desserts for my friend's birthday that I failed to listen to the girl that was describing what I was pointing to. My taste buds heard "Raspberry Macaroon" and the girl actually said "Raspberry Macaroon with ROSE OIL".

Needless to say I did not like the mini that I purchased for myself but my friend's all enjoyed, with great enthusiasm their desserts.

Love the food amazing for being as vegan as I can be amazing place to dine in on a date with options for us. Our order has come our a few times with seafood in it but we look past it for the amazing staff and management willing to correct it. As well as more than happy to serve us. When ever our order has been wrong we still paid full price we weren't looking for a freebie just simply a correction in the kitchen and it was made. Great drinks, food, and staff, will always return.

Love this place! If you love Mexican food you definitely have to try this place out! My favorite is hands down the flour tortilla chicken flautas! This is a great mixture with the complimentary chips salsa and beans that you get before you order! Also they have a Sunday brunch buffet that is always a great deal. From the homemade tortillas to the Mexican favorites for breakfast. Juevos con hamon, chile verde con pollo, bacon! Always got to have bacon! It's just a great atmosphere with live music playing

I'm a fan based on two things:  The price for breakfast and the variety of baked goods offered!

If I read the menu correctly, you have to get there before 10am to get the breakfast price of $8.95 versus the "brunch" price of $13.95.  The buffet was perfect and offered everything I could have wanted so I suggest sticking with the breakfast buffet.

Buffets can go one way or the other.  Either they are disgusting (ie Golden Corrall) with a ton of plastic, boxed food or they are a display of heavenly goodness.  Fortunately for me, Pike's offered the latter!   We're talking fresh fruit salad, biscuits and gravy, grits, cheese/potatoe hash, muffins, scones and pastries, eggs, egg benedict, sausage, bacon, blueberry french toast, etc.  Everything was fresh, what needed to be crispy was crispy, what needed to be fluffy was fluffy, what needed to be moist was moist.  It was all very good and of course the best part is that it is limitless!

The servers were friendly and by around 10:30 it was starting to get packed.  Obviously the south-end location is key and there really shouldn't be any other reason not to give them a try!

I'll be back!

"Indulge in an array of delectable oyster varieties at this esteemed establishment, where the freshness and quality of the bivalves are unparalleled in Las Vegas. The ambiance is suitable for both intimate gatherings and larger groups, offering an extensive selection of premium oysters that cater to diverse tastes. The knowledgeable staff provides exceptional service, allowing patrons to sample each variety before selecting the optimal dozen. Although the seafood platter may not meet expectations, the overall dining experience remains satisfying, especially when complemented by a friendly rapport with the bartender or oyster monger. A $50 meal of this caliber is certainly a worthwhile investment."

"This charming and diminutive eatery boasts an array of delectable pastries that are undoubtedly worth a visit. The friendly and hospitable staff adds to the overall appeal, creating a welcoming ambiance that invites patrons to linger and enjoy their culinary delights. Although the shop's physical dimensions may appear modest, it surprisingly offers an impressive amount of seating, accommodating a sizable number of customers within its cozy confines. However, be advised that complimentary samples of their scrumptious pastries are generously offered, which may tempt you into indulging in more than you had initially intended, transforming a hasty coffee stop into a leisurely gastronomic experience."
They quoted me 15 minutes, and just 10 minutes later called my name to say it was done. Quickest oil change I've ever had.\n\nPaid $38 and some change with the $5 off Ladies' Wednesday discount.
What a truly amazing view and ride through that mountainside! I will recommend this place to anyone that ends up in the area. It is something to see for sure

"The gastronomical establishment has undergone a thorough renovation, resulting in an expanded interior that exudes a more modern and sophisticated ambiance, with a repositioned bar area that affords increased space for socializing and dining, complemented by plush, tufted leather armchairs and subdued crimson illumination. My personal preferences include the delectable Cowbell Chili & Smoked Cornbread, a savory black bean burger, crispy sweet potato croquettes that resemble miniature donuts, and Dali's fries adorned with an assortment of flavorful toppings such as garlic aioli, buffalo sauce, grated Parmesan cheese, and a medley of fresh herbs. A comprehensive assessment of this culinary venue can be found on my blog, but the aforementioned items represent the most notable aspects of its offerings."

"Tacos El Gordo offers an array of delectable and authentic Mexican culinary delights, boasting an impressive taco selection that is both extensive and diverse, catering to the discerning palates of aficionados who crave rich, bold flavors. Furthermore, the prices are reasonable and affordable, making it an accessible dining option for those seeking a satisfying meal without breaking the bank. Additionally, the establishment remains open late, providing patrons with ample time to indulge in their preferred dishes at their convenience. However, the line system can become somewhat disorganized and perplexing, detracting from the overall experience. To enhance the efficiency of the queue, strategically placed signs above the ordering counters would greatly improve the process, thereby warranting a perfect five-star rating."

Been going to this place for years....... Hadn't been there in a long time and happened to be on Decatur today and we stopped by........ We should have just gotten one hoagie...... We split one and that was more than enough for both of us, ended up saving the other one for later..... Not a fan of fried Okra but we had some anyway, it was so so, I prefer the zucchini .. Don't understand the complaints about the prices, i think for what you get its fine.....We didn't bother eating outside since it's too damn hot this time of year, so we just brought everything home and it was pretty darn good.... We'll be back for more next time we're on that side of town........
Flavors and portions were spot on but customer service is lacking. While the service leaves much to be desired it wouldn't prevent me from frequenting the restaurant.

I have previously reviewed Eggspectation and found its kitchen creations excellent. They appear to have improved their service significantly since I last shared my opinions. As promised, therefore, four stars well-deserved. 

The menu has been revamped and the quirkiness and puns are mostly gone, but the eggs surely aren't. I think I will miss the great variety of dishes one could select from, however they seem to focus on a core set of competences these days and churn out a very pleasant palette of flavors.

With the sad departure of a couple of my brunch haunts, my trekking over a kilometre to Eggspectation shows it's good, filling and pleasant.

"I indulged in an epicurean escapade accompanied by two female companions. The verdant squash blossoms were a sight to behold, their delicate petals unfurling like nature's own canvas. The ambiance was nothing short of sublime, meticulously curated to create an atmosphere of refined sophistication. Each dish was a masterclass in culinary precision, the chef's dedication to his craft evident in every bite. My pork chop, cooked to a perfect medium rare, was a juicy, flavorful delight that left me in a state of gastronomic nirvana. The star of the show, however, was undoubtedly the quail, its tender flesh infused with a depth of flavor that was truly exceptional. I would enthusiastically endorse it to anyone seeking a culinary experience that transcends the ordinary. Although the menu is seasonal and subject to change, I have no doubt that future visits will afford me the opportunity to sample further delectable creations from this gastronomic haven. The wine list, featuring an array of Arizona-crafted vintages, piqued my interest, and I look forward to exploring its offerings on a subsequent visit. In conclusion, my sensory receptors were treated to a symphony of indulgence, leaving me in a state of unadulterated gustatory pleasure."

Compared to the malls in Springfield and Decatur, this one is the better of the three. There are no empty stores and it does get busy at the mall. \nThey have a great steak and potato company which closed in Springfield years ago. \nI like all the speciality stores that are here. They have a kitchen store, tons of kids stores, a gamestop, department stores, pet store, etc.

I had the privilege of partaking in a nursing conference in Las Vegas on September 18, 2013, where my colleagues and I opted to dine at The Noddle, located within the luxurious Bellagio hotel, subsequent to our exhaustive exploration of the strip. To our delight, the culinary offerings at the establishment far surpassed our expectations, particularly the shrimp pad thai that I had the pleasure of indulging in, which was remarkably delectable and well-prepared. In contrast, my fellow diners' choices of various soup and noodle dishes were merely satisfactory, with the beef being somewhat overcooked. Nonetheless, I would unhesitatingly endorse this restaurant to those seeking a satisfying dining experience following an extensive excursion and people-watching escapade on the famed Las Vegas Strip.

I went to Praying Monk on Saturday night with my wife. I love the look of this place and it has a great atmosphere. The staff was very friendly and nice.  They did a great job making you feel welcome. 

I am a Belgium beer fan so I was very happy too see their great selection on tap.  I had a St Bernardus ABT12 and my wife had the Triple Karmilet (our two favorites).

Now on to the food.
We had the Brussels sprouts and the soft pretzel to start. The brussels were light and fresh (not heavy and oily like most places) and the pretzel was very tasty. It was served with some sort of mustard butter that was awesome.

For dinner I ordered the Burger. The burger was great. It was flavorful and juicy. The Sriracha Aioli had the right amount of heat to kick this burger up a notch and the arugula... arugula always has a place on my burgers!

My wife ordered the Kale salad. The Kale was extremely fresh and crunchy. I would want it chopped into smaller pieces but my wife loved it.  The dressing was great and they didn't over dress it. 

Next time I go I will have to try the Lump crab.

One of my preferred culinary establishments offering affordable gastronomical delights, this particular eatery boasts an unpretentious gem of a dish concealed within its menu, specifically a delectable T-bone steak and eggs dinner that is sure to satiate even the most discerning palate; peruse the image provided for visual confirmation of the dish's quality.

Ohh my ohh my, this place is highly recommended... 

.. Despite having the most miserable waiter EVER!! 
I believe that there are 2 of those restaurants at 2 hotels next to each other so my friends and I had a funnydrunken mix up with meeting up for a 6am dinner... (Hmmm Oh so typical Vegas huhh) 

Anyways, I've ended up being at both locations the last time I was here. Both experiences were great. 
The service was good (minus the miserable waiter of course), the food was good and had a great variety. 

It is a shame that you can order from certain menus at certain times, but we managed to find something... 

Both location were nice and clean and we were seated quickly.. MOST important in Vegas in my opinion... Especially when it's whilst partying, right...

Don't think I have much else to say about this place... It's very "Cheesecake Factory" kind of place.. Which is a good thing... ?????? I guess....

Wow lines can get extremely long for tis place ! I went two times on my trip because it was just to good to pass up. Both times I gopt the chicken sandwiches the one with the hot peppers was amazing ! The other with the cheese and bacon and lettuce I did not care for the sauce. The coffee is also amazing !! I got a greek salad one time all the ingredients were just so fresh for a fast food places and very decent quality. This place is also open 24 hours in Planet Hollywod ! Food comes out really fast and the lines go pretty fast too !

"Wing Haven, an undiscovered gem in Charlotte, was brought to my attention during a Bike!Charlotte Bingo Bike Ride on a picturesque Saturday afternoon. The cycling route, which commenced at SouthEnd and traversed through downtown/Noda/Plaza Midwood/the greenway, culminated at Wing Haven, a secluded haven nestled within a residential area, strategically positioned between the Dilworth and Sewlyn districts. Despite its inconspicuous location, Wing Haven has the potential to attract a sizable audience, as evidenced by the 'NO WING HAVEN' parking signs erected in front of neighboring residences. This enchanting venue offers a diverse array of attractions for ornithologists, nature enthusiasts, and those who appreciate exceptional settings. Additionally, the space can be rented for intimate gatherings, and there are numerous activities designed for young children to engage in and explore."

"Opt for the Salt n Pepper Shrimp, fried chicken wings, cocktail shrimp, snow crab legs, raw oysters, greens, and fish... they also offer an array of additional seafood options including clams, mussels, crawfish... the children thoroughly enjoy this establishment.  We habitually utilize the 10% off coupon available for printing online.  In comparison to other Chinese/Asian buffets in the area, this restaurant offers a superior variety of seafood options."

This review is strictly for the lounge/bar area.  I loved the ambiance and decor here, with the balcony overlooking the casino and the changing color lights.  Super soft leather seating and of course pricy ass drinks.  But boogey enough that I was impressed since this was indeed Vegas!

Lululemon, oh how I struggle to merely consider you as "The One!" You are undeniably charming, possessing an impressive physique, likely due to your dedication to yoga and running, which renders you remarkably fit. Your polite demeanor, attentiveness, and keen sense of humor are truly captivating. Furthermore, your generous heart and inclination towards kindness are qualities that I hold in high esteem. However, I must confess that my adoration for your brand stems from the fact that your garments are designed to last an eternity. Unfortunately, the price point and limited availability of my preferred colors hinder me from indulging in your luxurious offerings more frequently than once a year. It is for this reason that I cannot bestow upon you a perfect rating, despite your remarkable qualities. My dear "The One," while I cannot deny the allure of your brand, I must admit that visiting you regularly and nurturing a deeper connection is my fervent hope. Someday, perhaps we will have a more enduring relationship, and together, we shall live happily ever after.

You can read others for food reviews.  Just know I am going back again again because of the service.  Server Yolanda even sent an email to thank us for being such great guests!  That was after I broke a glass with my IPhone!  Bartender William is fun.  Okay i will say something about the food.  The dishes our group loved were Tomato Soup, Roast Chicken and Steak dish.  The portions are small but I thought quality was outstanding.  I believe all food challenges will be worked out because the attention to service means someone cares what customers think. For me I prefer only wild caught salmon (or knowing it is sustainably sourced). I eat salmon several times a week and cannot afford the bad stuff.  I liked the raw tuna dishes (i ordered both on menu) yet felt they were heavy on fat content (which I prefer to save for dessert).  We order 4 desserts (there were 5 of us) - liked them all including ice cream minus potato chips next time. \nAnother outstanding element of this restaurant is the use of tableware. Very eclectic old china settings. Made the table fun.  \nAngelo got enough right out of the gate that the rest will come. Thank you
Got a groupon for the ultimate wash for $5. I liked that they scrubbed the car before it went in & thoroughly dried it after. I will go back again...

This Saks location has to be my personal favorite for their service style. Everyone is friendly, they great you, they often offer you a water bottle, however they let you wander if you tell them your just looking, and check on you sporadically but never smother. \nAlso they have the best makeup counter service of any store in the valley, period. My favorite is the YSL and Dior shared counter. Those ladies and gentleman are the best at telling you about their lines as well as other alternatives. For example on my last visit they showed me their concealer and ran to the Nars counter to show me one with more coverage. Which is what I was looking for. \nThe only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because shoe sales rack has really dwindled in size over the last year or two. Other than that, this place is fantastic.

Do you enjoy gyros? I do. I have enjoyed them since I was a boy in the Chicago suburbs. After eating my first gyro from Mad Pita Express, I told my fiance that it was the best that I had ever tasted! The meat is tender, and delicious. The cucumber sauce, tomatos, and herbs are fresh and good. The Pita is puffy and soft. 

My second time to Mad Pita Express I brought my fiance and she ordered a very good lemon rice soup. Very lemony and tasty!  She also enjoyed a piece of fresh baklava which she said was special.

5.00 for the Gyro is a very good price. The soup is 2.99 for a good sized portion. 

It takes a few minutes wait for the food to be prepared. However, the quaint, cozy restaurant has interesting decor that my fiance and I enjoyed looking at for several minutes--family pictures, many different plants, and eclectic artwork.

This is a small, casual, counter-service restaurant. You can dine in or carry-out. We chose to dine in, and our food was brought to us, along with plastic-ware and napkins.

I have a lot of health issues and a very limited diet.  Trying to stay alkaline, and keeping raw, I have found many delectable options.  My first visit, I tried the raw chile rellano, then the raw coconut curry spring rolls which were PHENOMENAL!  I also got to try a raw vanilla cupcake with coconut strawberry frosting. This is currently my favorite raw food venue.

"I have an immense fondness for the Destihl in Bloomington-Normal, thus, I felt compelled to sample its culinary offerings at this establishment. In the company of a colleague, I visited this restaurant on a Thursday evening, and while the atmosphere was not excessively crowded, it did possess a sufficient quantity of patrons. The interior design of the venue garnered my approval, and the configuration of the booths was quite ingenious. Our server was exceptionally cordial and helpful throughout our dining experience. 

My contentment was further elevated by the discovery that the menu bore a striking resemblance to its counterpart in Bloomington-Normal, with the sole variance being the assortment of beverages available. We initiated our meal with the Beer Battered Asparagus, which proved to be an exquisite delight! Although I was tempted to order my customary dish, the White Cheddar Stuffed Poblano Peppers, I opted to deviate from my routine and selected the Potato Crusted Rainbow Trout instead. The flavors present in this dish were truly captivating. My colleague followed suit and enjoyed her repast thoroughly. Motivated by our satisfaction, we decided to indulge in dessert as well. I requested the Creme Brulee, but unfortunately, it failed to meet my expectations. Its consistency was somewhat runny, and I am accustomed to experiencing a smoother, creamier texture in my creme brulee. 

In conclusion, the culinary excellence and hospitable service provided by this establishment are truly commendable. I hold this place in high esteem."

Good food, good late night, full of Philly Phans!!  What a great place to find  tucked away in the city.  Naturally, I ordered the Philly sub to give it the ol' test.  It passed!  The key is the roll and their roll was nice and fresh.  If you are full of food/beer and want something else to do.. Stroll over to the shuffle board table and give it a spin while you watch the games.  They even have friendly poker games once a week that you can simply just show up and play.  The whole staff is friendly and dont mind striking up a conversation with you.  The only negative side is that the place just isnt that clean.  But if you dont expect the Ritz ahead of time and know just where you are going.  Then you should be fine.  Enjoy!\n\n-Ian M.

Vey clean place a bit pricy but if you don't mind go there great experience I felt like a princess I got a gel manicure white tips with glitter cost 42 dollars. Good job on my real nails but on my broken nails I asked  for a fake nail over it the lady didn't do so good on those they looked really fat and fake but they blend in well with my other nails. Overall good job!!

"The quality of this eatery is quite satisfactory, and I have no doubt that I will visit it more frequently as the temperature drops. The cost-benefit ratio is reasonable, and although I did not opt for any high-end cuts of meat, I was pleased with the three-meat combination. However, I cannot recall the specific types of meat, aside from eye of round, but I managed to enjoy four plates of it. 

I strongly advise choosing the Sukiyaki style; the sweet soy sauce has a richer flavor, and the udon noodles, along with everything else that comes with it, are significantly superior. Don't neglect to add a generous amount of minced garlic, as it will enhance the taste greatly. 

While the noodle and vegetable plates are pre-prepared, they can be a bit disappointing since each plate tends to have an excess or shortage of a particular ingredient. On the other hand, meat plates are cooked to order and sliced appropriately. Depending on where you are seated, you may observe the meat being sliced and put together, which is a pleasant experience. There is no browning of meat that has been piled on top of another and refrigerated. 

I give this place four stars instead of five because of my error in ordering the shabu shabu rather than the Sukiyaki. In essence, I took Anthony M's leftover broth and combined it with my own, resulting in a surprisingly improved flavor. Unfortunately, a staff member accidentally poured shabu shabu water/broth into my dish, diluting the flavor. It was not the staff member's fault, but I failed to sample how everything tasted in Sukiyaki."

So while checking Yelp for some reasonable Vegas fare, I came across a venue with like 3000+ reviews, 1 dollar sign, and 4+ stars.  Check around, nothing else like it exists on The Strip.  Naturally, I had to go (mainly because I needed a break from $75 food bills for lunch).  

EoS is good, really good.  There's a huge variety of sandwiches that are all delicious and easy on the wallet.  It's really close to about half the strip, and even if you need to take a $15 cab, you're going to save money in the long run.  There's a breakfast menu which is open until 11am (I never made it), but the rest of their hot sandwich menu suits me just fine. 

I had the Chicken Chipotle Avocado thing, and later I had the Original 1786 or whatever.  The Original needed more sauce on the (the horseradish was great, but it needed more).  I got the Chicken Chipotle with extra sauce and it was awesome.  For like $7 a sandwich, you can't go wrong.

Note:  The sandwich isn't huge.  I only needed one, but I don't eat a lot.  Most dudes I hang with would need two to fill them up.  

Note2: If you go for dinner, head into the PH and check out the Pleasure Pit.  You'll see.....

Had a catered dinner here with 40 colleagues. Food was very good, service very good. Great location - even enjoyed a live string quartet playing in the \"courtyard\" outside the restaurant's entry.\n\nDefinitely would go again.

Nostalgia. I'm an 80's kid so I came for the Thrifty's ice cream. I've actually been here a few times but tonight's visit was different in a good way. I got circus animal flavor ice cream with snickerdoodle and sugar cookies to make my sandwich. Because who's counting calories tonight...not me. F a diet. At least for tonight. 

In the past the cookies were a bit on the hard side, not the best texture for a ice cream sandwich. Tonight's cookies were soft which made for a perfect sandwich. Their "scoop" of ice cream is Huge. I'm guessing people may complain of price (this ain't the 80's anymore and we must get over the 25 cent a scoop deal) but when you're getting a product/treat like this you forget about $'s sometimes. 

Staff is friendly. Place is kept clean. Good amount of space. Bonus that they have the table style arcade game set up and cool unique sodas in their drink fridge. All I need is some MJ, Madonna, Boy George, Cindy Lauper on blast on the radio, some Ronald Reagan on the tube, some girls with biker shorts big aquanet hair and fanny packs and maybe i can give this place 5 stars.

Who can say no to their $2 Signature dogs on Tuesdays? Well of course those who don't eat pork for dietary or religious reasons, but they should reconsider.
These hot dogs are delicious. I'm slowly working my way through the plethora of amazing options and then they go and make a weekly rotation of local brewery inspired hot dogs.
They seem to constantly be thinking up new ways to dress up the traditional frank. Grilled to perfection and with a myriad of options.
They also have great house chips and onion rings.
I usually do take out but it is a great location to sit and grab a beer with your hot dogs and during these Spring evenings, they have the roof top patio.

"My culinary exploits led me to indulge in the delectable pizza at this establishment, and I must say, the crispy crust was nothing short of exceptional. Given its location within the San Tan Mall, I would highly recommend paying a visit to this eatery, particularly if you're in the vicinity and have a penchant for savory pies. My experience was further enhanced by the company of my companion, with whom I shared a delightful double date. However, I must admit that the diminutive size of the dining area did result in a somewhat prolonged waiting period of approximately 45 minutes. Additionally, the ambient noise level increased significantly during peak hours, specifically on Friday evenings, though this is hardly a unique phenomenon and certainly not a reflection of the management's acoustic considerations. Nonetheless, my overall assessment of this restaurant remains favorable, and I would unhesitatingly advocate for a repeat visit, perhaps during less hectic hours."

"It is not as if this establishment has pioneered the concept of the sandwich per se, but my esteemed rating bespeaks my unwavering admiration for its culinary offerings. While the quality of the fare is undeniably impressive, it is the exceptional level of customer service that truly sets it apart from its contemporaries. Arthur, the proprietor, displays an unparalleled dedication to ensuring that each patron who enters his domain feels welcome and valued, evincing a genuine interest in their individual experiences and preferences. This personalized approach is a refreshing departure from the impersonal nature of chain restaurants, and it serves as a testament to the eatery's commitment to fostering a sense of community among its clientele.  

My recent visit afforded me the opportunity to sample the Roasted Turkey sandwich, which exceeded my expectations with its flavorsome cold cuts and freshly baked bread. The Mozzarella sandwich, with its rich, velvety cheese, proved to be another highlight of the menu. Furthermore, the turkey chili warrants high praise for its satisfying, comforting qualities, particularly on days when the temperature drops. Patrons would be wise to note, however, that beverages are served in generously proportioned vessels, nearly rivaling the size of a small vat. Additionally, the restaurant offers half-sandwich and soup combinations as part of its lunch specials, providing customers with an economical alternative to the standard full-sandwich option.  

The extraordinary hospitality extended by Arthur during my final visit merits particular mention. As the lunch hour drew to a close and the dining area became relatively quiet, he took the time to engage me in a leisurely conversation, displaying a genuine interest in my occupation and thoughts on the local downtown area. Such personalized attention is a rarity in today's fast-paced, large-scale dining establishments, making this cafe a veritable gem in the midst of more impersonal chain eateries. Those seeking a welcoming atmosphere and delectable sustenance would do well to pay this eatery a visit and experience the warmth of Arthur's hospitality firsthand."

"Accessibility is a hallmark feature of this arena, boasting proximity to both a garage and street parking lot, rendering it effortless for patrons to arrive and depart. The dimensions of the arena are considerable, primarily accommodating hockey matches and local graduation ceremonies. Although the box office is situated at a slight remove from the arena, attendees can avail themselves of conveniently located restrooms and indulge in reasonably priced refreshments. The seating arrangements are designed for optimal comfort, while events conducted on the lower level are distinguished by a covering of opaque flooring that retains the subterranean chill of the underlying ice rink, imbuing the atmosphere with a gratifying tangible sensation."

Spent a few nights at the Palazzo, then came down to the Cosmo with a group of friends.  Completely different vibe than most other Vegas places.  The Cosmo is definitely a higher class (read pricier) place, but has a more edgy and trendy side to it.  No cheesy statue of Caesar or reproductions of ancient Eurozone here. Rooms are fresh and inviting, and the casino area even has a better feel to it.  This place is in the CItycenter area, so be prepared for a hike if you are wanting to see TI, Wynn, or other casinos on the north end of the strip.

"Their pancakes are by far the most exceptional I've ever had! Just the mere thought of initiating a description of them causes my salivary glands to become hyperactive. They possess an inherent warmth, fluffiness, and buttery texture on the interior, juxtaposed with a delicate crispness on the exterior, particularly when consumed from the edges. Yummmmm... The combination of that with their warm maple syrup renders them utterly delectable. Despite being satiated, I still crave more! Not only were their pancakes remarkable, but their eggs were also of exceptional quality. We opted for the Apple-smoked Bacon, avocado, and jack cheese omelet, albeit we chose to disassemble it. We extracted the cheese, supplanted it with unadulterated egg whites (not egg substitute), and requested that they scramble it thoroughly (I abhor runny eggs). Truly, one of the most satisfying breakfast experiences I've had in an extended period. Every aspect, including my OJ, was superb. The sole reason I refrained from awarding them 5-stars is due to the absence of high chairs, subpar service, and the establishment's dire need of aesthetic renovation."

Last evening, my significant other and I opted to partake in a culinary experience that involved sharing a minuscule white pie and a cheese steak accompanied by onions and cheese whiz. The delectability of these dishes was utterly remarkable, and I would unhesitatingly endorse them to anyone seeking a gastronomical indulgence.

I love this place because of the great food and I enjoy how they have a separate dining area from the bar. The different styles of burgers are great! We enjoyed watching a hockey game on the big screen in the dining room. Go on a Monday when the burgers are $5. I personally wouldn't pay $8-11 for a burger.

Located in inside what appears to be the craziest indoor state fair like atmosphere of Circus Circus. That being said, once inside this meat oasis did the job. 3 of us stuffed ourselves silly with meat, sides and a few drinks for $200. Not so bad!  I competed in half ironman triathlon earlier that day and ate the whole ribeye and sides!

We had an amazing meal here...granted it was 3 years ago. Had a spicy shrimp dish and it was so delicious. Service was wonderful as was atmosphere. Both my husband and I still talk about the amazing Mexican meal we had here. Give it a try....

"Conventional southwestern terminal. The personnel are amicable. Occasionally, services to and from this location become heavily booked, particularly during periods of inclement weather when there is a surge in demand for easternbound travel. Fortunately, I have yet to encounter any difficulties with my own travel arrangements. However, the waiting areas at the gates tend to be overcrowded. Therefore, it is advisable to arrive ahead of time to secure seating and await your flight with greater comfort."

I love this place- esp. the breakfast. I started out with a Fat Boy bloody mary. It has bacon. And string cheese. Yum. I ordered the crab Benedict and it was delicious. My dining partners ordered the Denver scramble and prime rib hash. Both said their meals were great. We ended the meal with cookie dough egg rolls. They are evil, but soooo goood. My usual favorite dessert is their 6 layer carrot cake. One thing to remember is that the wait on Sunday morning is long. Do not walk in and expect to be seated in less than a half hour. They have a lounge area where you can get drinks while you wait which makes the time go a little faster.

"I recently partook in a culinary excursion to Verrado Grille for the initial time, and I must remark that it was an exceptional encounter given the circumstances. They cease operations at 9 p.m., and we arrived at approximately 8:30, hence I was anticipating subpar service due to our tardiness. Nonetheless, our server was quite hospitable, and the service remained satisfactory despite the proximity to closing time. I sampled a pint of Verrado Ale, which is an offering from Four Peaks' 8th Street brewery, and opted for the Almond Encrusted Basa, a visually appealing white fish complemented by a delectable Orzo/Risotto accompaniment. The cost is comparable to the level of excellence provided, and I would not hesitate to offer a slight increase in remuneration for the culinary experience. Overall, it was a delightful escapade, and I would heartily endorse aiming for a sunset repast, as the panorama over the golf course and the White Tank Mountains is truly breathtaking during that timeframe."

The text is: "Open 24/7. I just have to say every time we come here the girls that work inside are very nice and if they get a chance they will talk with you. Since they see us at least once a week we talk more. It always is clean inside and they are usually stalked up on drinks and snacks etc. Of course, we will be back."

The modified text is: "Operating on a continuous basis throughout the entire day and night, this establishment's welcoming female staff members consistently display amicable demeanors and engage in cordial conversations with patrons, fostering an atmosphere of warmth and hospitality. Upon entering the premises, it becomes apparent that meticulous attention has been devoted to maintaining a spotless environment, with an abundance of refreshments and snacks available for consumption. Given the favorable impression garnered from our frequent visits, it is unquestionable that we shall return in the future."

Yay for good Blockbusters.  There is one way closer to the house, but their selection sucks, the people are rude, and it's just plain ghetto.  This location is very large and has a great selection.  I think their selection is better than most.  The employees we have interacted with have always been very friendly and have a good sense of humor.  We actually have the Blockbuster online thing (think Netflix) and it works fantastically.  Whenever we come here to use one of our in-store exchanges, we are always in and out of there very quickly.  The other location seemed to have difficulties with that.  Anyway, this is my favorite Blockbuster in the valley.  The two reasons I subtracted one star is the awful parking lot, and I wish it were a bit closer to my house.

We were promptly seated at our reservation time, bread was brought (really, one dinky little roll?!! with no options for more?) and the waiter went through a couple of things.  The spinach salad was great, as were the bbq shrimp, but 4 average size shrimp for $20?  Probably the worst value on the strip, yeah they were awesome with a great bbq sauce but way overpriced for just 4.  \nThe seabass was very good as was the lamb shank.  Coming with sides included made it a fair value. The blueberry cobbler for desert was great!  \nWill probably come back, maybe for lunch this time.

Why did I come here: It was close by which is a plus for a student who lives in Campustown and wants to support something local.

They are open at good hours and I have never had a problem with getting an appointment. 

For a GUYS haircut, it is the perfect price for what I get. I have gone to more expensive places in the NW for a similar quality haircut. It is quick too and I never wait long.

The stylists are nice and friendly. I love the joke one plays on me when they "That will be a million dollars, please." If you like deals and are willing to pay cash, you can get your 10th haircut free.

Contrary to what Chheng L. thought, Cali people aren't the only ones who appreciate Yoshinoya. New York peeps also love it! My friends and I used to eat at the Yoshinoyas a lot when I was working in NYC, and the places were almost always packed. And no wonder - the food is good and cheap, and the service is fast. The main drawback (for me) for this lone franchise in AZ its distance from Phoenix; but even that isn't so bad, as it is one minute from the Dysart Rd. exit of  I-10. Still, I wish they'd open some franchises in Phoenix itself. And Chheng L was right -- pouring the clam chowder into the beef bowl sounds crazy but I found it to be yummy when I tried it.  However, if you've never tried the beef bowl before, try it by itself first. Enjoy!

KICKASSSSS MARGARITAS!!

This is THE place to go for margaritas in the area (near downtown)!  Come grab a pitcher or 4 of the Kickass Margaritas with some friends and enjoy some delicious appetizers as well!  (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=2z1vI-CXPyMHEMntTszyWg&userid=F28n26ynklEioZDInyK__A) 

I came here with a few clients to unwind a bit after a long day of work and it was so relaxing that didn't want to leave!  We sat in the outside seating area -- cute, but full of random decor -- I thought I walked into Guadalajara, lol  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#_5myU5HjdcHdwvbDArXbZg) 

We ordered a couple appetizers/entree to share along with our margaritas:

(They serve complimentary chips and salsa-- I loveee the homemade salsa, especially because it is spicy! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#hJpJSd1U3xGYs927JX1wJg))

- Adovada Ribs: Country style pork ribs marinade in red chili, served with rice and flour tortilla.  This is SPICYYY!  If you can't handle spicy, you probably won't eat more than a couple bites of this.  I have a pretty high tolerance for spicy food and I even thought this was pretty hot.  The pork was fork tender and the homemade flour tortilla was delicious.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#AvtkP_Po96waiz-8dDgtUQ)

- Chorizo Pizza: This too, was VERY SPICY!  Delicious, but I was for sure sweating after a few bites!  I love how the pizza is thin, and the crust is nice and crispy!  I'd say this is more like a giant tostada with a generous amount of spicy chorizo.  I would order this again!  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#vLFuk2p51aFrxWaVH8gLpg)

Cheeeeerss!  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/los-dos-molinos-phoenix?select=mOqppqoOhfgIncilkMVGJg#v-Z8I01sReuCoVjK7d0R4Q)
Rachel's Kitchen has a small selection wraps and burgers which are all pretty good. Where they really excel is with the smoothies. Highly recommend.

"Elated to discover an exceptional gyro establishment in Chandler, Arizona; it appears that the proprietors hail from Chicago, a fact that only serves to enhance my culinary experience. Although I have yet to sample their Italian beef offerings, I am thoroughly enjoying their delectable gyros and plates. Having visited this eatery on more than twenty occasions, I remain steadfast in my admiration for their gastronomical prowess. It is unfortunate that their website does not accurately reflect the quality of their fare, but I assure you that their cuisine far surpasses any preconceived notions one might harbor based on their online presence."

Never would i have thought of doing this ...but my wife convinced me that it would be a decadent treat ...and a great bargain....and that it was. we enjoyed the 24 hour pass..starting with a late dinner at the paris..it was good, a huge line up till they closed it...and the next day we had lunch at planet hollywood..it was so good we had to go back for dinner...clean,  well managed, and freshly prepared.  i strongly recommend the buffet at PH. Its all about not pigging out....and not eating a taste of everything ..lol...hey its hard to get a salmon caesar  salad in vegas for less than 30 bucks..so $50. for 24 hours of  pretty much whatever  food you want is great...not something i would want to do often..but once in a blue moon why not?   enjoy

I have been seeing Dr. Johnnie Woodson for years.  He is always very nice and willing to talk to me about my condition at length.  The office has gotten so much better since new management has taken over.\n\nSometimes the wait is a bit longer than I would like but the Doctor is wortht the wait!

I have had the privilege of availing myself of this establishment's shoe repair services on multiple occasions, with each experience yielding satisfactory results. Specifically, one pair of shoes had a detached sole that was successfully reattached through the application of adhesive substances. In contrast, the other two pairs required more extensive renovations, involving the replacement of their worn-out soles with newly fabricated ones. It is worth mentioning that Boris, the proprietor's son, exhibited exceptional cordiality and hospitality throughout the process. Furthermore, while the prices charged by this business may be slightly higher than those of its competitors in my hometown, the quality of their workmanship and the expediency with which they address customer requests justify the additional expense. My gratitude extends to the Yelp community for directing me to this hidden gem.
Great big Tostones, very nice hot sauce and mojo! Everyone at my table (two who had never had Cuban food) all cleaned their plates :)

This gastronomical establishment offers an ideal setting for a visit during the cold winter months, whereupon one can partake in a delectable array of culinary delights that not only possess a piquant flavor profile but also provide a comforting warmth. As a preliminary course, I customarily opt for a bowl of what appears to be a complimentary miso soup, which serves as a precursor to the primary dishes. The kitchen utilizes high-quality meat for their spicy barbecue, ensuring that each dish is delivered to the table while still sizzling hot, accompanied by an assortment of kimchi and other traditional Korean side dishes. Although certain menu items may seem somewhat expensive, the majority are generously portioned, allowing for sharing between two individuals.

"An exceptional dining establishment offering a delectable breakfast experience, situated within the luxurious confines of Mandalay Bay, affords a picturesque view of the meandering pathway leading towards the aquatic facility, thereby creating an idyllic ambiance for patrons to relish their morning repast. The culinary offerings, particularly the corned beef hash and waffles, are of superior quality and generously portioned, leaving customers feeling satiated yet regretful that an unlimited supply of fruit juice is not available to complement their meal, despite the minor drawback, the eatery maintains its merit as a prime destination for a satisfying breakfast experience."

Had dinner here with my wife and 3 kids. We were all very pleased with the food and the service. There isn't much available for younger kids, but mine were able to share a drumstick appetizer which was really well done and included 6 drumsticks, so it was more than enough for a young child or 2.  A large, juicy burger was very good and a steak that was just ok round out the standard fare. The nachos appetizer was not great, but it was just an appetizer.  The real star was the pizza. The dough is buttery and flakey yet chewy which made for one of the best pizza crusts that I have ever had. The sauce and cheese were well balanced to make this a wonderful personal pizza. I would definitely order it again if I was dining here. But I would also dine outside as the interior needs some updating.
The location is perfect, next doors to our dentist... and I think their chicken is awesome... the Spicy Honey Mustard and Asiago Parmesan... also MUST TRY.... their homemade Asiago Chips... nice!!!

"The pho served at this establishment was of exceptional quality, surpassing my expectations and rivaling those of previous experiences. Although I have had the pleasure of indulging in superior specimens, the culinary expertise demonstrated in the preparation of their pho was undeniably impressive. My order was for a spicy variation, yet I found it necessary to augment its piquancy with an additional condiment, specifically sriracha. Nonetheless, the dish proved satisfying and fulfilled my craving, especially after exposure to the inclement weather."

This review is more for the food court than the stores. First a brief review of the stores mainly they have a great selection of stores Nike, Adidas, Oakley, Guess, D&G and many more expect at least more than a couple of hours to go through the whole thing keep in mind this is all outdoors so dress accordingly especially during the summertime. Now on to the food court well not much of a selection you have Japanese and Chinese, Subway and Italian I actually had pizza for lunch it was ok good enough for my taste buds i also got to sample the teri chicken from the Japanese place and orange chicken from the Chinese place both were good but they could have better food.

"I had the pleasure of partaking in a culinary excursion to this esteemed establishment in the company of my spouse, maternal figure, and infant offspring this past weekend.  Our group constituted the sole patrons present, thus obviating the potential for service-related tribulations as documented by previous visitors.  The gastronomical offerings conformed to traditional preparation methods, yet retained an unparalleled delectability.  We sampled an array of appetizers, complemented by three entrÃ©es selected from the specialized yellow menu, accompanied by a single mango lassi, the total cost of which, inclusive of tax, amounted to $43.  It is worth noting that while the restaurant does not provide alcoholic beverages, management graciously extended permission to procure such libations from the adjacent grocery store and consume them in conjunction with our meal.  Thus, we acquired a pair of beers.  Furthermore, we derived amusement from the ambient music and television programming, specifically, the Indian version of 'Who Wants to Be a Millionaire,' which preceded our departure and was succeeded by music videos, rendering the atmosphere decidedly captivating."

The sentiment of astonishment was palpable, yet the gustatory experience was indeed satisfactory, and one could posit that the confluence of factors, including the temporal context of 10:30 AM, rendered Pizza Hut an optimal venue for a delectable repast.

Since I wrote about Tacone in Tustin, CA. It would not be fair not to write about Tacone in Vegas,especially the reason I visited the one in Tustin was because of the delicious wraps I had in Vegas. I had a coupon printed out from some Vegas tourism website, so my whole family went to Tacone for lunch. We did not have any high expectations since it is a fast food eatery, and it is inside Aladdin, we just wanted a quick bite before taking my kids to BuildaBear. Boy, were we pleasantly surprised!  There was a free sauce bar, from the popular honey mustard, bbq, to exotic creamy cilantro sauce and balsamic flavored dip, the kids were just having an awesome time trying all of them! The wraps were huge, I could not finish and had mine doggy bagged. I had the Thai cone, the peanut sauce with the cucumber salad tucked inside the wrap with soft steaming jasmine rice was superb! Hubby's Mambo wrap's filet mignon was juicy and tender. Kids loved their Campfire chicken wraps with sweet bbq sauce. The price is a bit expensive, hence the four stars. I think it was about $8.95/wrap. But it is something different and refreshing.

The rooms are nice, a little dull but nice. The big bathroom even in entry level rooms are a massive plus and if you like to soak in a deep tub you will be very happy. The rest of the Casino is nice enough but I think next time I will head back to my usual hangout which is the Mirage.
Exactly we had anticipated,  this will be a great place to have in your foodie book. Good job Vig McCormick Ranch

"It is with immense pleasure that I express my gratification regarding the establishment of a Komex in my vicinity, providing a convenient venue for a rapid repast. Furthermore, I frequently bring guests from afar or those unfamiliar with the eatery to experience its distinctive culinary offerings, particularly the delectable fusion tacos, with the spicy pork variant being my utmost preference. While I have sampled other menu items, they fail to impress me with their innovative fusion elements or exceptional taste, in my humble opinion."

This place is interesting. It's strictly a take out spot and they open from 5-10pm. Definitely not your average Thai food joint. 

Overall the food is great and my personal favorite is the Mango Sticky Rice. They actually give you a bigger portion of sticky rice here than anywhere else I've been. 

cleanliness is key here. Seeing as to how they don't actually have tables here so you can eat, I'd be surprised if it was dirty. 

The lady is pretty friendly and straight to the point. It looked like if it was just her and another employee so probably family. 

Overall its small, quaint, cheap and fantastic! definitely recommend this for them nights that you want to stay home and watch a movie!

We stayed here after getting an awesome deal on Priceline for $90 per night. I admit that if I'd paid full price I'd have been a little annoyed at the size of the room. It felt pretty small, but it was comfortable and had a great view of Heinz Field. It's also a fantastic location. We were able to walk almost everywhere, which I always enjoy when spending time in a new city. 

The hotel itself is beautiful, especially in the lobby. It's a historic hotel and really managed to keep the aesthetics of the original interior but update them in appropriate ways. 

I would recommend avoiding the restaurant if you can. As with all hotel restaurants it was overpriced, and the breakfast we ate there was unmemorable to say the least.

"An optimal culinary selection for the noontide or evening repast in the public square! The aforementioned dumplings are domestically fabricated and possess an exceptional tenderness. My personal preference was the combination of carrots and beef encased within said dumplings, which yielded a flavor profile that was indeed gratifying. Furthermore, the congee, available at a nominal cost of two dollars per bowl, serves as an affordable sustenance option for those who seek to satiate their hunger without incurring excessive financial burden. Thus, I recommend paying a visit to this establishment and partaking in their delectable offerings."

It's cirque so u know it's going to be good. The real only flaw is the somewhat vague storyline but who cares about storylines when u r watching incredibly creative set and costume and choreography. \nAfter a few beers I realized that the KA storyline is basically star wars.  If you keep that in mind it all makes sense- Luke and princess leah versus Darth vader and the emporor. Easy as that

Created by the founder of Cheesecake Factory, Grand Lux Cafe is like a more upscale European version of it's former self. Open 24 hours, it's a great place to sober up after the wild night.

It's 4am and we're all hungry. Us being Lucy Y., David G., Sarah A., and myself. Having been here before, I recommended coming here for some early morning grub. We encountered some half naked drunk dudes standing around the restroom outside the restaurant. Good stuff!

We were promptly seated and I was craving breakfast. Ordered the Smoked Salmon with onions and scrambled eggs, it came with hash browns on the side. Simple and delicate at the same time. Contrast of smoked salmon and eggs together created a good plate overall. Filling enough for bedtime.  

Pricier than most 24 joints in the hotels, but the food and service is better also. Keep in mind only the late night menu is available after a certain time.

"Wynn Casino epitomizes luxury and sophistication, offering an unparalleled gaming experience that is sure to captivate even the most discerning patron. Upon signing up for their esteemed Red Card, patrons are rewarded with a generous $10 FREE PLAY credit, which can be utilized to indulge in a myriad of exhilarating games of chance. Furthermore, the establishment boasts an impressive array of delectable cocktails, such as the decadent Chocolate Martini, which pairs perfectly with the ambiance of the lavish casino floor. As we savored our complimentary libations, we couldn't help but feel a sense of euphoria wash over us, culminating in an unforgettable afternoon of entertainment. Our encounter with the Mona Lisa slot machine proved particularly fruitful, as we walked away with a respectable sum of $12. Needless to say, our experience at Wynn Casino left an indelible mark on our hearts, and we eagerly anticipate the opportunity to return and indulge in the opulence that this esteemed institution has to offer."

This is a really good venue to hold meetings in Edinburgh. We hired the 'Glass Room' at the top of the building which had its own private balcony with stunning views across the city. \n\nThe Hub provided us with lunch - just sandwiches- but they finished it off with some really good, gooey chocolate cake which made me love the whole venue even more!! They also left some Edinburgh rock on the tables for us to munch through...so whenever my meeting became boring/overly bureaucratic I could have a sugar high to bring back my normal hyper-ness!

"The eatery exudes an inviting ambiance reminiscent of a cozy chalet, nestled conveniently on McGill Street, at the intersection of the business district and Old Montreal. Grange offers a seamless dining experience for those seeking a relaxed evening on the quays after work, boasting an uncomplicated yet diverse menu featuring tartares, generous salads, and mouthwatering burgers that cater to various palates. Prices are moderate to high, averaging around $25 per plate, but the restaurant compensates with an impressive wine selection. Although the service was friendly, it was somewhat sluggish, but we thoroughly enjoyed our visit and will likely return."

I recently attended the October Adults Night Out. The premise of the program is great-free admission, adult beverages, etc. I enjoyed exploring the museum and it was a nice activity for a Friday Night. The only downfall(s) were 1. The line to check in was extremely long. It didn't move slow, but it wasn't fast either. I had registered online but forgot to print the tickets. I would suggest definitely printing tickets ahead of time. The second issue was the \"beer garden.\" While I enjoyed the premise and the beers, there were only 2 beer servers and 1 wine server for many many people. The line went painfully slow and it made it hard to use the drink tickets and visit the center. Many people were actually giving away their tickets because the line was too long. I would attend another ANO again but I hope that they make some changes in the future to the above mentioned things.

Radio Maria has become our sanctuary, a place where my companions and I can indulge in delectable victuals and savor an atmosphere that fosters conviviality. We endeavor to partake in a 'girl's night out' on a monthly basis, and this eatery never fails to satiate our craving for a tranquil dining experience replete with captivating conversation pieces and exceptional service. Indeed, it ranks among my most beloved locales in Champaign for enjoying a leisurely meal.
Ordered for delivery here because I was at the TownePlace Suites nearby.  Lots of food and the sushi was awesome.  Delivered in less than 30 min on a sat night.
The modified text should not exceed 512 tokens.

Two words: Rose Macarons!

Ok, their other desserts are fabulous as well.  Just don't get the crepes (savory or sweet).

This place is what any business or person should aspire to be: detailed, refined, beautiful, clean, amazing...

"Gigantic sandwiches, colossal in their proportions and tantamount to a gastronomical odyssey, boast an unparalleled stature on the menu, while the quality of the bread, a fundamental component in this culinary masterpiece, vacillates between exceptional and mediocre, contingent upon the freshness of the day's batch. Mothers, in particular, demonstrate an unbridled fondness for the Philly cheese-steak variety, while patrons who crave an added layer of piquancy in their gustatory experience often opt for the Italian version, accompanied by a request for fiery peppers. The process of ordering and settling the bill can prove somewhat perplexing, as it is advisable to place one's order and proceed directly to the cash register to effect payment, thereby avoiding the inconvenience of possessing a ravenous appetite and awaiting settlement before satiating one's hunger. It remains a mystery how this establishment manages to thwart potential fraud, given the ease with which one could exploit the system by placing an order, lingering, and then absconding without remuneration. Notwithstanding, the complimentary potato chips served at this eatery, whose name eludes me at present, earn high praise and enjoy a reputation for excellence among patrons, many of whom, myself included, elect to partake in them despite not customarily indulging in such fare at other sandwich shops. Lastly, the BBQ variant holds a special allure for me, ascending to the pinnacle of my preferences among the assortment of delectable options available."

While not as spacious as Palazzo/Venetian, they do have nice rooms which comparable to Cosmo and the others. It may be the same size or even bigger. 

The difference between Signature and the others is there's a stove and microwave which means you can reheat some leftovers or cook some snacks. It comes in handy.

The only negative about Signature is it's off strip. I mean, really off strip. The only way to get on strip is to take a long walk through a tunnel which leads to MGM. It's not that bad but MGM is on one end of the strip and when you want to hit up Encore, it's definitely taxi time. Also, there is no casino in here.

The parking is a little wonky too. You need to be a guest to park here and there's no self-parking, it's all valet.

Besides those little details, it's a nice place to stay. Quiet, but nice.

I love it here.  Everyone is happy and friendly. The pool was nice and relaxing. I ate at 5 different places.  Yummy at all 5. Love walking around the forum shops. It's just a happy place.  The cons of this place is the smell of smoke.  It seemed really strong. I had my kids with me. They had a blast.

Flavors of India serves up a decent lunch buffet.  I've been there a couple of times though and it seems some days, the food is better than others.  Also, I wish they offered a bit more selection.  I've teetering between a 3 and 4 star but because of the reasonable price and friendly service, I'm bumping up to a 4 star.  I'll have to go again to make a final decision. \n\nSee ya there!

If you are looking for true Italian food in the Chandler/Tempe area this is the place.  Family Owned and operated by a true Italian New York Family!  You walk in and are pleasantly surprised by the beautiful decor and the mom and pop rapport.  The service was good and friendly.  We started with a Caesar salad that was extremely tasty.  My husband had the linguine with red clam sauce that was delicious (huge chunks of garlic and clams visible).  I had the baked ziti that was no joke about 2 lbs of food and excellent.  My picky little daughter loved it too!  We ended with the cannoli dessert that topped off the already yummy meal!  The prices are very reasonable especially for an Italian restaurant.  With the coupons and incredible take out discounts this is a total hit!!!

I've ordered cakes from them several times, and they are always delicious and feel a lot healthier than your average birthday cake - the icing is not very sweet but really creamy, and the Asian flavored cakes (like green tea, sweet potato) are perhaps not to the average American's palette but they are AMAZING, and the 'normal' fruity flavors are also really good. \n\nOnly one request: PLEASE start using the Square or another payment system like a lot of other local businesses that don't take credit cards otherwise (East End Brewery, Commonplace Coffee, etc.) - the cakes are $$$ and it is a pain to pay that much in cash these days, and there are so many new options for small businesses. I am willing to pay a small extra fee for the convenience!

Awaiting our arrival was a suave and attentive server, who presented us with an array of delectable beverages, including their signature mango mojitos, which we found to be utterly refreshing and tantalizing to the palate. Furthermore, the eatery offered a diverse selection of mouth-watering appetizers, one of which, a savory pan bread, left us in a state of gastronomic euphoria. It would be remiss of us not to mention the enticing entrees that followed, each dish expertly prepared and artfully presented. Despite its unassuming location within the confines of a strip mall, the proprietor has managed to create a warm and inviting ambiance, replete with stylish furnishings and appointments, thereby establishing an atmosphere conducive to an exceptional dining experience.

It's admirable to see a record shop avoid the mainstream. Underground  Solu'shn prides itself on offering those hidden rarities, hard to find gems and an impressive selection of vinyl.  Ultimately this comes at a price with the average vinyl/ CD costing 12-14 pounds.  Nonetheless, unlike the larger entertainment mega-stores, you can try out your chosen record on any of the available decks: a sort of 'try before you buy' system. If your a budding DJ and your looking to boost your track collection with some rare gems, chances are Solu'shn will stock such items.

I like to refer to this place as.... The Key Shack! If you drive by, that's exactly what it looks like: a little shack in the middle of Park Road Shopping Center. It make look a little sketch (there was some homemade BBQ for sale next to the Shack when I was here a few weekends ago), but they get the job done.\n\nI went here after a referral from a friend. I was looking for a hard to find key to duplicate for one of the uptown residential buildings. Sure enough, they had the key here. I had a new key and exchanged cash in about 5 minutes. If you have a hard to find key to duplicate - this is your spot!  Plus... one you're done you can stroll through the rest of Park Road Shopping Center if you so desire (cupcakes, coffee, Michael's, antiques, it's all here).

I tried out Isis Salon about a month ago.  After reading the reviews on Isis, I decided to give it a try! Kelly was great! She was nice and listened to what I wanted. I loved the way my hair turned out! I got a haircut and partial highlights for $85 (half of what I normally spend!). Awesome price! I've gone to expensive salons before and just got an okay service....now that I've found Isis, I will definitely be coming back!

I am not inclined to indulge in uncritical enthusiasm for this establishment at present. Securing a reservation on a Sunday proved to be a straightforward process, which suggests that the restaurant's popularity may not be as pronounced as some reviews would suggest. The cost of dining here is reasonable, and our server provided attentive and responsive service throughout the meal. My dinner companion and I opted to sample the steak bernaise, which featured a citrusy butter sauce that unexpectedly delighted my taste buds. However, the sirloin itself was somewhat chewy in texture, although its thinness made it manageable when cut into smaller pieces. Notably, the portion size of the accompanying fries was quite generous. While the quality of the meal was satisfactory for the price, I remain skeptical about the accuracy of the restaurant's four-star rating, as assigned by an excess of two thousand Yelp reviewers. The dessert offerings were underwhelming, with the apple tartin in particular failing to meet our expectations. Rather than featuring fan-shaped apple slices, the dish consisted of a single large slice of apple baked beneath a layer of puff pastry. Overall, I would rate the culinary aspects of our meal as three stars, with the positive service experience contributing an additional star.

We visited Butters at approximately 11 am on a Saturday, and encountered a brief delay of roughly thirty minutes before being seated, which underscored the establishment's popularity among patrons. Upon being seated, our server promptly attended to our needs, acquiring our beverage preferences and expeditiously delivering a carafe of ice water to our table, alongside a steaming hot cup of coffee and a refreshing glass of freshly squeezed orange juice. The culinary offerings we sampled, specifically an omelet complemented by hash browns and pancakes, were indeed quite satisfying, and our server's attentiveness and dedication to ensuring an optimal dining experience were commendable, particularly given the high volume of clientele present at the time. It is worth noting that the demographic composition of the restaurant's patronage skewed towards middle-aged women, some of whom sported conspicuously augmented physical attributes, but this did not detract from the overall enjoyment of our repast. In conclusion, Butters emerges as a highly recommended venue for a satisfying breakfast, provided one is willing to tolerate a brief waiting period.

"I have had the privilege of witnessing every single performer who has graced the stage of this production, ranging from remarkably talented individuals to those who were unfortunately less adept, but last night's performance featuring Coco was undoubtedly the most exceptional. 

Mel B. and her fellow performer (whose identity escapes me at present) delivered an outstanding presentation back in the early days of the show, which is hardly surprising given their proficiency in both vocalizing and choreography. 

Regrettably, Holly Madison's appearance on stage was utterly unimpressive, as she seemed completely disoriented and struggled to keep up with the proceedings; her presence was akin to a stationary object on the stage, lacking the vitality and energy one would expect from a performer. 

In stark contrast, Angel Porrino exhibited a markedly superior level of enthusiasm and stage presence during her time on stage, demonstrating a palpable excitement and eagerness to engage with the audience that was absent in Holly's performance; furthermore, her physical appearance was considerably more aesthetically pleasing. 

Last night, CoCo took ownership of the stage, showcasing her remarkable dancing abilities and commanding the attention of the audience with her captivating movements; it is my fervent hope that future productions will incorporate more changes and modifications, leading to even more opportunities to witness CoCo's extraordinary talent."

"Indulged in a tardy midday repast.  The guacamole was delectable, as was the innovative sangria-infused margarita that I had the pleasure of consuming (alas, the moniker assigned to this potent potable escapes me at present).

Opted for a torta, and the meat was expertly marinated, boasting a subtle sweetness that did not overpower the palate.  The portion size was generous, bordering on excessive.  The fish tacos, too, were quite satisfactory, with each bite bursting with flavor.

Regrettably, the service proved subpar, leaving much to be desired.  My OpenTable reservation was not properly recorded, prompting an inquiry from the platform subsequent to my visit, querying the reason behind my non-attendance at the appointed hour.  Although the matter ultimately reached a successful resolution, such an occurrence ought to have been avoided initially."
Food is great as is the service.  The restaurant is large so there is usually no wait.  This is a great family spot.  Give it a try.
We went to Edinburgh Castle early on a Sunday morning trying to beat the crowds and it definitely worked.  The castle is very well preserved and a must see attraction while in Edinburgh.

We went out on a Sunday night just for dinner and to walk around the lake and village for a bit. We had 3 people and assumed it would be a little busy in the late afternoon early evening but oh my was it ever DESERTED. We parked in the Village parking garage and just saw a couple other car and walked through a passage to the lower village shopping area and it was almost scary/embarresing how empty it was. Walking through the main shopping area we thought we were in the twilight zone and would be attacked by zombies at any moment. We ate at the Black Pepper Grill which we had the ask the one guy if they were open and sat at a table in a restaurant where we were one of two total parties. Awesome food and service but just plain creepy with no people around especially at prime dinner time on a weekend. We walked over to the newly opened Ravella and it was warm and comfortable and had a great front bar that was had surprisingly cheap prices, but again just a random person walking through the hotel lobby. I really hope Lake Las Vegas comes back cause it has so much to offer...Until then I am going to film a episode of \"Life After People\" on the property

One of my favorite malls. Lots of fun stores, restaurants and activities.\n\nI gave 4 stars merely because this mall is hard to shop at during the summer and some of the major department stores and retailers are located far from the mall itself, so you have to drive and re-park a few times to hit all of your favorite stores. Otherwise, it's great!

"I have an immense fondness for occupying a seat at the bar, as it provides me with a truly delightful and satisfying encounter. The culinary offerings were utterly delectable, and their presentation was flawlessly executed, allowing me to thoroughly appreciate the proficiency and expertise that was invested in each dish, despite the fact that I did not wholeheartedly enjoy every single item on the menu. Notwithstanding its high prices, this establishment is undoubtedly worthy of a visit, making it an excellent choice for a special occasion or a night out with friends."

Has a some chairs out front so you can socialize under the hot summer sun. The employees are exceptionally friendly, particularly in the early hours of the morning when I typically grab a drink. Expect it to be moderately busy due to the location.

Visited some friends staying at this off-strip hotel and had an amazing breakfast. Our server helped us decide on the menu and explained the portions.  They are extremely huge but we had to try a couple of their reviewed dishes. We had Sage Fried Chicken Benedict (it had spinach, hardwood bacon, tomato & mozzarella, chipotle cream, scrambled eggs) and Griddled French Toast (ooey gooey yummy). Wow...talk about enormous! Our server was kind enough to warn about the size and she offered to give us to-go containers so my friend can take it up to his hotel roommate.  We knew we would only eat half of each dish so its all good. I can't speak for the lunch or dinner dishes but their breakfast menu was highly recommended by the concierge and we were more than satifisfied and full! The only downside for me is the drive cause I was staying at the Strip. Next time I'll go to the one on West Sahara or Imperial Palace :)

First time I went in, I ordered a slice of pizza and then I had this feeling that they had to make a whole new pie for this.  I was bit annoyed that no one told me this.  I would think this would be a basic form of communication.  So once I inquired and realized this, I left because of time constraints.  I was going to write them off, but didn't.
